events.id: Summer Series - Philosophy In The Park-Queen Elizabeth Park,Masterton, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Summer Series - Philosophy In The Park
events.venue: Queen Elizabeth Park,Masterton, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Summer Series - Philosophy In The Park
Welcome to the Philosophy In The Park Summer Series !
These start in late November and run through to late February

Each session takes a different shape—sometimes small-group conversations, sometimes a single open circle—but all are rooted in the Socratic Method: asking questions, listening carefully, and thinking together rather than trading speeches or debating winners and losers.

Discussions can be on everything from Politics to Pop Music, Ideology to Identity, Markets to Marxism, Feminism to Faith, Aesthetics to Anarchy, Capitalism to Consciousness and beyond...

In the spirit of “Philosophy in the Public Sphere,” the group is open to everyone. No academic background required—just an open mind, a willingness to ask questions, and respect for different perspectives.
Bring a blanket or chair, your curiosity, and perhaps a thermos or snack to share.

[more details coming soon]

Join us on Meetup

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Homewood Airstrip| Roast by the Coast-Tranzit Coachlines, 316 Queen St, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Homewood Airstrip| Roast by the Coast
events.venue: Tranzit Coachlines, 316 Queen St, Masterton
events.long_description:
Enjoy a day out on the Wairarapa Coast with a family-friendly walk and a hearty roast lunch. Situated on working farmland, the Homewood Airstrip walk is a 5km return track that follows a gradual incline to the top, offering sweeping views of land and sea, before an easy downhill return. The gravel track is usually straightforward, but can be slippery or muddy in wet conditions—good footwear and wet-weather gear are recommended. Gates will be open and stock fenced off for the day. Thanks to Tranzit sponsorship the bus fare is significantly reduced for participants.

After your walk, return to the Homewood Storeroom to refuel with a traditional roast lunch of slow-cooked lamb, crispy roast potatoes, and seasonal salad, with an optional slice for dessert.

Walk Format
Travel: 1 hour each way from Masterton (2 hours total)
Arrive: Café at 10am (time for the loo and to collect maps—navigation support by Gavin, our seasoned guide!)
Walk: Depart up the airstrip by 10.30am; allow 2 hours including time to enjoy the views
Lunch: Return to the Storeroom by 12.30pm for a roast lunch
Return: Bus departs from the café at 2pm

This outing is ideal for fit trampers, casual walkers, families, pre-schoolers, and school groups (minimum age 4+). Expect moderate hills and potentially muddy conditions if it rains—but with the right gear, light rain and wind will only add to the adventure.

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Waiohine to Holdsworth Overnight-Waiohine Gorge, Waiohine Gorge Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Waiohine to Holdsworth Overnight
events.venue: Waiohine Gorge, Waiohine Gorge Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Note this is an overnight stay, starting from 9am Friday 21st November and finishing on Saturday 22nd November.
This guided overnight hike is the perfect introduction to tramping in the Tararua Ranges. Beginning with a spectacular crossing of the Waiohine Gorge suspension bridge — 94 metres long and 35 metres high — the walk follows fairly gentle terrain alongside the Waiohine River, through lush native bush, and without any steep climbs.

After a 9 am bus departure from Tranzit in Masterton, we travel to the Waiohine road-end (pickup available along the way at Carterton Station, timed to meet the train from Wellington) and set off on an 8 km walk to Tōtara Flats Hut. This Department of Conservation hut has bunkrooms with mattresses, cooking stoves, rainwater taps, a woodstove, and a long-drop toilet. We have booked most of the hut’s 26 bunks. On Day 2, wake to the sound of native birds before continuing on an 11 km walk to Holdsworth Lodge, where the bus will return us to Masterton.

What to bring: Good shoes or boots, rain jacket, backpack, sleeping bag (in a waterproof bag), overnight clothes, toiletries, any personal medications, food, cooking pot, plate, cutlery, toilet paper, water bottle, and snacks. Optional: togs and towel, battery bank. All rubbish must be carried out.

Important:
If you would like extra information and your gear checked, please attend an information session with your walk leader on Sunday 2nd November 6pm, at the Carterton Courthouse.
Must have a good level of fitness. Dogs are not permitted. There are no river crossings except by bridge, but one section requires walking along the riverbank to avoid a slip. If the river is too high, the walk will enter and return via Holdsworth. The walk leader will carry a Personal Locator Beacon, lighter, newspaper for the woodstove, and a basic first aid kit. No refunds except in exceptional circumstances or if the walk is cancelled.

events.id: Rhian Sheehan & Arli Liberman - Traces Album Release Tour - Wellington-The Great Hall, Massey University,Massey University Old Museum BLG, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Rhian Sheehan & Arli Liberman - Traces Album Release Tour - Wellington
events.venue: The Great Hall, Massey University,Massey University Old Museum BLG, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Rhian Sheehan & Arli Liberman - Traces Album Release Tour - Wellington
TICKETS FROM https://bit.ly/46xIJWo

ONE WELLINGTON SHOW ONLY - Friday Nov 21, The Great Hall at Massey University

Loop are proud to announce that acclaimed New Zealand musicians, composers and producers Rhian Sheehan and Arli Liberman will bring their collaborative album Traces to life for the first time ever, with a special three-show tour this November.

The tour will see the pair perform the album in its entirety at a series of intimate shows in Auckland, Wellington & Christchurch. These shows will see them accompanied by Ed Zuccollo and Riki Pirihi aka Riki Gooch (TrinityRoots, Orchestra Of Spheres) to bring the album to the stage.

Stream the album here - https://ffm.to/traces-album

This tour marks the long-awaited debut live performance of Traces, an instrumental journey blending electronic, ambient and post-rock soundscapes to create a world unlike anything else — described by filmmaker Sam Kelly as “an ethereal journey through dark and moody worlds.”

For the first time, audiences will be able to experience this collaboration in a live setting. With both artists renowned for their powerful, emotive performances and their ability to craft immersive sound journeys, these shows promise to be as visually striking as they are sonically transporting. Live performances from both Sheehan and Liberman are a rare treat, and this will be only the second-time ever both musicians will be performing together live.

Each show will see Sheehan and Liberman joined by two collaborators on stage to help bring the worlds created in Traces to life. Ed Zuccollo will bring his trademark synth-wizardry to the stage, as he did across a number of tracks on the album. His trademark sound has seen him perform with the likes of Troy Kingi, Kita, The Black Seeds and more, in addition to his own solo work as Zuke. Riki Pirihi aka Riki Gooch is one of NZ’s most celebrated musicians for his work with TrinityRoots, Fat Freddy’s Drop, Cave Circles, and countless others.

The four musicians will combine to perform Traces live, with the second half of the show featuring all four musicians collaborating live on stage with tracks from each artist’s individual catalogues.

These shows will also feature the stunning visuals created for the project by Dunedin-based visual artist Sam Caldwell, which are featured across the album cover and music videos. The Traces live experience will be a richly layered audio and visual feast, unlike anything either artist has performed before..

Tickets go on sale Thursday September 25. Audiences are encouraged to secure theirs early — with only three shows nationwide, these performances promise to be rare, unforgettable events. Presented by Loop, thanks to Manuka Phuel.

Stream the album here - https://ffm.to/traces-album This tour marks the long-awaited debut live performance of Traces, an instrumental journey blending electronic, ambient and post-rock soundscapes to create a world unlike anything else — described by filmmaker Sam Kelly as “an ethereal journey through dark and moody worlds.” For the first time, audiences will be able to experience this collaboration in a live setting.
Live performances from both Sheehan and Liberman are a rare treat, and this will be only the second-time ever both musicians will be performing together live.

events.id: Serenades across cultures- A fundraising concert-Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Parish,43 Ngaio Rd, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae-All Events In
events.name: Serenades across cultures- A fundraising concert
events.venue: Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Parish,43 Ngaio Rd, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Serenades across cultures- A fundraising concert
Join Lala Simpson (vocals), Dayle Anderson (piano), and Jonathan Berkahn (accordion) for an enchanting evening of music, where the soulful melodies of French chanson legends like Edith Piaf and Jacques Brel blend seamlessly with the haunting rhythms of Malagasy icons such as Bessa and Fanja Andriamanantena. Be serenaded by heartfelt songs of love, loss, and romance—an unforgettable night of timeless classics that capture the essence of passion and longing.

Join Us for an Unforgettable Concert Experience – A Night of Music with a Heartfelt Purpose!

Last year, as part of our Cultural Immersion Tour, I had the profound privilege of visiting Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, alongside Stuart Simpson, Rose Ruane, and my nieces and nephews. Located on the eastern side of Antananarivo, the capital, the orphanage was founded by the incredible Madame Hary in 2012. What started as a humble project from her own home has grown into a haven for 54 children, some of whom were rescued from areas where twins are sadly believed to be cursed.

Despite the challenges, the orphanage continues to thrive, relying entirely on the kindness of visitors. They grow their own rice, maintain a small chicken farm, and have a vegetable garden to sustain themselves. But their greatest need is for ongoing support and resources to continue providing for these beautiful children.

By attending our concert, you’ll be helping make a direct impact on the lives of these children. All profits from this concert will go toward completing the construction of a much-needed training center and extra bedrooms at Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, helping provide valuable education and support to the children in their care. In May this year, we raised over $4000 at a fundraising concert and $1700 on Givealittle.
Help us raise $2500 more so they can finish the building before the arrival of the rainy season.

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Carterton Entertainment Heritage Walk-Carrington Park, High St, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Carterton Entertainment Heritage Walk
events.venue: Carrington Park, High St, Carterton
events.long_description:
This walk is a collaboration between Carterton Historical Society and the Wairarapa Film Festival. Step back in time and celebrate Carterton's cultural heartbeat on the Music, Memory and High Street Heritage Walk. This guided 2-hour journey showcases the venues and events that have shaped the town's entertainment story - from the 1881 Library and modern Events Centre, which has hosted the Oversew Fashion Awards, Stan Walker's 2023 concert, and Kokomai Creative Festival performances, to the Regent Theatre, Live Lounge, Club Carterton RSA, and the historic Carrington Park Band Rotunda.

Along the way, discover the stories behind the Daffodil Festival, Balloon Festival ascensions and Burner Parade, and Carterton's thriving arts scene past and present. With heritage photos and festival tales this walk brings Carterton's creative spirit to life.

events.id: Messengers-National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Messengers
events.venue: National Library of New Zealand, 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
‘Animals first entered the imagination as messengers and promises,’ John Berger.
Messengers explores the enduring gaze shared between humans and other animals. The exhibition title is inspired by a line from John Berger’s seminal 1977 essay ‘Why Look at Animals?’ Berger argued that the relationship between humans and animals – ‘our unspeaking companionship’ – has been transformed by capitalism.
Messengers brings together historical and contemporary ways of looking at animals in photography and art. It features archival photographs from the National Library and Alexander Turnbull Collections, first taken by newspaper photographers in the mid twentieth century. The images capture everything from the polar bears once housed in Wellington Zoo, to an elderly gentleman standing amongst the life size concrete animal sculptures in his garden. These images are at once tender and loving, sentimental and silly, kind and indifferent.
Messengers places these archival photographs in proximity and conversation with contemporary sculpture and moving image works by four Aotearoa-based artists: Denise Batchelor, Brit Bunkley, Jane Dodd and John Ward Knox. From eerie AI and computer-generated animals to the hypnotic stare of a real live Ruru; from carved wooden godwits you can hold in your hand to ‘hominoid’ brooches, each artist’s work speaks to the ‘unspeaking companionship’ between humanity and other animals.
IMAGE Brit Bunkley, still from Transit, single channel video, 2025

events.id: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Self-Guided Tour of Stonehenge Aotearoa
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Explore Stonehenge Aotearoa at Your Own Pace

Our self-guided tour includes a map and a 12-minute audio-visual presentation to help you uncover the secrets of the henge. Afterward, head down to the stone circle and try out its unique acoustics — clap your hands and hear the echo respond, or whisper and see how far your voice carries.

A self-guided tour typically takes around 30 minutes, but many visitors stay longer simply because it’s so much fun. The bigger your group, the better the experience!

Please arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time.
Available during our opening hours: 10 AM – 4 PM.
events.description:

Afterward, head down to the stone circle and try out its unique acoustics — clap your hands and hear the echo respond, or whisper and see how far your voice carries.
A self-guided tour typically takes around 30 minutes, but many visitors stay longer simply because it’s so much fun.
The bigger your group, the better the experience!
Please arrive at least 30 minutes before closing time.

events.id: Stanton Warriors-meow NUI,92A Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Stanton Warriors
events.venue: meow NUI,92A Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Stanton Warriors
The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London—raving, clubbing, DJing, and throwing parties.
He returned to Wellington in 2000 and co-founded the event brand Sandwiches that November.
By 2003, Sandwiches had grown into a venue that became an iconic part of Wellington’s nightlife for over a decade, hosting both local and international artists. The brand also expanded into large-scale events, including outdoor music festivals such as Summerset at the Basin Reserve.

Now, The Sandwiches Guy and Meow Nui are joining forces to bring back a classic favourite from the Sandwiches days: Stanton Warriors!
Doors open at 8 pm, with Stanton Warriors hitting the stage at 10 pm. This one-off event is all about community—friends old and new coming together to dance, connect, and celebrate. Don’t miss your chance to be part of a night to remember.

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Wairarapa Moana Wander-Featherston Lake Domain, South Soldiers Settlemen Road, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Wairarapa Moana Wander
events.venue: Featherston Lake Domain, South Soldiers Settlemen Road, Featherston
events.long_description:
Join local freshwater ecologist, Dr Katie Brasell from Kahungunu ki Wairarapa, on the northern shore of Lake Wairarapa. On this 3-4km stroll, you can take in the fresh South Wairarapa air, learn what treasures the moana holds and how local kaitiaki (stewards) are helping to restore mauri (life force) to this jewel of our region.

Meet at the Lake Domain Reserve just south of Featherston. The walk will begin with a brief history of the lake’s importance to mana whenua by the Lake Domain camping area. Continuing for about 1km east across the top of the lake, you’ll hear about the locals favourite native shellfish, kākahi, and what the annual counts are telling us. A few hundred meters away, we’ll take a look at a myriad of aquatic plants (good and bad) and how restoring native species in the lake could turn the tide on this degraded ecosystem.

Walk Format:
This walk is suitable for all fitness levels, and is expected to take 1.5hrs. Children are welcomed but must be accompanied by parent/guardian.

events.id: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Shared 90-Minute Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Join a Shared Guided Tour and experience Stonehenge Aotearoa through the eyes of an expert. In this 90-minute journey, you’ll uncover how ancient cultures measured time, tracked the Sun and Moon, and connected the heavens with life on Earth.

Your experience begins with a captivating introduction and a 15-minute audio-visual presentation explaining how the Henge works. Then, step outside with your guide for a detailed tour of the stone circle, where astronomy, archaeology, and mythology come together in one unforgettable setting.

Perfect for visitors seeking a deeper understanding of the stars and stories that shaped human history.

events.id: Climate Fresk Workshop in Wellington-57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Climate Fresk Workshop in Wellington
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Do you want to be part of the solution to tackle climate change but don’t have the time to become a climate scientist? Join us for a 3-hour interactive workshop to explore the causes and consequences of climate disturbances.
Based on the IPCC report and played by over 2 million people worldwide, this collaborative workshop allows you to understand the key issues of climate change to empower you to take action.
How it works:
The workshop is based on a 42-card game. Each card represents an element, a cause or a consequence of climate change.
In teams, guided by your facilitator, you are encouraged to find the cause-effect relationship between the different components of climate change. Collective intelligence will get you from one deck of card to the next!
This step-by-step reconstruction provides keys to understand the complexity and develop an overview of climate change.
Agenda:
Introduction, 15 mins
Fresk Card Game, 1 1/2 hours
Debrief and Actions, 1 hour 15 mins
Climate Fresk is an excellent opportunity to understand the key elements of climate change and what you can do to be part of the solution. No previous climate knowledge is needed.

Tea, coffee and snacks will be served during the short break. Workshop run by Climate Training Co. Ltd. Donations welcome!

events.id: Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021-All Events In
events.name: Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021
events.long_description:
Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday
We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 8!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out, it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Stolen Tuesday, Kimba Jade, K-otik and Not My Sister
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.

Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11 Stolen Tuesday
11-12 Kimba Jade
12.1 K-otik
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------

NOT MY SISTER
Hailing from Italy and rooted in Wellington’s vibrant scene, Not My Sister burst onto the scene in 2024 and has quickly become one of Aotearoa’s most exciting rising DJs. In such a short time, she’s already lit up dance floors across the country, playing at festivals like Twisted Frequency, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den, and supporting international acts such as KC Lights.

She also holds a radio residency at Wellington’s iconic Radio Active, where her show dives deep into the world of house and underground sounds.

Heavily influenced by funk and disco, and driven by a love for vocals and all things groovy, Not My Sister delivers high-energy, uplifting sets full of passion and playfulness. She weaves together melodic basslines with soulful, tech, garage, and deep house elements, always keeping the crowd moving.

SoundCloud: www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
Facebook: www.facebook.com/notmysista
Instagram: www.instagram.com/not.my.sister
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@not.my.sister

STOLEN TUESDAY
Stolen Tuesday started life as a house music club dancer in the UK 20 years
ago, and has spent the last 10 years DJing at Wanaka and Queenstown's best
establishments, bringing her unique energy to create magical dance floors.
Since residing in New Zealand, she has previously split her time living between Great Barrier island and Wanaka, spreading the love through her weekly radio shows on Wanaka Beats and Aotea FM. Not shy of the underground scene, you will also find Stolen Tuesday getting down off grid and playing at bush doofs.
Best known for dropping all things bassy which exude an element of fun matching her own high energy, guest appearances on Base FM (Auckland) alongside well known Auckland DJs have helped showcase her enthusiasm and talent.
With a style ranging from glitter box style disco and funk, to dirty after hours Tech House and all things in between, including the occasional breaks/ghetto funk set, it’s no surprise that She has been a regular on the South Island festival scene where she has been happy warming up or playing after notable international artists. She has also played at Otherlanz and remotely at Great Barrier Island’s new Wingman festival.

Stolen Tuesday now resides in Wellington and whilst fairly new to the city has already played several times for both the 'Open air' brand at Carlucci land and with Wellington renowned 'Little monsters' notably shaking things up at this year's Newtown festival.
Although not one to take herself too seriously, Stolen Tuesday knows it all comes down to the music and having a good time!

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/user-720686581

KIMBA JADE
Kimba Jade has been lighting up dancefloors for over 20 years with her signature blend of deep, funky, and globally inspired grooves. A master of musical journeying, she weaves bass-driven beats with tribal, melodic, and soulful sounds that move both body and spirit.

With a deep passion for Ecstatic Dance and the power of music to connect and uplift, Kimba brings that same vibrant energy into clubs and bars. Her sets fuse Tech House, Indie Dance, and Techno, blending driving rhythms with emotive melodies to create an atmosphere that’s both immersive and electric.

After years in Sydney and Auckland’s underground scenes, Kimba now calls Wellington home—bringing her unique mix of rhythm, soul, and bass to local dance floors.

Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/kimba
Facebook: www.facebook.com/kimbadj/
Instangram: @djkimbajade

K-OTIK
Based in Wellington, New Zealand, K-otiK is a multi-genre DJ. His sound spans house, tech house, bass house, and techno — laced with heavy vocals and thumping basslines. With a cheeky stage presence and high energy behind the decks, K-otiK takes crowds on journeys that balance careful curation with unexpected twists. A regular on RadioActive FM and part of Wellington’s Open Air collective, he’s built a reputation for spreading joy through music. For K-otiK, music does not discriminate — it’s the universal language that brings people together.

Instangram: @dj_kotik_nz

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses.
It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.
There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.
What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise - 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say - 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes) - 1:40pm - Educational topic - 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.

events.name: Macaron Masterclass
events.venue: Le Ciel Bakery, 100 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
MACARON MASTERCLASS
Presented by Le Ciel Bakery
Whisk, pipe, and finesse your way to perfect Parisian macarons

Join us for a hands-on masterclass where you’ll learn the secrets to mastering this delicate French treat — from glossy meringue to flawless feet. Led by Chef Shuchi Bhardwaj, this is your golden ticket to boujee baking greatness.

- Create & take home your own box of beautifully filled macarons
- Learn foolproof techniques, flavour infusions, and piping styles
- Start your evening with a complimentary glass of bubbles and a decadent Black Forest cake for two—because love (and baking) should always begin on a sweet note.

What you’ll learn:
- Mastering macaronage & piping flawless heart shapes
- Avoiding common meringue mishaps

events.id: AlterCOP30: Digital Collage-Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: AlterCOP30: Digital Collage
events.venue: Level 2/57 Willis Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Led by Climate Training Co. and Jean-Philippe, the Digital Collage is a fun 3-hour workshop centred on collaboration and collective intelligence. 
The aim of the workshop is to raise awareness and train participants on the environmental issues of digital technology. The workshop also outlines solutions for a sustainable digital technology, and allows open discussions amongst participants on the important and timely topics.
A true team-building tool, allowing participants to come together and delve into the sustainability of our digital world, and engage with the solutions. 
It is built on the same theory and structure that underpins the Climate Fresk.
Benefits of this workshop for your organisation:
Build a shared understanding of digital sustainability 
Understand the problems and threats 
Find solutions that you can implement 
This workshop is rigorously sourced from data sourced by ADEME, Green IT, EcoInfo CNRS and the Shift Project’s reports and references.
How the workshop operates:
Understanding: in teams of 4 to 8, the participants identify and then draw the links between the cards of the game to build a “Collage” 
Personalisation: they visually express their key messages and link their work to their context: to take ownership of the content and create a team spirit
Debriefing: each group explains their title and decoration, then the facilitator makes a detailed summary of the whole system
Solutions: a solutions based exercise finishes the workshop, which stimulates discussion, reflection, and action around a sustainable digital world
If you're looking to build awareness and explore real solutions around digital sustainability in your organisation, this workshop is a great place to start.
In solidarity with AlterCOP30, this November we’re running a series of climate events across Aotearoa - bringing communities together to learn, connect, and take action for a just and sustainable future.
AlterCOP is a Global Initiative founded by The Matcha Initiative and The Transmutation Principle, locally brought to you by Climate Club, Climate Crew, and Climate Training Co.

events.name: Bowls and BBQ for Big Brothers Big Sisters Wellington
events.venue: 53 Apu Crescent, Lyall Bay, Wellington
events.long_description:
Picture this - it's a warm summer evening in Lyall Bay, you're at the bowling green with a bunch of friends and colleagues, the BBQ is fired up, you've got a drink in hand, and you know your whole evening is helping Wellington's rangatahi thrive.
That’s what Bowls & BBQ Wellington is all about.
So, grab your friends, call your colleagues, rally your flatmates, and roll up for a fun night of bowling and BBQ-ing in support of Big Brothers Big Sisters.
Throughout the evening, you'll be able to enjoy:
A friendly lawn bowls tournament. No experience is necessary (in fact, it’s usually more fun that way!)
A classic Kiwi BBQ dinner. A great chance to eat, relax, and catch up
Good company - meet others from local businesses and community groups.
A charity auction with the chance to bid on food hampers, jewellery, and experiences from generous local sponsors
Tickets are just $50 each, or $200 for a team of 4. This includes entry to our bowling tournament, plus a dinner afterwards.
https://www.bowlsandbbq.co.nz/wellington/

events.venue: Frank Kitts Park, Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wanna dance, mama? You’re invited to Mumrave!
This November, we’re taking Mumraves, a series of FREE pop-up nightclubs just for mums (R18), on tour across Aotearoa! Enjoy one power hour of dancing, laughter, and good vibes with other mums all set to beats from an awesome DJ. Because mums deserve to celebrate, reconnect, and have fun.
Mumraves also mark the launch of The Village NZ, a free online hub connecting mums to support and education in the first 1,000 days of motherhood. Our mission is to improve maternal health and build real community.
Each Mumrave session is one hour, capped at 40 participants, and includes:
A complimentary AF non-alcoholic beverage on arrival
Spot prizes
A goodie bag
Wellington: Fri 21 Nov | 5-10pm | Frank Kitts Park
Tickets will be released 16 October: Then get in quick and book your spot and get ready to dance in a pop-up rave tent, connect, and celebrate being a mum!

events.id: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Friday Nights-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lost Wax in Three Sessions - Hard Wax - Friday Nights
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Over three sessions create stunning jewellery using the age-old lost wax technique. This is an excellent opportunity to treat yourself to some creative fun on Friday nights!

In weeks one and two you'll learn how to work with jeweller's hard wax to create beautiful textures in metal that can be used to create amazing rings or objects. Your waxes will be sent away for casting in the metal of your choice.

Then there will be a week's break before the third session, to allow time for everyone's waxes to be cast. The third session covers how to trim, clean and finish your casts, turning them into original jewellery ready to wear!

More advanced students can use these sessions to complete projects in a class setting.

Included in the class fee are all your different types of waxes, sandpaper and courier costs.

Not included are the casting and metal costs which vary from student to student depending on what sized ring they want to make and the type of metal you choose. Small castings can cost around $6.65 - $12 and might cost between $7 to $30 in metals depending on if you use red bronze, white bronze or silver.

This class is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: 2025 Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour Launch with Lynda Hallinan-Copthorne Hotel & Resort Solway Park, 246 High St, Solway, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: 2025 Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour Launch with Lynda Hallinan
events.venue: Copthorne Hotel & Resort Solway Park, 246 High St, Solway, Masterton
events.long_description:
Join us in
Celebrating 15 years of the Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour with a special launch evening!
We’re thrilled to welcome Lynda Hallinan, gardening guru, author and broadcaster for an inspiring, fun and informal “On the Couch” evening.

Friday 21 November
6:00–7:30 pm
Copthorne Hotel, Solway Park, Masterton

Drink on arrival + canapés

Dress Code – Florals

Come mix, mingle, and hear Lynda share her passion for plants, and a life spent growing and writing about gardens.
Tickets are limited!

Journalist, author and broadcaster Lynda Hallinan has been writing about gardening since she was a teenager. Her most recent book, The Joy of Gardening, celebrates all the little things that make our hearts sing in a garden. Lynda lives with her family in the foothills of Auckland's Hunua Ranges, where she grows far too much of everything from food to flowers. Her most recent project has been the renovation of a rundown colonial cottage and the creation of Sweetgum Cottage garden, which is now open to the public.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Painting & Pizza in Seaview (Bob Ross Style - Lower Hutt) Come along to a relaxing evening and go home with a painting that is 100% made by you - in the Bob Ross style.
You'll be using genuine Bob Ross brushes, equipment and paint.
If you can hold a pen and write, you can hold a brush and paint - and Malcolm Sime (NZ's first USA trained and certified Bob Ross instructor) will be there to teach you.
Please wear old clothes suitable for painting in - the whole class will be creating the same painting as per the image below.
(Please note we are unable to cater for any dietary requirements and no partial refunds given) 23 May Painting: 21 November Painting: Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Ruamāhanga Awa Sundowner Walk-Ruamāhanga Awa Meeting Point, 39 Vintners Lane, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Ruamāhanga Awa Sundowner Walk
events.venue: Ruamāhanga Awa Meeting Point, 39 Vintners Lane, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Back by popular demand after delighting festival-goers in 2024, this unique twilight walk returns for 2025. Led by Jane & Rod from the Ruamāhanga Farm Foundation, the journey begins with a sensory—and at times silent—stroll along the Ruamāhanga River before entering the majestic Waihinga Bush, one of the finest examples of podocarp forest near Martinborough.

As the sun sets and the forest darkens, take your place beneath the towering trees and be transported by a mythical tale of how this special forest came to be. A truly atmospheric experience, blending nature, story, and stillness.

Registration cost will be donated to Ruamāhanga Farm Foundation.

Walk Format:
This 4km walk is predominantly on flat track, with mown grass underfoot, however the ground can be uneven.

events.id: Robin Hood - The Pantomime-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Robin Hood - The Pantomime
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Adventures of the original working-class hero and man in tights!

Robin Hood steals from the rich and gives to the poor in an oldie timey place where people are struggling and homeless and the landed gentry hoard the money all for themselves – Wellington 2025.

Robin must stop the Evil Sheriff from running roughshod over the citizens! But this quest is far from easy… there is archery, swordfights, and a lot of dance numbers to get through. Our hero is grateful for help from spies on the inside: Maid Marion, and her bolshie Nanny (Pantomime Dame Jthan Morgan).

Come one and come all to see the slings and arrows of outrageous panto!


Written by Simon Leary & Gavin Rutherford
Directed by Gavin Rutherford
Musical Direction and Arrangements by Michael Nicholas Williams

events.id: Sunset Guided Tour-Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Sunset Guided Tour
events.venue: Stonehenge Aotearoa, 51 Ahiaruhe Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Experience Stonehenge Aotearoa at its most breathtaking — as the sun dips below the Wairarapa horizon.
Our Sunset Guided Tour blends astronomy, storytelling, and the natural beauty of twilight for an evening you will never forget.

Led by one of our knowledgeable guides, this 90-minute experience explores how ancient cultures used the Sun to track time and mark the turning of the seasons. You’ll discover the scientific and cultural thinking behind the Henge’s unique Southern Hemisphere design before watching the sunset alignment from inside the stone circle.

Weather permitting, you’ll witness how the setting Sun interacts with the structure — a striking moment that links ancient knowledge with the rhythms of the natural world.

Duration and Schedule
• Allow: Approximately 90 minutes
• Start Time: Begins one hour before sunset
• Availability: Offered any day with advance booking

events.id: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 28-44 by Cheeky Events Australia-The Garden Hotel,63 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 28-44 by Cheeky Events Australia
events.venue: The Garden Hotel,63 Courtenay Place, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating for ages 28-44 by Cheeky Events Australia
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃
#speeddating

events.id: So Honest It Aches-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: So Honest It Aches
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
Life creates a collection of stories, some curious, some dramatic, some funny.

But what about the stories you keep to yourself, the stories that hardly see the light of day?

What if a group of older adults were brave enough to bring those stories to the stage?

‘So Honest it Aches’ is the culmination of a year-long performance programme where older adults make theatre that seeks to shift the way we look at ageing.

events.id: A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
“Jingle Jigs, Reels a Treat.”
Ken Longworth – The Newcastle Herald

Direct from its Off-Broadway season, A Taste of Ireland - The Irish Music & Dance Sensation, presents its holiday spectacular, A Celtic Christmas. Prepare to be enchanted with some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians bringing the spirit of Christmas to life, in a show that will make you laugh, cry, and sing into the night.

After captivating audiences across the USA and around the world, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland returns to New Zealand this festive season following a highly successful 2022 tour. Experience the magic as world-class performers blend melodic folk mash-ups, acapella tap battles, and heartwarming storytelling in one truly unforgettable performance.

Featuring former World Irish dance champions and stars from Lord of the Dance and Riverdance, A Celtic Christmas delivers a holiday spectacular packed with Irish wit, traditional tunes and heartfelt ballads, alongside all your favorite carols. The show’s exciting mix of electrifying rhythms and extraordinary talent promises an evening brimming with Irish charm and enthralling entertainment, all in one powerhouse event.

Immerse yourself in a traditional Celtic landscape and let the magic of an Irish Christmas transport you to a world filled with excitement and wonder, where vibrant music and dance embody the heartbeat of the festive season.

With over one hundred and fifty 5-star Facebook reviews and over 150,000 followers, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland promises 100% live singing and dancing as it bridges the gap between energetic folk music, Irish dance, and modern tap styles.

Don’t miss your chance to see this magical show as it tours New Zealand for a strictly limited season. Get your tickets now before they sell out.

**Musical instruments are subject to change from performance to performance

With over one hundred and fifty 5-star Facebook reviews and over 150,000 followers, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland promises 100% live singing and dancing as it bridges the gap between energetic folk music, Irish dance, and modern tap styles.

Don’t miss your chance to see this magical show as it tours New Zealand for a strictly limited season. Get your tickets now before they sell out.

**musical instruments are subject to change from performance to performance

You may also like the following events from A Taste of Ireland Company:

events.description:

Prepare to be enchanted with some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians bringing the spirit of Christmas to life, in a show that will make you laugh, cry, and sing into the night.
After captivating audiences across the USA and around the world, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland returns to New Zealand this festive season following a highly successful 2022 tour.
Experience the magic as world-class performers blend melodic folk mash-ups, acapella tap battles, and heartwarming storytelling in one truly unforgettable performance.
The show’s exciting mix of electrifying rhythms and extraordinary talent promises an evening brimming with Irish charm and enthralling entertainment, all in one powerhouse event.

events.id: Amélie the Musical-Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Amélie the Musical
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Following the success of its critically-acclaimed 2019–2022 UK production—which earned a GRAMMY® nomination and three Olivier Award nominations—Amélie the Musical now makes its Aotearoa New Zealand premiere at the Hannah Playhouse this November 14 – 29, 2025, starring Rachel McSweeney as Amélie Poulain.

Inspiring, whimsical, and brimming with heart, Amélie the Musical brings Jean-Pierre Jeunet’s five-time Oscar-nominated film to the stage with wit and charm. The show follows Amélie, an extraordinary but shy young woman who lives vividly inside her own imagination. She secretly improvises small acts of mischief and kindness for those around her. When an unexpected chance at love comes her way, Amélie realizes she’ll need to move beyond the lonely isolation of her youth and allow herself to be truly seen.

Featuring an original score by Daniel Messé and Nathan Tysen, and a book by two-time TONY Award® nominee Craig Lucas (The Light in the Piazza, An American in Paris), Amélie the Musical transports audiences into Amélie’s fantastical world. The audience watches as she discovers her voice, uncovers the power of human connection, and finds new possibilities around every corner.

“Illustrates the profound imaginative power of theatre” – The Times
“A magical and emotional triumph.” – The Guardian

events.id: Every Kind Of Weather-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Every Kind Of Weather
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A theatrical double-shot from an iconic playwright and one of our greatest actors.

Bruce Mason is perhaps the most significant playwright in Aotearoa New Zealand’s theatrical history. Writing with courage and insight, he was a lover of language and a champion of the underdog.

Between 1959 and 1978, Bruce toured the country, telling uniquely Kiwi stories about emerging identity, cultural cringe and social difference. From church halls to country shearing sheds to the Edinburgh Festival, Bruce would play anywhere, in any circumstance, to any audience.

To celebrate his extraordinary legacy, Brilliant Adventures and Circa Theatre are collaborating to make two of his greatest solo works resound for a new age.

Two plays: timeless, universal, distinct. Following their critically acclaimed, sold out run of THINGS I KNOW TO BE TRUE, actor Stephen Lovatt and director Shane Bosher return to Circa for a not-to-be missed theatrical encounter with a master craftsman.

THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER
“I invite you to join me, in a voyage into the past, to that territory of the heart we call childhood.”

Bruce Mason’s quintessential Kiwi classic chronicles the friendship between a 12-year-old boy and Firpo, a social outcast who dreams of winning an Olympic medal.

Through the boy’s eyes we see the wonder of life on a perfect beach, in a perfect 1930s New Zealand, during a perfect summer. It’s a world of magic and transformation, where anything can happen and miracles seem possible.

When the boy sets out to help Firpo make his athletic dream a reality, ignoring his father’s rebukes and community ridicule, a battle rages between the eternal optimism of childhood and the harsh pragmatism of adulthood.

Gliding effortlessly between flights of poetic fancy and blunt everyday speech, THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER is New Zealand storytelling at its very best.

NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES
An adolescent boy tries to find his place in an adult-dominated world. A young man retraces an intensely felt boyhood experience of bullying. A playwright in his last days reconciles the value of an artistic life and challenges the idea of New Zealand identity.

Comic disasters and confronting your own hubris. NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES is a richly autobiographical search for self-expression. Profound and true, it is a set of variations about over-reaching, cheekily confronting our very own Tall Poppy Syndrome.

Celebrating Bruce Mason
Directed by Shane Bosher
Performed by Stephen Lovatt

Thursday 20 November to Saturday 13 December
Preview Night: Wed 19 Nov – The End of the Golden Weather
Preview Night: Fri 21 Nov – Not Christmas, But Guy Fawkes
Sunday Special: Sunday 23 November – The End of the Golden Weather
Q&A: Tuesday 25 November
Choose Your Price Night: Wed 26 November – Not Christmas, But Guy Fawkes
Circa Two
Tues – Fri 7.30pm, Sat 4.30pm & 7.30pm, Sun 4.30pm
$30 – $60 Early Bird Tickets Available

Productions play on alternate nights with an opportunity to see both productions in conversation with each other on Saturdays

events.id: New Zealand School of Dance Performance Season 2025-Te Whaea: National Dance and Drama Centre, 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: New Zealand School of Dance Performance Season 2025
events.venue: Te Whaea: National Dance and Drama Centre, 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington
events.long_description:
The New Zealand School of Dance (NZSD) Performance Season is a highlight of the School calendar and a showcase of the extraordinary dedication and passion the students apply to their training throughout the year.

Students from both the classical ballet and contemporary dance streams will showcase their talent in a series of performances allowing audiences of family, friends, supporters and dance enthusiasts the opportunity to see the rising talent of the future.

This year’s event celebrates the huge contribution of the School to the dance landscape in Aotearoa and beyond, with many of the works created by and/or staged by NZSD graduates. The 2025 season demonstrates the diversity of the art form – showcasing luminary new choreographic voices of contemporary dance, while paying homage to the timeless foundations of classical ballet.

A season of 10 performances, showcasing two separate programmes of classical ballet and contemporary dance, where the students will display their extraordinary talent, to audiences of family, friends and dance lovers. The split programme this year features a bold selection of works showcasing both the technical prowess and artistry of these young dancers.
‍

events.id: Rhian Sheehan & Arli Liberman - Traces Album Release Tour-The Great Hall, 15 Buckle Street, Mount Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Rhian Sheehan & Arli Liberman - Traces Album Release Tour
events.venue: The Great Hall, 15 Buckle Street, Mount Cook, Wellington
events.long_description:
Loop are proud to announce that acclaimed New Zealand musicians, composers and producers Rhian Sheehan and Arli Liberman will bring their collaborative album Traces to life for the first time ever, with a special three-show tour this November.

The tour will see the pair perform the album in its entirety at a series of intimate shows in Auckland, Wellington & Christchurch. These shows will see them accompanied by Ed Zuccollo and Riki Pirihi aka Riki Gooch (TrinityRoots, Orchestra Of Spheres) to bring the album to the stage.

This tour marks the long-awaited debut live performance of Traces, an instrumental journey blending electronic, ambient and post-rock soundscapes to create a world unlike anything else — described by filmmaker Sam Kelly as “an ethereal journey through dark and moody worlds.”

For the first time, audiences will be able to experience this collaboration in a live setting. With both artists renowned for their powerful, emotive performances and their ability to craft immersive sound journeys, these shows promise to be as visually striking as they are sonically transporting. Live performances from both Sheehan and Liberman are a rare treat, and this will be only the second-time ever both musicians will be performing together live.

Each show will see Sheehan and Liberman joined by two collaborators on stage to help bring the worlds created in Traces to life. Ed Zuccollo will bring his trademark synth-wizardry to the stage, as he did across a number of tracks on the album. His trademark sound has seen him perform with the likes of Troy Kingi, Kita, The Black Seeds and more, in addition to his own solo work as Zuke. Riki Pirihi aka Riki Gooch is one of NZ’s most celebrated musicians for his work with TrinityRoots, Fat Freddy’s Drop, Cave Circles, and countless others.

The four musicians will combine to perform Traces live, with the second half of the show featuring all four musicians collaborating live on stage with tracks from each artist’s individual catalogues.

These shows will also feature the stunning visuals created for the project by Dunedin-based visual artist Sam Caldwell, which are featured across the album cover and music videos. The Traces live experience will be a richly layered audio and visual feast, unlike anything either artist has performed before..

Tickets go on sale Thursday September 25. Audiences are encouraged to secure theirs early — with only three shows nationwide, these performances promise to be rare, unforgettable events. Presented by Loop, thanks to Manuka Phuel.

events.id: Serenades Across Cultures-Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Church, 43 Ngaio Rd, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Serenades Across Cultures
events.venue: Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Church, 43 Ngaio Rd, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Join Lala Simpson (vocals), Dayle Anderson (piano), Richard Hardie on double bass, and Jonathan Berkahn (accordion) for an enchanting evening of music, where the soulful melodies of French chanson legends like Edith Piaf and Jacques Brel blend seamlessly with the haunting rhythms of Malagasy icons such as Bessa and Fanja Andriamanantena. Be serenaded by heartfelt songs of love, loss, and romance—an unforgettable night of timeless classics that capture the essence of passion and longing.

Join Us for an Unforgettable Concert Experience – A Night of Music with a Heartfelt Purpose!

Last year, as part of our Cultural Immersion Tour, I had the profound privilege of visiting Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, alongside Stuart Simpson, Rose Ruane, and my nieces and nephews. Located on the eastern side of Antananarivo, the capital, the orphanage was founded by the incredible Madame Hary in 2012. What started as a humble project from her own home has grown into a haven for 54 children, some of whom were rescued from areas where twins are sadly believed to be cursed.

Despite the challenges, the orphanage continues to thrive, relying entirely on the kindness of visitors. They grow their own rice, maintain a small chicken farm, and have a vegetable garden to sustain themselves. But their greatest need is for ongoing support and resources to continue providing for these beautiful children.

By attending our concert, you’ll be helping make a direct impact on the lives of these children. All profits from this concert will go toward completing the construction of a much-needed training center and extra bedrooms at Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, helping provide valuable education and support to the children in their care. In May this year, we raised over $4000 at a fundraising concert and $1700 on Givealittle. Help us raise $2500 more so they can finish the building before the arrival of the rainy season.

events.id: World Chase Tag Casual Game Night-101 Kilbirnie Cres, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: World Chase Tag Casual Game Night
events.venue: 101 Kilbirnie Cres, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come play Chase Tag at the Kilbirnie Recreation Center.
Come along to our casual game sessions. These will be open to anyone wanting to play and will be social, casual based rather than keeping score. We will play various versions of tag games: such as Ultimate Tag (which involves multiple evaders), Flight Club (which involves king of the hill format), and Chase-Off (the team version, as seen in World Chase Tag competition videos).
World Chase Tag was formed by Christian Devaux in 2012 after a game of Tag with his son in their back garden. A year later, he was joined by his brother, Damien, and together they set about turning the oldest game into the newest sport.

Cost:
-$4.50

United Help Ukraine’s Medical Aid Program provides supplies and equipment to state-run and military hospitals across Ukraine. United Help Ukraine obtains and distributes everything from syringes to ventilators and other life-saving operating-room equipment.
Would you like to make a sunflower?
We are also operating an open call for sunflower artwork to be exhibited at the event. The sunflower can be created using any medium (we will have options for digital and physical installation). You can choose to sell your sunflower at this event! Proceeds from your sunflower will be split 50/50; half going to you and half being donated to 'United Help Ukraine. There is free entry to sunflower creators, however, any donations to the cause are much appreciated.
If you are interested, register with this form: https://forms.gle/xsCWwn91wDHJQdSD8

events.id: Home, I'm Darling-Studio 73, 73 Main Street, Greytown-Event Finder
events.name: Home, I'm Darling
events.venue: Studio 73, 73 Main Street, Greytown
events.long_description:
The first Greytown Little Theatre production to be presented in the upgraded Studio 73 will be ‘Home, I'm Darling’ - a play by British playwright Laura Wade and will be directed by Victoria Ross.
‘Home, I’m Darling’ opens on Wednesday 19 November for a nine performance season.

The cast has some new faces and regulars returning to the GLT stage and includes Judy - Katie Cooper, Johnny - Egan Tearle, Fran - Lisa McLeod, Marcus - Greg Webb, Sylvia - Jo Crimp, Alex - Anna Logan.
Victoria Ross, the Director, describes ‘Home, I’m Darling’, as a witty-thought provoking piece of theatre and is a play that explores obsession and feminism and asks the question, ‘Have we evolved since the 1950s?’

Since its 2018 debut at Theatr Clwyd, the play has been performed in the West End and toured the UK, as well new productions in Australia and New Zealand. It has won several awards.

events.id: Lads Lads Lads! A Drag King Show-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Lads Lads Lads! A Drag King Show
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Are you ready for a boisterous band of bros?
A hefty helping of handsome heirs?!
A smorgasbord of sweaty studs?!

Then grab the gang and head down to Fringe Bar on 6 June for Lads Lads Lads! A Drag King Show, and prepare yourselves for the most delightful, most glittery, most wholesome masculinity you ever did see (there will be no hazing here!)

Our dazzling cast of dashing dudes and extraordinarily hairy gentlemen are bound to leave your seats moistened, your gobs a gasp, and have you cheering “Yeah the boys!”

So buck up, grab the whole fraternity and head to Eventfinda to grab your tickets from just $20.

Support your local Drag Kings!

Lads Lads Lads!

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($30.00 per ticket)

GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up
Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

You can contact us at willysmackntush@gmail.com

events.id: Stanton Warriors-92A Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Stanton Warriors
events.venue: 92A Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London—raving, clubbing, DJing, and throwing parties.
He returned to Wellington in 2000 and co-founded the event brand Sandwiches that November.
By 2003, Sandwiches had grown into a venue that became an iconic part of Wellington’s nightlife for over a decade, hosting both local and international artists. The brand also expanded into large-scale events, including outdoor music festivals such as Summerset at the Basin Reserve.
Now, The Sandwiches Guy and Meow Nui are joining forces to bring back a classic favourite from the Sandwiches days: Stanton Warriors!
Doors open at 8 pm, with Stanton Warriors hitting the stage at 10 pm. This one-off event is all about community—friends old and new coming together to dance, connect, and celebrate. Don’t miss your chance to be part of a night to remember.

events.id: Crush the Bug-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Crush the Bug
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
Someone wakes up. It is a working man. They are a bug! Sounds familiar, doesn’t it…

Ruff As Gutz presents: CRUSH THE BUG

A new comedic work created by award-winning theatre makers and clown husbands Sean Burnett Dugdale-Martin (MILK saga, ratKing, Buck Scourge: Living Nightmare) and Daniel Nodder (Only Bones – Daniel Nodder, Entry: Encounter, World of WearableArt 2025). These recent alumni from Ecole Philippe Gaulier have concocted a show about metamorphosis, confusion, technology, and humans' great capacity for distractedness. Two clowns attempt to stay on track as their attention spans wane and their curious minds wander. A piece of multimedia madness unfolds -- will they remember which story they are trying to tell? Or what is actually meant to happen in said story? Probably not. Join these award-winning fools in CRUSH THE BUG, a comedic exploration of forgetfulness, metamorphosis, confusion, forgetfulness and--

After traveling to France together to study at École Philippe Gaulier, DAN and SEAN shared a bed and solidified themselves as (platonic?) clown husbands in the city of love. Since returning, they have promptly begun to terrorize their friends and whānau with nonstop jokes, bits and various acts of clownery. They invite you to experience every single thought they have ever had in their head in this 1h concoction of chaotic comedy.

PREVIOUS AWARDS WON BY THESE CLOWNS:
WINNER: Spirit of the Fringe - Sean Burnett Dugdale-Martin - (Auckland Fringe 2020)
WINNER: Grand Design Award - ratKing (NZ Fringe 2023)
WINNER: Outstanding Solo Performance - Only Bones - Daniel Nodder (NZ Fringe 2023)
WINNER: Outside the Box Award - Only Bones - Daniel Nodder (San Diego Fringe 2024)
WINNER: Runner Up Best in Fringe - Only Bones - Daniel Nodder (Dunedin Fringe 2025)

Performer & Co-Creator – Sean Burnett Dugdale-Martin
Performer & Co-Creator – Daniel Nodder
Production Designer & Technician – Anne Larcom
Marketing & Publicity – Julia Bon McDonald
Sound Design & Composition – Ben Kelly
Photography – Charlie Jewell

events.id: Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Funky Fridays Vol.8 - Not My Sister, K-otik, Kimba Jade, Stolen Tuesday
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 8!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out, it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Stolen Tuesday, Kimba Jade, K-otik and Not My Sister
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.
Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11 Stolen Tuesday
11-12 Kimba Jade
12.1 K-otik
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------
NOT MY SISTER
Hailing from Italy and rooted in Wellington’s vibrant scene, Not My Sister burst onto the scene in 2024 and has quickly become one of Aotearoa’s most exciting rising DJs. In such a short time, she’s already lit up dance floors across the country, playing at festivals like Twisted Frequency, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den, and supporting international acts such as KC Lights.
She also holds a radio residency at Wellington’s iconic Radio Active, where her show dives deep into the world of house and underground sounds.
Heavily influenced by funk and disco, and driven by a love for vocals and all things groovy, Not My Sister delivers high-energy, uplifting sets full of passion and playfulness. She weaves together melodic basslines with soulful, tech, garage, and deep house elements, always keeping the crowd moving.
SoundCloud: www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
Facebook:
www.facebook.com/notmysista

Instagram: www.instagram.com/not.my.sister
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@not.my.sister
STOLEN TUESDAY
Stolen Tuesday started life as a house music club dancer in the UK 20 years
ago, and has spent the last 10 years DJing at Wanaka and Queenstown's best
establishments, bringing her unique energy to create magical dance floors.
Since residing in New Zealand, she has previously split her time living between Great Barrier island and Wanaka, spreading the love through her weekly radio shows on Wanaka Beats and Aotea FM. Not shy of the underground scene, you will also find Stolen Tuesday getting down off grid and playing at bush doofs.
Best known for dropping all things bassy which exude an element of fun matching her own high energy, guest appearances on Base FM (Auckland) alongside well known Auckland DJs have helped showcase her enthusiasm and talent.
With a style ranging from glitter box style disco and funk, to dirty after hours Tech House and all things in between, including the occasional breaks/ghetto funk set, it’s no surprise that She has been a regular on the South Island festival scene where she has been happy warming up or playing after notable international artists. She has also played at Otherlanz and remotely at Great Barrier Island’s new Wingman festival.
Stolen Tuesday now resides in Wellington and whilst fairly new to the city has already played several times for both the 'Open air' brand at Carlucci land and with Wellington renowned 'Little monsters' notably shaking things up at this year's Newtown festival.
Although not one to take herself too seriously, Stolen Tuesday knows it all comes down to the music and having a good time!
Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/user-720686581
KIMBA JADE
Kimba Jade has been lighting up dancefloors for over 20 years with her signature blend of deep, funky, and globally inspired grooves. A master of musical journeying, she weaves bass-driven beats with tribal, melodic, and soulful sounds that move both body and spirit.
With a deep passion for Ecstatic Dance and the power of music to connect and uplift, Kimba brings that same vibrant energy into clubs and bars. Her sets fuse Tech House, Indie Dance, and Techno, blending driving rhythms with emotive melodies to create an atmosphere that’s both immersive and electric.
After years in Sydney and Auckland’s underground scenes, Kimba now calls Wellington home—bringing her unique mix of rhythm, soul, and bass to local dance floors.
Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/kimba
Facebook:
www.facebook.com/kimbadj/

Instangram: @djkimbajade
K-OTIK
Based in Wellington, New Zealand, K-otiK is a multi-genre DJ. His sound spans house, tech house, bass house, and techno — laced with heavy vocals and thumping basslines. With a cheeky stage presence and high energy behind the decks, K-otiK takes crowds on journeys that balance careful curation with unexpected twists. A regular on RadioActive FM and part of Wellington’s Open Air collective, he’s built a reputation for spreading joy through music. For K-otiK, music does not discriminate — it’s the universal language that brings people together.
Instangram: @dj_kotik_nz

events.id: Lower Hutt parkrun tutu Pacer Event-South end of riverside car park, off Daly Street,Theramas, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Lower Hutt parkrun tutu Pacer Event
events.venue: South end of riverside car park, off Daly Street,Theramas, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Lower Hutt parkrun tutu Pacer Event
Welcome to our last pacer event of the 2025 calendar year and we are looking forward to seeing everyone dressed up in tutus as we approach into Summer with nicer weather.

If you are training for other racing events - long or short distance that you are looking into after the new year festive season, then this pacer event will hopefully improve your goals in mind for a faster mins/km.

We aim to have a range of pacers available, whole minutes ranging from 20 to 40 minutes to keep you on track and get you to the finish. The aim could be to get a personal best on this course, beat your overall PB or can be a goal to bring a person with you, which could inspire them to run. You will receive a pacer credit and a run towards your name, if you are pacing at the event! Another reason to help others achieve their goals.

Pacers so far:
20:00 - Matt D.
22:00
23:00
25:00 - Ioann v.
26:00 - Anthony B.
28:00 - Koko I.
30:00 - Claire M.
32:00 - Michi I.
35:00 - Victoria L.
37:00 - Maria D.

events.long_description:
Leefield Station Grape & Gravel: A Great Bike Race 2025
Leefield Station Grape & Gravel – The Great Bike Race 🚴‍♂️🍇🔥

Join us on Saturday 22nd November at Leefield Station, Marlborough, for a ride like no other. Whether you’re here to push yourself on the course or soak up the atmosphere from the sidelines, this is a day that celebrates adventure, community, and the land that makes it all possible.

👉 What to expect:
A unique ride through rolling hills, vineyard valleys and farmland tracks, rich in adventure, camaraderie, and great Leefield Station Flavour!

Course options to suit both seasoned riders, weekend warriors, friends looking for fun, or the whole family. There is both bike & e-bike categories and even a free kids race for under 12s.

Delicious Leefield Station BBQ featuring our own farm produce
Coffee, wine, and refreshments to keep the energy flowing all day
Post-ride celebrations with live music, prizes, and good vibes
Bring your bike, your mates, and your appetite for fun — because at Leefield Station, we do nothing by halves.

Join us for Marlborough's newest mountain biking and wine-tourism event!

📍 Location: Leefield Station, 1171 Waihopai Valley Rd, RD6, Blenheim, Marlborough.
🕘 Time: Gates open 8.30am.
Pre-race briefing will commence at approx 9.45am followed by kids race. Main races will follow. Event finishes at 3pm.

For more info about this event check out our events page including video:
https://marisco.co.nz/pages/grape-and-gravel-2025

events.id: Wellington Region Puzzle Swap-NZCIS - NZ Campus of Innovation and Sport,30 Somme Rd, Silverstream, Upper Hutt 5019, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Region Puzzle Swap
events.venue: NZCIS - NZ Campus of Innovation and Sport,30 Somme Rd, Silverstream, Upper Hutt 5019, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Wellington Region Puzzle Swap
Bring a puzzle and swap a puzzle!

Come enjoy the NZJPA Regionals and watch some speed puzzling action if you fancy it, there are puzzle activities to try your hand at, Raffles and a spot of coffee - but more importantly get your puzzle fix by swapping out your puzzles for some new inspiration!
This event is free for all to attend

Hope to see you there!


IMPORTANT! The puzzle swap operates on an honesty-based system. NZJPA will not be inspecting puzzles and cannot guarantee their completeness or condition. We are providing a space for puzzle enthusiasts to swap puzzles.

Please refrain from bringing puzzles with missing pieces or significant damage (e.g., water damage, severe fraying). It's important to ensure everyone has a positive experience.

Swap puzzles 'like-for-like'. For example, exchange a 1000-piece puzzle for another 1000-piece puzzle, or a 500-piece puzzle for another 500-piece puzzle.

For puzzles with an irregular number of pieces, choose the nearest size available, considering both size and quality. The attendant can help you decide if needed.

Enjoy swapping and updating your puzzle collection!

Wellington Region Puzzle Swap Bring a puzzle and swap a puzzle!
This event is free for all to attend Hope to see you there!
IMPORTANT!
The puzzle swap operates on an honesty-based system.
We are providing a space for puzzle enthusiasts to swap puzzles.

events.long_description:
Bubbly Balance – Mindful movement meets Méthode Traditionnelle
Find your flow, feel your balance and celebrate the sparkle of life at Bubbly Balance, hosted in the beautiful gardens of Hunter’s Wines.

We’ll begin with a barefoot walk through the native garden before easing into a mindful movement session that blends yoga, pilates and tai chi. It’s the perfect mix of grounding calm and uplifting energy, all set to the rhythm of breath and nature.

Afterwards, the focus turns to bubbles. Enjoy a guided tasting of Hunter’s acclaimed MiruMiru™ sparkling range, paired with flavourful bites that bring out the best in each glass. Learn a little, laugh a lot and toast to balance, celebration and the simple joy of being present.

And if you want, stay on after the event to relax in the garden with a glass of wine or a light lunch from Hunter’s seasonal menu.

events.id: PET First Aid Course - Wellington-Four Small Paws Ltd,7 George Daniels drive, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: PET First Aid Course - Wellington
events.venue: Four Small Paws Ltd,7 George Daniels drive, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
PET First Aid Course - Wellington
Our Pet First Aid Courses educate both pet owners and those working in the industry on animal first aid and emergency situations.
Studies show that 90% of all pets will experience at least one emergency situation in their lifetime!
- Would you know what to do if your pet choked on their toy?
- Would you know what to do if your pet stopped breathing?
- Would you know what to do if your pet was hit by a car?
Most people would not, which is why PET First Aid & Training (NZ) Ltd developed a concise, New Zealand focused first aid course that was available to everyone.
The course covers 23 different situations and it is hands on for all attendees. Using specially imported mannequins from the USA you will learn CPR and rescue breathing. You will practice your bandaging skills on live animals. Learn to recognise everyday poisons, the symptoms and how to help stabilise your animal until you can get professional help. This course will empower you and give you confidence in an emergency situation.
Each person receives:
- Full Colour Manual
- Emergency Response Plan
- Poisonous Food Fact Sheet
- Poisonous Household Item Fact
Sheet
- Poisonous Plants Fact Sheet
- Certificate - valid for 2 years
Course attendance is limited to 10 people to ensure that everyone gets the opportunity to get involved. As places are limited book in quick not to miss out!
Accredited for NZVNA CPD
Accredited for Duke of Edinburgh Hilary Award - bronze skill section
Animal Evac NZ partner - discount available for volunteers
The course runs for 6 hours and costs $189.00 per person / $160 per student (group rates available, please inquire).
To book:
www.petfat.co.nz

0508 PET FIRST

The course covers 23 different situations and it is hands on for all attendees.

Wild Forest Camp Wellington
This is to introduce outdoor camping to our NZ Adventure Women’s group lead by Chloe and Jono who run NZ Fun Adventures.
You will need to carry in everything for your stay including a tent/shelter, food and cooking items.
We will be showing you some skills from real life map reading skills to lighting a camp fire from scratch. How to source dry wood, preparing the fire safely and then actually getting to enjoy it in the evening for cooking etc.

The location details will be set inside the NZ Adventure Woman’s group post.
Children are absolutely welcome to attend and enjoy in the experience with us.

There is no charge for this event. We have a limited number of spaces available due to the camping location so once this is reached we will close the event.

We look forward to seeing you at the event.
If you have any questions please feel free to message Jonathan Collins directly 😊

events.id: 🧠 The Starving Brain | A Yogic Perspective on Nourishment, Energy & Focus-68 The Esplanade, Raumati South-All Events In
events.name: 🧠 The Starving Brain | A Yogic Perspective on Nourishment, Energy & Focus
events.venue: 68 The Esplanade, Raumati South
events.long_description:
🧠 The Starving Brain | A Yogic Perspective on Nourishment, Energy & Focus
We often talk about eating less — but not about what happens when we don’t eat enough.
When the body is under-fuelled, the brain takes priority — quietly redirecting energy away from digestion, hormones, and even mood regulation.

From a yogic lens, this is more than biology.
When energy stops flowing freely (prana), we lose clarity, intuition, and the natural rhythm that keeps body and mind in harmony.

In this 2-hour workshop, we’ll explore:
• Why the brain “steals” energy when under stress or depletion
• The emotional energy of food — and what your cravings might be teaching you
• The science of fasting — when it supports healing and when it harms
• The gut–brain connection and how awareness restores balance
• How nourishment, breath, and rhythm support neuroplasticity and vitality

We’ll finish with Q&A and discussion to help you integrate the insights into your own life.

💰 $40 per person
📍 Yoga Studio, Raumati South
🔗 Book here:

https://35daydetox.simplybook.net/v2/

“In yoga, nourishment isn’t indulgence — it’s how energy becomes consciousness.”

35 Day Detox | Reclaim your energy. Live with intention.
