From a yogic lens, this is more than biology.
When energy stops flowing freely (prana), we lose clarity, intuition, and the natural rhythm that keeps body and mind in harmony.
In this 2-hour workshop, we’ll explore: • Why the brain “steals” energy when under stress or depletion • The emotional energy of food — and what your cravings might be teaching you • The science of fasting — when it supports healing and when it harms • The gut–brain connection and how awareness restores balance • How nourishment, breath, and rhythm support neuroplasticity and vitality We’ll finish with Q&A and discussion to help you integrate the insights into your own life.

events.long_description:
Stitch your truth- Words that matter
Need some time to pause, reflect, and nourish yourself?

Join us for a mindful stitching workshop where we'll slow down and create together.

What we'll do:
• Drop into a gentle meditation
• Stitch meaningful words into fabric, creating your own unique art piece
• Enjoy yummy snacks and hot drinks
• Connect with others in a calm, supportive space

What to expect:
This is a workshop about slowing down and giving yourself permission to create. We'll spend time stitching words we want to hear or say into fabric - no rushing, no pressure, just mindful making.

Who is this for:
Anyone seeking downtime, quiet reflection, creative expression, or simply a break from the everyday. No stitching or artistic experience needed.

What's included:
All materials, tea, snacks, and gentle guidance throughout.

Cost: $35 pp
Spaces are limited

To register, email:

events.id: Amélie the Musical-Hannah Playhouse, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Amélie the Musical
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
‘Amélie the Musical’ is set to enchant Wellington for its Australasian premiere. The show will play at The Hannah theatre in November. The Grammy and Olivier Award-nominated adaptation follows shy Amélie Poulain, who carries out small acts of kindness for those around her. 
Wellington’s Rachel McSweeney, who played Sophie in the 2025 production of ‘Mamma Mia!’, stars as Amélie. Gemma Hoskins is Amélie’s mother, and William Duignan plays the pop icon Elton John. A cast of thirteen takes on many roles, from greengrocers to goldfish. Produced by WITCH Music Theatre, the show captures the whimsy of the film that made Amélie a global favourite. It features a Grammy-nominated score by Daniel Messé and Nathan Tyson, as well as a witty book by Craig Lucas. Directors Maya Handa Naff and Nick Lerew, with music director Hayden Taylor, bring Amélie’s quirky world to life. The Guardian has described the musical as “a magical and emotional triumph”.
events.description:
‘Amélie the Musical’ is set to enchant Wellington for its Australasian premiere.
The Grammy and Olivier Award-nominated adaptation follows shy Amélie Poulain, who carries out small acts of kindness for those around her.
Wellington’s Rachel McSweeney, who played Sophie in the 2025 production of ‘Mamma Mia!’, stars as Amélie.
Gemma Hoskins is Amélie’s mother, and William Duignan plays the pop icon Elton John.
Produced by WITCH Music Theatre, the show captures the whimsy of the film that made Amélie a global favourite.

events.id: Christmas in the Quarters--Wellington NZ
events.name: Christmas in the Quarters
events.long_description:
All your favourite Christmas traditions play out across four Saturdays in November and December. The Wellington festive season has a suitably summer flavour with a host of fun activities brought to you by Wellington City Council. 
Christmas in the Quarters kicks off with Christmas crafts in Midland Park on Saturday, 22 November. There are five craft activities to enjoy, plus face painting. Kids can also post a letter in Santa’s letterbox. On Saturday, 29 November, the whole family can enjoy Christmas music and performances. There will be choirs, hip-hop dance, ukulele playing, and more. Chill out and absorb the sounds and sights of Christmas.

events.id: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The impact of colonisation and urban drift are themes in a theatrical reboot at the next Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. ‘Waiora Te Ūkaipō — The Homeland’ was originally commissioned by the festival in 1992. Its return 34 years later at the 2026 festival is highly anticipated. It has become a landmark piece of New Zealand theatre — exploring the tension between past and future. Set in the summer of 1965, the play follows Hone, who brings his family from New Zealand’s East Cape to the South Island in search of a better life. As they gather for a beachside birthday hāngī with their Pākehā guests, buried secrets and cultural tensions rise to the surface. Far from their  tīpuna , the family must navigate questions of identity, belonging, and survival. 
Waiora Te Ūkaipō was conceived, written and directed by Hone Kouka (Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kahungunu). The multi-award-winning writer/director has penned 13 plays. Many have been staged in Aotearoa and further afield in Canada, South Africa, New Caledonia, and the UK. Waiora Te Ūkaipō is presented in partnership with the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts, Te Ahurei Toi o Tāmaki Auckland Arts Festival, Auckland Theatre Company and Tawata Productions.

events.id: Heathers the Musical-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Heathers the Musical
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s Westerberg High, where popularity is a matter of life and death. Welcome to ‘Heathers the Musical”. Based on a movie with the same name, the show is a coming-of-age story dealing with love, heartache, defying expectations, and being true to yourself. It originally premiered in Los Angeles in 2013. Since then, the musical has had record-breaking seasons across the globe. It now makes its professional New Zealand debut in 2026, and Wellington is in line to join the school assembly. Described as a high-octane, black comedy rock musical, Heathers is packed with a mix of ballads and showstoppers. The catchy tunes are written by Kevin Murphy (Desperate Housewives) and Laurence O’Keefe (Legally Blonde: The Musical). 
The 1989 film starred Winona Ryder and Christian Slater. It quickly achieved cult status among audiences. Both the movie and musical follow high school student Veronica Sawyer. Veronica is just another nobody until she’s unexpectedly taken under the wings of the beautiful and cruel Heathers. When mysterious teen rebel J.D. arrives, Veronica learns that it might kill to be a nobody, but it's murder being a somebody. 
This special production will feature a stellar Australasian cast. So grab your scrunchies, break out the Corn Nuts and wait for the bell to ring.

events.id: Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience-Innermost Gardens,The Inner Mt Victoria, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience
events.venue: Innermost Gardens,The Inner Mt Victoria, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience
Red Scare Theatre Company is proud to present Farrago Bazaar, an original Immersive theatre production with live action role-play elements. Unlike traditional theatre, you will be right in the middle of the action, and will have the power to shape the direction of the story.

400 years after the collapse of capitalism, the town of Farrago is preparing for its annual festival, where visitors from tribes across the continent will join to share food, stories and ideas. Parents and children are reunited; forbidden lovers search for each other; survivors of capitalism's last stronghold seek refuge. Amongst the six intertwining main narratives, the audience members each play characters from the visiting tribes and are free to shape the story as they see fit.

The culmination of artistic director Cassandra Tse’s PhD work into Immersive theatre and marking 12 years of Red Scare Theatre Company, Farrago Bazaar is the company’s most ambitious work yet, with a cast of twenty performers making up the various tribes of this post-post-apocalyptic world.

During the show, audiences can be drawn in to scripted storylines or create their own. As well as exploring the Bazaar – Innermost Gardens, transformed into a bustling market with secrets around every corner – they’ll be treated to a Farragonian feast.

Farrago Bazaar is a one-day experience with only two performances, on Saturday 22nd November: a matinee at 2pm and an evening show at 7pm.

Tickets are available now at https://www.redscare.co.nz/farrago-bazaar

events.id: Kapiti Crop Swap WAIKANAE-Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Parish,43 Ngaio Rd, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae-All Events In
events.name: Kapiti Crop Swap WAIKANAE
events.venue: Otaki Waikanae Presbyterian Parish,43 Ngaio Rd, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Kapiti Crop Swap WAIKANAE
THIS INVITE IS FOR THE WAIKANAE SWAP😁🌱
Everyone is welcome to our CROP SWAP meetings!
1st Saturday of the month – Otaki (1-2pm)
2nd Saturday of the month – Raumati (1-2pm)
3rd Saturday of the month – Pukerua Bay (3-4pm)
4th Saturday of the month – Waikanae (2-3pm)
To be clear, at Crop Swap, we swap more than just crops! We share everything homegrown and homemade: Vegetables, fruits, herbs, plants, seedlings, flowers, seeds, baking, preserves, sauces, jam and all things yummy! You can also bring everything garden and kitchen related like empty containers, tools, labels, planting pots, worm juice, coffee grounds, gardening magazines, cook books, recipes, a SKILL…possibilities are endless.
The key is that this is a cashless event, no koha can offered or accepted.
This is generally how a Crop Swap will run:
2-2.15pm
• People arrive with their crops and put them out on the tables provided.
• You are then free to chat and mingle with your fellow garden enthusiasts, exchange tips, make new friends or just wait until it starts.
2.15-2.45pm
• We conduct a quick briefing outlining the guidelines for swapping.
• If there is not a lot of people, we can listen to anyone who wants to introduce their crop.
• Once everyone has placed their crops we like to do a Karakia to bless the kai. We want to emphasise our values regarding generous giving and mindful taking.
2.45-3pm
• Close out, put away tables and clear the hall.
The meetings will be held regularly on the 2nd Saturday of every month in Raumati and the last Saturday of every month in Waikanae.
Further information:
1. There will be a koha food box for anyone who wants to donate food or seedlings in addition to their swaps. The Crop Swap team will distribute any koha crop and left over crops to local food pantries.
2. If you do not have any crops to swap but need fresh fruit or veges for the next week, you can bring plants, flowers, seedlings, herbs, eggs, preserves, jams, baking, liquid manure, gardening books, magazines, planting containers, sometimes even chooks who need a new home! We want this to be accessible to everyone, especially those who are struggling to put fresh fruit and veges on the table!

events.name: Saturday Sounds | James Stent
events.venue: The Bond Store,3C Magrath Ave, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Saturday Sounds | James Stent
James Stent is a 19 year old singer, guitarist, and songwriter from Ōtaki. He draws on a lot of old school pop music like Billy Joel and Queen, and his voice has been compared to people like Frank Sinatra and Michael Bublé. Expect a mix of guitar accompanied singing as well as backing tracks. Whenever James plays acoustic guitar he puts some extra spice into it, as he comes from a very technical electric guitar background. His performances reflect the unique blend of styles and genres he has picked up over the years.

__
Check out the rest of the 2025/6 season here: https://www.mostlymusic.nz/saturday-sounds

Saturday Sounds is a partnership between Mostly Music and The Bond Store. We have worked collaboratively to create an environment where musicians are welcomed and celebrated, and where audiences are encouraged to sit and listen to the music while enjoying excellent hospitality.

For more info about Mostly Music, check out mostlymusic.nz
For more info about The Bond Store check out thebondstore.co.nz

events.id: Nui Hui 7-14 Waiu St, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt 5014-All Events In
events.name: Nui Hui 7
events.venue: 14 Waiu St, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt 5014
events.long_description:
Nui Hui 7
NUI HUI 7 – LIVE AT 14 WAIU STREET
Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
Saturday 22 November 2025 | 4PM – LATE

Nui Hui is back – louder, prouder, and more unfiltered than ever. This grassroots music series is built for the people, by the people, shining a spotlight on bands who grind it out, carve their own paths, and keep live music alive.

Nui Hui 7 is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge, and soul against a true blue-collared backdrop. No industry machines, no corporate gloss – just raw, rising talent backed by the passion of locals and volunteers who believe in the power of music.

This year’s lineup is stacked with unsigned and upcoming artists from across the region and beyond:

4PM – Munkiez

With a sound as cheeky and chaotic as their name suggests, MUNKIEZ is a bluesy, funk-rock explosion that proves good times and great grooves go hand-in-hand. Hailing from Upper Hutt, this crew is all about embracing the raw energy of rock and roll while slathering on a thick coat of soulful, slinky funk.
They're not here to reinvent the wheel, but to make it spin faster, dirtier, and with a whole lot more swagger. With a dash of that no-nonsense, straight-outta-the-garage Kiwi attitude. MUNKIEZ are a band you feel in your bones, a sound that gets your head nodding and your feet moving before you even realize what's happening. They play it like they mean it, because they do.

5PM – The Groundsmen

Scott Paddock and Shane Martin formed The Groundsmen back in the heady days of 2017 and went through various drummers and bass players before finally finding stability with drummer Rowan Carlyle in 2018.

Since then they’ve played numerous gigs (one supporting Head Like A Hole in Gisborne at Smash Palace 30th anniversary) and released 3 singles on Spotify and other streaming platforms - Black Car, Supanova and Achtung Baby (check them out!).

They’ve recorded their debut album and are just about to mix it and release it.

Playing only original earthen rock punk, we always, always, perform at 110% energy levels and put on a great show with hooky uptempo toons!! With songs commenting on contemporary society and life at large all 3 members throw themselves fully into their performance and leave no energy unused. You will leave one of their shows changed.

See the excerpt from a review of a in Whanganui July 2020:

“After a quick change of equipment, The Groundsmen were next on the agenda. Proclaiming themselves to be Taranaki’s premier rock punk band, the trio wasted no time in belting out a hard and fast set of original, classic punk-inspired tunes that were lapped up by the growing gathering of punters. Bass player Scott Paddock is a tour-de-force; full of noise, energy and an appropriate rock-punk swagger. Along with guitarist Shane Martin and drummer Rowan Carlyle, The Groundsmen powered their way though and energetic set, and it was immediately evident that they were ecstatic to be back on stage and performing again after the recent enforced hiatus. The trio powered through a set of classic, no-frills, original punk inspired tracks that had almost everyone in the room either on their feet or gyrating in their seats. Definitely a crowd-pleaser, there is no doubt whatsoever that The Groundsmen were in their element, and clearly love what they do.”

….from Ambient Light, author Bridget Herlihy, 4th July 2020

6PM – Kaletta Band

Kaletta is a Latin rock band that brings together the rhythms of ska punk and gypsy sounds in Spanish. With musicians from Chile, Colombia, Argentina, Italy, the UK, and New Zealand, our sound is a blend of different beats and roots. We've had the privilege of being two-time national finalists in the Battle of the Bands (BOTB 2024 and 2025) and have performed at festivals like Island Bay and toured the top South Island. We're excited about our upcoming tours in New Zealand next year.

What we're passionate about is creating music that's true to ourselves. Each song is a journey, moving from calm to energetic moments that we hope will keep you engaged. Our lyrics touch on social and political themes, and we hope our performances will inspire thought and conversation. We're looking forward to sharing our music with you and creating memorable experiences through our dynamic sound and energy.

7PM – Burning Embers

Accustomed to breaching anything that requires sociable etiquette they still manage to pull off their unique brand of Wainuiomata rock.

From out of nowhere, they regroup, drink a few, set a plan, and do the complete opposite in tasteful fashion. Burning Embers have an uncanny habit of pulling off a great set, usually unscripted but full of the essence that is Rock n Roll. We're not here long enough to care, but we do love a great audience
Reminiscent of Days of the New and Alice in Chains they're definitely genuine entertainment

8PM – Stretch to Mould

Stretch to Mould is a rock band from Wellington New Zealand who formed in 2012. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Darrell Vickers, who has been the only constant member throughout multiple line up changes. Since 2024 the line up has consisted of Vickers alongside Chris Fursdon (bass guitar) and Thomas Fuller (Drums). Stretch to Mould are known for their high energy, hard hitting riffs, powerful vocals and all-round solid musicianship. The band released their debut album Shadows in 2012, EP Painting Faces in 2014 and are currently working on their next release.

9PM – Ras Judah and the Culture Embassy

a 10-piece NZ band of varying cultural backgrounds, hence the name.
The cultural diversity of the band is reflected in the sound of the music
a fusion of African styles, Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro-Latin rhythms.

We describe our sound as Afrocentric-World Music as much of what we play is based on African rhythms and songs, which is where our lead-singer ‘Ras Judah’ and two of our master drummers come from (Botswana, Ghana and Tanzania respectively), plus Roots Reggae. Though everyone contributes their own culturally inspired sound, with other band members from Cuba, England and Japan, and others with Greek, Kiwiana and jazz backgrounds. Not just a musical treat representing many parts of the world, but also a visual one; a carnival of ethnic diversity and collaboration on stage!

10PM – The Fabulous Pakehas

Were first conceived in London England, way back in the early 90s whilst on O.E's. Currently working on a album, & after 33 years, still in no rush.
With two of us having roots in WOA TFP are honoured to be playing a set of our originals for NUI HUI 7
The T.F.P original line up are, Antony Maddock, Scott McGill, Leslie Tearne, &
Bevan Ritchie.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From soul-stirring grooves to fist-in-the-air anthems, Nui Hui 7 is more than just a gig – it’s a celebration of musicians who hustle, create, and share their art on their own terms.

Nui Hui: supporting local, celebrating original, and keeping the fire of live music burning

Also check out other Music events in Lower Hutt, Entertainment events in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.name: Nui Hui 7 - Fly High Brother Paul
events.venue: 14 Waiu St, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt 5014
events.long_description:
Nui Hui 7 - Fly High Brother Paul
'In Rocking Memory of Paul Norris'
R.I.P Brother'

NUI HUI 7 – LIVE AT 14 WAIU STREET
Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
Saturday 22 November 2025 | 4PM – LATE

Nui Hui is back – louder, prouder, and more unfiltered than ever. This grassroots music series is built for the people, by the people, shining a spotlight on bands who grind it out, carve their own paths, and keep live music alive.

Nui Hui 7 is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge, and soul against a true blue-collared backdrop. events.id: Porirua Parkrun-Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Porirua Parkrun
events.venue: Bothamley Park, Champion Street, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"

events.id: Manawatu Saloon Champs + Sidecar Best Pairs-85 Cuba Street, New Zealand 4410,85 Cuba St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North-All Events In
events.name: Manawatu Saloon Champs + Sidecar Best Pairs
events.venue: 85 Cuba Street, New Zealand 4410,85 Cuba St, Palmerston North 4410, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Manawatu Saloon Champs + Sidecar Best Pairs
Speedway action this Saturday night at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway where the Manawatu Saloon Championship is decided along with the exhilarating side-by-side Sidecar racing action for the AFC Motorcycles Sidecar Best Pairs. Saturday night will also see the return of V8 Modifieds racing wheel to wheel around the Robertson Prestige International Speedway. Fantastic SuperStocks, metal crunching Stockcars and eye-catching Minisprints add to a massive night of entertainment.

A quality field of drivers is expected for the sought after Manawatu Saloon Championship adding to a packed show at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway in the form of Corvettes, Camaros and Mustangs racing wheel-to-wheel. The wide tyres and thundering V8 engines add another style of speedway racing which is proving popular not only with drivers but the spectators alike. The Saloon racing this season has been competitive at the Robertson Prestige International Speedway with local drivers including 7p Clayton More, 57p Calvin Honore, 81p Jonathan Mason, and 242p Ashleigh King all looking to be in contention for the title.

Adding to the exciting programme is the AFC Motorcycles Sidecar Best Pairs which will see some of the country’s best sidecar combinations pair up and battle it out. With 14 combinations confirmed including 5p Wingnut & Sam McNaught, 8p Rob Miller & Jaxon Hannan, 17p Tony Hislop & Aidan Foothead, recent Ray Tarrant Sidecar Memorial winners 27b Craig Boaler & Kayla Meehan all included in the sensational field. The Robertson Prestige International Speedway has seen some spectacular Sidecar racing and this best pair championship is set to deliver this high calibre of entertainment for the fans once again!

With the return of the V8 Modifieds to the Robertson Prestige International Speedway, expect a high calibre of side-by-side racing from these v8 powered race cars with replica fiberglass car bodies and big wings! Drivers including Newton Gordge from Taranaki, Cody Hata from Auckland, 28w Ricky Dykstra and 9e Sheldon Arapere have indicated that they will be in attendance for this momentous return of Modified racing to the Robertson Prestige International Speedway.

Adding to the packed programme this Saturday night, the Superstocks will hit the track with grit, steel, and determination to be at the front of the pack. Metal crunching Stockcars will be battling it out for the chequered flag as well. Both classes race Side-by-side and bumper-to-bumper, these drivers in both classes mean business, with their fearless attitude and willingness to put on a show its anyone’s guess who will carry the chequered flag at the end of the race! Rounding out what is set to be a massive night the Minisprints make their return ahead of their Oval Superstars Tour first round the following weekend.

Classes in action are SuperStocks, Stockcars, Saloons, Sidecars, Modifieds, Minisprints

Drivers, please follow the below link to register your intention to race on the 22nd November
https://www.pnspeedway.co.nz/forms/22-11-2025

Please Note: Entries in other classes will determine whether Youth Ministocks are added to the programme later in the week.

Admission prices are $30 for an Adult (16 years and over), $10 for Children aged 8-15, and $70 for a Family pass of 2 adults and up to four children. Kids aged 7 and under are FREE.

Tickets are available to pre-purchase online from www.eventfinda.co.nz , (tickets purchased incur an additional service fee) or on race day from Gate 1 (Waldegrave Street), Gate 2 (Cuba Street - Bridge) and Gate 3 (Cook Street) from 5.30pm.

Racing Starts 6.30pm.

Click here to view a full list of the Arena terms and conditions of entry https://venuespn.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/Terms-and-Conditions-of-Entry-2023.pdf

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
This Course runs over the 11th, 12th, 18th and 19th of October not the 18th, 19th, 25th and 26th listed.

PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun, safe, relevant, and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in, your PADI qualification will be recognised.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend, we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive, so we can go at your pace, no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend, you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed, you will be ready for the sea dives.

Once you are a certified diver, you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification on-line. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course, and our regular Dive Days.

We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call, email or stop by our Dive Store.

Kind regards,
Tony Howell
PADI Course Director
Tel: 04 233-8238 Email: nzsa@scubadiving.co.nz Web: www.scubadiving.co.nz
9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua 5026


PADI Open Water Diver course at a glance:
•Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
•Practical: One weekend pool training, one weekend with four sea dives
•Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
•Start Time: Please be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am daily.

Location:
We are located at 9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Check our website for location.

Prerequisites:
•Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
•Be able to swim 300m (no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
•Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts, a visit to your doctor is required.
•Elearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
•Complete the RDP Tables Quiz and Exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring:
•Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
•If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
•A pen, swimming costume, towel and a snack for the breaks.

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures,9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua, New Zealand
events.long_description:
PADI Open Water Diver Course
“Ever Since I Was A Kid I’ve Wanted To Learn To SCUBA Dive…”

PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun safe relevant and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in your PADI qualification will be recognised.

To learn to dive first complete the medical questionnaire to make sure you are medically fit to dive. Next pay your deposit and select your course dates. You will receive your PADI eLearning theory which must be completed before you attend the first practical session. This simple and fun eLearning program will give you the knowledge you need to understand the reason for the skills you will learn.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive so we can go at your pace no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed you will be ready for the sea dives.

During the second weekend you complete four sea dives two per day. This is where we confirm and practice the skills you learnt in our pool – all under direct supervision. You will also complete a simple 300m swim (no time limit and wearing wetsuit mask snorkel and fins).

Once you are a certified diver you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification online. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course and our regular Dive Days.
Our aim is to prepare you for the fascinating adventure of diving. We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call email or stop by our Dive Store.
 
PPADI Open Water Diver course at a glance
Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
Practical: One weekend pool training one weekend with four sea dives
Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
Start Time: Be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am each day.

Location
We are located at 9 Marina View Mana Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Our Location

Prerequisites
Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
Be able to swim 300m (mask snorkel and fins no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts a visit to your doctor is required.
eLearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
Complete the Optional RDP Tables Quiz and Exam after the final exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring
Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
A pen swimming costume towel and a snack for the breaks.
Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost
Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
Includes: PADI eLearning Course Dive Gear Rental Pool Sessions and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased.
10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.

Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course
Course bookings can be made in-store via email online or over the phone
The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
eLearning courses once redeemed cannot be transferred.
Before we can send you the eLearning link we require your full name date of birth a valid personal email address and phone number.
Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Activities For Certified PADI Open Water Divers
Local Diving; It’s a good idea to keep diving regularly especially in the weeks following your course. We’re here to help with advice on dive sites and gear rental. Want a guide? Join us for Dive Days!
Advanced Open Water course; Further your dive skills and continue your underwater adventures with the PADI Advanced Open Water course you can start straight after your Open Water Diver course.
As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you can take the following Specialty Diver courses alongside those available to non-divers; Altitude Diver – AWARE Fish ID diver – Boat Diver – Digital Underwater Photographer – Diver Propulsion Vehicle Diver – Drift Diver – Drysuit Diver – Enriched Air/Nitrox Diver – Equipment Specialist – Night Diver – Peak Performance Buoyancy – Sidemount Diver – Underwater Naturalist – Underwater Navigation

events.id: 2025 Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour-North Wairarapa, State Highway 2, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: 2025 Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour
events.venue: North Wairarapa, State Highway 2, Masterton
events.long_description:
2025 will mark 15 years of Pūkaha’s much-loved annual fundraiser – the Wairarapa Garden Tour.

This two-day, self-drive garden tour will feature beautiful and unique gardens in North Wairarapa.

Highlights include…

Scenic Garden Trails
Wander through enchantingly designed gardens adorned with an abundance of native plants, exotic flowers, and captivating sculptures.

Meet the Gardeners
Gain insights from passionate gardeners who have nurtured these landscapes into works of art.

Exclusive Workshops
Learn gardening tips and tricks from experts, and uncover the secrets behind creating and maintaining a stunning garden.

The Market Fair
Indulge in delectable local cuisine and beverages and shop quality local handicrafts amidst picturesque surroundings.

Pick your gardens and choose your route according to whatever tickles your gardening fancy. The tour offers at least a dozen private gardens (not usually open to the public) to choose from. Gardens are revealed in the lead-up to tour weekend.

Locally-sourced and home-made refreshments will be available in selected gardens and BYO picnics are welcome in some gardens. Look for the icons to guide you.

Ticketed Event- early Bird tickets on sale 15 September 2025

events.id: Cooking - Singapore Nyonya Food-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking - Singapore Nyonya Food
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Love scrumptious Nyonya or Peranakan food? Combining Chinese, Malay and other influences, come and discover how to make your own Nyonya cuisine. Some communal ingredients supplied, a list of other ingredients will be sent out before the course starts (approx cost $35).

Description
Create some classic mouth-watering and flavourful Nyonya dishes. Come and discover how to blend ingredients with distinct spices and cooking techniques. You can easily replicate these dishes at home.

Some ingredients supplied but a list of additional ingredients needed (approximate cost $35) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.

Please bring an apron, dish cloth, sharp knife, tea towels and containers to take food home.

Target audience: Adventurous food lovers!

Note: Nuts and gluten will be used in some recipes - this course is not suitable for vegetarians.

By the end of the course, you’ll have:
- Made a selection of Nyonya dishes to take home.
- Become more familiar with using the various spices.
- Understood more about the Nyonya cooking.
- Become more confident to cook Nyonya food at home.

Note: Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites
Basic cooking skills required.
1 day

FREE OF CHARGE
Computers, Monitors, Tablets and Small Devices, Laptops, Routers and Modems, Mice, Servers, UPS, Cameras, Hifi Stereo Amps and Speakers, Mobile Phones, Car Batteries, Wiring & Cabling, Mainframe Circuit Boards, etc.

events.long_description:
Jason Payn as Elvis
ntroducing Jason Payn as Elvis

Jason prides himself on delivering an authentic Elvis Presley concert experience.

His foster mother introduced him to Elvis gospel records as a young boy, and his appreciation for 'The King' has stuck with him through life.

Jason has competed at national and international Elvis Tribute Artist contests since 2014, regularly placing in the top five, and securing professional events on the strength of those performances.

An evening with Jason Payn as Elvis Presley is a moving experience, bringing energy and entertainment in celebration of one of the World's greatest entertainers.

Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/ElvisTributeArtistJasonPayn

TICKET PRICE INCLUDES SUPPER

Tickets are $20 and available from the club ph 06 379 8069, or online @eventfinda https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2025/jason-payn-as-elvis/carterton)

events.name: Microsoft Excel - Advanced
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Microsoft Excel - Advanced
For those who have completed the Intermediate course or equivalent - you must be competent using Excel formulas and formatting.
A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.
All computer courses are run in the school computer labs and you are required to use the school desktops for the duration of the course (you are not able to use your own laptop).  Some of the courses may require you to login onto the network. 
By the end of the course, you'll have had an introduction to the more advanced features of MS Excel, including how to:
• Manage lists: sort and filter
• Create a pivot table from an existing set of data
• Create custom date formats
• Analyse data: goal seek, data tables and scenario manager 
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: New Zealand Mini Golf Open 2025-Golf Warehouse, 80 Randwick Rd, Moera, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: New Zealand Mini Golf Open 2025
events.venue: Golf Warehouse, 80 Randwick Rd, Moera, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Aotearoa’s best mini golfers will go head-to-head at the NZ Mini Golf Open this November!

Fierce competition, friendly faces, and plenty of fun – with prizes including cash and a spot for the Pro champion at the 2025-26 World Adventure Golf Tour Final in England.

Golf Warehouse in Lower Hutt boasts a driving range, a pro shop, a 9-hole golf course and an outdoor 18-hole “Round the World” mini golf course inspired by internationally famous golf holes. The Par-54 course will entertain and challenge beginner mini golfers and experienced players alike.

Put your putting skills to the test against New Zealand's best minigolfers, or bring along some friends to settle that argument of “who's the best putter?”

This year's categories:
- Amateur Youth (5-17 years) - 2 rounds
- Amateur Pairs - 2 rounds
- Amateur Seniors - (55 and over) 3 rounds- Amateur Women's & Men's - 3 rounds
- Pro Women's & Pro Men's - 8 rounds (2 days)

The Schedule
Saturday 22nd November
- 9:00am Check-in opens and warm-up begins
- 9:45am Player briefing and groupings
- 10:00am Tee-off for all categories
- 12:30pm Prizegiving and lunch break (estimated)
- 1:00pm Pro round 4 tee-off
- 4:30pm Close of Day 1 (estimated)

Sunday 23rd November
- 9:30am Day 2 Warm-up
- 10:00am Pro Round 6 tee-off
- 12:30pm Prizegiving (estimated)

events.id: 2025 Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour Floral Workshops-The Purple Dahlia, 10 Miro Street, Lansdowne, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: 2025 Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour Floral Workshops
events.venue: The Purple Dahlia, 10 Miro Street, Lansdowne, Masterton
events.long_description:
Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour Workshops at Purple Dahlia
Dates: Saturday 22 & Sunday 23 November 2025
Location: Purple Dahlia, Masterton (Exact address provided with booking)
Hosted by: Pip of Purple Dahlia

Join us during the Pūkaha Wairarapa Garden Tour for a weekend of beautiful, hands-on workshops celebrating seasonal flowers, sustainable floristry, and creative garden-inspired design.

Saturday 22 November
Morning: Dried Wreath Workshop
Time: 1–1.5 hours
Create a stunning dried wreath using vine bases and naturally dried flowers and foliage from the Purple Dahlia cutting garden. Learn sustainable floristry techniques and take home a lasting festive decoration.
All materials provided. Travel-friendly design.

Afternoon: Dried Wreath Workshop
Time: 1–1.5 hours
Create a stunning dried wreath using vine bases and naturally dried flowers and foliage from the Purple Dahlia cutting garden. Learn sustainable floristry techniques and take home a lasting festive decoration.
All materials provided. Travel-friendly design.

Sunday 23 November
Morning: Fresh Posy Workshop
Time: 1–1.5 hours
Learn to cut, prepare, and design with seasonal flowers from the cutting garden. Pip will guide you in creating a hand-tied posy to take home.
All materials provided. Travel-friendly design.

Afternoon: Fresh Vase Arrangement Workshop
Time: 1.5–2 hours
Discover how seasonal flowers are grown, harvested and used, then create your own vase arrangement guided by Pip. A great opportunity to bring home beauty and new skills.
All materials provided. Travel-friendly design.

Tickets:
Limited spaces available for each session.
Tickets include all flowers, foliage, and materials needed.
Bookings essential.

You do not need a Garden Tour ticket to attend this event; it is ticketed separately.

This event requires a separate ticket and is not included with the Garden Tour pass.

Please note: Garden Tour tickets do not grant entry to this workshop — tickets are sold separately.

Attendance at this event is ticketed independently and does not require a Garden Tour ticket.

Every year, NZ’s fave comedy show hits the road, thrilling and enraging packed theatres nationwide. It’s 7 Days Live!

Jeremy Corbett, Dai Henwood, Hayley Sproull, Paul Ego, Josh Thomson, Ben Hurley, and Justine Smith break all the rules — no cameras, censors, or lawyers.

events.id: Bike Maintenance for Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Bike Maintenance for Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
We’ll cover what to look out for when things start to wear out, and how to check for problems, so you can be confident your bicycle is safe to ride.
Those who feel intimidated in bike shops are especially welcome in this course.
Regardless of whether your bike is in pristine condition, or desperately in need of TLC, it is welcome on the course – bikes showing a bit more wear can be useful for the learning of the whole group.
If you have the following, please bring them as well:  A multi-tool and pump; chain oil and rag; lightweight close-fitting gardening or rubber gloves.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: - Name most parts of a bicycle correctly - Perform a quick safety check on any bicycle - Fix a flat tyre - Adjust your bike to fit your body - Oil and clean your chain - Identify and fix some common brake problems Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel.

events.id: Bike Maintenance for Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bike Maintenance for Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Gain the confidence and skills to maintain your bicycle in good working order, and to diagnose and fix some mechanical problems. Get familiar with bike terms and tools and learn through practical experience.

Have you recently started riding a bike and want to make sure you can take care of it properly? Or have you been riding for ages, but have always been scared to fix anything yourself?

Are you unsure of how to pump your tyres, or how much oil your chain needs? Find yourself fumbling for words when trying to describe that clunking sound to the guy in the bike shop?

This one day course lays bare the nuts and bolts of bicycle mechanics for absolute beginners, as well as those with a little experience. Through practical experience working with your own bicycle, you will find out what needs to be done to keep it running smoothly. We’ll cover what to look out for when things start to wear out, and how to check for problems, so you can be confident your bicycle is safe to ride. You will also learn how to fix some of the most common mechanical problems, and learn about the correct terminology and tools to use.

Those who feel intimidated in bike shops are especially welcome in this course. No question is a stupid question!

Bringing a bike to work on is essential, preferably one that you are riding regularly, because the best way to learn is by building familiarity with your own ride. E-bikes are welcome, although the extra weight can mean they are more challenging to work on. Regardless of whether your bike is in pristine condition, or desperately in need of TLC, it is welcome on the course – bikes showing a bit more wear can be useful for the learning of the whole group.

Bring your pushbike along on the day, If you have the following, please bring them as well: A multi-tool and pump; chain oil and rag; lightweight close-fitting gardening or rubber gloves.

(Please note this course is not exhaustive and is not a professional training course).

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
- Name most parts of a bicycle correctly
- Perform a quick safety check on any bicycle
- Fix a flat tyre
- Adjust your bike to fit your body
- Oil and clean your chain
- Identify and fix some common brake problems

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: Cannons Creek community planting day-Porirua-Facebook
events.name: Cannons Creek community planting day
events.venue: Porirua
events.long_description:
Join us and Ngāhere Korowai on Saturday 22 November at Cannons Creek Lake Reserve to plant grasses and trees. This planting is part of a project to restore and enhance the mauri of this important body of water.
This community event is an opportunity to meet and greet other passionate locals while we work towards restoring our streams. It is one of a handful of events focused on caring for Cannons Creek Lake. Come along and be part of the ongoing effort to look after this place!
Please note – there is a concrete path to the planting site, but the planting area may be very muddy and slippery.
When: Saturday 22 November, 9.30am-12pm
Where: Cannons Creek Lake Reserve – enter from the footpath on Warspite Ave and follow the flags
You will need to bring:
• gumboots or sturdy closed-toe shoes that you don’t mind getting muddy
• warm and waterproof clothing
• sun hat and sunscreen
• reusable water bottle
We will provide:
• plants and planting tools
• kai
• First Aid trained staff
• hand sanitiser
• sunscreen
• public toilets can be found in Bedford Court.
Getting there:
There is parking available in Bedford Court. The 220 Bus stops at the entrance on Warspite Ave and the 226 Bus stops on Bedford St which is within walking distance to the planting site.
Make your way towards the flags and gazebos, which will be located at the seats in Cannons Creek Lake Reserve. Friendly helpers in high vis from Porirua City Council and Ngāhere Korowai Collective will be there if you have any questions.
Event sign up/admin will be from 9.15-9.30am with the event running from 9.30am-12pm.
We appreciate you giving up your time to do some great mahi for Papatūānuku. Feel free to spread the word to whānau and friends to join you on the day!
See you there!

events.id: Power BI for Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Power BI for Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join our Power BI expert and master this comprehensive tool so that you can maximise your skills and combine powerful data cleaning and modelling capabilities with an intuitive, drag-and-drop interface for creating stunning visualizations.
 Power BI is a powerful and accessible tool for data analysis and dashboarding, widely used across many industries. This beginner friendly course is designed to be practical and hands on, covering subjects such as:
* Connecting to data sources
* Using Power Query for data transformation
* Introduction to DAX
* Creating relationships between tables
* Building interactive visualizations
Note: All computer courses are run in the school computer labs and you are required to use the school desktops for the duration of the course (you are not able to use your own laptop).  Some of the courses may require you to login onto the network. 
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.long_description:
Influence | A one day seminar on Family, Faith & Free Speech
Hosted by Victory Christian Centre with guests Bob McCoskrie, Penny Marie, Nathan Seiuli and Nick Hanne

About this Event

Welcome to the Influence Seminar!
Date: 22 November 2025
Location: Victory Christian Centre

Family - Faith - Free Speech
Join us for a day filled with inspiring talks, interactive workshops, and networking opportunities.

Guest Speakers
Bob McCroskie - Family First - https://familyfirst.org.nz/
Nathan Seiuli and Nick Hanne - Pillar - https://www.nzpillar.com/
Nathan and Nick have come from the Free Speech Union and have now joined Pillar which launches in October. PILLAR is focused on civil liberties, carrying forward many of the causes that they have championed for in the past, while also broadening their focus to include areas beyond free speech.
Penny Marie - Let Kids Be Kids - https://letkidsbekids.nz/

We suggest you bring your own lunch or check out the amazing local cafes nearby.
We look forward to seeing you there.

events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
This class is for level 2+ and advanced students. It is not open to beginners. This more advanced class is ideal for those who are already competent at soldering simple joins, annealing, and basic tool use on their own.

The course starts on Saturday 22 November and runs for 4 weeks until Saturday 13 December, 10am-1pm.

Students must have completed two 4-week blocks or a 6-week block at a minimum. If you are unsure of your level because you may have done a few different shorter classes, please contact us and we can advise you.

A more advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you and the group to take on more exciting and complex challenges. They will work with the group to find appropriate projects for you and for the class as a whole. Each 4-week block may focus on a particular skill topic, rather than doing loads of different topics with each student over the block.

Level 2 students learn to solder more competently on their own using chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project so they have something to hone their skills that they are familiar with, as well as taking on a new skill. Their silver project could be a pendant on a handmade chain, a charm bracelet, or a more complex bezel setting.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques. They should prepare to have one or two simple projects they can work on self-directed in class.

This class fee does NOT include materials for any student.

All metals and stones, as well as quality findings and chains, are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it thriftily in future projects.

All metals and stones as well as quality findings and chains are available for purchase each week in the studio. Students are encouraged to keep their silver scrap and find ways to use it thriftily in future projects!

Our booking system asks for payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

A more advanced set of students means that your tutor can support you and the group to take on more exciting and complex challenges.
They will work with the group to find appropriate projects for you and for the class as a whole.
They may create a simple stone setting or ring alongside this challenge project so they have something to hone their skills that they are familiar with, as well as taking on a new skill.

events.long_description:
This is a great opportunity to see our beautiful Preschool environment nestled beside the native forest area of Otari Wilton's Bush which we utilise for our weekly bushwalk.

Meet our 100% registered teachers and ask any questions.

We are a not-for-profit, community Preschool and Playgroup offering affordable Montessori Early Childhood Education. Catering for children from birth to 6 years.

Small class sizes.

Our vision is to "nourish the human spirit to create a better world".

For more information call the Preschool on 475 9688 or visit our website.

Bring the whole whanau, we really look forward to meeting you.

events.id: Paint Your Pet-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint Your Pet
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Looking for a creative gift idea for family or friends? A painting of one's pet created by you may be just the perfect gift.

Bring in a photo of your pet to copy or use as a guide to create the scene. You will learn the basic properties of watercolour and acrylic paint mediums and from there, choose the medium that best suits an outcome that highlights the unique character of your pet.

This workshop will improve your observational skills while learning the basic techniques of structure and composition.

All materials included.

events.id: Rosana López - Argentinian Puppeteer-Vogelmorn Bowling Club, 93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Rosana López - Argentinian Puppeteer
events.venue: Vogelmorn Bowling Club, 93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington
events.long_description: All the way from Argentina, The Wellington Puppetry Festival is delighted to welcome a magical and remarkable marionette artist - Rosana López. With her roots in the Andes of Mendoza, Rosana brings with her a rich cultural heritage, woven into every thread of her marionette work. Her art transcends borders, offering not only string puppets but also a profound connection to place, memory, and identity. The show she will be sharing with us is ‘Enderas Masugui’ (The magic wheel of time).

events.id: Watercolour Landforms-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Watercolour Landforms
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Do landforms catch your eye and make you wonder how to capture the light on the ridges and the dark valleys. In this workshop Charlotte will share her approach to capture the landforms, use of colour and transparency in the medium of watercolour. You will use the core techniques of watercolour to paint landforms. We will refresh our knowledge of washes and edges, then use them to create beautiful landscape paintings.

This course is for intermediate painters and suitable for students looking to further develop their watercolour skills.
Required materials for you to bring - your own watercolour paints, palette, brushes and 4 quarter sheets of 100% cotton 300gsm watercolour paper.

Two day workshop, Saturday 22 November - Sunday 23 November, 10 am - 5 pm daily.
events.description:

We will refresh our knowledge of washes and edges, then use them to create beautiful landscape paintings.
This course is for intermediate painters and suitable for students looking to further develop their watercolour skills.

events.id: Who What Where Drama Workshops-Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Who What Where Drama Workshops
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention Centre, 50 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us for some cheap-as-chips drama workshops for children aged 5 to 12 this November at Tākina Exhibition and Convention Centre.

Classes are suitable for any level of experience - complete beginners OR regular drama goers - and focus on a range of drama topics. From animal game silliness, to collaborative improvisation, subtext discovery, intro to directing there's loads of learning and fun to be had.

We're in this beautiful big space for THREE WEEKENDS ONLY, so don't miss out!

Workshops are only $12-15 per person, per session. Bookings are essential as spaces are limited.

https://www.belcampbell.com/whowhatwhere

events.id: Wild Forest Camp Wellington-Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Wild Forest Camp Wellington
events.venue: Wellington
events.long_description:
This is to introduce outdoor camping to our NZ Adventure Women’s group lead by Chloe and Jono who run NZ Fun Adventures.
You will need to carry in everything for your stay including a tent/shelter, food and cooking items.
We will be showing you some skills from real life map reading skills to lighting a camp fire from scratch. How to source dry wood, preparing the fire safely and then actually getting to enjoy it in the evening for cooking etc.
The location details will be set inside the NZ Adventure Woman’s group post.
Children are absolutely welcome to attend and enjoy in the experience with us.
There is no charge for this event. We have a limited number of spaces available due to the camping location so once this is reached we will close the event.
We look forward to seeing you at the event.
If you have any questions please feel free to message Jonathan Collins directly

events.id: Twin Peaks Wellington: The Season 2 Finale-Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Twin Peaks Wellington: The Season 2 Finale
events.venue: Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
This year we celebrated 35 years of Twin Peaks with community screenings of the entire original 1990-91 series in Wellington for the very first time!

We have now made it to the last screening for 2025. This is gonna be a massive one; watching the remaining episodes and finishing off with the Devastating, Shocking, Soul Shattering, Brilliant and most Mesmerizing episode of them all.

The Legendary... Twin Peaks Season 2 Finale!

This is what we will be watching :

Episode 26: "Variations on Relations" (47mins)

Episode 27: "The Path to the Black Lodge" (46mins)

Intermission

Episode 28: "Miss Twin Peaks" (46mins)

Episode 29: "Beyond Life and Death" (50mins)

With all Log Lady Intros! Which are, sadly the last ever Log lady Intro's ever made.


WHERE: The "Blue Lodge Cinema" in Te Auaha. 65 Dixon St. Te Aro.

(Take the lift or stairs to Level 1 and turn left.)
Specs: 4K projection, Screen size 4450mm x 2500mm, Aspect ratio 16:9 with 7.1 surround sound.

Here is a link to Te Auaha's cinema so you know what to expect.
https://www.teauahaevents.com/our-spaces/cinema

WHEN: Meet at 10:30am on Saturday 22nd Nov. 2025. in the Bar area. The bar will be closed but you are welcome to bring your own snacks/drink.
Chat with other Twin peakies and the show will start on the dot at 11:00am

COST: Tickets are $10 per person

Grab your ticket here:
https://events.humanitix.com/twin-peaks-wellington-finale

This is the last and FINAL screening in the "Blue Lodge Cinema" which today shall be closing it's curtains forever.

So don't miss out and grab your tickets ASAP to enjoy this final "Gathering of Angels" in the "Blue Lodge Cinema" with your people that love Twin Peaks as much as you do!


RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales, so DO purchase it beforehand please.

2. All attendees MUST be 18yo +

3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.

4. Get tickets ASAP as these screenings won't be repeated.

Thank you! And hope to see you there.

events.long_description:
Wellington City Council is celebrating Christmas with four free whānau-friendly events, in four different parts of the city this year.

Kids, come and make Christmas Mahi Toi (crafts) in Midland Park on Saturday 22 November, any time between 11am and 5pm. There will be a number of craft activities to enjoy, face painting, and you can post your letter to Santa in Santa’s Letterbox.

Check out our other events at wellington.govt.nz/christmas, including:

Music at Glover Park - Sat 29 Nov
Circus under the sails at Queens Wharf - Sat 6 Dec
Santa and activities at Waitangi park - Sat 13 Dec

events.id: Curators' Talk - Reclaimed Land: Tāngata, Tiriti, Taiao-60 Lady Elizabeth Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Curators' Talk - Reclaimed Land: Tāngata, Tiriti, Taiao
events.venue: 60 Lady Elizabeth Ln, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for a conversation between Reclaimed Land: Tāngata, Tiriti, Taiao curators Israel Randell and Susan Ballard.
Israel is a multidisciplinary artist, curator, and educator whose practice is grounded in Indigenous futurisms, spatial storytelling, and whakapapa. Her work often takes the form of installation, writing, and performance — exploring the relationships between time, place, and identity through a distinctly Māori lens.
Susan Ballard is an art writer, curator and professor of art history and environmental humanities at Te Herenga Waka Victoria University of Wellington. She is currently working on a new book tracing an environmental art history of Aotearoa New Zealand, to be published in 2027.
Access information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku (toilet) at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. You can find more accessibility information here. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

Israel is a multidisciplinary artist, curator, and educator whose practice is grounded in Indigenous futurisms, spatial storytelling, and whakapapa.
Her work often takes the form of installation, writing, and performance — exploring the relationships between time, place, and identity through a distinctly Māori lens.
Susan Ballard is an art writer, curator and professor of art history and environmental humanities at Te Herenga Waka Victoria University of Wellington.

MEGA Machines Day – Free Family Fun!

Date: Saturday, November 22
Time: 11 AM – 2 PM
Location: Mitre 10 MEGA Masterton

MEGA Machines Day is back and it’s bigger and better than ever! This is a completely FREE family event designed for kids and parents to enjoy together. Children can climb into our HIAB truck, forklift, loader, and a concrete mixer courtesy of Higgins, dress up, and take amazing photos.

events.id: Telescope Mastery-Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Telescope Mastery
events.venue: Star Safari Observatory, 1169 Ponatahi Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Our Telescope Course is back!

You already own a telescope, but...

If you already have a telescope and would like to learn more about how to use it, how to collimate it and any other maintenance they need, what type of eyepieces are the best to buy and any other equipment.

BRING YOUR TELESCOPE ALONG!
OR

You don't have a telescope, but...

would like to learn how to use one, don't fret! We have 14, and you can learn all about them.

Your instructor:
Sam, our resident astrophysicist.

Sam is skilled in explaining the intricacies of telescope operation and makes learning both accessible and engaging. Our course offers hands-on experience with our diverse collection of 14 telescopes, ranging from classic reflectors to sophisticated refractors and versatile catadioptrics.

Where: Star Safari Observatory - 10 minutes from Martinborough


There's no "but" after our course. You'll know exactly:

- Where to start?

- What to do?

- How to get the best out of your telescope?

- What must you consider if you wish to plunge into deep-sky astrophotography?

You get:
A collimation cap - no more guesswork on how to collimate your telescope. With this tool, you can keep your telescope sharp.

Tea and coffee - refreshments.

Bring your lunch and a picnic blanket! We have a spectacular setting at Star Safari Observatory, and we will stop for a lunch break to enjoy our Moon garden and the surroundings.

Take the giant leap; reach for the stars!

At the end of the course, you'll learn all about the types of telescopes available and mounts, attachments, and eyepieces. We cover the whole lot. We have been using telescopes for a long time and now have an excellent range for our public sessions and at our home observatory.

We're not affiliated with retailers, so our advice is unbiased and based on our years of experience with lugging telescopes around the world, maintaining them and using them.

events.id: Vocal Blokes Over the Hill and Still Singing-63 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Vocal Blokes Over the Hill and Still Singing
events.venue: 63 Main Street, Greytown 5712, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Vocal Blokes return to Greytown
– Older, Bolder, and Still Singing
Greytown, you asked for an encore — and we couldn’t resist.
Wellington’s Vocal Blokes are crossing the Remutakas once again for a full day of music, laughter, and good company on Saturday, 22 November.
Our concert last year was such a hit that we’ve decided to do it all again — only bigger and better. This time we’re adding two singing workshops led by our young and inspiring music director Paddy Shanahan, before rounding the day off with the 4:30 pm concert Over the Hill and Still Singing at the St Andrews Union Church Hall.
Workshop 1: Finding Your Voice (11:30 – 1:00 pm)
Think you “can’t sing”? Paddy Shanahan would disagree.
In this light-hearted session, he’ll show how singing is really just “talking on pitch.” Starting with Reviewing the Situation from Oliver!, you’ll discover how expression and rhythm turn everyday speech into music. No solos, no pressure — just an easy, encouraging space to let your voice come alive.
Workshop 2: Singing Together (2:00 – 3:30 pm)
Once you’ve warmed up, it’s time to build harmony.
Drawing inspiration from Jacob Collier’s version of Coldplay’s Fix You, Paddy will guide the group in shaping simple “oohs” into rich, layered sound. It’s less about perfection and more about listening, blending, and feeling the joy of shared music.
If you take part in this second workshop, you’ll also be invited to join the Vocal Blokes on stage for one song at the afternoon concert — a true “community choir” moment.
Workshops cost just $20 each or $35 for both, and if you enrol for both you get free entry to the concert.
The Concert – Over the Hill and Still Singing
At 4:30 pm, the St Andrews Hall doors open for a concert that promises to be every bit as joyful as last year’s — maybe even more. Over the Hill and Still Singing is a playful nod to our journey from Wellington to Greytown and to the fact that most of us are, well, not exactly in our twenties anymore.
But that’s the beauty of it — we sing for the sheer love of it. Expect songs about travel, friendship, and meeting new people, all delivered with our trademark mix of heart and humour.
We love performing for Greytown audiences because you listen, laugh, and sing along in all the right places. There’s something special about this town — the warmth, the curiosity, the way the hall fills with energy before the first note.
Come Join the Chorus
So whether you’re a shower-soloist, a closet crooner, or simply someone who enjoys good company and great music, come spend the day with us.
Bring your voice, bring a friend, and rediscover how good it feels to sing together.
Workshops at 11:30 am and 2:00 pm.
Concert at 4:30 pm — St Andrews Union Church Hall.
Because being Over the Hill just means you’ve found a better view.
events.description:
Our concert last year was such a hit that we’ve decided to do it all again — only bigger and better.
This time we’re adding two singing workshops led by our young and inspiring music director Paddy Shanahan, before rounding the day off with the 4:30 pm concert Over the Hill and Still Singing at the St Andrews Union Church Hall.
It’s less about perfection and more about listening, blending, and feeling the joy of shared music.
If you take part in this second workshop, you’ll also be invited to join the Vocal Blokes on stage for one song at the afternoon concert — a true “community choir” moment.
But that’s the beauty of it — we sing for the sheer love of it.

events.id: Artist & curator floor talk - Whai Wāhi-6 Kelburn Pde, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Artist & curator floor talk - Whai Wāhi
events.venue: 6 Kelburn Pde, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for an exhibition walk-through of ‘Whai Wāhi’ with artists Madison Kelly, Melanie Tangaere Baldwin and others, facilitated by co-curators Abby Cunnane and Brooke Pou.
12noon on Saturday 22 November
'Whai Wāhi' is a full-gallery group exhibition exploring Te Tiriti o Waitangi as a living document. Anchored by the Te Papa treaty panel redacted by Te Waka Hourua in 2023, the exhibition features intergenerational works articulating mana motuhake, dissent, and an enduring will to engage in critical dialogue about our shared colonial past.
Follow link for exhibition details: https://www.adamartgallery.nz/exhibitions/future/whai-wahi
[Image caption:
Madison Kelly, 'Heed a tohu, cradle a branch' (detail), 2025, brass, steel, felt, mallets, drumsticks, harakeke, cord, dimensions variable. Image courtesy of the artist.]

events.name: Bariatric Seminar with Dr. Alejandro Gutierrez - Palmerston North, NZ
events.venue: The Copthorne Hotel,110 Fitzherbert Avenue, Palmerston North Central, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bariatric Seminar with Dr. Alejandro Gutierrez - Palmerston North, NZ
Join us for a seminar with Dr. Gutierrez to learn about weight loss surgery options in Mexico!

About this Event

Thinking about weight loss surgery? Join Mexico Bariatric Center for a FREE In-Person Seminar in New Zealand, November 21–23!
We’re coming to Auckland, Palmerston North, and Christchurch for a special 3-day tour to bring expert answers, real patient stories, and community support straight to you. All attendees get $150 off our surgery package!

Hosted by:
👨‍⚕️ Dr. Alejandro Gutierrez – Our chief bariatric surgeon will be there in person to explain our procedures, answer your questions during a LIVE Q&A, and give you the confidence to move forward.
👨‍⚕️ Dr. Ron Elli – Founder of Mexico Bariatric Center, ready to share how we support patients every step of the way from scheduling to recovery.
💙 Vanessa Taylor – Our past patient and NZ Coordinator, will be there to share her personal weight loss journey and guide you through the patient process.

What You’ll Learn at the Seminar:
✅ Weight loss surgery procedures we offer and the differences
✅ What’s included in our all-inclusive surgery packages
✅ How our group travel from New Zealand to Mexico works
✅ Real patient stories and testimonials
✅ Live Q&A with our team and time to connect with others on the same journey

Already had surgery with us? Come say hi! Friends and family are more than welcome too. We can't wait to see you there!

events.name: Foraged Basketry - November
events.venue: 65 Wallace Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our ancestors, no matter where in the world they came from, knew how to weave baskets, nets and vessels from what they found around them. Join artist Hannah Schickedanz to rediscover the art of twined and woven basket-making, using grasses, Montbretia, Convolvulus and other foraged flora. You'll take home at least one small basket and a useful skill, enabling you to create baskets from any number of fibres found in nature.
Coeliac friendly afternoon tea will be provided, please let me know if you have any other dietary requirements.

events.id: Nutcracker High Tea-90 Cable St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Nutcracker High Tea
events.venue: 90 Cable St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
QTea twirls into a sun-drenched daydream with a high tea inspired by The Nutcracker. In partnership with the Royal New Zealand Ballet, we’re serving a festive fairytale where Christmas meets choreography – with a Kiwiana twist.
Perched above the harbour, QTea High Tea reimagines its plated treats into a sugar plum dreamland. Think raspberry-layered delights, golden pistachio choux, smoked salmon cups and piroshki that dance on the palate.
Sip in style and cheers to the season with The Mouse King’s Toast, Prosecco and Guignolet fizzing with festive sparkle. Craving something a little nuttier? Try The Storm Master’s Tipple. For pure summer magic in a glass, reach for the Sugar Plum Fairy Fizz.
Saturday & Sunday 1pm-3pm | 4 October – 20 December

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Hāpua Farm-Hāpua farm, 1094 Masterton Castlepoint Rd, Tauweru, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Hāpua Farm
events.venue: Hāpua farm, 1094 Masterton Castlepoint Rd, Tauweru, Masterton
events.long_description:
Discover the beauty of Hāpua Farm, a property that combines rolling farmland with wetlands, native bush, and sweeping views of the surrounding hill country. Led by Michael Birch, a member of the Ruamahanga Restoration Trust, the walk begins on the farm’s airstrip, offering beautiful views of the Tararua Ranges before descending through farm tracks, open paddocks, and bush trails.

Along the way, explore wetlands created by large landslides 11,000–12,000 years ago, and continue east to two protected QEII covenant areas of native bush. Here, you’ll encounter towering totara, matai, and kahikatea, as well as abundant birdlife including kererū and tūī. Last year's participants had rave reviews of this walk!

Walk Format:
The walk covers around 6 km. You must be able to climb over fences and walk for 3 to 4 hours over uneven ground. Some climbing is involved - this is a hill country farm. This walk is partly in cellphone coverage. This walk will be cancelled if it has been raining heavily in preceding days. You must arrange your own transport to this walk.
