events.id: In the Round Embroidery Workshop-112 Waipapa Road, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: In the Round Embroidery Workshop
events.venue: 112 Waipapa Road, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join me for some fun and social stitching at my 'In the Round Embroidery Workshop' running on Saturday 22 November 2025 at Hataitai Community House in Wellington City!
DATE: Saturday 22 November 2025
TIME: 1.30pm-5.00pm
PLACE: Hataitai Community House, 112 Waipapa Road, Hataitai, Wellington City
In the workshop you will learn some simple stitching techniques and start work on a meditative mandala inspired embroidery artwork. You will gain the skills to be able to finish this project at home.
Your facilitator will be me -Stella Peg Carruthers - a textile craft artist and eco-lifestylist who sees crafts as being a way to affect positive change in the world as a creative gesture against apathy. My practice is centered around sustainable materials re-use and slow creativity processes. I am also interested in creating supportive community workshops that mirror the history of sewing in social spaces.
I will supply your backing fabric and sewing needles and you will have access to my collection of embroidery floss and fibres for stitching.
To complete your enrolment please fill out the following form.
Registration form link below
https://forms.gle/nN85Kyk8hd6PKtGo6
I am really looking forward to meeting and stitching with you as we connect in creative community.
Only 10 spaces so get in quick not to miss out!

events.id: Farrago Bazaar-Innermost Gardens, Wellington, Lawson Place, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Farrago Bazaar
events.venue: Innermost Gardens, Wellington, Lawson Place, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Farrago Bazaar
Written and Directed by Cassandra Tse
Innermost Gardens, 31 Lawson Place, Mount Victoria, Wellington
Saturday 22 November, 2pm, 7pm
Tickets at https://www.redscare.co.nz/farrago-bazaar

400 years after the collapse of capitalism, the town of Farrago is preparing for its annual festival, where visitors from tribes across the continent will join to share food, stories and ideas. Parents and children are reunited; forbidden lovers search for each other; survivors of capitalism's last stronghold seek refuge. Amongst the six intertwining main narratives, the audience each play characters from the visiting tribes and are free to shape the story as they see fit.

Poster design by CosmoBones

What is Farrago Bazaar?
Farrago Bazaar is an original Immersive theatre production with live action role play elements. Unlike traditional theatre, you will be right in the middle of the action, and will have the power to shape the direction of the story.

What is Immersive theatre?
Immersive theatre is a type of live performance in which there is no separation between the audience space and the performer space. There is no stage – the audience are right in the middle of the storyworld.

What is live action role play?
Live action role play (larp) is an interactive form of collaborative storytelling in which players take on character roles. In the world of Farrago Bazaar, you won't be playing as yourself – you'll get to choose from a range of characters that belong to the world of Farrago, and act as that character throughout the experience.
events.description:
Parents and children are reunited; forbidden lovers search for each other; survivors of capitalism's last stronghold seek refuge.
Amongst the six intertwining main narratives, the audience each play characters from the visiting tribes and are free to shape the story as they see fit.
Unlike traditional theatre, you will be right in the middle of the action, and will have the power to shape the direction of the story.
What is Immersive theatre?
What is live action role play?

events.id: Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience-The Inner Mt Victoria, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Farrago Bazaar: An Immersive experience
events.venue: The Inner Mt Victoria, Wellington
events.long_description:
Red Scare Theatre Company is proud to present Farrago Bazaar, an original Immersive theatre production with live action role-play elements. Unlike traditional theatre, you will be right in the middle of the action, and will have the power to shape the direction of the story.
400 years after the collapse of capitalism, the town of Farrago is preparing for its annual festival, where visitors from tribes across the continent will join to share food, stories and ideas. Parents and children are reunited; forbidden lovers search for each other; survivors of capitalism's last stronghold seek refuge. Amongst the six intertwining main narratives, the audience members each play characters from the visiting tribes and are free to shape the story as they see fit.
The culmination of artistic director Cassandra Tse’s PhD work into Immersive theatre and marking 12 years of Red Scare Theatre Company, Farrago Bazaar is the company’s most ambitious work yet, with a cast of twenty performers making up the various tribes of this post-post-apocalyptic world.
During the show, audiences can be drawn in to scripted storylines or create their own. As well as exploring the Bazaar – Innermost Gardens, transformed into a bustling market with secrets around every corner – they’ll be treated to a Farragonian feast.
Farrago Bazaar is a one-day experience with only two performances, on Saturday 22nd November: a matinee at 2pm and an evening show at 7pm.
Tickets are available now at https://www.redscare.co.nz/farrago-bazaar

events.id: Free Studio Session: Watercolour Gift Tags Workshop-42A Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Free Studio Session: Watercolour Gift Tags Workshop
events.venue: 42A Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Step into a peaceful creative space and enjoy a relaxing 90-minute studio taster session with Jordan Harcourt-Hughes at her Otaihanga riverside studio.
In this free session, you’ll explore simple watercolour techniques and create a set of beautiful handmade gift tags — a heartfelt, personal touch for Christmas gifts and festive gestures. It’s a chance to slow down, connect with others, and rediscover the joy of making something by hand. This is an easy, relaxing introduction to the Mindful Creativity Studio, offering a taste of Jordan’s upcoming workshops and courses.
All materials are supplied, along with tea, coffee and light refreshments. You’ll just need to bring a couple of permanent markers (such as black and white Posca pens, 0.5–0.7 mm).
No art experience is needed — just bring your curiosity and a willingness to play with colour. You’re also welcome to bring a friend, but please remember to RSVP early as places are limited.

events.id: Miramar Night Market-Motu Kairangi Te Kohanga Reo, 27 Chelsea St, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Miramar Night Market
events.venue: Motu Kairangi Te Kohanga Reo, 27 Chelsea St, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Summer is on its way and there is no better way to celebrate than with the Miramar Night Market!
Join us on Saturday, 22 November 2025 from 3pm - 8pm to meet talented local artists and crafters from across the Wellington Region, selling their gorgeous products including:
• Plants, fresh flowers & seedlings
• Jewellery
• Clothing, bags and accessories
• Crochet & knitted toys
• Scented candles
• Homewares & soft furnishings
• Children & baby items
• Skincare, cosmetics, soaps & natural products
• Gifts & treasures
• Resin items
• Crystals
• Wooden & metal works
• Ceramics & pottery
• Pet accessories
• Carvings & sculptures
• Wool products
• Much much more!
Food trucks / stalls, coffee carts and entertainment for all to enjoy, while relaxing on the back lawn and watching the kids play on the playground!
Each stall will have either cash or eftpos facilities available, however it is best to bring cash to the market too.
This is a great opportunity to make the most of that last minute Christmas shopping, with one-of-a-kind gifts, decorations, and treats from some of Wellington's most talented crafters and artists!
A selection of Christmas music will get you in the festive mood to enjoy the atmosphere. This is a night, not to be missed!

events.id: Spotlight 13 "Burn the Boats"-Tapere Nui Theatre, Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Spotlight 13 "Burn the Boats"
events.venue: Tapere Nui Theatre, Te Auaha, 65 Dixon Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
From the mind of Patrick Godinet we present - Spotlight 13 "Burn the Boats" 2025!

Trail Blazer, Innovation, Progressive, Transcendence, all synonymous with Spotlight - Artistic Director/Co-Founder Patrick Godinet and Producer/Co-Founder Daphne Seyb alongside the MTM Faculty present to you our latest offering in Spotlight 13 "Burn the Boats" 2025 - More than a show, since day one, our mission has always been to bridge the gap in our community, to create a platform without boundaries and creative freedom for artists. The look, the sound, the feel - immersive and full of soul!

Featuring the More Than Moves - Spotlight 13 "Burn the Boats" incredible cast - Over 50 dancers from all over NZ, and abroad representing Auckland, Levin, Palmerston North, Dunedin, Christchurch, Australia, France, London and last but not least, our very own Poneke Wellington!
Also featuring our incredible special guest choreographers/acts from Auckland and Australia more details coming soon, this will be a showcase like no other.

Every Spotlight is different and brings it's own soul and energy but the essence remains - Movement, Expression, Heart, and Community.

Four shows only... Don't miss out!!

Excited to connect with our amazing community, friends and family, have them share and come together for a very special SZN of the Spotlight 13 "Burn the Boats" 2025

*Warning explicit language and strobe lighting may be in show* Suitable for a mature audience.
Please note: No show/no refund policy
No refund on tickets please be sure before purchasing.

Proudly supported by Te Auaha

Featuring the More Than Moves - Spotlight 13 "Burn the Boats" incredible cast - Over 50 dancers from all over NZ, and abroad representing Auckland, Levin, Palmerston North, Dunedin, Christchurch, Australia, France, London and last but not least, our very own Poneke Wellington!
Also featuring our incredible special guest choreographers/acts from Auckland and Australia more details coming soon, this will be a showcase like no other.
Every Spotlight is different and brings it's own soul and energy but the essence remains - Movement, Expression, Heart, and Community.

events.id: Queensgate Night Market-Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Queensgate Night Market
events.venue: Queensgate Shopping Centre, 45 Knights Rd, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
What started as a humble food market in a suburban Auckland carpark has grown into one of New Zealand’s most popular evening destinations. The Auckland Night Markets bring together street food, community, and live entertainment - and from the 27th September 2025, Queensgate Night Market will be joining the family!
Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

events.venue: Fensham Reserve, 24 Cobden Road, Carterton
events.long_description:
Join photographer and Adobe Community Expert Geoff Walker for a creative evening walk at Fensham Reserve. Starting at 6pm, this two-hour session will focus on exploring new perspectives and learning practical techniques to capture stunning images with your mobile phone camera.

With the reserve’s bush tracks and open spaces as your backdrop, you’ll discover how to make the most of evening light while sharpening your photography skills in a relaxed, supportive setting.

events.id: Jason Payn as Elvis!-Club Carterton, Broadway, Carterton, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Jason Payn as Elvis!
events.venue: Club Carterton, Broadway, Carterton, Carterton
events.long_description:
Introducing Jason Payn as Elvis

Jason prides himself on delivering an authentic Elvis Presley concert experience.

His foster mother introduced him to Elvis gospel records as a young boy, and his appreciation for 'The King' has stuck with him through life.

Jason has competed at national and international Elvis Tribute Artist contests since 2014, regularly placing in the top five, and securing professional events on the strength of those performances.

An evening with Jason Payn as Elvis Presley is a moving experience, bringing energy and entertainment in celebration of one of the World's greatest entertainers.

Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/ElvisTributeArtistJasonPayn

TICKET PRICE INCLUDES SUPPER

Tickets are $20 and available from the club ph 06 379 8069, or online at eventfinda

events.id: The Phoenix Astronomy Lecture Series - Dr Michelle Thaller-West Taratahi Hall, Chester Rd, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: The Phoenix Astronomy Lecture Series - Dr Michelle Thaller
events.venue: West Taratahi Hall, Chester Rd, Carterton
events.long_description:
Join The Phoenix Astronomical Society for the Phoenix Astronomy Lecture Series — an ongoing programme of inspiring talks from real scientists and astronomy professionals.
Each month, we explore new frontiers of space research, from solar physics and exoplanets to telescopes in Antarctica and the search for life beyond Earth.

Hosted at West Taratahi Hall, the series marks a new era for the Society — one focused on credible science, open discussion, and sharing the wonder of the Universe with our community.

Come along, meet fellow astronomy enthusiasts, and be part of the conversation under Wairarapa’s world-class dark skies.

Dr Michelle Thaller (NASA, retired)
Recent Discoveries in Astronomy – What’s Happening in Our Universe

events.id: Butter Wouldn't Melt-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Butter Wouldn't Melt
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Gate opens 7pm. Music starts 7.30pm.
Butter Wouldn’t Melt just (15/8) hit Number 3 on the Aotearoa Music Charts with their album Where The Roots Grow Deep. Finalists for the 2023 Best Folk Artist Tūī | Te Kaipuoro Taketake Toa with their first album 1931, Butter Wouldn’t Melt has made a name for themselves around Aotearoa, headlining Folk Festivals from Auckland to Dunedin. Their blend of country, Americana, bluegrass, and folk influences with a distinctly New Zealand flavour, promises audiences an evocative performance defined by their poetic lyricism, powerful harmonies and thought provoking stories. The band includes Andrea Reid (Vocals and rhythm guitar), Nick Burfield (Vocals and lead guitar), Cara Brasted (Fiddle and vocals), Marz Connelly (Double bass and vocals), and Mikey Muggeridge (Mandolin and vocals).On the back of the success of their first Album, Butter Wouldn’t Melt got to work in the studio and in 2025 released Where the roots grow deep, an ode to all the music that brought them together in the first place. This album turned out to be the first chapter in a two-part album journey and is set to be followed by Beneath the stars above in 2026. Together, these albums form a story in contrast—two sides of the same mountain, two worlds intertwined: one bathed in light, the other steeped in shadow. Both records showcase Butter Wouldn’t Melt’s signature local storytelling and rich harmonies, weaving contemporary folk, country, bluegrass, and Americana into a sound that is as timeless as it is deeply personal. Expect these two worlds to collide brilliantly in this performance.

Come along and enjoy their great gig in our special space, up close and personal.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30.
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

events.id: High Dependency Unit with Special Guests W.I.T.C.H-Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: High Dependency Unit with Special Guests W.I.T.C.H
events.venue: Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington
events.long_description:
After close to a decade away from live stages, the mighty High Dependency Unit return this November announcing their first shows since 2016 including a key festival performance at The Others Way, and an all ages show in Port Chalmers to kick off the tour.

Since their formation in 1993, HDU have carved out a singular space in Aotearoa’s music landscape, fusing and funneling shoegaze and psychedelic noise into hypnotic, sonic power. Their live shows are the stuff of legend, their studio output of essential albums and EPs through the 90s and 2000s have become touchstones for generations of musicians both here and abroad.

The return of Tristan Dingemans, Neil Phillips, and Constantine Karlis to the stage and a rare chance to witness HDU in full flight is nothing short of a seismic event. These November dates will see the band revisit their formidable back catalogue and remind audiences why they’ve long been considered one of New Zealand’s most powerful live acts.

Adding to the magic of this tour, HDU’s Wellington Meow Nui show will feature very special guests W.I.T.C.H. on the bill. The legendary 1970s Zamrock pioneers whose psychedelic rock, funk, and African rhythms have made them cult icons around the world, W.I.T.C.H. (We Intend To Cause Havoc) are in the midst of a global renaissance, bringing their irresistible live energy to new generations making this one-off pairing with HDU an utterly unmissable night.

events.long_description:
🔥 DUMPSTER FIRE 2: The Second Sending 🔥
Last year we lit the bin. This year, we’re pouring petrol on it.
DUMPSTER FIRE is back for round two! It’ll be a night of chaotic energy, questionable decisions, and dangerously good tunes. Against all odds (and several restraining orders), the raccoons have returned, and they’ve brought a whole crew of chaos with them.
We’ve got a smouldering lineup of back-to-backs and bangers that’ll make you forget you’ve ever needed to sleep:
🧯 Esskay b2b Scholten: legally questionable, unfortunately unstoppable.
🔥 Koduk b2b Tonin : two (?) brain cells, four decks, no restraint.
🚒 Liability b2b Subz: tag-teaming your eardrums into submission.
😈  Bvrbwyre: a bad bitch, bass, and bad decisions.
💨 Gusty: category 5, blowing out ya eardrums.
🦝 Flatto: all killer, no curvature.
Bring ya friends, ya mums, ya misso’s, and maybe a fire extinguisher. 
This isn’t a gig, it’s a full-blown emergency. I’m not kidding. Please send help. The racoons are biting.
Doors open 9pm @ Heartbreaker Bar, Dixon St.
$5 earlybirds, get in quick before the price goes up 🔥

events.id: Taumarunui on the Main Trunk Line 2025-Palmerston North Railway Station,Matthew Ave, Palmerston North, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Taumarunui on the Main Trunk Line 2025
events.venue: Palmerston North Railway Station,Matthew Ave, Palmerston North, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Taumarunui on the Main Trunk Line 2025
Travel over seven viaducts, see the Rangitikei cliffs, the central volcanic plateau, National Park and the Raurimu Spiral ‒ all while travelling on the new Capital Connection carriages to “Taumarunui on the Main Trunk Line” (and back).

Our route begins at Palmerston North and will take us over the Mangaweka viaducts, among the tallest in the North Island, with views seldom matched in New Zealand. You can view the picturesque Rangitikei River below as it flows past the high sandstone cliffs.

Leaving National Park we then travel down one of the rail wonders of the world, the Raurimu Spiral. This magnificently engineered piece of railway, steeped in history with stories of how an engineer with courage, foresight and a brilliant ability overcame one of the most challenging railway engineering assignments of the last century.

here are two options once you get to Taumarunui, a bus tour to Omaka Lodge or the Taumarunui Rail Action Centre.

The bus departs the Taumarunui railway station at 12.30 for Omaka Gardens and will be back at the station by 2.30pm. A pop-up café will be available for you to enjoy lunch while out at Omaka and you will have 3 acres of country excellence to explore at your leisure.
Roses will be in bloom and the rhododendrons in flower. There is even a garden for your wedding hour. There are fantastic views and vistas over the forgotten world.

https://www.omakalodge.nz/ https://gardenstovisit.co.nz/private-gardens/omaka-lodge/

Included are transfers and entrance to the garden for your self-guided tour. Additional guided tours cost an additional $5.00 ‒ please pay to the hosts.

When you buy your train ticket you can choose a shuttle bus that will take you Taumarunui Rail Action Centre where you can view their model railway, trucks, jiggers, tractors and carriages. A hidden little gem, operated by the Taumarunui Rail Action Centre.

If you do not want to take a bus you may wish to visit the railway museum (on the platform) where you can wander down memory lane, or visit the town shops just across the road from the station.

At 2.45 pm it’s “All aboard” for our return journey to friendly Palmerston North!

This train will be hauled by a KiwiRail diesel locomotive.

When Sunday 23rd November 2025
Depart Palmerston North 8.30 am
Depart Marton 9.10 am
Arrive Taumarunui 12.10 pm
Depart Taumarunui 2.45 pm
Arrive Marton 5.55 pm
Arrive Palmerston North 6.30 pm

Adult fare to Taumarunui $180
Adult fare with side trip Omaka Lodge Garden $202.50
Adult fare and Taumarunui Rail Action Centre $193

Our route begins at Palmerston North and will take us over the Mangaweka viaducts, among the tallest in the North Island, with views seldom matched in New Zealand.
Leaving National Park we then travel down one of the rail wonders of the world, the Raurimu Spiral.
here are two options once you get to Taumarunui, a bus tour to Omaka Lodge or the Taumarunui Rail Action Centre.
The bus departs the Taumarunui railway station at 12.30 for Omaka Gardens and will be back at the station by 2.30pm.
When you buy your train ticket you can choose a shuttle bus that will take you Taumarunui Rail Action Centre where you can view their model railway, trucks, jiggers, tractors and carriages.

events.id: Manu Park Site Viewing-Karuhiruhi St, Waikanae 5036,Waikanae, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Manu Park Site Viewing
events.venue: Karuhiruhi St, Waikanae 5036,Waikanae, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Manu Park Site Viewing
Meet us and find out how you can build your dream home in a new subdivision that combines outstanding natural beauty and a real sense of community.

The agent is on-site at the end of Karuhiruhi Street every Sunday between 10.00am - 11.00am.

Since its establishment in 2018, Manu Park has become a highly sought-after community, with Stages One and Two fully sold out. Don’t miss your chance to secure a piece of this paradise in Stage 3, where only 8 sections remain.

Manu Park isn’t just a place to live—it’s a place to belong. Designed with families in mind, it offers a safe and welcoming environment where kids can ride their bikes down quiet streets, explore nature on their doorstep, and grow up knowing their neighbours. Centrally located near Waikanae township it offers expansive open spaces and a strong sense of community; Manu Park is a neighbourhood where friendships flourish and families thrive.

Nestled within protected native bush, Manu Park offers breathtaking surroundings, generously sized sections, and the opportunity to build a home tailored to your vision and lifestyle. Named after the Māori word for bird, it sits beside the renowned Nga Manu Nature Reserve, close to Waikanae’s excellent schools and amenities, just minutes from the beach, and under an hour from Wellington city.

Teaming up with local building companies, Manu Park offers House and Land packages for a seamless home-building experience. Visit Manu Park to explore Design and Build opportunities to create a home that perfectly fits your lifestyle.

Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a vibrant community where nature and modern living come together. Visit manupark.nz to learn more and secure your section today

events.id: Natural Textured Rings-Workspace Studios Ltd,65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Natural Textured Rings
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd,65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Natural Textured Rings
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Workshop fee is $128, early bird $115 till 27 October.

You may also like the following events from Workspace Studios Ltd:
This Saturday, 20th September, 12:00 am, Advanced Flush Setting in Two Days in Wellington
This Sunday, 21st September, 04:00 am, Natural Textured Rings - Christchurch Workshop - Spring in Christchurch
This Sunday, 21st September, 04:00 am, Stacking Rings - Wellington - September session in Wellington
Also check out other Workshops in Wellington, Kids events & activities in Wellington.

events.id: John Bishop — 25 Years of Stand-up Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: John Bishop — 25 Years of Stand-up Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
English comedian, presenter, and actor John Bishop is heading to Wellington with a milestone to shout about. The Liverpool-born comic is celebrating 25 years in the business. His material usually draws from life experiences, and previous stand-up has covered observations about fatherhood, cycling around the world, playing semi-professional football, and his time working as a nightclub doorman. His Michael Fowler Centre show will undoubtedly showcase his famous natural charm and humility while delivering hilarious observations. 
“I can’t believe it will be 25 years since I first performed at the Frog and Bucket in Manchester. It’s been a rollercoaster!” says John. On top of stand-up comedy, he has found fame as a presenter. Among his many television appearances is ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ This series saw him chatting with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport. He has also fronted multiple documentary-style shows.

events.id: Kāpiti Chorale presents: Mendelssohn's Elijah-St Paul’s Church, Kapiti Road,Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Kāpiti Chorale presents: Mendelssohn's Elijah
events.venue: St Paul’s Church, Kapiti Road,Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kāpiti Chorale presents: Mendelssohn's Elijah
An unforgettable story told in music that grips you from the first note.

Mendelssohn’s Elijah is one of the great Romantic oratorios. Packed with drama, rich harmonies, and powerful choruses, it tells the story of the prophet Elijah: his triumphs, struggles, and moments of quiet doubt. From fire raining down from the sky to the still small voice in the wilderness, this is music that moves!

Elijah has long been a favourite with choirs and audiences across Aotearoa. This is a rare opportunity to hear it live on the Kāpiti Coast.

Conducted by Eric Sidoti, this full-length performance features soprano Emily-Jane Stockman, alto Charlotte Secker, tenor Jamie Young, bass Joe Haddow, youth soloist Natalie Mower, and organist Jonathan Berkahn.

Tickets
$35 General Admission
$15 Students
Printed tickets will be available after 15 October at Moby Dickens’ Books (Paraparaumu Beach), Jenoa (Waikanae), and Books & Co. (Ōtaki).
Email:
Phone: (021) 261 2749

events.name: Yin Yoga & Cacao | Winds of Change
events.venue: 44 David Street, New Zealand 7201,44 David St, Yelverton, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand, Blenheim
events.long_description:
Yin Yoga & Cacao | Winds of Change
✨ Yin Yoga & Cacao : Winds of Change

🗓 Sunday 23 Nov | 4:00–6:00pm | 📍Body Restore Clinic

The Wild Winds of Spring have been stirring us. What if we use the wind element as the messenger it is, and tune into its wishes for us? Let us ground, stretch & pause so as to listen to what is needed at this time of great planetary change & transformation.

Join us for heart-opening cacao followed by a slow, nourishing yin yoga practice designed to support the body, mind, and spirit in addressing our inner guidance within.

This gathering is an invitation to:
🍃 Surrender to the winds of change, letting them clear what no longer belongs
🌬 Hear the bodies wisdom, wisdom held within
🌿 Support the physical body by stretching muscles, addressing fascia system & your energy bodies, to harmonize inner movement with outer flow
🕯 Ground through stillness, even as the world swirls around you

All are welcome. No prior yoga experience needed, arrive as you are.

Whether you're seeking clarity, longing for renewal, or simply wishing for space to pause and breathe, you are welcome here.

Expect cacao, soft unfolding, soul-nourishing stillness, and deep rest.

$35 per person | Limited spots
Bookings essential – https://beyourownguru.me/yin-yoga-classes/

Wear something comfy, bring a journal if you’d like to write, and anything else that helps you feel grounded and at ease.


About Your Host – Heidi 🌟

Hi, I’m Heidi! With 20 years of experience in holistic health, I bring together a unique blend of practices, including Yin Yoga, energy healing, and health coaching, to help people to move towards a balanced, aligned life. I’m all about slowing down, tuning in, and reconnecting with what truly matters.

This **Yin Yoga & Cacao Afternoon** is my way of creating a space where you can pause, nurture yourself, and experience the magic of stillness and heart-opening rituals. Yin Yoga gently stretches and nourishes your body, while ceremonial cacao deepens your connection to your heart and intuition.

events.id: River City Express-Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: River City Express
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Travel to the beautiful river side town of Whanganui, hauled by both steam locomotive Ja 1271 and heritage diesel electric locomotive, Da 1410. Choose between doing your own thing, or jumping on a serene cruise of the Whanganui River onboard the coal fired paddle steamer "PS Waimarie".

Leaving Kapiti as most others are still sound asleep, we quickly escape the coast and delve into the rurality of the Horowhenua. After a stop in Palmerston North we head up the trunk through the townships of Feilding and Marton before turning onto the Marton - New Plymouth railway line for the last stretch into Whanganui. After crossing the 290km long Whanganui River, we proceed slowly down the short 5km branch line taking us to Taupo Quay.

From here - it's up to you what you wish to do!

- Sail On The Queen Of The River - Waimarie
This option includes a river cruise aboard the coal-fired paddle steamer Waimarie, restored after 50 years submerged. The cruise features commentary on Whanganui’s river history, and you can view the boiler and possibly send a message via homing pigeon. The fare covers return train travel, bus transfers, and the cruise.

From Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin: Adult $199 / Child $179.
From Palmerston North/Fielding: Adult $179 / Child $159.
You can also add a picnic-style artisan lunch for two for $40.

OR

- Do Your Own Thing & Explore Whanganui
You’ll be transferred by bus to the Riverboat Centre and can explore Whanganui on foot or by hiring a vintage cruiser bike. Attractions include the Durie Hill Elevator, Riverboat Museum, NZ Glassworks, Motua Gardens, and local shops and eateries. A tram ride is also available for a small fee. This option includes train fare and bus transfers.

From Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin: Adult $149 / Child $129
From Palmerston North/Fielding: Adult $129 / Child $109

On the return journey, you can pre-order a meal served at your seat: chicken salad, mini baguette, and chocolate brownie. Cost is $30 per person, with vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free, and allergy-friendly options available.

events.id: A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Carterton-Wairarapa Events Centre,50 Holloway Street, Carterton, New Zealand, Clareville-All Events In
events.name: A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Carterton
events.venue: Wairarapa Events Centre,50 Holloway Street, Carterton, New Zealand, Clareville
events.long_description:
A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland - Carterton
“Jingle Jigs, Reels a Treat.”
Ken Longworth – The Newcastle Herald

Direct from its Off-Broadway season, A Taste of Ireland - The Irish Music & Dance Sensation, presents its holiday spectacular, A Celtic Christmas. Prepare to be enchanted with some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians bringing the spirit of Christmas to life, in a show that will make you laugh, cry, and sing into the night.

After captivating audiences across the USA and around the world, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland returns to New Zealand this festive season following a highly successful 2022 tour. Experience the magic as world-class performers blend melodic folk mash-ups, acapella tap battles, and heartwarming storytelling in one truly unforgettable performance.

Featuring former World Irish dance champions and stars from Lord of the Dance and Riverdance, A Celtic Christmas delivers a holiday spectacular packed with Irish wit, traditional tunes and heartfelt ballads, alongside all your favorite carols. The show’s exciting mix of electrifying rhythms and extraordinary talent promises an evening brimming with Irish charm and enthralling entertainment, all in one powerhouse event.

Immerse yourself in a traditional Celtic landscape and let the magic of an Irish Christmas transport you to a world filled with excitement and wonder, where vibrant music and dance embody the heartbeat of the festive season.

With over one hundred and fifty 5-star Facebook reviews and over 150,000 followers, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland promises 100% live singing and dancing as it bridges the gap between energetic folk music, Irish dance, and modern tap styles.

Don’t miss your chance to see this magical show as it tours New Zealand for a strictly limited season. Get your tickets now before they sell out.

**musical instruments are subject to change from performance to performance

events.name: Give Dragon Boating a Go – Free Sunday Sessions with Pōneke Watersports
events.venue: 43 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
New to Wellington or just keen to try something new this summer?
Come paddle with Pōneke Watersports, Wellington’s largest dragon boat club!
Join our club paddle sessions and give it a go most Sundays until 14 December at the Wellington Lagoon.
Spaces are limited, so send us a DM with your:
- name
- email
- preferred date
- confirmation that you can swim 50m.
(9th Nov is booked out!!)

Meet at 8:15am for a quick intro, safety briefing, and to meet the crew. Then we’ll head out for a relaxed paddle around the lagoon and waterfront, back by 9:30am.
We’ll teach you everything you need to know.
Just bring:
Clothes you don’t mind getting a bit wet (no jeans)
Sun protection (hat, sunscreen, etc.)
Water shoes or jandals (bare feet are fine)
A good attitude and sense of fun
Ability to swim 50m (H&S requirement)
Dragon boating’s for everyone, from age 20+ to over 70! It’s a great way to get fit, meet people, and join a friendly community. Rain, wind or shine — we paddle either way.

Can't wait to see you there!

events.id: Yoga for all at Kai Tahi-Kai Tahi, 20 Parumoana St, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga for all at Kai Tahi
events.venue: Kai Tahi, 20 Parumoana St, Porirua - Mana
events.long_description:
WHAT IS YOGA?

Yoga is breathing deeply, letting go of anxious thoughts, being kind, stretching the body to reduce tension, being more flexible, focusing and being mindful, and moving into different shapes.

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF YOGA?

Get stronger, more flexible and re-learn to relax in these Sunday morning community yoga classes. Reduce your blood pressure, improve circulation, reduce anxiety – and find more ease in your body.

HOW WILL I FEEL AFTER MY SUNDAY YOGA FOR ALL AT KAITAHI CLASS?

Lighter, more relaxed, stronger, more confident, calmer.

WHAT KIND OF YOGA WILL I BE DOING?

A mix of vinyasa, hatha, restorative and mindfulness. Beginners welcome.

WHO IS THE YOGA TEACHER
Janie Walker is a trained and experienced vinyasa, restorative and yin yoga teacher. She weaves ancient yoga philosophy and breath work with easy poses. Her classes are for beginners and those who want to deepen their own practice. Janie focuses on relaxation, breath and relaxing the mind.

DO I NEED TO BOOK?
No bookings necessary. Just turn up. Yoga mats provided or bring your own.

CAN I DO YOGA IF I AM INJURED OR RECOVERING FROM ILLNESS OR DON'T FEEL GOOD?
If you have an injury or want to chat about how to look after yourself during your yoga class, please do contact Janie: becalmed@outlook.co.nz or phone 0274539099. If you have any other physical or mental conditions that you’d like Janie to be aware of so she can support you, please contact her.

Find out more about BeCalmed Studio and Janie Walker - www.becalmedstudio.com

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Pōhatu Farm Riversdale Beach Hike-Pōhatu Farm, Homewood Road, Riversdale Beach, Wairarapa Coast-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Pōhatu Farm Riversdale Beach Hike
events.venue: Pōhatu Farm, Homewood Road, Riversdale Beach, Wairarapa Coast
events.long_description:
From the Summit to the Sea – The Riversdale Beach Farm Hike is your gateway to experiencing New Zealand’s stunning rural landscapes and is the perfect way to reconnect with rural life.

Ideal for hikers with a moderate to high fitness level, this self-guided, catered one-day hike covers 17-km, taking you along the historic Orui Station coast, the Whareama River, and the rolling hills of Pōhatu Farm. Perched between land and sea, Pōhatu is a family-run, 1,200-hectare sheep and beef farm, rich in raw beauty and natural abundance.

Located just five minutes from Riversdale Beach, 45 minutes from Masterton, and just over two hours from Wellington and Palmerston North, this hike is an adventure you’ll never forget. Enjoy a Wairarapa Walking Festival special of $40pp (50% off!) which includes a generous packed lunch.

Walk Format:
Your adventure begins by meeting your host and driving in convoy along a well-maintained 5-km forestry road, offering scenic views of native bush, pine forests, and the Pacific Ocean. You'll arrive at a designated carpark where your host will provide a health and safety briefing and hand out your generous packed lunch. Once the briefing is complete, your 17-km self-guided journey begins with a gentle downhill walk to the breathtaking Orui Station coastline. From there, you’ll follow the coast for approximately 7-km before crossing back over to Pōhatu Farm where you’ll walk alongside the beautiful Whareama River. At the 11-km mark, you’ll begin your first and only ‘spicy’ ascent to the top of the Pōhatu Farm ridges - where panoramic views await - before completing the loop back to your vehicle. Take your time to enjoy the hike at your own pace. This self-guided experience is designed for adventurers who value a mix of challenge and leisure.

Important:
You are responsible for your own travel here. A moderate-high level of fitness is required. This walk takes approximately 5hrs, including stops. Strictly no dogs allowed. Please note there is only a bathroom at the lunch stop. Please email pohatufarm@gmail.com for any dietary requirement queries.
events.description:
From the Summit to the Sea – The Riversdale Beach Farm Hike is your gateway to experiencing New Zealand’s stunning rural landscapes and is the perfect way to reconnect with rural life.
Ideal for hikers with a moderate to high fitness level, this self-guided, catered one-day hike covers 17-km, taking you along the historic Orui Station coast, the Whareama River, and the rolling hills of Pōhatu Farm.
From there, you’ll follow the coast for approximately 7-km before crossing back over to Pōhatu Farm where you’ll walk alongside the beautiful Whareama River.
At the 11-km mark, you’ll begin your first and only ‘spicy’ ascent to the top of the Pōhatu Farm ridges - where panoramic views await - before completing the loop back to your vehicle.
Take your time to enjoy the hike at your own pace.

events.id: Jewellery-making in 4 Weeks, Mixed levels, Sunday Mornings - Ōtaki-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Jewellery-making in 4 Weeks, Mixed levels, Sunday Mornings - Ōtaki
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
This Sunday morning block is a short course on jewellery-making.

It starts on Sunday 23 November and runs for 4 weeks till Sunday 14 December, 10am-1pm.

Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items. Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

These blocks are also a nice way for existing students or more advanced makers to work on more challenging projects and join friendly classes in our well-equipped studio!

All materials you need can be purchased in class - beginners should expect to use around $30 - $40 of metals in this block.

This block is great for teens and kids over 12 or so. NOTE: Anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, Afterpay or PayPal on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this ;)

events.id: John Bishop | Wellington-Michael Fowler Centre-All Events In
events.name: John Bishop | Wellington
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre
events.long_description:
John Bishop | Wellington
Comedy superstar John Bishop is set to return to Australia & New Zealand with his new show 25 Years Of Stand Up, to celebrate his incredible 25-year career.

John Bishop said: “I can’t believe that next year it will be 25 years since I first performed at the Frog and Bucket in Manchester. It’s been a rollercoaster! And I can’t thank the fans enough who have supported me all the way. I really hope you can come and celebrate with me.”

John has achieved huge success with a number of his own comedy, entertainment and documentary TV shows including: ‘John Bishop’s Australia’, ‘John Bishop’s Britain’; ‘John Bishop’s Only Joking’; ‘The John Bishop Show’ (BBC1); ‘The John
Bishop Christmas Show’ and ‘John Bishop’s Gorilla Adventure’, ‘John Bishop’s Ireland’ and four series of the critically acclaimed ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ which saw him chatting one to one with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport. Other TV credits include two series of ’The John Bishop Show’, ‘Doctor Who’ and the documentary John & Joe Bishop: Life After Deaf.

Last year, John starred in the UK & Ireland tour of Mother Goose with Ian McKellen, which included a hugely successful run in London’s West End.

‘John Bishop has taken on the mantle of Britain’s top comic…the funniest two hours you’ll have any time soon’ ★★★★★ Daily Mirror

‘Bishop has funny bones… everything is infused with his startlingly natural personality’ ★★★★The Times

It’s been a rollercoaster!
And I can’t thank the fans enough who have supported me all the way.
I really hope you can come and celebrate with me.” John has achieved huge success with a number of his own comedy, entertainment and documentary TV shows including: ‘John Bishop’s Australia’, ‘John Bishop’s Britain’; ‘John Bishop’s Only Joking’; ‘The John Bishop Show’ (BBC1); ‘The John Bishop Christmas Show’ and ‘John Bishop’s Gorilla Adventure’, ‘John Bishop’s Ireland’ and four series of the critically acclaimed ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ which saw him chatting one to one with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport.

events.id: Narrative Refresh w. Austin Harrison | A PopRox Workshop-61/69 Abel Smith Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Narrative Refresh w. Austin Harrison | A PopRox Workshop
events.venue: 61/69 Abel Smith Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Sharpen your narrative tools in this one-off workshop with PopRox improv.
Refresh and restock your narrative toolkit to create a satisfying arc for your improv- be it within a scene or across a whole show. We'll unpack what a narrative arc is, and the simple tools and choices you use to help keep a scene/show on track.
This is a refresh intensive, so folks should have some experience with improvised scene work and have taken a workshop in narrative before- to get the most out of this workshop.

ABOUT THE TEACHER
Austin Harrison is one of Aotearoa's most prolific improv performers, producers and teachers. He's a founding member of PopRox, a 6-time winner of Late Night Knife Fight and a Wellington theatre Award winner. Past shows include Ungartered Territory, Pudgy Mediocre White Men Solve Your Problems, and Magnus Steele. He's taught with Improv Connection, WIT, Voice Arts and was recently appointed Artisitc Director of the New Zealand Improv Festival. Austin specialises in interactive and narrative work and loves the full spectrum of joy improv has to offer!

THE STAND-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the workshop.

Austin Harrison is one of Aotearoa's most prolific improv performers, producers and teachers.
Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the workshop.

events.id: Natural Textured Rings-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Natural Textured Rings
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! 

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: The permaculture design process for a sustainable lifestyle-59 Wellington Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The permaculture design process for a sustainable lifestyle
events.venue: 59 Wellington Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We invite you to spend a day at Doris & Bob's, experiencing how permaculture can help you design more than just your garden! Applicable in all situations of life, no need to own your own place.
Doris will share her journey of integrating the permaculture design approach into her life's questions, her diverse home and community projects in Paekakariki (eg. PaeCycle, a food scrap collection set up and Pataka Kai, the public cupboard to give and take food abundance), and as Trustee of Toru Education: Motivated by an sense of urgency and responsibility to take care of our finite resources and to care for our environment with all its diverse wildlife and each other. Through storytelling and practical examples, we'll explore how these principles can help shape our lives and communities for the better, and how we all can contribute as individuals. Every choice we make matters.
We also will take a stroll through Doris's garden and engage in some hands-on activities to experience some of the principles in action. Of course, we will spend some time at the various compost heaps (Compost is Doris' middle name!). Regenerating soil with home made compost! Making compost involving food scraps (closely predator managed) or from garden waste (free standing heaps). 
Lunch will be provided—feel free to bring a small contribution to go with the homemade bread if you'd like (but not expected).
After lunch, we will explore the design process of creating a base map for your specific setting, whether it be a your home garden, personal question such as 'What's next?' or a community project.
No prior experience in permaculture is needed. We hope you will leave with new ideas and connections, practical inspiration for your own compost making and an enhanced understanding of how many ways you can apply the permaculture design process and create community, one compost heap at the time!
There will also be a crop swap table where we practice the permaculture approach of reciprocity of 'give and take'; you might enjoy bringing seeds, seedlings, produce from your garden, and walk away with something unexpected (again, don't feel obliged to contribute).
Spaces are limited to 15 spaces to fit into our living room, so make sure you reserve your spot. We are at 59 Wellington Road, up the driveway on your right. Don't follow google directions as that would take you down to the beach. Just come on down Wellington Road, and we are up on your left. Please park below by the lay-by and walk up. We have a friendly little Cavalier type dog called 'Honey' as part of our family.

PaeCycle, a food scrap collection set up and Pataka Kai, the public cupboard to give and take food abundance), and as Trustee of Toru Education: Motivated by an sense of urgency and responsibility to take care of our finite resources and to care for our environment with all its diverse wildlife and each other.
We also will take a stroll through Doris's garden and engage in some hands-on activities to experience some of the principles in action.
Of course, we will spend some time at the various compost heaps (Compost is Doris' middle name!).
We hope you will leave with new ideas and connections, practical inspiration for your own compost making and an enhanced understanding of how many ways you can apply the permaculture design process and create community, one compost heap at the time!
There will also be a crop swap table where we practice the permaculture approach of reciprocity of 'give and take'; you might enjoy bringing seeds, seedlings, produce from your garden, and walk away with something unexpected (again, don't feel obliged to contribute).

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Kiriwhakapapa Loop Track-Kiriwhakapapa Loop, Kiriwhakapapa Road, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Kiriwhakapapa Loop Track
events.venue: Kiriwhakapapa Loop, Kiriwhakapapa Road, Masterton
events.long_description:
This guided walk follows the 2km Kiriwhakapapa Loop Track in Tararua Forest Park, about 16km north of Masterton. The track is well-graded with a gentle 50m incline and includes bridges across the Kiriwhakapapa Stream. Walkers will pass through regenerating native forest and a stand of exotic Redwoods.

The walk will take approximately 2 hours and is led by members of the Masterton Tramping Club and Wairarapa Walking Festival Committee, who will also provide information about other tracks in the area.

Walk details:
Meet at 13 Church Street (carpark next to Masterton Police Station) if you’d like to carpool. The track is generally flat, with a 50m incline. Note uneven forest floor and tree roots. No cellphone coverage in the area.

events.id: s Wellington Theatre Tours-The Opera House Wellington, Wellington, NZ-Ticket Master
events.name: s Wellington Theatre Tours
events.venue: The Opera House Wellington, Wellington, NZ
events.long_description:
General Admission OnlyAll Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. 
Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events. For more information visit Ticketmaster.co.nz/mobileticket

Join us for a behind-the-scenes tour of Wellington's iconic St James Theatre and The Opera House. Discover hidden stories, architectural splendour, and rich theatrical history as you step behind the velvet curtain and explore two of the city's most beloved performance spaces. Led by expert guides, this tour takes you on a journey through over a century of theatre magic. Tread the boards in the footsteps of legendary performers. Uncover the secrets of stagecraft and marvel at the breathtaking details of these heritage-listed buildings. From opulent foyers and ornate auditoriums to backstage corridors brimming with history, you'll see the theatres as you've never seen them before.

events.id: Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop 23rd November 2025-123 Pirie St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop 23rd November 2025
events.venue: 123 Pirie St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.
This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.
We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.
This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.
Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit
www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.
For questions, email felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz.
Join my email newsletter to hear about upcoming foraging workshops: https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/pages/newsletter

events.id: Glass Jewellery-making - 4-week Block-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Glass Jewellery-making - 4-week Block
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for this fabulous block of classes in glass jewellery-making!

This course is a great way for beginners and those with some experience to get into working with glass to produce beautiful beads that can be used in a myriad of ways.

Beginner students will learn correct tool use, health and safety for lampworking and gain a solid understanding of the basic lampwork process. They will also learn some ways of incorporating their beads into wearable jewellery.

Level 2 students will learn to refine their glass application skills and can begin to practice creating set patterns in their beads. They will be encouraged to develop an eye for design, planning their pieces out and working to master the colours they prefer to use.

Course cost includes set materials, such as glass and some stainless-steel findings. Silver, findings and extra glass are available to purchase in the studio.

Health and Safety Note: if you are near-sighted or have difficulty with fine motor skills please contact us to check if this class is suitable before booking.

People under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Poetry at Dorset Square-Dorset Square, 23-25 Brandon Street, Featherston-Event Finder
events.name: Wairarapa Walking Festival 2025: Poetry at Dorset Square
events.venue: Dorset Square, 23-25 Brandon Street, Featherston
events.long_description:
The artist collective Tramping Gently Club invites you to welcome undergrowth and fertility at Dorset Square. Join a thought-provoking walk through Dorset Square, part of the Featherston Walkways and Reserves. Along the way, discover a participatory artwork featuring the poetic voices of South Wairarapa youth —where walkers are invited to take part in Poems Against Sustainability.

This unique card-game artwork opens space for sometimes challenging but important conversations about climate change, our relationship to the land, and working with nature. First presented at Featherston Booktown 2022, and later developed during a year-long residency at Turere Lodge in the Remutaka Forest Park, this participatory artwork explores big ideas through creativity and play.

Set within the accessible Dorset Square—the most accessible of four urban bush reserves in Featherston. This walk is an opportunity to connect with a re-emerging under story of kawakawa. Once a paddock used as a training area for the Fire Brigade's competition team, the reserve now offers cool shade in the hot Wairarapa summer and an emerging low flammability undergrowth.

Walk Format:
Walkers can expect a gentle walk - 1hrs in total. Maximum 20 participants. All ages.

Image Credit: The Tramping Gently Club Art Collective

This event was previously advertised to be held at Pigeon Bush - however public access here is now restricted and the walk has been relocated to Dorset Square.

This unique card-game artwork opens space for sometimes challenging but important conversations about climate change, our relationship to the land, and working with nature.

events.id: Mr Ward's Map-Quaker Centre & Friends House, 7 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mr Ward's Map
events.venue: Quaker Centre & Friends House, 7 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Elizabeth Cox is a Wellington historian and author of "Mr Ward's Map: Victorian Wellington Street by Street". It is full of the city's social and architectural history, told through the incredibly detailed map drawn by surveyor and engineer Thomas Ward in the 1890s. Many people interested in Wellington heritage will be familiar with the map, as it gives such an accurate picture of the city at that time. It shows every house, commercial building, garden shed and outdoor toilet, and lots of other details. The 1890s were a time of great growth in the Mount Vic area, so there are lots of interesting details shown of the suburb.
Sunday November 23 at 2.30pm
The Friends' (Quakers) Hall, Moncrieff Street
Non-members welcome

events.id: Kāpiti Chorale presents Mendelssohn’s Elijah-St. Paul's Anglican Church Paraparaumu, 1 Langdale Avenue, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Kāpiti Chorale presents Mendelssohn’s Elijah
events.venue: St. Paul's Anglican Church Paraparaumu, 1 Langdale Avenue, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
An unforgettable story told in music that grips you from the first note.

Mendelssohn’s Elijah is one of the great Romantic oratorios. Packed with drama, rich harmonies, and powerful choruses, it tells the story of the prophet Elijah: his triumphs, struggles, and moments of quiet doubt. From fire raining down from the sky to the still small voice in the wilderness, this is music that moves!

Elijah has long been a favourite with choirs and audiences across Aotearoa. This is a rare opportunity to hear it live on the Kāpiti Coast.

Conducted by Eric Sidoti, this full-length performance features soprano Emily-Jane Stockman, alto Charlotte Secker, tenor Jamie Young, bass Joe Haddow, youth soloist Natalie Mower, and organist Jonathan Berkahn.

Tickets
$35 General Admission
$15 Students
Printed tickets are available at Moby Dickens’ Books (Paraparaumu Beach), Jenoa (Waikanae), and Books & Co. (Ōtaki).
Email: tickets@kapitichorale.org.nz
Phone: (021) 261 2749

events.id: Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth: Marlborough Whānau Swim for Diabetes Action Month 2025!-Kinross Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth: Marlborough Whānau Swim for Diabetes Action Month 2025!
events.venue: Kinross Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth for an afternoon at Stadium 2000 in Blenheim.
This family-friendly event is a chance for young people living with diabetes and their whānau to connect, enjoy the pool together, and contribute to our nationwide One Million Minutes of Movement challenge. (Note: this is a public pool session — we’ll be enjoying the space alongside others.)
Come along earlier to support the Blenheim Lions Club “Lap the Map” walk for diabetes awareness — a great way to add even more minutes. Meet at 9am at Raupo Cafe and enjoy a leisurely walk along the Taylor River Reserve.
Registrations (for the swim) are essential and close Thursday, 13 November.
To register or find out more, please contact amanda@diabetes.org.nz.
Bring along:
Togs and towel
Water bottle
Diabetes supplies
Afternoon snack
Please note:
Children 5yrs old and under require an adult swimming with them and to remain within arms reach at all times
Children 9yrs old and under must be actively supervised at all times (watching and able to provide immediate assistance if required)
This is all about spending time together, staying active, and being part of something bigger this Diabetes Action Month.

events.id: The End of the Golden Weather-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The End of the Golden Weather
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.long_description:
A theatrical double-shot from an iconic playwright and one of our greatest actors.

Bruce Mason is perhaps the most significant playwright in Aotearoa New Zealand’s theatrical history. Writing with courage and insight, he was a lover of language and a champion of the underdog.

Between 1959 and 1978, Bruce toured the country, telling uniquely Kiwi stories about emerging identity, cultural cringe and social difference. From church halls to country shearing sheds to the Edinburgh Festival, Bruce would play anywhere, in any circumstance, to any audience.

To celebrate his extraordinary legacy, Brilliant Adventures and Circa Theatre are collaborating to make two of his greatest solo works resound for a new age.

Two plays: timeless, universal, distinct. Following their critically acclaimed, sold out run of THINGS I KNOW TO BE TRUE, actor Stephen Lovatt and director Shane Bosher return to Circa for a not-to-be missed theatrical encounter with a master craftsman.


THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER
“I invite you to join me, in a voyage into the past, to that territory of the heart we call childhood.”

Bruce Mason’s quintessential Kiwi classic chronicles the friendship between a 12-year-old boy and Firpo, a social outcast who dreams of winning an Olympic medal.

Through the boy’s eyes we see the wonder of life on a perfect beach, in a perfect 1930s New Zealand, during a perfect summer. It’s a world of magic and transformation, where anything can happen and miracles seem possible.

When the boy sets out to help Firpo make his athletic dream a reality, ignoring his father’s rebukes and community ridicule, a battle rages between the eternal optimism of childhood and the harsh pragmatism of adulthood.

Gliding effortlessly between flights of poetic fancy and blunt everyday speech, THE END OF THE GOLDEN WEATHER is New Zealand storytelling at its very best.


NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES
An adolescent boy tries to find his place in an adult-dominated world. A young man retraces an intensely felt boyhood experience of bullying. A playwright in his last days reconciles the value of an artistic life and challenges the idea of New Zealand identity.

Comic disasters and confronting your own hubris. NOT CHRISTMAS, BUT GUY FAWKES is a richly autobiographical search for self-expression. Profound and true, it is a set of variations about over-reaching, cheekily confronting our very own Tall Poppy Syndrome.

Celebrating Bruce Mason
Directed by Shane Bosher
Performed by Stephen Lovatt

Please note The End of the Golden Weather and Not Christmas, but Guy Fawkes tickets need to be purchases separately, see the Circa Theatre website for full dates and ticket details.

events.id: OUT ON THE STREET - Music Posters from NZ and beyond - Thistle Gallery--41.297130, 174.773570-Facebook
events.name: OUT ON THE STREET - Music Posters from NZ and beyond - Thistle Gallery
events.long_description:
An exhibition of Music Posters from New Zealand and beyond
Steve Cochrane has been collecting music posters since the late 1970s
By the mid eighties he was importing posters from Europe and selling them mail order through Rip It Up magazine, which evolved into both wholesale and retail
In 1985, Steve joined post punk luminaries Skank Attack and began pasting posters on Wellingtons streets. Eventually realising you could get paid for it, casual work for bars and clubs kept the gas tank full and led to his first poster distribution company The Stick Up!
After a much needed hiatus, Steve returned to the music industry a few years ago, via record and poster retail. Steve now runs Wellington poster company Pasted!, and remains an active musician and promoter
After decades of sporadic trading, Steve still has an extensive poster collection acquired from a vast array of sources. There's Flying Nun gems like Skeptics, The Chills, The Bats and Bailter Space, there's Shihad, Split Enz, and Space Waltz, along with NZ tour posters of REM, Elvis Costello, U2, Mick Jagger, Billy Bragg and many more
With a very small house and a huge collection, its time to start letting this stuff go for others to enjoy - consequently all works are for sale in the gallery or on our Trademe store
https://www.trademe.co.nz/.../stores/Out-On-The-Street
Tuesday 18th, 5 - 9pm
Wednesday 19th to Saturday 22nd, 11am - 7pm
Sunday 23rd, 11am - 5pm
We also has have the Out On the Street Live concert upstairs on Saturday 22nd from 7pm. Details here:

events.id: Koh Kazama Guitar Spectacular-Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Koh Kazama Guitar Spectacular
events.venue: Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington Classical Guitar Society are excited to announce Koh Kazama is coming to Wellington! Prepare to be dazzled by a programme featuring works by Piazzolla, Scarlatti and more.

A New York City native, Koh Kazama is a concert guitarist and educator whose diverse repertoire ranges from early music played on period instruments to contemporary music using electronic effects. He has been invited to perform in renowned venues, festivals, and concert series, including Carnegie Hall, Miami International GuitART Festival, Long Island Guitar Festival, and WNYC New Sounds Live series. Recent highlights include concerts with Grammy-nominated ensemble Seraphic Fire, a solo concert tour in Japan, and performing the Villa-Lobos Guitar Concerto with the Alhambra Orchestra.

Dr. Kazama holds a Doctor of Musical Arts degree from Stony Brook University. He completed his Bachelor of Arts in psychology, Master of Music, and Artist Diploma at Yale University. He received a full scholarship to attend Yale. He is currently an adjunct professor at New World School of the Arts, a partner of Miami Dade College, University of Florida, and Dade County Public Schools in Miami, Florida.
events.description:
Wellington Classical Guitar Society are excited to announce Koh Kazama is coming to Wellington!
Prepare to be dazzled by a programme featuring works by Piazzolla, Scarlatti and more.
A New York City native, Koh Kazama is a concert guitarist and educator whose diverse repertoire ranges from early music played on period instruments to contemporary music using electronic effects.
He has been invited to perform in renowned venues, festivals, and concert series, including Carnegie Hall, Miami International GuitART Festival, Long Island Guitar Festival, and WNYC New Sounds Live series.
Recent highlights include concerts with Grammy-nominated ensemble Seraphic Fire, a solo concert tour in Japan, and performing the Villa-Lobos Guitar Concerto with the Alhambra Orchestra.

events.id: A Celtic Christmas By a Taste of Ireland-Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: A Celtic Christmas By a Taste of Ireland
events.venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
events.long_description:
“Jingle Jigs, Reels a Treat.” Ken Longworth – The Newcastle Herald

Direct from its Off-Broadway season, A Taste of Ireland – The Irish Music & Dance Sensation, presents its holiday spectacular, A Celtic Christmas. Prepare to be enchanted with some of the world’s finest Irish dancers and musicians bringing the spirit of Christmas to life, in a show that will make you laugh, cry, and sing into the night.

After captivating audiences across the USA and around the world, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland returns to New Zealand this festive season following a highly successful 2022 tour. Experience the magic as world-class performers blend melodic folk mash-ups, acapella tap battles, and heart-warming storytelling in one truly unforgettable performance.

Featuring former World Irish dance champions and stars from Lord of the Dance and Riverdance, A Celtic Christmas delivers a holiday spectacular packed with Irish wit, traditional tunes and heartfelt ballads, alongside all your favourite carols. The show’s exciting mix of electrifying rhythms and extraordinary talent promises an evening brimming with Irish charm and enthralling entertainment, all in one powerhouse event.

Immerse yourself in a traditional Celtic landscape and let the magic of an Irish Christmas transport you to a world filled with excitement and wonder, where vibrant music and dance embody the heartbeat of the festive season.

With over one hundred and fifty 5-star Facebook reviews and over 150,000 followers, A Celtic Christmas by A Taste of Ireland promises 100% live singing and dancing as it bridges the gap between energetic folk music, Irish dance, and modern tap styles. Don’t miss your chance to see this magical show as it tours New Zealand for a strictly limited season. Get your tickets now before they sell out.

**musical instruments are subject to change from performance to performance.

events.name: John Bishop: 25 Years Of Standup
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Comedy superstar John Bishop is set to return to New Zealand with his new show John Bishop: 25 Years Of Standup, to celebrate his incredible 25-year career.

John Bishop said: “I can't believe that it will be 25 years since I first performed at the Frog and Bucket in Manchester. It's been a rollercoaster! And I can't thank the fans enough who have supported me all the way. I really hope you can come and celebrate with me.”

John has achieved huge success with a number of his own comedy, entertainment and documentary TV shows including: ‘John Bishop’s Australia’, ‘John Bishop’s Britain’; ‘John Bishop’s Only Joking’; ‘The John Bishop Show’ (BBC1); ‘The John Bishop Christmas Show’ and ‘John Bishop’s Gorilla Adventure’, ‘John Bishop’s Ireland’ and four series of the critically acclaimed ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ which saw him chatting one to one with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport. Other TV credits include two series of ’The John Bishop Show’, ‘Doctor Who’ and the documentary John & Joe Bishop: Life After Deaf.

Hurry, this will sell out!

‘A performer of rare natural charm… the hottest stand-up going’ ★★★★★Daily Telegraph

‘John Bishop has taken on the mantle of Britain’s top comic…the funniest two hours you’ll have any time soon’★★★★★ Daily Mirror

’A stand-up masterclass... top quality comedy’★★★★★ Liverpool Echo

‘Bishop has funny bones… everything is infused with his startlingly natural personality’ ★★★★The Times

‘Routines about grappling with unexpected fame relayed with a knowing humility is key to Bishop’s appeal’★★★★ Metro

‘It must take serious graft to look this effortless’ ★★★★ Evening Standard

Presented by Bohm Presents in Association with Lisa Thomas Management

events.id: Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ever wondered what became of Darth Vader and Mr Stevens, or the monkey in the tree, and did the pears ever ripen? English comic Eddie Izzard has been spinning wildly funny and surreal tales for 35 years. Her huge and devoted fan base is in for a treat as she embarks on a tour. In Eddie Izzard — The Remix: The First 35 Years, she reimagines some of her favourite comedy highlights. She delves into material from the touring show The Ambassadors (1993) through to Wunderbar (2019). For the audience, it’s a glorious chance to hear a new take on classic material and hear another new mad-capped twist to the story. As always, with Eddie, there will be unexpected tangents and hilarious interludes. No night will be the same. 
This show promises to be a beautiful, hilarious journey spanning a 35-year career. It will be thought-provoking, intelligent and suitably surreal. Who could resist?

Yoga in the Park
Join us for the 7th year of Yoga in the Park at Waikanae Park on Park Ave!
Our classes focus on balance and stability, incorporating breathing exercises, longer holds, and plenty of options to modify poses based on your fitness level. We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. This is your practice, so if you’d rather spend the hour in Child’s Pose, soaking in the sounds of the birds, that’s perfectly fine!
What to bring: A mat or towel, a hat, and some water. I’ll take care of the rest.

Payment Options:
Cash
Bank transfer (online)
Pricing:
$15 for a single class
$150 for an Outdoor Pass (covers the whole season: Nov to March, 20 classes + additional beach yoga sessions starting in 2026)
I can’t wait to see familiar faces and welcome new ones this season! Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions.
