events.id: Shakespeare in Love - The Play - Information Evening-12 Horton Street, New Zealand 7201,12 Horton St, Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand, Blenheim-All Events In
events.name: Shakespeare in Love - The Play - Information Evening
events.venue: 12 Horton Street, New Zealand 7201,12 Horton St, Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand, Blenheim
events.long_description:
Shakespeare in Love - The Play - Information Evening
We are excited to announce that Shakespeare In Love, will be the first production of the 2026 Play Season for the Marlborough Repertory Society at the Boathouse Theatre.

It is a wildly playful, funny, and romantic work of historical fiction that modern actors and audiences will relish!

You may recognise the title?

Shakespeare in Love is a play with music that was adapted for the stage by Tony Award® and Olivier Award® -winning writer Lee Hall, based on the screenplay by Academy Award®-winning writer Marc Norman and Tony Award®, Olivier Award®, and Academy Award®-winning writer Tom Stoppard.

Our production from April 15th to 25th 2026 will be directed by Pam Logan, KSM, with Amanda Tollemache as Assistant Director.

The play calls for an ensemble of versatile actors and musicians - and a dog. A range of ages for the cast of approximately 20.

Those interested in being onstage, backstage, or forming the troupe of musicians are encouraged to come along to our Information Evening to find out all about this passionate and fun celebration of Shakespeare and the art of theatre.

See the cast list on our website - www.boathousetheatre.co.nz

The auditions will be Monday 8th and Tuesday 9th December, 7pm Boathouse Theatre.


What is Shakespeare in Love?

A romantic piece of historical fiction, the story centers around a young Will Shakespeare as he struggles to find his inspiration. Enter the feisty, aristocratic Viola de Lesseps, who longs to be an actor. The relationship they forge serves as inspiration for
Will’s greatest play – Romeo and Juliet.
This stage adaptation of the 1998 film brings Shakespeare’s dialogue to the forefront and highlights its theatrical origins. Much of the dialogue is taken from Shakespeare’s cannon (with Romeo and Juliet featured heavily throughout) and many of the plot devices employ tactics commonly found in plays of the Elizabethan age: cross-dressing disguises, mistaken identities, suspicions of adultery, sword fighting, a comedic nurse, and even
visions of ghosts are all present, as is the enduring “play-within-a-play” convention that Shakespeare fondly adopted for many of his works. Overall, Shakespeare in Love delivers a delightfully crowd-pleasing, deeply romantic, and highly adventurous tale of love and drama in Renaissance-era England.

Shakespeare in Love - The Play - Information Evening We are excited to announce that Shakespeare In Love, will be the first production of the 2026 Play Season for the Marlborough Repertory Society at the Boathouse Theatre.
It is a wildly playful, funny, and romantic work of historical fiction that modern actors and audiences will relish!
See the cast list on our website - www.boathousetheatre.co.nz The auditions will be Monday 8th and Tuesday 9th December, 7pm Boathouse Theatre.

events.id: You Spot It You Got It: Unpacking cultural conditioning and turning the mirror inwards-42 Wainui Road, Waiwhetu, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: You Spot It You Got It: Unpacking cultural conditioning and turning the mirror inwards
events.venue: 42 Wainui Road, Waiwhetu, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Talanoa Tai Learning is a new collection of learning experiences. They're designed to help you build your cultural responsiveness and improve your ability to engage meaningfully with Pacific communities. Talanoa is a Pacific style of deep dialogue, with a focus on how we connect to each other and strengthen relationships, while still being able to share honest and effective insights. If you want to strengthen your capability in this space, to create transformational change, and to enhance your relationships with people from different communities - this workshop is your chance to grow.
What will I gain from You Spot It, You Got It?
In You Spot It, You Got It, you will deepen self-awareness by being encouraged to recognise some of your own conditioning and impacts of this in your daily life/practices. When we are not conscious of the things that might not sit right within us then we unknowingly or knowingly project them onto others. What we reject, we project. By examining patterns and recognising our conditioning, then we can truly understand how we can live in more conscious ways. This Talanoa Tai learning experience offers space for talanoa, tools and exercises to facilitate introspection and personal growth by turning the mirror inwards.
This is a 3.5 hour in-person learning experience. The day will start with a mihi whakatau to welcome you into the space.
Who is this workshop for?
These learning experiences are for both Paciﬁc professionals and those from other communities. You don’t need to have prior knowledge or experience in this area - we’ll meet you where you are and provide a welcoming, supportive environment for you to learn.
Cultural responsiveness is for everyone. Whether you’re in social work, education, government, community sectors or beyond, these learning experiences have been designed to help everyone build their skills. If you think this professional development might be right for you, it is!
Cost
When work is busy and budgets are tight, cultural responsiveness can often take a backseat. But this is an aﬀordable investment that will help you address the challenges that so many of us share, like how to build engagement and trust, and avoid relationship missteps. It’s not a buzzword; it’s a vital skill if you want to better meet the needs of the people you serve. Price: $170 (inc GST) per person, including morning tea.
Facilitator
Our team’s extensive research and experience feed into these sessions, with a focus on interactive activities and practical, real-life examples. Our team has decades of experience across a range of ﬁelds, in particular social development, education, and research. We have worked with organisations and businesses across the Paciﬁc, and our engagement with diﬀerent Paciﬁc languages, cultures, and communities means we oﬀer robust, informed perspectives. Fa’aeafale’upolu (Polu) Samuelu is the facilitator of this Talanoa Tai Learning experience.
events.description:
Talanoa Tai Learning is a new collection of learning experiences.
If you want to strengthen your capability in this space, to create transformational change, and to enhance your relationships with people from different communities - this workshop is your chance to grow.
When we are not conscious of the things that might not sit right within us then we unknowingly or knowingly project them onto others.
Whether you’re in social work, education, government, community sectors or beyond, these learning experiences have been designed to help everyone build their skills.
It’s not a buzzword; it’s a vital skill if you want to better meet the needs of the people you serve.

events.name: SharePoint Online/2019 for Power Users, 4-Day Training Course in Wellington
events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Course: SPOPEU Duration: 4 Days Audience: End Users Microsoft Course: 55215 Overview This course delivers the complete site owner story from start to finish in an engaging and practical way to ensure you have the confidence to plan and create new sites or manage your existing sites, whether you're using SharePoint Online through Microsoft 365, or SharePoint 2019 on-premises.
Your goal is to learn how to make SharePoint relevant to your team by using a sites functionality to help you share information and collaborate with your colleagues.
During the class you will also learn best practices and ‘what not to do’ as you watch live, interactive demonstrations and put theory into practice with hands on exercises.
Module List Module 1: Introduction to SharePoint Module 2: Finding Content Module 3: Working with Lists Module 4: Working with Libraries Module 5: Working with Publishing Features Module 6: Leveraging Social Content in the Business Module 7: Site Owner Responsibilities Module 8: Creating and Managing Sites Module 9: Site Customisation Module 10: Permissions and Security Module 11: Creating & Managing Lists & Libraries Module 12: Advanced Document Management Module 13: Power Platform Integration Module 14: Creating & Managing Content Types Click here for the full 'SharePoint Online for Power Users' course outline Click here for the full 'SharePoint 2019 for Power Users' course outline

events.id: Experience Rapid Learning Cycles - Wellington-7 Dixon Street, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Experience Rapid Learning Cycles - Wellington
events.venue: 7 Dixon Street, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Rapid Learning Cycles (RLC) is a new project management approach for innovation that is a synthesis of ideas and methods from Agile and Lean Product Development. An increasing number of companies around the world are turning to RLC to get their ideas to market faster and regain their confidence to innovate.
Jason Low from Solid Consulting is a Certified® Rapid Learning Cycles Senior Consultant and has used RLC for nearly 10 years. When Jason was the Head of Design & Innovation at Trimax Mowing Systems, he saw first-hand of his 4 years there how RLC sped up R&D and drove better, more informed decision-making capabilities, and reduced the risk of project loop-backs.

This interactive session has been designed specifically to introduce the concept and value that Rapid Learning Cycles will bring to your business. Attendees will leave with actionable tools - like defining a "Core Hypothesis", "Key Decisions" and how to identify what project management framework to use for certain projects. These are all valuable skills to learn for any business, and you will be able to start applying these concepts in your workplace.
Using Rapid Learning Cycles will:
• Speed up your R&D program
• Give you a clearly defined project plan that is easy for everyone to understand - even for the most “blue sky” projects
• Get better engagement across the business
• Achieve better learning outcomes
• Build an extensible knowledge library
There are limited numbers for this event, so please register if you are interested.
Refreshments will be provided with a chance to network with all attendees after the event.
Here are a few of the internationally known innovative businesses that are public about their use of Rapid Learning Cycles: Breville, Phillips, Zespri, Gallagher, Trimax, Trimble, Navico, Kimberly-Clark, Whirlpool, Steelcase, Keurig Dr Pepper, Sonion, Medtronic, Sunpower, Constellium, Hyster-Yale, Novo Nordisk, Novozymes.
This event is proudly brought to you in partnership with:
Solid Consulting
Creative HQ
PDMA-NZ
The Rapid Learning Cycles Institute

events.id: Kāpiti Tech November Meetup-31 Poplar Avenue, Raumati South 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kāpiti Tech November Meetup
events.venue: 31 Poplar Avenue, Raumati South 5032, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us at Sunday Cantina in Raumati South as we wrap up the year with the KāpitiTech Cluster. We will share a recap on the Tech Cluster, celebrate wins, and prepare for the future. What a year it has been!
We will be joined by our very own Diana Minnée, a highly respected Kāpiti-based tech entrepreneur and operator, and the Co-Founder & CEO of Ask Astro, an AI-driven startup helping business leaders make smarter, faster decisions. With deep experience across New Zealand’s tech sector, Diana bridges human and AI, transforming strategic insight into scalable tools that empower growth.
In this talk, Diana will share insights on how human strengths should guide our technology choices and how AI can amplify, not replace, our capabilities.
What to expect
Insights from founder, Diana Minnée, Ask Astro.
2025 recap on KāpitiTech Cluster.
Interactive session to plan for 2026.
Open networking with members of the KāpitiTech Cluster.
Snacks and light refreshments will be available. Alcohol can be purchased at the venue.
About KāpitiTech:
KāpitiTech is here to connect the local Kāpiti tech network. With the support of Kāpiti Coast District Council, we’re working to develop the local tech cluster to collaborate, share knowledge, and grow.  

If you have an idea for an event, have feedback, or would like to learn more, get in touch by emailing kapititechnz@gmail.com. We would love to hear from you!

events.name: Yoga in the Park
events.venue: Waikanae Park, Park Ave, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Join us for the 7th year of Yoga in the Park at Waikanae Park on Park Ave!

Our classes focus on balance and stability, incorporating breathing exercises, longer holds, and plenty of options to modify poses based on your fitness level. We’ve had kids join us in past years, and if you consider yourself "older," you’re more than welcome, too. This is your practice, so if you’d rather spend the hour in Child’s Pose, soaking in the sounds of the birds, that’s perfectly fine!

What to bring: A mat or towel, a hat, and some water. I’ll take care of the rest.

Payment Options:
Cash
Bank transfer (online)

Pricing:
$15 for a single class
$150 for an Outdoor Pass (covers the whole season: Nov to March, 21 classes + additional beach yoga sessions starting in 2026)

I can’t wait to see familiar faces and welcome new ones this season! Feel free to get in touch if you have any questions.

events.id: Musicking Together-Evaro, Level 1, James Smith Corner, 65 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Musicking Together
events.venue: Evaro, Level 1, James Smith Corner, 65 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Musicking Together is a free community music circle run by Sophie Sabri, a registered music therapist, in collaboration with different local musicians each month. The event takes place monthly at Evaro. It is open to anyone who has a love for music, and no musical experience is required. The venue is wheelchair accessible.

This month, we will host music therapy student Jessica Browning for a night of music with heart and harp.
Musical instruments are provided. Come along to meet new people and play music without pressure. "Musicking Together" is a safe space to create music together, to dance, to sing or simply listen to others. As long as we are in space, we are musicking.

How to find us? Evaro is located in the James Smith building, at the corner between Manners and Cuba Street. Enter the building and pass Rebel Sports to find the stairs. Go up to level 1 and follow the corridor on the left. You'll find Evaro to your left.

events.id: Tiaki Moana: Guardians of the Ocean Wellington Premiere-1 Fairway Drive, Avalon, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tiaki Moana: Guardians of the Ocean Wellington Premiere
events.venue: 1 Fairway Drive, Avalon, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tiaki Moana Documentary Screening – Te Whanganui-a-Tara | Earth Sciences Institute
Join us for a special evening of film, kōrero, and connection celebrating Pacific-led ocean protection.
The Tiaki Moana documentary follows an unprecedented regional movement that brought together 200 participants from 35 countries — youth, scientists, policymakers, and community leaders — to chart new pathways for ocean governance across the Pacific. Filmed in Tahiti and Mo‘orea, it highlights powerful stories of collaboration, culture, and care for our shared ocean.
Programme
Doors open 5.45pm, events starts promptly at 6.00pm. Please be seated by 6.00pm
Mana whenua welcome
Introduction – Earth Sciences New Zealand
Opening Remarks – New Zealand National Commission for UNESCO
Film introduction – Executive Producer & Blue Cradle Founder/CEO, James Nikitine
Tiaki Moana documentary screening (34')
Panel discussion + Q&A (speakers TBC)
Networking
📍 Venue: Earth Sciences Institute, GNS Science, 1 Fairway Drive, Avalon, Lower Hutt
🕕 Time: 6:00–7:30 PM
🎟 Free entry (Koha welcome – donate via Humanitix!)
With thanks to our partners: Fonds Pacifique, U.S. Department of State, Young Pacific Leaders, and the Government of Tahiti.

events.id: ✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky WELLINGTON-Colombo Street &, Rintoul Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: ✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky WELLINGTON
events.venue: Colombo Street &, Rintoul Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky
Discover the story of Chiron, the immortal centaur unlike any other: healer, teacher, prophet, and guide to heroes from Achilles to Asclepius. We’ll explore Chiron’s legendary skills in medicine, music, hunting, prophecy, and ethics, and why ancient storytellers remembered him as the gentlest of the centaurs.Follow the centaur’s path through your own chart in this astrological gathering of thought-provoking discussion, exploration and discovery.
About The Planet Mechanic (aka Sousa)
Sousa is the only New Zealand graduate of Kepler College of Astrological Arts & Sciences in the USA. With 30 years experience, she is a passionate and insightful interpreter of the signs and seasons of the sky. www.theplanetmechanic.co.nz
New to Astrology?
Consider taking the Crash Course in Astrology - a one day event of self-discovery studying the fundamentals of your astrology chart. This is available online, taught in small groups of ten or less participants. https://events.humanitix.com/crash-course-in-astrology-online

events.id: Deep dive - OPEN level - Hip Hop styling-60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Deep dive - OPEN level - Hip Hop styling
events.venue: 60 Dixon St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Across five immersive sessions at 7pm (no class on Monday 17th Nov), we’ll explore the fusion of Zouk’s fluidity with the grounded rhythm and groove of Hip Hop. This isn’t just about choreography — it’s also about embodying attitude, texture, and expression through movement that feels raw, connected, and alive.
Through isolations, foot work, and rhythm play, you’ll learn to bring hip hop’s strength and intention into Zouk’s softness and flow. We’ll explore how to shift energy, contrast smoothness with sharpness, and find your own unique flavour within the dance.
These concepts will be anchored in Zouk’s foundational movements, helping you integrate Hip Hop styling in a way that enhances connection, musicality, and body awareness.
This is an OPEN level deep dive, welcoming both newcomers and experienced dancers. Whether you’re looking to expand your styling or reconnect with your groove, this series invites you to move with rhythm, express with confidence, and dance with authentic flow.
Prepaid 5 week block cost is $90 waged or $75 for unwaged/students
- If you are also doing another level class with us then the cost will be reduced to the unwaged/student cost for all classes (saves you a bit of $$)
- Ad hoc cost is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students
Online payments can be made to Adam Polaczuk
Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25
Details: Your name and ZoukDeep16
Location:
Classes are in the Footnote NZ Dance Studio, 60 Dixon street

events.name: Eddie Izzard | Wellington
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Jervois Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Eddie Izzard –The Remix Tour Live is a chance for Eddie, inspired by her ever loyal
audiences to remix and re-imagine some of her own favourite, personal comedy
highlights. Eddie’s 35 years of sell- out comedy shows stretch from “The Ambassadors” in
1993 to “Wunderbar” in 2019. Ever wondered what became of Darth Vader and Mr Stevens or the monkey in the tree, did the pears ever ripen… and will God ever appear? It’s a glorious chance to ‘maybe’ find out the answers or discover more questions to those Izzard
conundrums. It’s highly likely that no night will be exactly the same so as ever with
Eddie, expect the unexpected.
“In the first 35 years of my standup career I came up with many weird and crazy
comedy stories. The ones I like the best will be in my 2025 live Remix Tour. “
Eddie Izzard
This show promises to be a beautiful, hilarious journey spanning a 35-year career of
thought provoking, intelligent and surreal ideas. Who could resist?

events.id: Parent Support Group – Lower Hutt-River of Life Centre,774 High St, Boulcott, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Parent Support Group – Lower Hutt
events.venue: River of Life Centre,774 High St, Boulcott, Lower Hutt 5011, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Parent Support Group – Lower Hutt
Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.

Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Lower Hutt to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement- free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.

So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Children are welcome too! Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want.

Contact Meredith Dyer for more information:
| 027 808 3947
events.description:
Parent Support Group – Lower Hutt Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.
Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Lower Hutt to support carers and parents just like you.
These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement- free environment.
No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’.
We get it, and we are here to help.

events.id: Andy Binns: Immersive-event Designer-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Andy Binns: Immersive-event Designer
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
In this final Creative Mornings event for 2025, our guest speaker will be, Andy Binns. Andy is an immersive-event designer, transforming spaces into unique, powerful, sensory experiences. With some basic equipment, he founded Hype Entertainment (@HypeEntertainmentNZ) in 2010. Operating out of his parents’ garage, growing it into a creative enterprise known for one-of-a-kind installations that capture international attention.
Andy’s journey has been one of continual growth and discovery, professionally and personally. Guided by a strong spiritual side and a firm faith in synchronicity and symbolism, he is driven by simple desires:
• To inspire awe as people walk into a space
• To lift the energy in a room
• To design projects that make a positive impact
Through his creations, Andy reminds us that design can be a form of meditation- that, “true magic happens when art, nature, and spirit meet”.
Come along for this immersive and inspiring talk, meet like minded creatives, enjoy a light breakfast and register your spot today.

Come and join us at the Karori Friendship Club — a friendly weekly gathering where you can:
- Meet new people
- Share stories over morning tea
- Try your hand at a puzzle or join a chat group
- Simply enjoy time together in a relaxed space

events.id: Mature Mountaineer's Talk: Geoff Spearpoint Reflects on His Journey-Tararua Tramping Club Inc., 4 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mature Mountaineer's Talk: Geoff Spearpoint Reflects on His Journey
events.venue: Tararua Tramping Club Inc., 4 Moncrieff St, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Doors open 1.30pm, talk starts 2pm

Geoff Spearpoint will present a very personalised view of his career so far, bringing his passion for remote places to a wide audience.
Geoff began tramping in 1966 when he was 15, which grew into a passion for transalpine trips and climbing. He has had a variety of careers however employment has mostly been a means to an end, and his real career continues to revolve around the mountains.
He has been on expeditions to the Northern Patagonian Icecap, Himalayas, Karakoram Range, Yunnan and Tibet and worked in the Dry Valleys for Antarctica New Zealand. However, in the background, there were always transalpine tramping and climbing trips throughout the Southern Alps, where he explored interesting corners including the Ngapunatoru Plateau, Olivine Ranges, Volta, Hooker Wilderness, Cook area, Godley, Gardens, the Bracken Snowfield, and other remote places.
Geoff is perhaps best known for the books he has written, including his latest, ‘The Great Unknown’, a photo and text essay of Southern Alps wilderness trips, designed to encourage and inspire more journeys, and for his behind-the-scenes roles in successful television series. In recent years, Geoff has been actively involved in the care of our back country assets and is a founding member of the Backcountry Trust Board.
Enquiries:
Dave Bamford, dave@davebamford.co.nz Tel 027 457 0313
Andy Carruthers, chair@wellingtonalpineclub.org.nz Tel 021 244 6051

Mature Mountaineer meetings are a NZ Alpine Club initiative providing an opportunity for older members of the NZAC & affiliated clubs to get together, share and hear stories (usually from an invited speaker), and have afternoon tea. The intention is to provide a social gathering for those less likely to go out to evening events. The concept has been successful in Christchurch (since 2006), Auckland and Wellington. The functions are open to all interested outdoor enthusiasts and are made possible thanks to support from Tūpiki Trust.
events.description:
Doors open 1.30pm, talk starts 2pm Geoff Spearpoint will present a very personalised view of his career so far, bringing his passion for remote places to a wide audience.
He has had a variety of careers however employment has mostly been a means to an end, and his real career continues to revolve around the mountains.
He has been on expeditions to the Northern Patagonian Icecap, Himalayas, Karakoram Range, Yunnan and Tibet and worked in the Dry Valleys for Antarctica New Zealand.
However, in the background, there were always transalpine tramping and climbing trips throughout the Southern Alps, where he explored interesting corners including the Ngapunatoru Plateau, Olivine Ranges, Volta, Hooker Wilderness, Cook area, Godley, Gardens, the Bracken Snowfield, and other remote places.
In recent years, Geoff has been actively involved in the care of our back country assets and is a founding member of the Backcountry Trust Board.

How will a Glenfarclas Family Cask fare next to an indie single cask Glenlivet? Will a gently Peated Benromach hold its own next to a dark Caol Ila, and where will that pesky mystery whisky sit in this cacophony of peat and sherry!??

Caol Ila 'Adelphi' 2014 / 10 years old #326024 55.4% - 1st fill oloroso sherry hogshead
Mystery - oloroso hogshead - is it a Ben, Glen or Islander (WB score 87.81)?
I hope you can join us for another tilt at five tip top drams!

events.id: Draw It Out - Teens workshop 25 Nov-level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Teens workshop 25 Nov
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A fun and deep way for teens (11-17 year olds) to learn to process their feelings.
Theme: Strengthening self-resources
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Teenage years can often be filled with external influences, making it hard to listen to our own inner voice for guidance.
This single workshop helps teens to use drawing to access their inner resources, because often they have the guidance within, and just need help to bring it out.
Dates
This is a single workshop:
4.00pm-5.30pm
Tuesday 25 November – Strengthening self-resources
Cost
$46 total
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.long_description:

Singing in the Season – A Christmas Combined Concert!
Join us for a magical hour or so of festive music as WCC and WYV come together once again for our joyful Christmas tradition! This is only the second time ever we’ve combined forces for a Christmas concert, and it’s shaping up to be something truly special.
Over the past few weeks, WCC has opened its doors to the community through our “Come Sing With Us” Christmas program — and now our fabulous guest singers will take the stage with us to share everything they’ve learned.

Expect sparkle, harmony, and heart as we showcase the incredible hard work from WCC, WYV, and our wonderful community singers.

events.id: Moon Goose + National Sensation at MOON-167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Moon Goose + National Sensation at MOON
events.venue: 167 Riddiford St, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Local Wellington darlings NATIONAL SENSATION are joining forces with folk-duo Moon Goose, for a Sunday special at MOON on November 30th. With a view to celebrate their recent friendship, which includes an unlikely combination of kiwiana-indie-folk-celtic-rock-alternative-pop music and a shared love for mullets and bowl-cuts, these strangely adorable creatures will blow your socks off.
Kicking off the evening are alt-folk artists Moon Goose who recently released their debut EP ‘On the island where our shadows lie’, showcasing their dark-yet-bright blend of Celtic-inspired folk music. Their songs include both traditional folk songs from the British Isles and original compositions that celebrate nature, friendship, and the magic of storytelling. With intricate harmonies, deep folk-scapes, glittering guitar and fiddle riffs, Moon Goose will move you deep and good.
Unique creatures of growing renown, NATIONAL SENSATION have been compared to Kate Bush, Bjork, Devendra Banhart, Jefferson Airplane, The Phoenix Foundation, Florence and the Machine, London Grammar, The Topp Twins and various other bands that they are trying really hard to rip off without infringing on copyright. You’ll get bloody good bangers, ballads, banter and more as they sing about the serious stuff, like calling Aotearoa home, your Mum, the bush, death in a funny way, death in a sad way and your local Residents Association. They haven’t peaked yet so see them before they’re washed up.
Doors open at 4:30pm
Music starts at 5pm
Tickets: $20
Artist support: $30
Door sales: $25

events.id: Evening Book Launch: Music Without End: A Book of Listening by Roger Horrocks-57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Evening Book Launch: Music Without End: A Book of Listening by Roger Horrocks
events.venue: 57 Willis St, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Unity Books and Atuanui Press in celebrating the launch of Music Without End: A Book of Listening by Roger Horrocks.
Roger will be accompanied by fellow writer, editor and radio producer Chris Bourke.
***
This unique book will introduce you to exciting new areas of music and spark new insights into the nature and pleasures of listening.
Besides providing an unusually wide-ranging, accessible survey of the landscape of music, and the various ways we listen, it features interviews with ten people deeply involved in the field – composers, singers, and sound specialists – working in popular, jazz, classical, experimental or global music. If you’re a listener who enjoys only some of those genres, this book can revolutionize your interest in them all.
***
All welcome, see you there!

events.id: The Great French Potluck by French Touch Welly-11 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: The Great French Potluck by French Touch Welly
events.venue: 11 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia Ora & Bonjour everyone!
Ready to kick off the summer season with delicious food and great company? Join us for a convivial French Potluck at the beautiful Botanic Garden!
Everyone is invited! Whether you are part of the French community, a Francophile, or a local just wanting to enjoy the vibe, Kiwis are absolutely welcome! You don't need to speak French to have a great time—just a love for good food and sharing.
Let's gather together, share our favorite dishes, and enjoy a lovely evening surrounded by roses.
How it works: It’s a Potluck! Please bring a French-inspired dish to share (quiche, cheese, salad, tart, cake... surprise us!). Bring your family, your friends, and your picnic blanket.
Where: In front of the Begonia House (Lady Norwood Rose Garden), 101 Glenmore Street.
When: Saturday, 29th November | 5pm – 8pm.
Drinks: BYO alcohol (wine/beer) is allowed. Please drink responsibly.
Important: This is a "Pack in, Pack out" event. Please help us keep the garden beautiful by taking your rubbish and empty bottles home with you.
Weather Update: This event is weather permitting. In case of bad weather, we will notify you 24 hours in advance on this event page and a new date will be set.
Local Businesses: Local French businesses are welcome to join and showcase their products to the community! (Note: No direct sales permitted on site).

events.long_description:
Join me on an afternoon of Sound Healing and an introduction to Fascial Maneuvers.
We will be starting the afternoon at 5:15pm for half an hour of fascial manuevers (think stretch with gentle movement and breathing) to relax and get the body into rest mode, and at 5:45 we will start a 60-minute Sound healing Journey with crystal and Tibetan bowls, drums, voice, and more.
Seeing that the end of the year is approaching soon, I thought we could focus on letting the old (that no longer serves) out, to make space for the new in.
When? Sunday 30th November from 5:15-6:45
Where? Hataitai Centre (157 Hataitai Road, Hataitai, Wgn)
Suggested koha $20, but pay what you can.
Everybody is welcome. No previous experience in anything is required, only your presence.
Bring a mat, blanket, pillow, a friend, and/or anything you want to be comfy and warm!
Looking forward to sharing this afternoon with you!
You are welcome to RSVP via DM (Instagram or Facebook) or email me at soundhealingnz@gmail.com

events.id: Build your Professional Board of Directors-Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Build your Professional Board of Directors
events.venue: Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
You’ve got colleagues to vent to, friends to debrief with, and maybe a podcast or two for inspiration… but when was the last time you had an intentional conversation about your career? It’s time to change that. 
While coaching and courses get all the attention, there's another powrful tool that often gets overlooked: a Professional Board of Directors. The women who navigate pivotal career moments best? They don't do it alone.
Just as companies need a board to guide them, you deserve a trusted circle to help with career decisions, fresh perspectives, and ongoing accountability.

This interactive 2-hour session is for women at every stage - from new graduates to senior leaders. Over a few drinks and snacks, you’ll:
Learn: What a professional board of directors is, how they work and why they’re so impactful.
Connect: We’ll pre-match you with 4-5 others at a similar stage and situation. This will be your board for the evening!
Experience: Your first board meeting. We'll provide instructions and a simple agenda.

Bonus: Your ticket comes with a free 3-month Powrsuit membership (worth $147). Designed for busy people, Powrsuit combines bite-sized learning, peer coaching, and micro-networking in one all-inclusive membership. With weekly live events and on-demand access through our web and mobile apps, you will make step-by-step progress in your career, on your terms.
Note: While all genders are welcome in the Powrsuit network, this event is for Women+. Want to join as an Ally or learn more about what we do? Get in touch.

events.id: Singapore and the Indo-Pacific in an Age of Geopolitical Competition-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Singapore and the Indo-Pacific in an Age of Geopolitical Competition
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join the Asia New Zealand Foundation and the Centre for Strategic Studies for a discussion with Professor Joseph Liow, Dean and Wang Gungwu Chair Professor of East Asian Studies at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy. Professor Liow will be in conversation with Professor David Capie, Director of the Centre for Strategic Studies.
As US-China rivalry deepens, Asia’s strategic landscape is shifting rapidly. In this discussion, Professor Liow and Professor Capie will explore what great-power competition means for the region, how Singapore manages its relationships with both Washington and Beijing, and ASEAN’s evolving role in maintaining peace.
Event Details
Date/time: Tuesday, 25 November 2025, 5:30pm - 7:00pm
Venue: RHLT2, Ground Floor, Rutherford House, 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011
This is an open event, so feel free to bring a friend! Please RSVP for catering purposes.
About Professor Joseph Liow
Professor Joseph Liow (Joseph Chinyong Liow) is Dean of the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy and Wang Gungwu Professor in East Asian Affairs, National University of Singapore and concurrently, Chairman of the Middle East Institute at the same university. He was previously Dean of College of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, where he was also Tan Kah Kee Chair in Comparative and International Politics, and Professor and Dean at the S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies. He held the inaugural Lee Kuan Yew Chair in Southeast Asia Studies at the Brookings Institution, Washington DC, where he was also a Senior Fellow in the Foreign Policy Program.
 About Professor David Capie
Professor David Capie is Director of the Centre for Strategic Studies and Professor of International Relations. He is also a Trustee of the Asia New Zealand Foundation. David's research interests focus on conflict and security issues, particularly in the Asia–Pacific, and New Zealand's foreign and defence policy. He has authored or co-authored three books and numerous articles and book chapters. His research has been supported by the Rockefeller Foundation, the East-West Center and the Royal Society of New Zealand’s Marsden Fund. David has held visiting positions at the Weatherhead Center for International Affairs at Harvard University and at LUIS Guido Carli in Rome. He was regional co-chair of the Council for Security Cooperation in the Asia-Pacific (CSCAP) from 2020 until 2022 and was a member of the ASEAN Regional Forum Experts and Eminent Persons Group from 2012 to 2019.
events.description:
Join the Asia New Zealand Foundation and the Centre for Strategic Studies for a discussion with Professor Joseph Liow, Dean and Wang Gungwu Chair Professor of East Asian Studies at the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy.
About Professor Joseph Liow Professor Joseph Liow (Joseph Chinyong Liow) is Dean of the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy and Wang Gungwu Professor in East Asian Affairs, National University of Singapore and concurrently, Chairman of the Middle East Institute at the same university.
He was previously Dean of College of Humanities, Arts, and Social Sciences, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore, where he was also Tan Kah Kee Chair in Comparative and International Politics, and Professor and Dean at the S. Rajaratnam School of International Studies.
About Professor David Capie Professor David Capie is Director of the Centre for Strategic Studies and Professor of International Relations.
He is also a Trustee of the Asia New Zealand Foundation.

events.id: 8 week Pre Xmas Beginners Yoga Course-Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: 8 week Pre Xmas Beginners Yoga Course
events.venue: Yoga in Daily Life Centre, 23 Jessie St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice as well as plenty of time for guided relaxation. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.
This course called "part 1" will cover the second half of Level 1 from the System of Yoga in Daily Life.

events.name: Awareness through Movement classes
events.venue: Quaker Meeting Room, 8 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria, Wellington
events.long_description:
Under the guidance of experienced Feldenkrais teacher Sue field. you will explore movement in new and interesting ways. Moving slowly will give you the opportunity to notice, and let go of, muscle tension.
Students typically feel taller, lighter, less tense.

These lessons have to be experienced to be understood.

First class free.

Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular

Please note that there will be no class on 18th November, but we may run a practica
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico
Week 2: Lateral
Week 3: Soltinho
Week 4: Body Roll, and Snake
Week 5: Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.

events.id: Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly | BOOK LAUNCH, WELLINGTON-57 Willis Street, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly | BOOK LAUNCH, WELLINGTON
events.venue: 57 Willis Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us to celebrate the release of Chris Knox: Not Given Lightly, a biography by Craig Robertson.
Friday 28 November
6pm
Unity Books
57 Willis Street
Wellington
Come along to hear more from Craig in conversation with
Nick Bollinger and to get your copy signed. Books will be available to purchase thanks to our hosts, Unity Books, and light refreshments provided.
Read more about the book: https://aucklanduniversitypress.co.nz/chris-knox/
—
ABOUT THE AUTHORS
Craig Robertson grew up in Dunedin, New Zealand, where as a student he wrote a thesis on the ‘Dunedin Sound’, as well as articles for Rip It Up and a fanzine on local bands. He is now professor of media studies at Northeastern University in Boston, Massachusetts, and the author of The Passport in America: The History of a Document (‘provocative’ – New York Times) and The Filing Cabinet: A Vertical History of Information (‘captivating’ – The Atlantic). His book on Chris Knox is a labour of love by an enthusiast with a deep understanding of the man, the music and the culture he worked in. Knox himself blessed the project before his stroke.

Join us for a spectacular one-night-only celebration as Everybody Eats marks five years of community impact in Wellington — hosted high above the city at Cliftons Wellington.
Suspended above Wellington’s breathtaking skyline, guests will indulge in a three-course menu while taking in sweeping views across our beautiful city. We can’t wait to raise a glass with you to five years of impact, the people who made it possible, and the exciting heights still to come.

events.id: HUT KEEPERS-205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: HUT KEEPERS
events.venue: 205 Ohiro Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
DUE TO PUBLIC DEMAND
An extra screening on Wednesday, 3 December at 6:00 p.m.
A grassroots legacy for New Zealand's remote huts.
Amid decades of underfunding and bureaucratic gridlock, the future of New Zealand’s remote backcountry huts and tracks hangs in the balance. Frustrated by inaction, Andrew Buglass sets out to make a difference - hoping to spark a movement.
“We were hoping that it would become a movement, a shift in consciousness.” Hut Keepers is a story about doing what’s right - even when no one’s watching.
All ticket proceeds will go to the Backcountry Trust to fund work in the Tararua Forest Park.

events.id: Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year-Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington,175 Vivian Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year
Prepare for the new year with this interactive goal-setting workshop designed to help you clarify aspirations build a success-driven mindset

About this Event



Habit Mastery Series: Goal Setting for the New Year

The new year is fast approaching! Discover how to unlock your potential with this interactive goal-setting workshop so you can smash those new year’s resolutions. Learn how to clarify aspirations, set goals, and develop a success-driven mindset. Gain practical tools to turn dreams into actionable plans through hands-on exercises and expert insights.
This workshop is ideal for professionals, entrepreneurs, students, and anyone seeking clarity and direction in their personal or professional life.
Key Takeaways:
The psychology of goal setting
Creating goals
Overcoming obstacles and staying motivated
Tracking progress and adjusting strategies
Harnessing visualization and mindset for success
Join us for:
Discussions & Exercises: Interactive learning and goal-setting activities
Expert Insights: Best practices from experienced facilitators
Networking: Connect with like-minded individuals





The session will be followed by a delicious plant-based dinner together, all included in your ticket!






Meet Your Host: Nava
Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!



Agenda


🕑: 06:00 PM - 06:15 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 06:15 PM - 07:15 PM
Habit Mastery Series: Goal setting for the New Year
Host: Nava

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:30 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert
Info: Plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket !

events.id: Terra Soma Yoga-175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Terra Soma Yoga
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Terra Soma Yoga
You are welcomed to a gentle, invitational yoga experience.
Terra-soma yoga (translating to earth-body) weaves together hatha yoga, somatic inquiry, and nature connection, inviting you into awareness of your inner terrain. This approach encourages you to meet yourself as you are — to listen to the intelligence of your body's own rhythms and sense how they echo the wider rhythms of the earth. Through this listening, we enter a living, evolving conversation about well-being and what it can look like in today’s world.
How is your heart? We often hear “follow your heart” or “listen to your heart,” but what does that actually mean? In this class, you’ll be invited into heart somatic enquiry - locating this intelligent organ, listening into this space, and perhaps allowing it to lead, inform, or express through movement.
The structure of this hour-long class includes:
A gentle lead-in towards the heart
A mixture of supine, seated, and standing asana
Repeated sequences with encouragement to make them your own — add or subtract asana, move in your own time, with your own breath
Optional free movement explorations
This is an invitational practice — everything is a choice, not a must. Tailor the practice to suit yourself. Come as you are; everyone and all of you is welcome.
Your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, making this an evening of movement, heartful awareness, and wholesome connection.
Meet Abbie, your facilitator,
Abbie is a 200-hour certified yoga teacher who trained with Awakening Arts: School of Yoga and Eco Somatics. She deeply values the insight, liberation, inner and collective resources somatic movement practices can offer. Abbie has also completed a 50-hour training exploring how yoga can support trauma awareness, mental health, and body image. She thrives in and intends to create spaces where each person’s pace is honored and the body’s innate wisdom is encouraged to emerge and lead.
................................................................................................
Booking for Thursday is recommended!
For more details and to book please go here--
https://bit.ly/eventTickets
...............................................................................................
Make Thursdays your night to connect and take a break from your week. Events range from creative workshops, wellness courses to entertaining experiences. All within a down-to-earth and welcoming space. Each event wraps up with a plant-based dinner and dessert.

events.name: Uprooting the Past Through Yoga Philosophy
events.venue: 175 Vivian St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Uprooting the Past Through Yoga Philosophy
Past experiences can feel like knots holding us back. Learn how bhakti yoga and the Bhagavad-gita guide us to accept what has been, act wisely in the present, and navigate toward a freer, brighter path ahead.
Meet your host, Sivananda
Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.
6.15pm Tuesday 18th November
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets

Theme: Re-finding your spark
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
This single workshop focuses on the theme of re-finding your spark, and connecting to what it is that is driving you. Great if going through change or curious about something new.
Date
This is a single workshop
6.30pm-8.00pm
Tuesday 25 November
Cost
$46 total
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.id: Men's Group Tuesday 25 Nov-Central City, Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Men's Group Tuesday 25 Nov
events.venue: Central City, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae Beach - Summer in NZ-Hey Coastie, Wellington, 42 Tutere Street, Waikanae-Event Finder
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae Beach - Summer in NZ
events.venue: Hey Coastie, Wellington, 42 Tutere Street, Waikanae
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Waikanae Beach! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: First drink is included in the ticket price.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Jian Liu-Prefab Hall, 14 Jessie St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Jian Liu
events.venue: Prefab Hall, 14 Jessie St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Welcome to the grand finale of Shostakovich: Unpacked. A four-part concert series presented by New Zealand String Quartet and friends to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Shostakovich’s death.
 
So far, across three night-time gatherings, the NZSQ has taken to the stage with Orchestra Wellington, Antipodes Quartet and Ghost Trio to explore the raw emotional power of one of the 20th century’s most troubled, yet defiant, musical voices. Now, it’s time for the series to come to its climactic conclusion at the fourth programme, featuring renowned pianist Jian Liu.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers. From duets, to quartets, to a full chamber orchestra, we're getting up close to the celebrated chamber music and lasting legacy of Dimitri Shostakovich, 50 years after his death. This final programme features an exciting new composition by student composer, Estella Wallace. Estella is the recipient of the Finlayson Prize, developed by the New Zealand String Quartet Trust in partnership with New Zealand School of Music - Te Kōkī and SOUNZ Centre for New Zealand Music and generously sponsored by Hon. Christopher Finlayson. The prize invited students to compose a new piece for string quartet inspired by and responding to the life and works of Dmitri Shostakovich. Estella's new piece, 'Of Sorrows', will be performed by the NZSQ musicians alongside two of Shostakovich's most powerful works: his Piano Quintet, and the final piece he ever wrote, his Viola and Piano Sonata.
 
We invite you to join us in concluding the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”. Together we will explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, and how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Four: Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Jian Liu
Artists onstage: NZSQ / Jian Liu
Shostakovich: Piano Quintet, Viola and Piano Sonata
Unpacked: Of Sorrows - a brand-new composition by emerging composer, Estella Wallace. Generously supported by Hon. Christopher Finlayson.
Spotlight: The artistic culmination of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, and the heart of the entire series. Following a performance of Shostakovich’s celebrated Piano Quintet, bear witness to one of the most special artistic collaborations of 2025. Award-winning pianist Jian Liu joins beloved NZSQ founding member, Gillian Ansell MNZN, in the very last work written by Dmitri Shostakovich. Ending in hushed silence, and in almost total darkness, this concert will not only leave listeners deeply moved by what Shostakovich experienced throughout his own life but also inspire reflection of what we as human beings still experience throughout our world today.
Tickets: $15 - $55
In order:
Wednesday 9 July, 6:30pm & 8:30pm, NZSQ + Orchestra Wellington
Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
Special Addition in Auckland: Wednesday 24 September, 7pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Special Addition in Nelson: Tuesday 28 October, 7pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu
Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu
events.description:
Estella is the recipient of the Finlayson Prize, developed by the New Zealand String Quartet Trust in partnership with New Zealand School of Music - Te Kōkī and SOUNZ Centre for New Zealand Music and generously sponsored by Hon.
Estella's new piece, 'Of Sorrows', will be performed by the NZSQ musicians alongside two of Shostakovich's most powerful works: his Piano Quintet, and the final piece he ever wrote, his Viola and Piano Sonata.
Together we will explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, and how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.

events.id: The 'Other' Curriculum Roadshow - Wellington-581 Evans Bay Parade, Kilbirnie, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: The 'Other' Curriculum Roadshow - Wellington
events.venue: 581 Evans Bay Parade, Kilbirnie, Wellington
events.long_description:
Link to register: https://events.humanitix.com/the-other-curriculum...
Event description
Multiple Choice: Screening and Education Discussion
Join the Aotearoa Educators Collective (AEC) for a pivotal evening of discussion focused on the future of education with colleagues in Wellington. We are proud to host a screening of the compelling documentary, Multiple Choice - see the trailer here. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wroL0kvYJLs
This film explores the profound and often challenging impacts of high-stakes, standardised testing on students, teachers, and the entire education system. Following the screening, we will open up a vital conversation about how we assess, Curriculum reform, and celebrating what is great about what we are doing now in Aotearoa New Zealand.
Your Voice Matters
This event is a crucial opportunity for educators, policymakers, parents, and community members to engage directly with key issues shaping our local schools and kura. We aim to:
Spark informed discussion about the role of assessment and qualifications.

events.id: 'Una Serenata Italiana' - – an intimate evening of Italian opera favourites at the Public Trust Hal-Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: 'Una Serenata Italiana' - – an intimate evening of Italian opera favourites at the Public Trust Hal
events.venue: Old Public Trust Building, 131 Lambton Quay, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Te Pae Kōkako – The Aotearoa New Zealand Opera Studio (TANZOS) performs for Wellington audiences for the first time this November with Una Serenata Italiana – an intimate evening of Italian opera favourites at the Public Trust Hall.
Directed by Elaine Kidd (Head of the Jette Parker Artists Programme, The Royal Opera House Covent Garden) and accompanied by Caroline Dowdle (Head of Opera, Atelier Lyric Verbier Festival; repertoire coach with the Jette Parker Programme and the Royal College of Music), the concert celebrates the beauty of Italian opera and the new generation of New Zealand opera artists defining the country’s vocal landscape.
Presented in association with Ambasciata d’Italia Wellington, this special performance continues the vision of Dame Malvina Major, whose support for artist development through TANZOS helps nurture Aotearoa’s rising operatic talent.
Featuring Sarah Mileham, Niamh Bentley, Jasmine Jessen, Katherine Winitana, Ridge Ponini, Faamanu Fonoti-Fuimaono, Tomairangi Henare and Samuel McKeever.
About TANZOS:
Te Pae Kōkako – The Aotearoa New Zealand Opera Studio (TANZOS) is directed by internationally recognised soprano Madeleine Pierard, Dame Malvina Major Chair in Opera, and led by Head Vocal Coach Nikki Li Hartliep, an acclaimed performer and teacher who has worked with major opera companies and conservatories around the world.
TANZOS provides full-time, international-level opera training for up to six exceptional New Zealand singers each year, supported by donor-funded scholarships and guided by Dame Malvina Major’s long-held vision for professional opera education in Aotearoa.
Find out more at https://www.tanzos.org/

events.long_description:
Come and join us for Improvers Zouk Block F (5 weeks).
Please note that there will be no class on 18th November, but we may run a practica
We have some great new content for you this year and will be building on foundational movements.
The complete Improvers course consists of 6 different Blocks (A-F).
Each block focuses on a different aspect and technique of Brazilian Zouk and so they can be completed independently of each other.
Our recommendation is to complete all 6 Blocks before progressing onto the Brazilian Zouk Deep Dive classes.
In Improvers Block E you will get an Introduction to Head movements - Rotisserie, as well as some exercises on Creativity.

- Ad hoc cost per class is $20 waged or $18 unwaged/students

Acct: 03-0531-0559348-25

Classes are in Footnote dance studio, 60 Dixon Street

events.id: Challenges in a Changing World – what kind of future do we want?-Kāpiti College Library Room, Margaret Rd, Raumati-Event Finder
events.name: Challenges in a Changing World – what kind of future do we want?
events.venue: Kāpiti College Library Room, Margaret Rd, Raumati
events.long_description:
Challenges in a Changing World – what kind of future do we want?

Humanity is at a crossroads

One path into the future leads to increasing social and economic division, environmental destruction, war and planetary peril. The other path leads to increasing social harmony, economic and environmental balance, and a golden era of peace.

Throughout history, especially at times of crisis, great spiritual teachers have emerged to show humanity the next step forward.

According to British artist, author and esotericist Benjamin Creme, a group of such spiritual teachers is now living in the modern world ~ Maitreya, the World Teacher and The Masters of Wisdom ~ to help and inspire humanity in its task of global transformation ~ to create a civilisation based on sharing, justice and peace; for humanity to act - to share and save our world.

From ancient times, a body of spiritual teachings known as the Ageless Wisdom has been handed down from generation to generation. A systematic and comprehensive account of the evolution of consciousness in humanity and nature, it describes how the universe came to exist, how it operates, and humanity’s place within it.

As humanity matures, further aspects of this previously hidden knowledge are released in a wider, more open manner. Throughout the last 100 years, the Ageless Wisdom Teachings have been communicated through individuals such as Helena Blavatsky, founder of the Theosophical Society, and later by Alice A. Bailey and Helena Roerich, followed by Benjamin Creme.

Along the lines of these teachings, humanity is once again at a critical point in its further development, now with a growing awareness of the necessity for unity, justice and peace.

According to these teachings, Maitreya – known as the Teacher for this coming Age of Aquarius – will emphasise the utter necessity for peace, and that the complete renunciation of war can only be achieved by trust. Sharing alone, Maitreya will affirm, can engender that trust.

~ followed by a short Transmission Meditation session ~
Share International New Zealand. Contact (021) 261 2749
Access - entrance from Raumati Road/ walk - drive past Te Raukura ki Kāpiti / Kāpiti Performing Arts Centre

events.id: Cliff Richard - Can't Stop Me Now-111 Wakefield St, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Cliff Richard - Can't Stop Me Now
events.venue: 111 Wakefield St, Wellington
events.long_description:
British music icon Sir Cliff Richard announced his highly anticipated live tour for New Zealand 2025. These shows offer a rare chance to witness one of Britain’s most celebrated performers in a live setting.
Next year will mark 12 years since New Zealand audiences have seen Cliff Richard live in concert and the 2025 tour will begin in Auckland and make its way to Wellington & Christchurch. Fans will be treated to a setlist packed with timeless classics, including hits such as "Living Doll," "We Don’t Talk Anymore," "Devil Woman," and many more. Known for his energy, charisma, and enduring stage presence, Sir Cliff continues to capture hearts and inspire audiences as he has done across the eight decades.
As one of the greatest hitmakers in British music history, Cliff Richard has sold in excess of 250 million records worldwide, securing his place among the best-selling artists of all time. He remains the only artist to achieve UK Top 5 albums across eight consecutive decades, a remarkable feat recognised by the Official Charts Company. Since his debut in 1958 with “Move It!”, Sir Cliff has delivered a string of chart-topping hits, including 14 number-one singles and seven No. 1 albums, cementing his legacy as a pop legend.
These 2025 performances offer fans a rare opportunity to see one of music’s all-time greats in concert at the age of 85.

Less than a year since their inception, their name has become a whispered promise across the city’s music scene, with many already declaring them next in line to the throne.
Half/Angel and Goose Garden are delighted to present a supporting lineup woven from their favourite voices in the scene.

events.id: Mehana at Meow -Echoes of Balkans-17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Mehana at Meow -Echoes of Balkans
events.venue: 17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Once again at Meow — let Balkan music lift your spirits!
From north to south, east to west, the music of the Balkans dances through landscapes as diverse as the region itself: playful melodies from eastern Serbia, heartfelt ballads from Dalmatia, expressive and ornamented tunes from the north, the unexpected eastern flavours of Bosnian music, and the vibrant fusion of influences woven into the traditions of Northern Macedonia and Greece.
And of course, we’ll add our own songs to the mix — An unforgettable night — not to be missed!
events.description:
Once again at Meow — let Balkan music lift your spirits!
From north to south, east to west, the music of the Balkans dances through landscapes as diverse as the region itself: playful melodies from eastern Serbia, heartfelt ballads from Dalmatia, expressive and ornamented tunes from the north, the unexpected eastern flavours of Bosnian music, and the vibrant fusion of influences woven into the traditions of Northern Macedonia and Greece.
And of course, we’ll add our own songs to the mix — An unforgettable night — not to be missed!

Poets from around the country will battle it out for the title of 2025 National Champion!

events.name: Quiz Night
events.venue: Choice Bros, 62 Ghuznee Street, Wellington
events.description:
Come join us for the weekly ritual on a Tuesday night, where you and your crew will negotiate five rounds of amazing trivia with Gee Quiz.
Your team's street cred, life smarts and common sense will go a long way to ensuring success on the night.
Add to the mix exquisite beers, delicious food and an incredible vibe, it's the place to be on a Tuesday night with plenty of time for laughter, banter and merrymaking!

So, grab your buddies and come on down and join us for one of Wellington's best quiz nights – Choice Bros style!

events.id: SOLD OUT - The Phoenix Foundation Perform 'Pegasus' - WELLINGTON-93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: SOLD OUT - The Phoenix Foundation Perform 'Pegasus' - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 93 Mornington Rd, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
***SOLD OUT***
The Phoenix Foundation Performs Pegasus
To celebrate the 20th anniversary of their landmark sophomore effort Pegasus, The Phoenix Foundation will perform the album in full in the smallest venue they could find. Surprise! Catch the band at Voglemorn Bowling Club the 28th of November, performing an intimate and intricate set of TPF classics that blew the xennial minds of noughties New Zealand.
The band are gearing up for their Pegasus show at The Others Way festival but it seemed cruel to not sneak in a little home town show, but make no mistake, tickets are very very limited. Don’t miss a trick and get in quick so you can cut sick with The Phoenix Foundation at the VBC, where music is the language of love and laughter is the voice of reason guiding ships of joy through the straits of humanity.
Doors 7pm
Performance 8pm - 9pm
A note from the venue:
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space.
This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm.
The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com

events.id: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton-49 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton
events.venue: 49 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ali Whitton is a New Zealand-based singer-songwriter. Born in Aotearoa and raised in rural North Yorkshire, his music blends introspective folk, alt-country, and acoustic storytelling, drawing inspiration from artists like Nick Drake, Bright Eyes, Johnny Cash, and Bob Dylan.
With poetic lyrics rooted in nature and emotional honesty, his songs explore themes of longing, resilience, and cosmic wonder. After an early career touring the UK and France – including sharing stages with Ed Sheeran – Ali settled in Aotearoa New Zealand, where salty sea winds and bush covered landscapes continue to shape his sound.
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe returns with 'Spit Out Your Gum' – his fourth album and most intimate release to date. Vivid, offbeat, and full of heart, the record captures Cunliffe at his most direct, delivering a collection of songs that glow with warmth and humanity.
Across its tracks, Cunliffe takes listeners on a journey from the streets of London to the bright lights of Karangahape Road, and out into the cold green waves of the Irish Sea. Each song feels alive – steeped in imagery, character, and a quiet intensity that rewards deep listening.
Recorded live-to-tape at Roundhead Studios, 'Spit Out Your Gum' carries the unmistakable warmth of that hallowed room and the people within it. With Paddy Hill engineering, Cunliffe was joined by Dave Khan (violin, piano) and Cass Basil (bass, clarinet).
Together, they captured performances that unfold in real time – no edits, no digital polish, just songs recorded in single takes, preserving the intimacy, imperfection, and energy of the moment.
events.description:
Ali Whitton is a New Zealand-based singer-songwriter.
Born in Aotearoa and raised in rural North Yorkshire, his music blends introspective folk, alt-country, and acoustic storytelling, drawing inspiration from artists like Nick Drake, Bright Eyes, Johnny Cash, and Bob Dylan.
With poetic lyrics rooted in nature and emotional honesty, his songs explore themes of longing, resilience, and cosmic wonder.
After an early career touring the UK and France – including sharing stages with Ed Sheeran – Ali settled in Aotearoa New Zealand, where salty sea winds and bush covered landscapes continue to shape his sound.
Recorded live-to-tape at Roundhead Studios, 'Spit Out Your Gum' carries the unmistakable warmth of that hallowed room and the people within it.

events.id: Ben Ottewell & Ian Ball By Request Tour | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Ben Ottewell & Ian Ball By Request Tour | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
After what must be their 10,000th voyage to their favourite touring destination (give or take a few), Ben Ottewell and Ian Ball, founding members of the legendary Gomez, return to Australia and New Zealand for another run of unforgettable, up-close-and-personal shows.
Calling all fans, Tijuana Lady’s, actually Me, You, Everybody to See The World through the eyes of Ian Ball and Ben Ottewell as they Bring Their Lovin’ Back Here to New Zealand.
Expect the best tunes from the best of 25 years of touring to Australia and the best albums Bring It On, Liquid Skin, and beyond all delivered with Ben Ottewell’s unmistakable growl and Ian Ball’s melodic brilliance.
No rules.
Make sure you fill out the song request form here: bit.ly/GomezByRequest Get your request in and Bring It On!
