events.id: James Nokise: One Right Rant | Wellington-The Fringe Bar,26-32 Allen Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: James Nokise: One Right Rant | Wellington
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,26-32 Allen Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
James Nokise: One Right Rant | Wellington
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!

About this Event

Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.
One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.

About James Nokise
A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.
Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.
James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.

Also check out other Comedy events in Wellington, Entertainment events in Wellington, Festivals in Wellington.

events.id: SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT-The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT
events.venue: The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT
All tickets to this show have sold. Second show announcement soon...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.

You may also like the following events from Darren Watson:
This November, 9th November, 05:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Tauranga in Tauranga
This November, 15th November, 09:30 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Kumeū in Waitakere
This November, 21st November, 10:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - New Plymouth in New Plymouth
Also check out other Music events in Lower Hutt, Entertainment events in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Saya Gray, Karen Nyame KG + Mā-Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Saya Gray, Karen Nyame KG + Mā
events.venue: Meow Nui, 92 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011, Wellington
events.long_description:
Drunken Piano, Banished Music and The Others Way festival are hyped to announce a huge debut NZ appearance on Friday 28th November 2025 for Canada’s Saya Gray at Wellington’s stunning Meow Nui. Support comes from UK producer DJ Karen Nyame KG and Te Whanganui-a-Tara local artist Mā.

Taking the stage in Wellington ahead of her Others Way Festival appearance the next night, Saya Gray will be performing material from her excellent record released earlier this year SAYA.

Saya Gray has earned a reputation for electric, hypnotic live performances, leaping between instruments and genres, beguiling and entrancing her audiences.

“The alt-pop experimentalist delivered a mesmerizing, emotional performance with a triumphant sense of self” – Range Magazine

Watch her NPR Tiny Desk performance here.

Sharing the Meow Nui stage with Saya is UK DJ, producer, vocalist Karen Nyame KG.

“Channeling a deeply rooted attachment to the African diaspora, KG’s innovative and percussive assemblage of dance music spanned amapiano, afrobeats, uk funky, gqom and beyond.” – Resident Advisor

You can check our her boiler room set at Primavera here.

Rounding out the evening is local artist Mā. With their second album “Blame It On The Weather” being released earlier this year, Mā told RNZ “I’d rather talk about how we can move forward, how we can evolve, how we can work together better”.

Don’t miss this celebratory evening of creative expression and artistic genius. With Saya Gray and KG performing for the first time in New Zealand

events.name: Red Ribbon Revue: A Cabaret for World Aids Day
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
A fun and festive (and gently informative) cabaret in recognition of World Aids Day (which is a few days later on Dec 1st). Hosted by Neil D'Bear Thornton (Best Comedian and Best MC, Wellington Comedy awards) and sponsored by The Burnett Foundation and Body Positive. Comedy! Drag! Burlesque! Music! More! (Cast includes Jak Darling, Willie Smackntush, members of Fired Up Stilettos, and more!)

World AIDS Day, observed annually on December 1st, is an international day to raise awareness of the global fight against HIV/AIDS.

All profits to benefit Body Positive (https://bodypositive.org.nz/). Body Positive Inc. is a peer support organisation, founded by and run for, all people living with HIV in New Zealand.

Doors at 7:00pm. Cabaret at 8:00pm. Drinks and karaoke to follow!

Tickets available on https://events.humanitix.com/let-s-planet-new-album-release

Let’s Planet makes jangly pop with a backbone and they have been doing it for 40 years. Formed by songwriter/guitarist Alan Galloway, with Nigel Clements and Helen Cairney, the group found its true direction when Caroline Easther (The Chills, The Verlaines, and now in The Warratahs) joined with her snap-tight drums and Murray Costello (The Mockers) came in on bass. Pagan Records released Favours, Loving Tongues and La Gloria, where Let’s Planet honed their chiming guitars, close vocal harmonies, melodic basslines, and catchy hooks. They have shared stages with R.E.M., Crowded House, Throwing Muses, The Proclaimers, Split Enz, and Paul Kelly. Reviewers have called their catalogue “thoughtful and polished, moving from breezy guitar numbers to moody indie-rock”, and their earlier material has been collected on Pearlers, a best-of compilation available on Bandcamp.

Alan and Caroline have kept on writing and performing. Now - only 27 years after their last studio album - Let’s Planet is back with a new record! Anything You Want picks up all the right threads again: textured songs, thoughtful arrangements, and the hooks that long-time fans expect and new listeners will be excited to discover.

The album release gig will start 7:30 pm 29 November in St Peter's Hall, Paekakariki ﻿with help from Tatiana Sogrina, and Nigel Mitchell from Orangefarm.

Let’s Planet are offering anything you want — and quite possibly something you didn’t know you needed.

events.name: Third Eye Hi-Fi Presents - Druid's Temple
events.venue: 154 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Third Eye Hifi Presents:
Druids Temple
Rooted in the ancient traditions of the druids, this night channels the deep connection between land, spirit, and sound. The druids saw the earth as sacred — every tree, stone, and breath carrying rhythm and resonance. Their gatherings in the forests were not just rituals, but sonic ceremonies — where vibration, intention, and nature intertwined.
Carrying that lineage into the present, we gather once more — not in oak circles, but beneath the pulse of sub-bass and smoke. The dancefloor becomes our modern temple, a sacred space where frequencies align and collective energy moves as one.
Channeling ancient energy through modern frequencies, our array of homegrown and international artists bring their influence in the 130 / 140 bass music scene for an immersive experience to remember.
// Druids Line-Up //
Tamar
Clova
Tarantist
Kameano
Bvrbwyre
Steering Hippies
Decor by RabidFoam
Visuals by Focal Point
Artwork by P-S-I

events.name: A.Skills (UK)
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
A.Skillz (UK)
A.Skillz is a master of the decks and a true party rocker, known for fusing Funk, Soul, Hip Hop, Rock, and Bass into an electrifying mix that’s uniquely his own. His sets burst with re-edits, remixes, and original productions, taking crowds on a high-energy journey through sound. With a signature flair that blurs genres and ignites dancefloors, A.Skillz brings the party wherever he goes.

With support from The Sandwiches Guy (Bryce) and KARDIAK
The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London immersed in rave and club culture—DJing, promoting, and throwing parties. Returning to Wellington in 2000, he co-founded the event brand Sandwiches, which by 2003 had evolved into one of the city’s most iconic venues. For over a decade, Sandwiches was at the heart of Wellington’s nightlife, hosting top local and international acts and expanding into large-scale events such as the legendary Summerset at the Basin Reserve festival.

events.id: W**d Releasing Bee-Hana Udy Pl, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: W**d Releasing Bee
events.venue: Hana Udy Pl, Paraparaumu Beach, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
W**d Releasing Bee
Kia Ora Koutou

Now we have finished planting for the year we are turning our attention to the all-important W**d releasing. This is essential to keeping the young plants that we have planted this winter from being overwhelmed by grass and weeds. Also mulching to help with moisture retention over those hot summer days. Our next weeding is on Saturday 29th November, meeting at the Nursery on Hana Udy Place at 9.00am. Gloves, tools and sunscreen provided along with a morning tea and an update on the Reserve afterward. Hope to see you there! Feel free to bring a friend and encourage others to join us. This will be our last volunteer activity for the year.

Also over summer we may need some help in watering the plants we put in this year, I will do a post if we need extra help.


Health & Safety Notice: When working in the Reserve, please ensure your clothing and footwear are appropriate for expected weather conditions (cold, wet or hot) and the terrain (such as holes, hidden objects, blackberry, overhead branches). Trip hazards and slippery tracks are a possibility. Stay clear of waterways. Be cautious if you have allergies and carry the necessary medication. Enjoy your time in the Reserve and please avoid blocking pathways used by other users. Report any accidents, injuries or possible hazards to the H&S Coordinator (021 071 5364).

events.id: Eco Dye Workshop-Waikanae Arts and Crafts Society Inc,27A Elizabeth St, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae-All Events In
events.name: Eco Dye Workshop
events.venue: Waikanae Arts and Crafts Society Inc,27A Elizabeth St, Waikanae 5036, New Zealand, Waikanae
events.long_description:
Eco Dye Workshop
Impressions of Nature on Silk

Eco dyeing, also known as leaf or eco print, is a gentle, alchemical process where the natural pigments of leaves are transferred directly onto fabric, creating one-of-a-kind botanical imprints.

Join me for a full day of slow making and discovery as we explore this beautiful dialogue between nature and cloth. In the morning, we’ll forage around the hall, gathering leaves and foliage that speak to us. You’ll learn how to prepare and bundle silk with plant materials, drawing out colours and patterns from the landscape itself.

In the afternoon, you’ll design and dye your own silk scarf — a wearable memory of place and season, marked by the delicate traces of nature’s touch.

You will learn

• which plants and fibres work best for this method
• how to use an iron mordant to enhance colour and detail
• different bundling techniques and approaches

All materials and tools will be provided for use during the workshop.

Your workshop fee includes silk fabrics to explore and experiment with, one silk scarf to design and dye, and a detailed handout with information on mordants, dye plants, tips, and useful resources.

A ‘what to bring’ list (including suggestions for clothing and optional items) will be sent out closer to the workshop date.

Booking through my website (see link above)

Location

27A Elizabeth Street (Art and Craft Society)
Waikane
Kāpiti

Join me for a full day of slow making and discovery as we explore this beautiful dialogue between nature and cloth.
In the morning, we’ll forage around the hall, gathering leaves and foliage that speak to us.

events.id: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day-6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512-All Events In
events.name: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day
events.venue: 6 Hewson Cres, Otaki Beach, Otaki 5512
events.long_description:
Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day
Create gorgeous simple leadlight suncatchers with Lisa Sinclair.

A super fun day-class, ideal as a stand-alone experience, or as a day to get stuck into projects with your tutor at hand.

Beginners choose from a range of achievable patterns and choose their colour palette. They will learn to cut the glass, and prepare it before foiling and soldering each piece, creating a simple elegant colourful glass project.

The aim of this one day class is to leave with a completed small leadlight glass item.

More experienced students may bring existing projects to work on in class - though emphasis will be placed on focusing on the same techniques of flat, nicely soldered simple designs.

This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students. All tools are supplied, though you are welcome to bring your own tools and glass if you have them.

Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee.
Additional materials and tools are available to purchase.

Not suitable for children. Older teenagers (16+) are welcome.

Workshop fee $215, Early bird $194 till 2 November.

We are celebrating Christmas with four free family-friendly events, in four different quarters of the city this year! 🎅

🎶Bring the whānau for a day filled with Christmas tunes and performances! From choirs, ukulele groups and hip-hop, to face painting and a chance to pop a letter in Santa’s Letterbox... there are many ways to feel the Christmas sprit.

Chill out and absorb the sounds and sights of Christmas at Glover Park on 29 November, any time between 11am and 5pm📍

Join us for four weekends of Christmas magic all around Pōneke!
🎄 Crafts at Midland Park on Saturday 22 November.
🎄 Music at Glover Park on Saturday 29 November.

events.id: Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again-12 Britannia Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012,12 Britannia St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again
events.venue: 12 Britannia Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012,12 Britannia St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again
Our upcoming Echoes of Home invites audiences on a musical and storytelling journey that traces the emotional path of every migrant — from the laughter of childhood to the quiet ache of distance and the enduring warmth of return.

Through five evocative chapters of live music, dance, and performance, the show unfolds as a tapestry of memory and identity — celebrating resilience, cultural pride, and the beauty of belonging.

It begins with “Tuổi Thơ Bé Nhỏ” (Childhood Memories), a tender glimpse into early life in Vietnam, filled with playfulness and sunshine.
Then comes “Thời Học Sinh” (School Days), where friendship, curiosity, and the vibrant pulse of youth take centre stage.
“Trưởng Thành” (Adulthood) follows, echoing the courage to grow, dream, and chase life’s horizons.
The story deepens with “Xa Quê Lập Nghiệp” (Life Abroad) — a heartfelt portrait of those who leave home to build a new life, balancing hope and longing.
Finally, “Nhớ Nhung Tìm Về” (Longing and Return) closes the circle, where nostalgia meets gratitude and the heart finds its way home again.

Blending traditional Vietnamese melodies with modern artistry, Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again is more than a performance — it is a bridge between generations, a celebration of roots, and an embrace of the shared human journey toward belonging.

events.id: Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio-SPACE Yoga and Mindfulness Studio,8 Lookout Road, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio
events.venue: SPACE Yoga and Mindfulness Studio,8 Lookout Road, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio
We invite you to a special evening of Sacred Harmonic Sound with multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia. This immersive sound journey offers a deeply restorative experience that invites you to settle into stillness, reconnect with the heart, and explore a sense of inner spaciousness through vibration and tone.
Claudio skilfully layers the sounds of gongs, crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other traditional instruments, enhanced through high-quality audio equipment so the sound can be both heard and felt throughout your body.
Harmonic sound and vibration offer the nervous system a chance to truly rest. In this state of relaxation, the thinking mind softens, and we find connection to citta — the heart-mind. From this place, silence arises naturally through the vehicle of sound.
This experience is open to everyone. No previous yoga or meditation practice is needed.

What to bring:
You are welcome to bring your own yoga mat, though studio mats are also available. We will provide bolsters, blankets, and eye pillows for your comfort.

Booking is essential — spaces are limited and this event often fills quickly.

About Claudio
Claudio is a multi-instrumentalist musician originally from Mexico City and now based in Wellington. Born into a family of musicians, he began playing music at a young age and later studied classical guitar. His journey led him to Montreal, where he explored jazz, world music, and spiritual sound traditions.

Extensive travels in Asia and Europe deepened his connection with Indian music and yogic philosophy. He studied Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu and Varanasi, and has since worked with a wide range of instruments including the sitar, esraj, bansuri, harmonium, flutes, gongs, and voice.

Claudio’s work blends technical skill, deep presence, and a profound respect for the healing power of sound.

Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

events.long_description:
Come along to our Christmas Community Garage Sale — a great morning out for the whole family! Browse through a wide range of quality second-hand items including household goods, books, toys, games, puzzles, CDs, and more. events.long_description:
ROLL UP, ROLL UP – THE EXTRAVAGANZA FAIR IS BACK!

Celebrating 11 epic years of magical mayhem on the road!

New Zealand’s biggest and most fabulous traveling fair is rolling back into town – and you’re invited!

We’re bringing grassroots charm, vintage flair, and old-school fun to town – a joyride for all ages! Whether you’re 5 or 95, there’s something here to make your heart happy.

FREE ENTRY for kids! Gold coin for adults – that’s it!

Get ready for a weekend packed full of FREE entertainment the whole whānau will love.

Expect a kaleidoscope of colour, creativity, and community vibes with:
*Unique market stalls, arts,crafts & more!
* Yummy street food galore
* Kids rides & games all day
* The fabulous Ashton Family Circus
* Burns the Dragon breathing fun
* Enchanting Mermaid Storytime
* Sparkling LuckyStar Zone (as seen at Splore!)
* Live music all day
* Tarot, past-life readings & mystical moments

Tiny homes, solar setups & sustainable inspiration
Retro lounges & shady chill zones = your new favourite hangout spot

See you there this summer 2025 - 2026!!

events.id: A Marvellous Miramar Christmas: 29 November (3 sessions)-63 Miramar Avenue, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: A Marvellous Miramar Christmas: 29 November (3 sessions)
events.venue: 63 Miramar Avenue, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We've designed a Christmas experience for the whole family!
Come along and get into the Christmas spirit by joining in a marvellous Miramar Christmas extravaganza! As a family, come along and enter our amazing, indoor, interactive Christmas festival!
Enjoy hands-on crafts and activities together, get into some fun games at your own pace, listen and singalong to live music, let the younger tamariki have their space in a free-play area, tuck into our delish loaded free hot chocolates and cookie bar, get your annual whanau photo in our dress up photobooth, hear Christmas stories, take time to remember someone special at the remembrance tree... and many more merry and marvellous festivities!
Timing note: This year's Christmas event is a 'go-at-your-own-pace' session and you are welcome to leave when needed. Sessions/festival conclude 90mins after the start time.
Market note: While this event is designed to feel like a Christmas market/fair or festival - all experiences and crafts while in your session have no additional cost/are included. The only fee is the initial ticket fee.

TICKET DETAILS:
A Marvellous Miramar Christmas is all about getting into the Christmas spirit - our hope is that we can support families in the Miramar community through this event!
Tickets are $3 per child or adult / $13 for a group of 5.
Please note: if you require more than 5 tickets, please add any additional individual or group tickets to make up your group total.
All proceeds from this event will go towards providing Christmas gifts and support for families in the Miramar community. Thank you for your support!
Simply book tickets for your prefered session using this website! Please reserve tickets for any adults AND kids attending.


SESSION TIMES:
There are three A Marvellous Miramar Christmas sessions over the weekend. Each session is up to 90mins.
Saturday 29 November: 9.30 - 11am
Saturday 29 November: 11am - 12.30pm
Saturday 29 November: 1.30pm - 3pm
Please note: All children under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult.

RESERVE YOUR TICKETS ONLINE TODAY!
 Any queries, contact us on Facebook or email miramar.corps@salvationarmy.org.nz or call 04 388 8284

K A T E brings sultry soulful, ethereal blues.

Teamed up with some of Wellingtons greatest musicians, K A T E and her band have been known to bring an outerworldy experience to those who witness them live, leaving people feeling as though they are on a natural high.

Playing songs written by K A T E, that she truly believes she has channeled for the healing and expansion of not only her heart but all other hearts on this planet. Songs that deliver powerful messages and not only bring a presence to the room when played, but as the frequency of K A T E's voice radiates in and through the audience, people can't help but become engaged with their whole being.

A setlist of heartfelt music that you will also most definitely want to move your body to too.

Doors open 7pm for a 7.30pm start.

events.name: Artisan Craft Market
events.venue: Dowse Square, Laings Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Lower Hutt City outside at the Dowse Square!

events.name: Foxton Christmas Fair
events.venue: Te Awahou Nieuwe Stroom,28 Harbour St, Foxton 4814, New Zealand, Palmerston North
events.long_description:
Foxton Christmas Fair
🎄 Get Ready for a Foxy Christmas Market in Foxton! 🎄

The holiday season is here, and Foxtail Events is bringing the festive cheer to Foxton with a fabulous Foxy Market! 🎅✨

Join us for a fun-filled day with something for everyone:

🍴 Food Trucks – delicious bites to satisfy all tastes
☕ Coffee Carts – warm up with your favourite brew
🎨 Art & Craft Stalls – find unique, handmade gifts
🧸 Kids Play Zone & Games – fun for the little ones
🦙 Petting Zoo – meet some furry friends
🎤 Open Mic Stage & Live Music – enjoy local tunes
🎅 Santa Claus – get a photo with the big guy
🎨 Face Painting – let your creativity shine
🎄 Wishing Star Christmas Tree – make a wish for the season
🚗 Classic Cars – a beautiful display for car enthusiasts

And so much more! ✨

It’s the second year of this magical event, and we can’t wait to celebrate with you all again. Local artisans and craftsmen will showcase their handmade treasures, from stunning ornaments, jewellery, and candles to unique home décor and scrumptious holiday treats.

With the aroma of fresh coffee, tasty food, and the sounds of joyful chatter filling the air, the market will be transformed into a festive wonderland. It’s the perfect place to find that special gift and embrace the community spirit of the season.

Come join us and experience the magic of Christmas in Foxton! 🎁

You may also like the following events from Foxtail Events Community Markets:
Next Sunday, 7th September, 12:00 am, Ngaio Village Market in Wellington
Next month, 20th September, 03:00 am, Mean Market in Wellington
Next month, 27th September, 12:00 am, Kapiti Botanist Market in Paraparaumu
Also check out other Arts events in Palmerston North, Music events in Palmerston North, Kids events & activities in Palmerston North.

events.id: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Leadlight Glass Suncatcher Day
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Create gorgeous simple leadlight suncatchers with Lisa Sinclair.

A super fun day-class, ideal as a stand-alone experience, or as a day to get stuck into projects with your tutor at hand.

Beginners choose from a range of achievable patterns and choose their colour palette. They will learn to cut the glass, and prepare it before foiling and soldering each piece, creating a simple elegant colourful glass project.

The aim of this one day class is to leave with a completed small leadlight glass item.
More experienced students may bring existing projects to work on in class - though emphasis will be placed on focusing on the same techniques of flat, nicely soldered simple designs.

This is a warm and friendly class with excellent support and learning for complete beginners and more advanced students. All tools are supplied, though you are welcome to bring your own tools and glass if you have them.

Your materials for your beginner project are supplied as part of your course fee.
Additional materials and tools are available to purchase.

Not suitable for children. Older teenagers (16+) are welcome.

events.id: Screenprinting taster workshop Nov 29th - print a tote bag-160 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Screenprinting taster workshop Nov 29th - print a tote bag
events.venue: 160 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Design and screenprint your own tote bag, no experience needed!
Join artist and designer Greta Menzies for a fun, hands-on introduction to screenprinting using paper stencils.
In this 2-hour session you’ll design and cut your own stencil, then print your artwork onto a tote bag (included in your ticket).
Want to make extras? See the 'what's included' section below.
What you’ll learn
How to create and screenprint your own design using paper stencils
Tips and tricks from Greta’s years of experience as an artist and textile designer
(Greta is happy to answer any questions about printing methods and help you find resources)

What’s included
All materials provided, including one tote bag
Extra tote bags will be available on the day for $6 each. They make great gifts!
You’re also welcome to bring your own light-coloured fabric or fabric item to print on, just make sure it’s at least 50% natural fibre (cotton or linen is ideal).
The max print size is A3.
Can I print more than one bag? Or multiple colours?
Once your design is on the screen you can print a few multiples if you'd like.
The workshop is set up for participants to make one bag with a single colour print, but depending on how fast you work, (if there is time) you are welcome to add another colour.

Who it’s for
This workshop is for anyone curious about screenprinting, no experience required.
All ages welcome! (Under 13s will need an adult to join them.)
Accessibility
The space is wheelchair accessible.
The process is adaptable for all abilities. If you can use scissors, that's excellent, tearing paper also works. Greta is happy to help with cutting if needed.
Details
Date: Saturday November 29th, 2025
Time: 10.30am - 12.30pm
Location: Mt Cook School, 160 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington
Cost: $85 per person
Class size: Max of 10 participants
What to bring
Yourself and your ideas!
Wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little paint on (or bring an apron)
Optional: light-coloured fabric item to print on (at least 50% natural fibre, cotton or linen is ideal)
Water bottle and snacks if you like
Extra tote bags available on the day for $6 each
(random colours and limited selection, unless you want to email me ahead of time and order something specific: greta.menzies@gmail.com)
About Greta
Greta Menzies is an artist and designer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has taught art and design workshops since 2015, in galleries, schools, community studios, and at Massey University. Greta first started screenprinting with stencils in her garage at 17, making hoodies and t-shirts for her mates. Over the last few years, she’s refined her accessible, low-impact printing method while teaching school groups - and now it’s time for all ages to have a go!
events.description:
Join artist and designer Greta Menzies for a fun, hands-on introduction to screenprinting using paper stencils.
What you’ll learn How to create and screenprint your own design using paper stencils Tips and tricks from Greta’s years of experience as an artist and textile designer (Greta is happy to answer any questions about printing methods and help you find resources) What’s included All materials provided, including one tote bag Extra tote bags will be available on the day for $6 each.
Once your design is on the screen you can print a few multiples if you'd like.
The workshop is set up for participants to make one bag with a single colour print, but depending on how fast you work, (if there is time) you are welcome to add another colour.
Wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little paint on (or bring an apron) Optional: light-coloured fabric item to print on (at least 50% natural fibre, cotton or linen is ideal) Water bottle and snacks if you like Extra tote bags available on the day for $6 each (random colours and limited selection, unless you want to email me ahead of time and order something specific: greta.menzies@gmail.com) About Greta Greta Menzies is an artist and designer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.

events.id: Ōtari Raranga Weavers Kōanga 2025-Urban Dream Brokerage, 106 Courtenay Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ōtari Raranga Weavers Kōanga 2025
events.venue: Urban Dream Brokerage, 106 Courtenay Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
Kua raranga tahi tātou he whariki mō āpōpō
Together we weave the mat for future generations

Nau mai haere mai, all are welcome to attend Ōtari Raranga wānanga (classes)

*29 November you will be surrounded by the mahi made by our Tuakana rōpū


WAENGANUI SCROLL DOWN vvv

FOR THE TEINA (BEGINNER) WĀNANGA
No experience required and all materials provided. You will walk away with woven taonga at the end of every class.

During the first 2 classes, beginner students will complete a variety of putiputi (flowers). We will harvest for you if it is your FIRST class.

Moving forwards you will start making kōnae (2 corner kete - basket), kono (4 sided kete) and tapawhāroa and more.
You will need to harvest 8-10 rau for yourself and start building your own tool kit.

After completing 6 or more beginner classes (close together) you may be ready to move up to our intermediate classes. Please talk with our kaiako and kaiāwhina if you are interested.

With regular attendance you will:
- Learn tikanga (protocols) and karakia for hauhake (harvesting) and preparing harakeke
- Build your mātauranga (knowledge)
- Use kupu Māori appropriate to raranga practice
- Develop your pūkenga (practical skills)
- Create taonga (treasures) for your whānau
- Build hononga (connections) within our raranga rōpū (group)
- Have the skills to practice at home.

What’s included in your beginners ticket?
- Three hour weaving class with experienced kaiako
- Harakeke is provided for your first class and then you should hauhake (harvest) for yourself or click the "please harvest for me" option in addition to your ticket at least two days before class.
- Light refreshments are provided and we encourage you to bring kai to share.


FOR WAENGANUI (INTERMEDIATE) WĀNANGA

15 Nov we will be doing kōhua (boiling) and dyeing for preservation hence the extra cost.

Our kaiako will have made it clear to you when you can advance to this level from beginners.
We will be planning projects in advance to keep all on similar taonga so check your emails.

Projects may include new closes for your kete timata, kete waikawa, puritanga, pīkau and pōtae. We will teach you preparation, preservation and storage of harakeke - important especially over winter months.

With regular attendance you will deepen mātauranga gained from beginner classes and share you learnings with others.

Follow us on Facebook or Instagram: Otari Raranga Weavers

For more information about what to expect and what to bring visit our www.otariraranga.co.nz
We mihi to our funders and sponsors Wellington City Council, Wellington Gardens and the Ōtari-Wilton Bush Kaitiaki, Maverick Creative, Good Fortune Coffee and Wellington Apothecary.

BEGINNERS Led by Linda Lee (Ngāti Huia, Ngāti Raukawa, Ngāti Kurī, Te Rarawa, Te Aupōuri), Irihāpeti Te Aho (Ngāti Kahungunu, Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Pauhauwera) and Anna Lees (Te Āti Awa, Kāi Tahu)with support from our kaiāwhina; Sarah O'Sullivan (Kai Tahu), Anita Murdoch (Ngati Kahungunu, Waikato-Tainui), Sarah O’Sullivan (Ngāi Tahu), Te Kāhui Tapsell (Te Arawa, Tainui), and Frankie Stewart (Tangata Tiriti).

WAENGANUI Led by our raranga rangatira; Frank Topia (Ngā Puhi, Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Haua)

Important information
- It is important that everyone turns up on time for karakia
- For tikanga purposes beginner ticket sales close two days before wānanga giving us time to hauhake (harvest) for you
- If class numbers are too low, we may have to cancel (and will offer a refund or transfer) so please check your emails before class

Follow us on Facebook or Instagram: Otari Raranga Weavers
For more information about what to expect and what to bring visit our www.otariraranga.co.nz

We mihi to our funders and sponsors Wellington City Council, Wellington Communities Trust, Wellington Gardens and the Ōtari-Wilton Bush Kaitiaki, Maverick Creative, Urban Dream Brokerage, Good Fortune Coffee and Wellington Apothecary.

events.id: NCWNZ Self Defence Course - 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence-65 Salamanca Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: NCWNZ Self Defence Course - 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence
events.venue: 65 Salamanca Road, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
NCWNZ Free Women’s Self-Defence Course: Supporting Awareness for the 16 Days of Activism Against Gender-Based Violence
Empower yourself with practical skills, confidence, and awareness at this free women’s self-defence session, offered by the National Council of Women New Zealand – Wellington Branch to help raise visibility and conversation around the international 16 Days of Activism Against Gender-Based Violence campaign. With support from the Wellington Hapkido Academy, this workshop provides a safe, inclusive space to learn effective strategies for personal safety.
During this 90-minute session, experienced instructors will guide participants through:
Awareness and Prevention
- Body language
- Situational awareness
- Risk reduction strategies
Physical techniques
- Basic strikes
- Escapes
- Improvised weapons
Scenario practice
- Simulate high stress situations
Event Details
Date: Saturday 29 November 2025 - Session runs 11:00am – 12:30pm.
Location: Court 3, Club K, 65 Salamanca Road, Kelburn
Parking: Available at 65 Salamanca Rd, with additional lower-level parking accessible from within the carpark.
What to Bring & Wear
Clothing: Track pants or similar, crew-neck top
Footwear: Bare feet (training on mats)
Water: Please bring a water bottle
Safety Info: Optional - provide a contact name/number for use only in case of a medical event (kept confidential and destroyed afterwards)
This event is completely free, and all women are warmly encouraged to attend. Bring friends, learn valuable skills, and grow your confidence. Limited spots available, so get in quick!
Optional donations to the NCWNZ Wellington Branch can be made when reserving your ticket—every contribution supports our ongoing advocacy for gender equality, safety, and community wellbeing in Wellington!
Join us for a practical, empowering session that builds confidence and helps raise awareness of the importance of preventing gender-based violence.
If you register - and are unwell or unable to attend the session - please email ncwwlg@gmail.com and let us know as soon as possible so another person can take your spot!

events.id: Real Talk Kāpiti-Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Real Talk Kāpiti
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
The ‘Real Talk’ kaupapa has been created to establish a sense of belonging for all of us.
Where REAL people are able to share their REAL stories to inspire and empower others, especially our rangatahi.

From this event you can expect Inspiring Kaikōrero, Yummy Kai for all, heaps of awesome free stuff to win!
This event is FREE for Rangatahi and FREE for Service Providers and Kaiako. Adults just a donation please.

Our kaikōrero:
• Pairama Wright – Tiktok Sensation
• Pania Te Paiho – Wāhine Toa Hunting, Hakaturi
• Rutu King-Stubbs – Hope Is My Homeboy
• Peleti Oli
• Elise Niu
• Kiino Krystal – MC
• Sophie Taylor-Edwards – Kaiwaiata
• Tania Carr – Host

Our kōrero may touch these topics:⁠
• ⁠Mental Health awareness⁠
• Suicide and triggers and coping mechanisms⁠
• Sexual & physical abuse and domestic violence⁠
• Being raised in a gang affiliated environment⁠
• Consequences of committing crimes⁠
• Drug and alcohol addiction⁠
• Teen pregnancy & pregnancy loss⁠
• Death & grief⁠
• Discrimination – racial, gender, sexual orientation⁠
• Takatāpui & tangata whaikaha ⁠
• Relationship breakdowns⁠
• Career & business aspirations⁠
• Standing strong in who you are⁠

Come along to meet our kaikōrero, hear some inspirational stories and share space with the Real Talk kaupapa.

⁠#RealTalk #ReakTalkKāpiti #MoNgaRangatahi

events.id: Real Talk Kāpiti-Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,34 Raumati Rd, Raumati Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Real Talk Kāpiti
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,34 Raumati Rd, Raumati Beach, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Real Talk Kāpiti
We are excited to announce that we are bringing Real Talk to Kāpiti. We can’t wait to share space with you all!
🔥Saturday 29th November
🔥11am to 3pm (doors open at 10.30am)
🔥Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,
Kapiti College, Paraparaumu

This is a FREE event for Rangatahi (14-25years) and also FREE for Rangatahi Service Providers, Kaiako, anyone that works with our rangatahi, Tāngata whaikaha and whaiora.
Click here to register for your tickets:
https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2025/real-talk-kapiti/paraparaumu

Real Talk Kōrero

We take our audience on a journey, a journey of laughter, a journey of tears, and a journey with absolute passion and purpose.
We create a safe space to speak about what we have experienced in our lives, and that we don’t have to be whakamā, we don’t have to live in silence, we don’t have to hide our secrets anymore.
Because when we speak – we heal, when we speak we free ourselves, and when we speak – we provide inspiration and hope for others.

We provide the following at each event:

❤️Inspiring kaikōrero
❤️Free kai and refreshments
❤️Opportunity to win some incredible prizes on the day
❤️FREE Real Talk pukapuka for every rangatahi in the audience

The subjects covered in our kōrero start with but are not limited to the subjects listed below:

⚫️Suicide and triggers and coping mechanisms
⚫️Mental Health awareness
⚫️Sexual, physical abuse and domestic violence
⚫️Being raised in gang affiliated environments
⚫️Drug and alcohol addiction
⚫️Teen pregnancy & pregnancy loss
⚫️Death & grief
⚫️Takatāpui & tangata whaikaha
⚫️Discrimination – racial, gender, sexual orientation
⚫️Relationship breakdowns
⚫️Career & business aspirations
⚫️Standing strong in who you are

We have a great line up of powerhouse, inspirational kaikōrero/speakers on the day:
🔥Pairama Wright – TikTok sensation
🔥Pania Te Paiho – Wāhine Toa Hunting & Hākuturi
🔥Peleti Oli – Youth Advocate
🔥Elise Niu
🔥Rutu King-Stubbs – Hope Is My Homeboy
🔥Sophie Taylor-Edwards - Kaiwaiata
🔥Kiino Krystal - MC
🔥Hosted by – Tania Carr

Also check out other Health & Wellness events in Paraparaumu.

events.id: Eastbourne Garden Tour-St Alban's Anglican Church, 11 Ngaio St, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Eastbourne Garden Tour
events.venue: St Alban's Anglican Church, 11 Ngaio St, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Step into a world of six acclaimed private gardens in Eastbourne, Wellington, each a living canvas of colour, design and inspiration from lush natives to sculpted landscapes. Each garden tells a story and provides a visual image of wonderful creations.

One garden, allegedly with the best vista, has not been opened to the public before. One garden has previously featured in the House and Garden magazine.

The tour (self-guided) will begin with an opportunity to buy potted plants from 11.30 and sit-down lunch from 12 midday, both in the tranquil St Alban's church garden, 11 Ngaio St Eastbourne, Lower Hutt, Wellington.

The garden tour proper will start at 1pm from St Alban's church, with the supply of a map of gardens to visit and will end with hors d'oeuvre, Italian wine and live music in an Italian courtyard of the last garden at 5-6 pm.

A map of gardens will also be supplied by email in the week prior to Nov 29th.

events.name: High Tea at Le Cordon Bleu | 29 NOVEMBER 2025
events.venue: Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand,Level 2, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
High Tea at Le Cordon Bleu | 29 NOVEMBER 2025
Experience an exquisite selection of the finest French Pâtisserie prepared by our highly creative & talented Diplôme de Pâtisserie students.

About this Event

Experience an exquisite selection of the finest French Pâtisserie prepared by our highly creative and talented Le Cordon Bleu New Zealand Diplôme de Pâtisserie students. Tickets are allocated for specific days and seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time-slot you have booked for.
Kiwiana Edition: This High Tea is a speciality menu inspired by classic kiwi treats, enjoy a collection of old favourites with a Le Cordon Bleu spin.

Ticket Information:
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 29th November. (other sessions are also available, to purchase tickets for these events please click here and select your chosen date. Tickets are non-transferable, please ensure you purchase tickets for the correct date.)
Price: $45 per person includes High Tea and complimentary Tea and Coffee.
Booking Times: 11.30am | 12:00pm | 2:30pm | 3:00pm
Tickets are allocated for specific days and seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time you have booked for.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu High Tea experience is one hour. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' collection of French Pâtisserie.
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations, or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.



What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Pâtisserie programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.
Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

events.id: Beacons of Hope walk tour (World AIDS Day special event)-Āwhina Centre, 220 Willis Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Beacons of Hope walk tour (World AIDS Day special event)
events.venue: Āwhina Centre, 220 Willis Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
** FREE - but please register at https://walktours.nz/book **

Join us for a special event marking both the 40th anniversary of the founding of the Burnett Foundation Aotearoa and the 40th anniversary of the death of Bruce Burnett – one of Aotearoa’s pioneering HIV activists and educators.

Bruce was instrumental in co-founding the AIDS Support Network in the early 1980s, which would become the New Zealand AIDS Foundation in 1985, later renamed to the Burnett Foundation Aotearoa in 2022.

Walk Tours NZ, in association with the Burnett Foundation, is hosting a very special walk tour to commemorate these two significant anniversaries. Starting outside the Āwhina Centre on Willis Street, we’ll walk through central Wellington, stopping at various locations to pay tribute to some of this country’s HIV pioneers.

Learn about personal and collective responses to the epidemic, and hear short archival recordings from those who experienced the early years first-hand.

As part of the walk tour, we’ll return to the Āwhina Centre where the Burnett Foundation team will talk about the current state of HIV in Aotearoa and show a couple of panels from the New Zealand AIDS Memorial Quilt.

events.id: Eastbourne Garden Show-11 Ngaio Street, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Eastbourne Garden Show
events.venue: 11 Ngaio Street, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Step into a world of six acclaimed private gardens each a living canvas of colour, design and inspiration from lush natives to sculpted landscapes. Each garden tells a story and provides a visual image of wonderful creations.
One garden, allegedly with the best vista, has not been opened to the public before. One garden has previously featured in the House and Garden magazine. The tour (self-guided) will begin with lunch and an opportunity to buy potted plants in the tranquil St Alban's church garden, 11 Ngaio St Eastbourne, Lower Hutt, Wellington. The tour will end with hors d'oeuvre, wine and live music in the last garden.
This is a chance not just to visit amazing gardens but support the earthquake strengthening of St Alban's historic church and hall for a rejuvenated community hub.
St Albans church garden
The six private gardens all lie within a less than 100 m walk of the 83 Metlink Marine Parade bus route, but a car or bicycle would be more convenient.
A glimpse of the six separate gardens (a-e).
a
a
b
c
d
e
f
f
The garden show is in support of earthquake strengthening of the de Jersey Clere designed St Alban's church and adjacent hall to remake this a community hub.
For the last hundred years and more, this beautiful church designed by acclaimed architect Frederick de Jersey Clere has been the heart of Anglican parish life for people in the eastern bays of Wellington. People have rejoiced, prayed and wept in it through happy family milestones and sad occasions, through two world wars and countless celebrations and crises. Along with its parish hall and tranquil garden, it has been the base for social and community services and outreach, and its memorial wall houses the ashes of local residents.
But in 2016 the congregation had to suddenly leave the church, which was deemed an earthquake risk.
Since then, the parish has explored alternatives for continuing its life and service to the people of the eastern bays. In that process it has kept its ministry and worship going through borrowed premises in local schools and other churches. Now, however, the parish has decided it needs to go back to its original base and strengthen both St Alban’s Church and the parish hall so it can continue to serve the community from its heart and home in Ngaio Street, for the next hundred years and more.
Detailed plans for strengthening the church and hall to meet acceptable safety standards have been drawn up, and fund-raising is under way. The parish is a registered charity (CC22188) and tax-deductible receipts will be issued for all donations.
Postponement by 1 day to 30 Nov if weather were to dictate and would be announced on this web site.

events.id: Plant Diversity & Human Impacts On Endangered Plants - Guided Walk-Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Plant Diversity & Human Impacts On Endangered Plants - Guided Walk
events.venue: Botanic Garden, 101 Glenmore St, Wellington
events.long_description:
In this easy 60-minute downhill walk we will obtain a perspective on plant biodiversity and human impacts on endangered species.

Species radiation in the Southern Hemisphere with New Zealand examples - Kōwhai, Hebe (Veronica) and Kauri.

Examples of rare and endangered species owing their situations directly to human activities. These plants include:

- Shrubby toroaro/mingimingi (Muehlenbeckia astonii),
- Three Kings kaikomako (Pennantia baylisiana),
- Bartlett's rātā (Metrosideros bartlettii)
- Three Kings vine/akapukaea (Tecomanthe speciosa).

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.

Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

events.id: Monthly Life Drawing-Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Monthly Life Drawing
events.venue: Te Pūkenga Whakaata The New Zealand Portrait , Shed 11, 60 Lady Elizabeth Lane, Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
Come along and have a go at portraiture with our koha life drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.

With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.

The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!

Interested in modeling? Contact us—we're always looking for sitters. Everyone is welcome to join!

Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

events.id: Stacking Rings - Ōtaki Beach-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Stacking Rings - Ōtaki Beach
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Create your very own ring stack from copper, brass and sterling silver in this fast, fun and highly rewarding workshop!

Guided by our experienced and supportive tutors, you’ll be introduced to the fundamental skills of jewellery-making while creating a small collection of rings to take home and treasure.

During this 3-hour class, you’ll learn how to measure your finger, cut metal to size, and add textures and patterns using hammers and punches. From there, you’ll be shown how to solder your rings together with a jeweller’s torch before finishing them with filing, sanding and polishing techniques. Along the way, our tutors will share tips and tricks, patiently guiding you so you feel confident every step of the way.

By the end of the session, you’ll have crafted two sterling silver rings and two copper or brass rings, and if time allows, you can make even more!

Each ring you make is completely your own, whether you keep them sleek and simple or experiment with texture and pattern. You’ll leave not only with a stylish, wearable ring stack, but also with the joy of having made something truly unique with your own hands.

This class is perfect for beginners, groups of friends, or visitors wanting a memorable creative experience. Many students find jewellery making a wonderfully mindful activity - slowing down, working with their hands and enjoying the calming rhythm of making.

Your class fee includes copper and brass for practice, sterling silver for two rings, plus all consumables such as solder, sandpaper and polishing materials. Extra silver and other metals are available for purchase in the studio if you’d like to expand your collection.

Children aged 12 and up are welcome, though anyone under 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again-12 Britannia Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again
events.venue: 12 Britannia Street, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our upcoming Echoes of Home invites audiences on a musical and storytelling journey that traces the emotional path of every migrant — from the laughter of childhood to the quiet ache of distance and the enduring warmth of return.
Through five evocative chapters of live music, dance, and performance, the show unfolds as a tapestry of memory and identity — celebrating resilience, cultural pride, and the beauty of belonging.
It begins with “Tuổi Thơ Bé Nhỏ” (Childhood Memories), a tender glimpse into early life in Vietnam, filled with playfulness and sunshine.
Then comes “Thời Học Sinh” (School Days), where friendship, curiosity, and the vibrant pulse of youth take centre stage.
“Trưởng Thành” (Adulthood) follows, echoing the courage to grow, dream, and chase life’s horizons.
The story deepens with “Xa Quê Lập Nghiệp” (Life Abroad) — a heartfelt portrait of those who leave home to build a new life, balancing hope and longing.
Finally, “Nhớ Nhung Tìm Về” (Longing and Return) closes the circle, where nostalgia meets gratitude and the heart finds its way home again.
Blending traditional Vietnamese melodies with modern artistry, Echoes of Home: Where We Begin Again is more than a performance — it is a bridge between generations, a celebration of roots, and an embrace of the shared human journey toward belonging.

events.id: Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio SOLD OUT!-8 Lookout Rd, Roseneath, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Harmonic Sound Journey at Space with Claudio SOLD OUT!
events.venue: 8 Lookout Rd, Roseneath, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We invite you to a special evening of Sacred Harmonic Sound with multi-instrumentalist Claudio Escutia. This immersive sound journey offers a deeply restorative experience that invites you to settle into stillness, reconnect with the heart, and explore a sense of inner spaciousness through vibration and tone.
Claudio skilfully layers the sounds of gongs, crystal and Tibetan singing bowls, Native American flutes, and other traditional instruments, enhanced through high-quality audio equipment so the sound can be both heard and felt throughout your body.
Harmonic sound and vibration offer the nervous system a chance to truly rest. In this state of relaxation, the thinking mind softens, and we find connection to citta — the heart-mind. From this place, silence arises naturally through the vehicle of sound.
This experience is open to everyone. No previous yoga or meditation practice is needed.
What to bring:
You are welcome to bring your own yoga mat, though studio mats are also available. We will provide bolsters, blankets, and eye pillows for your comfort.
Booking is essential — spaces are limited and this event often fills quickly.
About Claudio
Claudio is a multi-instrumentalist musician originally from Mexico City and now based in Wellington. Born into a family of musicians, he began playing music at a young age and later studied classical guitar. His journey led him to Montreal, where he explored jazz, world music, and spiritual sound traditions.
Extensive travels in Asia and Europe deepened his connection with Indian music and yogic philosophy. He studied Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu and Varanasi, and has since worked with a wide range of instruments including the sitar, esraj, bansuri, harmonium, flutes, gongs, and voice.
Claudio’s work blends technical skill, deep presence, and a profound respect for the healing power of sound.
Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud https://soundcloud.com/claudioescutiasounds
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/claudio_yoga_sound_healing
Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/soundhealingyogamusicclaudio

Let’s Planet makes jangly pop with a backbone and they have been doing it for 40 years. Formed by songwriter/guitarist Alan Galloway, with Nigel Clements and Helen Cairney, the group found its true direction when Caroline Easther (The Chills, The Verlaines, and now in The Warratahs) joined with her snap-tight drums and Murray Costello (The Mockers) came in on bass. Pagan Records released Favours, Loving Tongues and La Gloria, where Let’s Planet honed their chiming guitars, close vocal harmonies, melodic basslines, and catchy hooks. They have shared stages with R.E.M., Crowded House, Throwing Muses, The Proclaimers, Split Enz, and Paul Kelly. Reviewers have called their catalogue “thoughtful and polished, moving from breezy guitar numbers to moody indie-rock”, and their earlier material has been collected on Pearlers, a best-of compilation available on Bandcamp.
Alan and Caroline have kept on writing and performing. Now - only 27 years after their last studio album - Let’s Planet is back with a new record! Anything You Want picks up all the right threads again: textured songs, thoughtful arrangements, and the hooks that long-time fans expect and new listeners will be excited to discover.
The album release gig will start 7:30 pm 29 November in St Peter's Hall, Paekakariki ﻿with help from Tatiana Sogrina, and Nigel Mitchell from Orangefarm.
Let’s Planet are offering anything you want — and quite possibly something you didn’t know you needed.

events.long_description:
K A T E brings sultry soulful, ethereal blues.

Teamed up with some of Wellingtons greatest musicians, K A T E and her band have been known to bring an outerworldy experience to those who witness them live, leaving people feeling as though they are on a natural high.

Playing songs written by K A T E, that she truly believes she has channeled for the healing and expansion of not only her heart but all other hearts on this planet. Songs that deliver powerful messages and not only bring a presence to the room when played, but as the frequency of K A T E's voice radiates in and through the audience, people can't help but become engaged with their whole being.

A setlist of heartfelt music that you will also most definitely want to move your body to too.
Doors open 7pm for a 7.30pm start

events.id: Wellington Bluegrass Society presents: Forty Years In Harmony-Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Bluegrass Society presents: Forty Years In Harmony
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone, 38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Three friends Chris Priestley, Julian McKean and Angela Fox, who have been creating music for over forty years, come together to perform their first ever concert!

Julian McKean and Chris Priestley first met and played together in 1981 when they formed Acoustic Confusion with Denny Stanway and were later joined by Brendan Power. The four were guests at many NZ festivals including the 1983 National Folk festival in Wellington, and recorded the legendary LP Hazy Days in 1985.

After the group split up, they remained in contact and often performing and recording over the years. Chris recorded his first solo LP Argentina to Invercargill, during which he met Angela Fox and realised what a fabulous harmony singer she was. Angela also recorded two CDs of her fabulous songs. Julian continued to write great songs including Far Far Away which became a NZ folk classic. Angela and Julian individually helped Chris on most of the many LPs and CDs he recorded over the years. However Angela had never sung on any of Julians songs, likewise for Julian with Angela's songs.

"though the three of us have been playing together for more than fourty years, we have never done a concert together, so we’re looking forward to creating some magic at the bluegrass club"
- Chris Priestley
events.description:
Three friends Chris Priestley, Julian McKean and Angela Fox, who have been creating music for over forty years, come together to perform their first ever concert!
The four were guests at many NZ festivals including the 1983 National Folk festival in Wellington, and recorded the legendary LP Hazy Days in 1985.
Chris recorded his first solo LP Argentina to Invercargill, during which he met Angela Fox and realised what a fabulous harmony singer she was.
Angela also recorded two CDs of her fabulous songs.
Angela and Julian individually helped Chris on most of the many LPs and CDs he recorded over the years.

events.id: Wax Women-203 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wax Women
events.venue: 203 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
We’re back for round two at Nolita! After the energy and connection of our first all-female vinyl night, we’re spinning up another evening celebrating women behind the decks.
Join us for a night of warm rhythms, deep cuts, and pure analog sound, no sync buttons in sight, no USBs, just records. Expect everything from funk and disco to techno and eclectic breakbeat gems, handpicked and mixed live by an incredible lineup of wāhine DJs who know how to get the dancefloor banging.
Join us for one night of pure energy, skill, and sound, the way it was meant to be heard. This series is all about championing women in music, celebrating the craft of vinyl DJing, and creating a space where people can dance, connect, and enjoy the magic of sound played how is should be, straight from wax.
Robyn, the original host and heartbeat of the La Bella movement, brings her raw, instinctive selections to centre once more.
Odette aka Gimpgirl, a subversive selector and true audio provocateur, returns with her signature breaks, and attitude that challenged every lazy beat around her.
Kimba Jade, vinyl devotee and groove alchemist, has been lighting up dancefloors for over two decades. Founder of Divinyl in Auckland and a master of soulful basslines.
All vinyl. All night.
#womendjs #kiwiwomendjs #vinyldjs #vinylonly #breaks #house #techno #wellingtonnz #oldskool

events.id: CARBON/02-113 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CARBON/02
events.venue: 113 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
After the intense CARBON premiere at bSpace in 2024 we are excited to announce CARBON02.
CARBON02 is your journey to dawn through new rhythmic and hypnotic realms - Join us for an unforgettable night of intense, transportive, contemporary techno. The CARBON crew aim to give you a music-first night of the finest, freshest techno from around the globe - Each DJ bringing a powerhouse showcase of their personal definitions of the genre.
CARBON02 brings together a potent line-up of the finest techno DJS in New Zealand : a rare combination and a legendary night not to be repeated. We will be slowly raising the heat over the night, challenging you to delve deeper, dance harder and experience techno as it was intended.
Close your eyes, forget your name, forget the world, return to the source.
DJ Coda is the godfather of techno in New Zealand. With a career that spans decades, he isn’t just a DJ but a dedicated promoter and one of the trustees of NZ’s longest running student radio station, Radio Active.  DJ Coda is a master of his craft and never fails to deliver.

Ned Raw (formerly tjaden) a legend in the 90’s techno scene, delivers an intensity unmatched in Australasia. Decades of experience can be heard and felt in the sonic journeys he delivers.

CYXQRD is a producer and DJ, his music is played globally and represents the new-breed of New Zealand techno artists. Purveyor of deep, soulful techno that is felt as much as heard.

F.Huk guaranteed to deliver the freshest, grooviest techno
This is a free, limited ticket event (with koha entry on the night)
events.description:
After the intense CARBON premiere at bSpace in 2024 we are excited to announce CARBON02.
CARBON02 is your journey to dawn through new rhythmic and hypnotic realms - Join us for an unforgettable night of intense, transportive, contemporary techno.
DJ Coda is the godfather of techno in New Zealand.
Decades of experience can be heard and felt in the sonic journeys he delivers.
CYXQRD is a producer and DJ, his music is played globally and represents the new-breed of New Zealand techno artists.

events.long_description:
Lacuna brings back Fill The Void for one last dance of the year.
Lineup (A-Z):
Bontempo
Benny Balance
Cee
Fronta
Parry
After two unforgettable nights in 2025, Lacuna returns to Meow Nui one last time this year — closing the chapter with a signature night of deep, rolling, high-energy house.
This edition of Fill The Void brings together a stacked local bill representing the very heartbeat of Wellington’s underground.
Expect hypnotic grooves, late-night energy, and that undeniable Lacuna atmosphere — crafted for those who know and love the dancefloor.
No headliners. No hierarchy.
Just homegrown heat, community energy, and a night built on pure sound & connection.

See you there.

events.id: Manafunduro-Rangituhi / Colonial Knob,190 John Burke Dr, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Manafunduro
events.venue: Rangituhi / Colonial Knob,190 John Burke Dr, Aotea, Porirua 5024, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Manafunduro
SAVE THE DATE

Manafunduro
The third edition of the Manafunduro, brought to you by the Mana Cycle Group. Sponsored by and an epic prize pool from @FScycles and enabled by Porirua City Council


RACE COURSE - TBC
We are proud to release our Stage Runs for the Easy/Intermediate and Advanced/Hard categories. The stages are numbered for reference only and can be done in ANY order you like (or a few times if you wish!!) within the time constraints of 3.5hours.

Easy / Intermediate Course
TBC
Hard / Advanced Course
TBC

Videos of all of last years course have been made by the organising committee (Cheers Team!) and links to maps on trailforks are in the descriptions here on Youtube.

https://www.youtube.com/@ManaFunduro/videos

Easy - will be suitable for riders happy with G2-G3 level trails
Hard - Faster, harder G3 - G5

**NOTE** Wellington Enduro Series points will only be available for those racing in the Hard category only!

PRELIMINARY RACE TIMETABLE (TBC)
8:30 am - registration opens
9:00 am - volunteer briefing
9.45 am - Riders briefing (attendance compulsory)
10.00 am - Race start - all categories
1.15pm - Gates Close.
1.30 pm - race finish
2:00pm / 2.15pm ish - Podium


CATEGORIES (Male/Female/Gender Diverse for each category)

U10

U13

U16

U19

Open (19-29)

Masters 1 (30-39)

Masters 2 (40-49)

Masters 3 (50+)

E-Bike (no age groups)

WELLINGTON ENDURO SERIES POINTS

The Mana Enduro is part of the 2025 Wellington Enduro Series. Provided you're racing the Advanced Course, points from this race will contribute to your overall WES ranking.

ONLINE PRICES

Season tickets are available via our WEBSITE.

Trails Wellington/WMTBC Members – $35
PNP & MMBC Club Members – $35
General Entry – Non-member – $60
Under 13s – $25
The WMTBC has a reciprocal arrangement with the MMBC and PNP allowing discounted entry to this race if you are a member. Contact your club administration for the entry code.



If you aren't a Trails Wellington/WMTBC member already, CLICK HERE to join the Club and save on online registration.

Online registration closes Saturday November 29th at 9pm.

ON-THE-DAY PRICES

Member* – $60 cash

Non-member – $80 cash

*Valid memberships: Trails Wellington/WMTBC, PNP & MMBC.

If the event sells out in advance, there will be no on the day entries.

INCLEMENT WEATHER

In the event of conditions that pose an unnecessary risk to competitors, the organisers will make a decision whether or not to run the event on the day advertised, and best efforts will be made to notify registrants as early as possible.

Refunds & Cancellation Policy

In the event that you are no longer able to attend (and notify us by Friday the 29th by 9am) or the event is cancelled due to bad weather or unforeseen circumstances—we are unable to provide refunds, so instead we will credit your WMTBC account. You can use the credit to pay for future events, WMTBC membership or as a donation to Wellington trails.

Event terms & conditions

NOTE: If you are under 18 years of age, you need your parent or guardian to sign/agree on your behalf.

I agree to wear a NZ Safety Standards approved helmet for the duration of any runs down the tracks.

I accept the risks inherent in mountain biking and will not hold the event organisers or landowner liable for any damages.

I am personally responsible for ensuring my bike is securely on the shuttle transport (if part of this event) and will not hold the Wellington Mountain Bike Club Inc liable to any damage.

If you need to stop on a trail, pull to the side and ensure both you and your bike are well off the trail.

You may injure yourself or come across an injured rider, if it is serious, someone should remain stationary with the injured rider and then the next rider must notify a marshal as soon as possible.

I agree to abide by all rules set out by the Wellington Mountain bike Club Inc.

I agree to a fee of $100 in the event that the race timing token allocated to me is not returned to WMTBC at the end of the event.

Ebiker's are permitted to use one bike and one battery per entrant, smaller capacity batteries are allowed an extender.

If you aren't a Trails Wellington/WMTBC member already, CLICK HERE to join the Club and save on online registration.
In the event of conditions that pose an unnecessary risk to competitors, the organisers will make a decision whether or not to run the event on the day advertised, and best efforts will be made to notify registrants as early as possible.
I am personally responsible for ensuring my bike is securely on the shuttle transport (if part of this event) and will not hold the Wellington Mountain Bike Club Inc liable to any damage.
I agree to abide by all rules set out by the Wellington Mountain bike Club Inc.

Making A Statement Entertainment Presents:
Te Awahou Minifest 2025

Hosted by Dilz, the Te Awahou Minifest promises to deliver a day that will be remembered. This is an all ages event for locals and travelers, aimed to bring our people together through the connectivity of music and community.

Foxton Main Street outside Foxton Barber & Beauty
Sunday November 30th 2025
9:00am - 1:00pm

Free Food
Free Haircuts for Kids
Live DJ & Entertainment
Games & Activities
Prizes & Giveaways
Food Carts
Coffee
Ice Cream
Health Services
AND MORE!

Stay tuned to our Facebook event page for the announcements of our SPECIAL GUESTS, PERFORMERS AND GIVEAWAYS

The Making A Statement Podcast will be hosting a live and direct korero session welcoming involvement from our audience. This will be your opportunity to ask our hosts any questions you may have. For us this presents an opportunity to break the stigma around 'talking to strangers', showing the power of connectivity and communication.


A music video and the moments of the day will be captured by Beyond the Frame, filming the highlights and monumentalising the energy created at the latest addition to the annual events hosted here in the heart of Foxton.


Making A Statement Apparel will be sold at the event. To ensure your size/style is available you are welcome to preorder in advance and collect on the day!

Brought to you in support by:
Horowhenua District Council
Foxton Tourist and Development Association
Foxton New World
Foxton Karate Club
Foxton Barber & Beauty
Kair Design
More FM

We are still reaching out to our wider community for any support or participation enquiries. If you would like involvement in the event, please DM me or email .
Let's do something special Foxton - It takes a collective to make a statement.

events.long_description:
Foraged Flavours: Create a Wild Feast by the Sea
Join Wild Botanica for a relaxed and hands on afternoon of wild cooking and coastal living.

Foraged Flavours: Create a Wild Feast by the Sea takes place in a stunning beachside villa, where you’ll prepare and share a seasonal feast made from foraged and garden fresh ingredients. Together we’ll craft simple, beautiful dishes and edible gifts perfect for the festive season,all while enjoying ocean views, great company, and a touch of seaside magic.

After our meal, you’re welcome to unwind with a swim or soak in the hot tub as the sun sets over the sea.

A new Foraged Flavours experience: fresh menu, new setting, and a celebration of summer’s wild abundance.

When: Sunday 30th November, 2–7pm
Where: Beachside Villa, Raumati South, Kapiti Coast

Bookings: www.wildbotanica.co.nz

p.s. if you haven't already, please join me for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop on 23rd November to learn all about foraging for and identifying wild plants.

More info on the venue, we’ll be at the beach house: http://www.seascapes.co.nz/
