events.id: Happy & Willing Horse Clinic-299 Takarau Gorge Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Happy & Willing Horse Clinic
events.venue: 299 Takarau Gorge Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Does something in your partnership with your horse feel a little “off” right now?
Maybe your horse is still doing the things you ask, but the softness, willingness, or spark you used to feel together is missing.
Maybe you notice tension, hesitation, or subtle “no’s” where there used to be “yes.”
If you want to pay attention now; understand it, work with it, and strengthen your connection before the new year. Then this clinic is for you!
When & Where:
🗓 Sunday 30th November
📍 Ohariu Valley, Wellington
Rider Spots: 4 only (to ensure plenty of hands-on time and space for learning)
This isn’t your run-of-the-mill clinic. We explore why things are showing up in your horse’s behaviour by diving into:
Horse psychology and learning principles
Recognising stress before it escalates
Setting your horse up to be relaxed, soft, and willing
Each rider works with me in two separate 1:1 sessions; on the ground or under saddle, depending on what your horse needs.
Sessions aren’t based on what the rider wants to do, they’ll be guided by what your horse communicates.
If your goal is to simply ride, compete, or “get things done” without considering your horse’s comfort, this isn’t for you ❌
But if you want a partnership that is:
✅ Pleasant and stress-free for both horse and rider
✅ Builds trust and connection
✅ Leaves your horse genuinely happy to work with you
…then you’ll love this experience ♥️

Rider Spots
Include:
Two 1:1 sessions
Two theory sessions
Fully catered luxury lunch + drinks & nibbles to close the day
WhatsApp support for a month to integrate learnings at home
Want to learn but can't bring your horse, use one of ours
Spectator Spots include observation of sessions, theory, Q&A, plus lunch and closing drinks/nibbles.

Please note: The clinic will only run if enough riders sign up. Tickets will be fully refunded if the event is cancelled.
Extra: Want to make a weekend of it? Stay over Saturday and we can arrange a VIP experience ☺️
Have any questions or want to organise a VIP experience: email susan@equineeq.co.nz

If your goal is to simply ride, compete, or “get things done” without considering your horse’s comfort, this isn’t for you ❌ But if you want a partnership that is: ✅ Pleasant and stress-free for both horse and rider ✅ Builds trust and connection ✅ Leaves your horse genuinely happy to work with you …then you’ll love this experience ♥️ Rider Spots Include: Two 1:1 sessions Two theory sessions Fully catered luxury lunch + drinks & nibbles to close the day WhatsApp support for a month to integrate learnings at home Want to learn but can't bring your horse, use one of ours Spectator Spots include observation of sessions, theory, Q&A, plus lunch and closing drinks/nibbles.

events.id: Roxy Retro | Monty Python and the Holy Grail-5 Park Road, Miramar, New Zealand 6022,5 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Roxy Retro | Monty Python and the Holy Grail
events.venue: 5 Park Road, Miramar, New Zealand 6022,5 Park Rd, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Roxy Retro | Monty Python and the Holy Grail
50th Anniversary

A comedic send-up of the grim circumstances of the Middle Ages as told through the story of King Arthur and framed by a modern-day murder investigation. When the mythical king of the Britons leads his knights on a quest for the Holy Grail, they face a wide array of horrors, including a persistent Black Knight, a three-headed giant, a cadre of shrubbery-challenged knights, the perilous Castle Anthrax, a killer rabbit, a house of virgins, and a handful of rude Frenchmen.

events.id: Reiki Healing Training - Level One-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Reiki Healing Training - Level One
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall, Aorangi St, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
❤ Reiki has had an extremely powerful positive influence on my life, and on the lives of my clients and students, helping us all to heal and change mindset, physical and emotional conditions, and to see life in a new light.

Reiki helped with my recovery from Chronic Fatigue syndrome and Mental stress ❤ I will share this with you in this course and help you open your life to the positive transformation that Reiki can bring.

I am a Usui Reiki Master and Teacher with 27 years experience working consciously with energy and a growing number of happy students. I offer an accessible, supportive training experience which enables you to easily benefit from the natural healing experience.

This TWO DAY course offers 12 hours of in person training including attunement, a full manual, certificate of completion and ongoing support. Maximum of 7 participants to enable close support and interaction.

The Reiki Level 1 Course focuses on energy and how we use it, it involves being attuned to the Reiki energies and using them for self-practice. Reiki is a great tool if you want to feel centered in your life, it helps to balance and align our energy bodies, and can cause positive changes in many areas of our lives.

When you receive your Reiki First Degree attunement you become a channel and are able to bring through healing energies ongoingly for yourself and friends and family.
Reiki can be used to help heal a wide number of conditions and to initiate and support positive life changes. Further details on enquiry.

Dates are specially chosen to be auspicious for firstly bringing energy to a new focus and purpose and the second date holds energies conducive to alignment.

SUNDAY 30th November and SUNDAY 7th December, 10am-5pm

The week gap in between the two training days allows you to receive support as you experience the 'cleanse' and integration period after the Reiki attunement - also offered is a Zoom follow up group session three weeks after the attunement date (time TBC)

Venue: PARAPARAUMU Memorial Hall, New Zealand

Investment: $511 for full TWO day course, training, all support materials including manual, certificate, refreshments and ongoing support. Please bring food to contribute to lunch.

If you are interested in coming on this course, please contact me by email at bryony@heartsonghealing.life or fill in this form -

https://forms.gle/iTAqp1NokjTscZbR6

The investment for this course is $511 NZD.

FULL PAYMENT, $511 -https://buy.stripe.com/fZeeYJ7bE3cJakM011

DEPOSIT, $77 NZD - https://buy.stripe.com/4gw3g17bE00x64wg00

FOR A PAYMENT PLAN - PLEASE CONTACT ME bryony@heartsonghealing.life

Please do contact me if you have any questions at all - by DM or by email at bryony@heartsonghealing.life

events.id: Silver Ring Day - Christmas session!-65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Silver Ring Day - Christmas session!
events.venue: 65 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This great one-day class is ideal for beginners, but experienced students are also welcome. Have fun making your own ring or perhaps a wonderful present for a loved one! The workshop runs from 10am - 4pm with a lunch break.
Students will practice making simple textured or polished rings in either copper or brass, then move onto making one or more silver rings from start to finish. They will learn measuring, texturing, soldering and finishing techniques to make beautiful, wearable rings!
Students can choose from creating textured, stamped or polished rings in flat metal, or adding in stacking rings in wire and bar. More experienced students may wish to make a wider ring, or a series of rings, perhaps in a tapered form or including finer details and finishing, or possible stone setting. This is a one-day class aimed at either providing a fun experience with a great result, or excellent grounding in basic jewellery techniques for those wanting to pick up the activity.
Course fee includes practice materials and 8g sterling silver. Extra materials are available to purchase in the workshop if time allows. As this is only a one-day class we will be providing a set range of widths for your ring bands so as to make the project enjoyable and achievable.
Kids aged 12 and up (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
The workshop fee is $248, early bird $225 (till 2 November).

events.id: Special event - Herd Bathing (full)-Coast Road, Wainuiomata, Wellington-Facebook
events.name: Special event - Herd Bathing (full)
events.venue: Coast Road, Wainuiomata, Wellington
events.long_description:
A Sharing of my horse herd in a unique experience - enjoying being in amongst a gentle herd of horses and sharing the afternoon, just being together.
Join me for a peaceful experience of being among my 8 horses. Soaking up their special presence, enjoying the country sounds while having a moment away from our busy lives. A moment to slow everything down and connect with a horse in a very different way.
(No horse experience necessary. )
This is approx 1.5 hour event. After a safety briefing we will enter the herds space, down by the river. There will be seats available or you can bring your own.
$50 per person, max 8 people in one sitting.
You will be in amongst my herd of horses so wear appropriate clothing for the weather, and good footwear ie warm jackets and closed shoes/gumboots. Welcome to bring a blanket to keep warm. Will be postponed if weather isn’t suitable.
Looking forward to this

Message me to register

events.id: Bill Lake-Underworld Tavern, 13 Pirie Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bill Lake
events.venue: Underworld Tavern, 13 Pirie Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
“Gentle, sometimes witty and just as often moving reflections at every turn” – Graham Reid

Guitarist, singer and songwriter Bill Lake is a cornerstone of Aotearoa’s musical landscape. With a career spanning more than four decades, Bill has shaped the sound of New Zealand roots music—leading the iconic Windy City Strugglers, co-founding the pioneering rock outfit Mammal, and fronting the brassy, groove-laden Pelicans in the 80s.

A gifted storyteller with a wry lyrical touch, Bill’s songs have been covered by Midge Marsden, Darren Watson, Kokomo, Rag Poets and Marg Layton. His live performances are intimate, soulful affairs—equal parts reflection and revelation.

Bill is joined by longtime friend and Mammal bandmate Steve Hemmens, recently returned from the UK, whose supple bass lines bring warmth and swing. Rounding out the trio is multi-instrumentalist Alan Norman (The Warratahs, Rag Poets), adding colour and texture on accordion, percussion, guitar, and piano.

Together, they offer a rich, rootsy blend of blues, folk, and country music with heart, history, and a touch of Wellington grit.

events.id: Monthly Astro Meetup-Colombo Street &, Rintoul Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Monthly Astro Meetup
events.venue: Colombo Street &, Rintoul Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington's Monthly Astrology Meetup
A Monthly gathering for all Astrologers, enthusiasts, and the astro curious - All Welcome!
Featuring a new speaker/topic each month.
This month: Jayn Verkerk - Finding our Locations
We all have places that we vibe with, and those we don't. Which places in the world do you align with – for work, holiday or relocation?
For this session I will share techniques(using astro.com) that I've learnt in readings. Bring along your chart and we can map it onto the earth to locate your best places for travel or relocation, and generally share experiences of location and astrology.
Jayn Verkerk is a mostly modern astrologer. Self-taught, along with courses with Graham Ibell, she was active at the Wellington Astrology Centre. Jayn is a researcher with a PhD in critical digital humanities and creative practice.    
$10 entry fee, includes tea, snacks and presentation.
For more info, contact Erika at erikaegrant@gmail.com

events.id: Yin Yoga and Soundscape, with Kellie and Chelsea-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Yin Yoga and Soundscape, with Kellie and Chelsea
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join Kellie and Chelsea for a blissful afternoon of gentle yin yoga and sound.
Together, they have a unique passion for creating a container that allows you to deeply rest and nourish your whole self. Kellie and Chelsea's offerings are a sensory sanctuary. They allow participants the space to deeply rest and balance and reconnect with their nervous systems, using the power of yoga and sound. If you're looking to deeply nurture your inner landscape, this is the perfect invitation.
This collaborative offering is a two hour live soundscape, featuring a 60 minute yin yoga nidra and guided meditation.
Allow your body to unravel in gentle, guided somatic yin yoga movements, encouraging deep relaxation and release, all while you are enveloped in the bliss of soothing, gentle sound vibrations.
Together, Kellie and Chelsea have a beautiful collection of sound tools and instruments, including but not limited to:
Two full sets of crystal singing bowls
The handpan and its earthy, resonant tones
Angelic harp melodies
Soft and gentle wind chimes
The shruti box and acoustic guitar, coupled with voice activation and sacred mantra
Come as you are, all are welcome.
With love,
Chelsea and Kellie
XX
Please note: You will need a yoga mat, drink bottle, warm blanket, comfortable clothes and a pillow.

events.id: Hutt Valley Orchestra - Festival-St James Church, 71 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Hutt Valley Orchestra - Festival
events.venue: St James Church, 71 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Hutt Valley Orchestra's Christmas concert for 2025 features music by composers from the 18th to the 21st century.

With Brahms "Academic Festival Overture" and Saint-Saens "Finale" from Symphony no 3, all parts of the orchestra can be heard in this rousing music. The strings then play the first movement of Bach's Brandenburg Concerto no 3. Following a collection of variations by Nicola Kirkup of Mozart's Air from "The Marriageof Figaro", we move on to our Christmas pieces including Mozart's "Sleigh Ride", Coleridge Taylor's "Christmas Festival" and some Christmas Carols.


Conductor Mark Carter

events.id: Kim Churchill (Australia) LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekakariki-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kim Churchill (Australia) LIVE at St Peter's Village Hall | Paekakariki
events.venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.description:
Whether you’ve followed his journey from afar or are discovering his music for the first time, this tour is set to be a celebration of song and spirit from one of Australia’s most compelling live performers.
I have three now and each year I fly between them playing festivals and seeking the far corners of world and all the beautiful places I can play music I was lucky enough to become good friends with Billy Bragg from England early on and he taught me a lot about longevity and living as an artist for the long haul.
‘Window to the Sky’ was the most played song on triple J at that time and it went on to be 42 in the Hottest 100 and is Platinum in Australia, Gold in Canada and Germany .and has over 50 million streams!
I toured it around the world as an independent self managed artist.and sold over 12 thousand tickets and played 149 concerts Now I'm back in Australia in my camper van writing this from a small town on the Eyre Peninsula in South Australia.
I’m have a new album coming out October 11th and am.

events.id: Neurodivergent Speed Dating 20-35, 35-50-Hotel Bristol, 131 - 133 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Neurodivergent Speed Dating 20-35, 35-50
events.venue: Hotel Bristol, 131 - 133 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Looking to meet new friends to hang out with, or maybe find love in a comfortable, respectful environment? Join us for a speed dating event designed specifically for neurodivergent adults in Wellington!

This inclusive and sensory-considerate evening is all about meaningful conversations and low-pressure socializing. This event will be good for those with ASD, ADHD and/or anxiety. Whether you’re looking for friendship, romance, or just a fun evening out, this is your chance to connect at an event with your needs in mind.

Price includes a drink and delicious food at the break!

Accessibility and Comfort:
We’re committed to making this event as accessible and welcoming as possible. Sensory-friendly spaces, quiet zones, and fidget-friendly items will be available. There will also be conversation prompts on the table. Let us know any additional accommodations that will be helpful to you when registering and we will do our best to accommodate them.

Who Can Attend:
All genders and sexualities are welcome to come and mingle and meet others but the speed dating part of this evening will likely work best for heterosexual people. (This could change depending on numbers!)

If you are unwaged, please message info@speeddatingnz.co.nz for a discount code.

events.id: Shane & the Shazam Band Feat. Suzanne Lynch - Solid Gold Hitmakers-Club Carterton, Broadway, Carterton, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Shane & the Shazam Band Feat. Suzanne Lynch - Solid Gold Hitmakers
events.venue: Club Carterton, Broadway, Carterton, Carterton
events.long_description:
Introducing Shane & the ShaZam Band Featuring Suzanne Lynch

Singer Shane Hales MNZM, a Kiwi Musical legend, is an English immigrant who found fame as the lead singer of the raucous Pleazers in the mid-1960s, before he became one of the more enduring faces of that decade, remaining a household name to this day.

He has recently been awarded an MZZM (OBE) for his services to music in New Zealand in the Queen's Birthday Honours List 2017

Legendary Kiwi entertainer Shane is Famous for his TV appearances on C’mon 68 & 69, Happen Inn, & Freeride as well as his current long-running TV music series "Rockin’ the Planet with Shane" Face TV Sky 83.

His hit records include songs like Saint Paul, Heya, Natural Man and Lady Samantha.
Shane has released over a dozen albums and is still actively touring the country and playing to appreciative crowds. He personally hand-picked the members of his ShaZam Band from the cream of NZ’s musicians.

His song Saint Paul was a number 1 hit in the NZ charts for 7 weeks in 1969, and was also a top 10 hit in Germany..

Shane & The ShaZam Band perform a full tribute to all the big hits of the 60's and 70's, including Cliff Richard & The Shadows, The Rolling Stones, Beatles as well as many of the great rock & roll hits from the teen idols of that amazing era Elvis, Rick Nelson, Buddy Holly, & Dion, as well as Shane's own big hits Saint Paul ,Natural Man & Cuddly Toy. .

You are guaranteed a fantastic night of music & dancing from this legend of NZ music who definitely knows how to entertain a crowd..

Suzanne Lynch is a world renowned Vocalist who has worked with some of the greatest recording stars
Having established a name in New Zealand as the blonde member of the popular 60's duo "The Chicks" and then as a solo performer;

Suzanne studied vocal technique with the well known singing teacher from Covent Garden in England, who had recently moved out to New Zealand.. Hubert Milverton Carta for 3 years, before travelling to England in Jan 1973 and she quickly became one of London’s first call session singers singing on Albums by Chris De Burgh, Art Garfunkel, ShaWaddyWaddy, Cleo Lane The Walker Brothers and Cat Stevens to name just a few. She joined Cat Stevens band in 1974 and performed with him on two world tours and on all his recordings until he gave up his music and became Yusuf Islam. She had the pleasure of singing with him once again in Christchurch last year at his concert there as his special guest.

Whilst in England Suzanne also did a lot of work with Neil Sedaka, touring and recording a live album with him at The Royal Festival Hall with the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra in London. She toured with Charles Aznavour throughout England and Europe. She performed on many English television shows, including a Lulu Special, a series with Leo Sayer, and was a regular singer on the English television series, “Get it Together”.

Back in New Zealand in 2004 – 2007 Suzanne was the vocal coach for 3 seasons of New Zealand Idol, 2008 – 2009 vocal coach for Stars In Their Eyes., and was the vocal and performance coach for New Zealand’s Got Talent 2013 2014

events.id: Classical Tenor Saxophone & Piano Duo Recital "The Art of Time and Sound"-8 Fancourt Street, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Classical Tenor Saxophone & Piano Duo Recital "The Art of Time and Sound"
events.venue: 8 Fancourt Street, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Tomomi & Gabriela
Classical Tenor Saxophone & Piano Duo Recital
“The Art of Time and Sound”
Wellington: Karori Anglican Church – Sunday, 30 November, 4 pm
Saxophonist Tomomi Arita-Johnston and pianist Gabriela Glapska warmly invite you to The Art of Time and Sound— a concert that explores how saxophone music travels through the centuries, connecting emotion, colour, and imagination, with a special focus on the classical tenor saxophone.
The programme opens with Jean-Baptiste Singelée’s 4ᵉ Solo de Concert, showcasing the lyrical beauty and virtuosity of the classical tenor saxophone. J. S. Bach’s Sonata in E-flat Major (BWV 1031) follows, where Baroque grace meets the saxophone’s warm resonance. Camille Saint-Saëns’ Sonata Op.168 brings wit, charm, and elegance in a new tonal landscape.
The journey continues with Astor Piazzolla’s “Bordel 1900,” “Café 1930,” and “Night-club 1960,” tracing the sensual evolution of tango, and concludes with George Gershwin’s “Rhapsody in Blue,” a vibrant fusion of classical sophistication and jazz spirit featuring three saxophones.
(FYI: Auckland performance – Lewis Eady, Saturday, 6 December, 5 pm)

The programme opens with Jean-Baptiste Singelée’s 4ᵉ Solo de Concert, showcasing the lyrical beauty and virtuosity of the classical tenor saxophone.

events.id: Cushion Concert with Yury Gezentsvey-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cushion Concert with Yury Gezentsvey
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.long_description:
IAS Cushion Concerts presents local bands in the intimate environment of historic Inverlochy House. Join us as Principal Violinist, Yury Gezentsvey, performs some of Telemann's baroque Violin Fantasias for solo violin, as part of the opening celebration of Inverlochy’s Fundraiser exhibition.


Born in 1952 in Kiev, Ukraine (USSR at the time), Yury Gezentsvey graduated from the Gniessin Institute of Music in Moscow (1974). He emigrated to Chicago, USA (1979) where he was Concertmaster of the Chicago Civic Orchestra, before being engaged as Concertmaster of the Caracas Philharmonic Orchestra in Venezuela (1980), where he also formed a Chamber Ensemble with American pianist Harriet Serr (most acclaimed resident pianist in Venezuela, who also became his mother-in-law). Yury was appointed Principal First Violinist of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra (1985) and, together with his wife Desirée and their three daughters, he made his new home in Wellington.

Yury has become a valued member of the music world in New Zealand, having taken part in several International Festivals of the Arts in Wellington as a Chamber Music Violinist. As the leader of the Dominion Quartet, he recorded all 17 string quartets by Alfred Hill (NAXOS).

Since his retirement from the NZSO at the end of 2022, he has been enjoying playing with Orchestra Wellington, teaching, and treasuring family life with Desiree, their children and six Kiwi grandchildren.

Visit (violinart.co.nz) for more information about Yury.

He emigrated to Chicago, USA (1979) where he was Concertmaster of the Chicago Civic Orchestra, before being engaged as Concertmaster of the Caracas Philharmonic Orchestra in Venezuela (1980), where he also formed a Chamber Ensemble with American pianist Harriet Serr (most acclaimed resident pianist in Venezuela, who also became his mother-in-law).
Yury was appointed Principal First Violinist of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra (1985) and, together with his wife Desirée and their three daughters, he made his new home in Wellington.

events.id: NZTrio presents Hypnotique-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: NZTrio presents Hypnotique
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Described as a “national treasure” and “New Zealand’s most indispensable ensemble”, NZTrio He Taonga Wairere is renowned for its eclectic repertoire, outstanding talent and warm kiwi stage presence. Bringing together three incredibly accomplished artists, every NZTrio performance powerfully reaffirms the importance and cathartic nature of a live musical experience in today’s digital world.

Hypnotique presents a diverse array of works that challenges expectations of traditional chamber music. A whirlwind of motion typifies NZ composer Lyell Cresswell's virtuosic Moto Perpetuo, ahead of Fauré's Piano Trio in D minor with lyrical elegance and lush harmonic textures, contrasting with the percussive and electronic influences in Le Boeuf's jazz-adjacent Obliquely Wrecked. Australian composer Elena Kats-Chernin pays homage to Haydn, blending classical and contemporary styles in Calliope Dreaming, then finally, the full Romantic immersion of Schönberg's Verklärte Nacht is structured around the five stanzas of a poem; deeply transcendent and utterly beautiful.

The Programme (2 hours including 20min interval)

Lyell Cresswell (NZ) - Moto perpetuo
Gabriel Fauré - Piano Trio in D minor, Op. 120
Pascal Le Boeuf - Obliquely Wrecked
Elena Kats-Chernin - Calliope Dreaming
Arnold Schönberg - Verklärte Nacht arr. for piano trio

Companion tickets available

events.id: Cacao and Soundscape with Kellie and Chelsea-Te Horo, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Cacao and Soundscape with Kellie and Chelsea
events.venue: Te Horo, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This offering seeks to hold you in a space where you will be wrapped in warmth, and the healing alchemy of sound for two restorative hours. This will be an evening of inward reflection and deep nervous system nourishment, an opportunity to down regulate and tend to your inner world landscape.
The evening will begin with a cacao ritual and gently guided yoga nidra. Then guests will be cocooned in blankets, eye masks & bathed in sound alchemy for 90 uninterrupted minutes.
Chelsea and Kellie weave a story utilising an array of instruments in their collaborative offerings, as well as their love of voice activation and the power of mantra.
Over the course of this event, you will encounter the alchemic sounds of:
Two full sets of crystal singing bowls
The handpan and its earthy, resonant tones
Angelic harp melodies
Shamanic drumming
Soft and gentle wind chimes
Crystal pyramid and alchemy bowl with deep, ancient resonant frequencies
The shruti box and acoustic guitar, coupled with voice activation and sacred mantra
Previous attendees have described Kellie and Chelsea's soundscape journeys as unique, powerful, mesmerising and deeply soothing.

There is something so special about gathering with intention, to allow sound to move through you, to soften you, to bring you back home to yourself. We cannot wait to welcome you into the studio.

With all our love,
Chelsea & Kellie
Xx

events.id: Mehana at Meow - Echoes of Balkans-MEOW, Wellington, 9 Edward St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Mehana at Meow - Echoes of Balkans
events.venue: MEOW, Wellington, 9 Edward St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Once again at Meow — let Balkan music lift your spirits!

From north to south, east to west, the music of the Balkans dances through landscapes as diverse as the region itself: playful melodies from eastern Serbia, heartfelt ballads from Dalmatia, expressive and ornamented tunes from the north, the unexpected eastern flavours of Bosnian music, and the vibrant fusion of influences woven into the traditions of Northern Macedonia and Greece.

And of course, we’ll add our own songs to the mix — An unforgettable night — not to be missed!

events.id: Wairarapa Cinematheque presents RUN LOLA RUN (1998)-230 Queen Street, Masterton 5810, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wairarapa Cinematheque presents RUN LOLA RUN (1998)
events.venue: 230 Queen Street, Masterton 5810, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Welcome to the Wairarapa Cinematheque
Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.
Run Lola Run – One Night Only Screening | Wairarapa Cinematheque
Get ready for a high-octane cinematic thrill ride! Run Lola Run (1998) is a German cult classic that races through fate, love, and chance in a way you’ve never experienced. With its kinetic energy, unforgettable soundtrack, and inventive storytelling, this is a film best seen on the big screen.
📅 Date & Time: Sunday 30 November, 7:30pm
📍 Location: Regent 3 Cinemas, Masterton
Tickets:
If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night, you’re covered — just present your card at the door.
Single tickets are $15 each, available via Humanitix or cash sales at the door on movie night.
Join us at the Wairarapa Cinematheque for a one-night-only celebration of film, artistry, and community. Don’t miss this unforgettable cinematic experience!
Join us in celebrating film, artistry, and community in the Wairarapa.

If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night, you’re covered — just present your card at the door.

Join us at the Wairarapa Cinematheque for a one-night-only celebration of film, artistry, and community. Don’t miss this unforgettable cinematic experience!
events.description:

Run Lola Run (1998) is a German cult classic that races through fate, love, and chance in a way you’ve never experienced.
With its kinetic energy, unforgettable soundtrack, and inventive storytelling, this is a film best seen on the big screen.

events.name: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
events.venue: The Roxy Cinema, 5 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington
events.long_description:
Details
Directed by Terry Gilliam, Terry Jones
Starring Terry Gilliam, Eric Idle, Terry Jones, John Cleese, Michael Palin, Graham Chapman
50th Anniversary

--- A comedic send-up of the grim circumstances of the Middle Ages as told through the story of King Arthur and framed by a modern-day murder investigation. When the mythical king of the Britons leads his knights on a quest for the Holy Grail, they face a wide array of horrors, including a persistent Black Knight, a three-headed giant, a cadre of shrubbery-challenged knights, the perilous Castle Anthrax, a killer rabbit, a house of virgins, and a handful of rude Frenchmen. ---

events.id: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself-5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Rangatiratanga for Life - Becoming the CEO of Yourself
events.venue: 5 Main Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The day is designed to stretch and grow you! In the whakatauākī of Tā Apirana Ngata (Ngāti Porou), E tipu, e rea, he exhorts us to 'grow and flourish'. Grow and flourish! More than survive, get by, do ok. Flourish! This day will explore ways to fully engage with the beautiful moemoeā this whakatauākī speaks to.
E Tipu, E Rea
E tipu e rea mō ngā rā o tō ao
Ko tō ringa ki ngā rākau a te Pākehā
Hei ora mō te tinana
Ko tō ngākau ki ngā taonga a ō tīpuna Māori
Hei tikitiki mō tō māhunga
Ko tō wairua ki tō atua, nāna nei ngā mea katoa
Grow and branch forth for the days destined to you
Your hands to the tools of the Pākehā for the welfare of your body
Your heart to the treasures of your ancestors as adornments for your brow
Your spirit to God, who made all things
— Sir Apirana Ngata

You may like to think about how the day can help you align your professional work-based objectives (often expressed as KPI’s) with your personal vision, mission and goals.
The aims of the Course are to:
1. To host a mana ake wānanga exploring your unique future;
2. To bring together a group of people interested in creating rangatiratanga in their lives;
3. To draw from mātauranga Māori to support participants to create a 12-month personal strategic plan (drawing on moemoeā, pūrakau and pūtake);
4. To facilitate learning using Māori learning and teaching styles;
5. To connect people to the power of lifelong learning; and,
6. To add to the network of dedicated, Treaty based nation builders who have the goal of 'Becoming a CEO' on their radar for themselves or someone they know, whether that be at the personal, whānau, hapῡ, iwi or organisational level.
Our programme is interactive and delivered through a range of teaching / learning techniques which also include: facilitation; small group discussion; critical analysis; reflection; and, reporting back.

events.id: The Smarter Ways to Win Clients For Your Wellington Health Biz In 2026-The Angus Hotel,5 Cornwall Street, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: The Smarter Ways to Win Clients For Your Wellington Health Biz In 2026
events.venue: The Angus Hotel,5 Cornwall Street, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Smarter Ways to Win Clients For Your Wellington Health Biz In 2026
Grow your Wellington health business and attract fresh new clients ahead of 2026 by leveraging the latest website tools, tricks and tactics…

About this Event





Join Us at This Year's LIVE marketing Workshop And Get The Latest Website Tactics, Tools & Tricks to Grow Your Wellington Health Practice Heading Into 2026...

Help us celebrate The Wellness Directory’s 16th year anniversary and learn the smarter ways to win clients from your website... without any confusing web jargon and 'tech-aches'!


Did you know our average attention span sits at a whopping 8 seconds right now - one less than that of a goldfish? 🫧🐠
...If you're struggling to keep your website visitors engaged and generate regular, reliable client bookings then this workshop could be divine timing for your health business. If promoting your services across socials feels like a constant uphill battle and a drain on your time, energy and vibrational then this 16th year workshop is definitely for you!
At this interactive workshop, we’ll be revealing the same methods that other NZ businesses currently pay digital agencies thousands of dollars to learn and access.
These are little known and highly effective tactics and tools that will help your practice stand out in an increasingly noisy and competitive web space, ahead of 2026.




After attending this one-off Wellington workshop you will be able to;


✅ Generate regular client enquiries with by using THE one effective engagement tool for keeping web visitors on your website. They will be excited and curious to learn more about you and the services you provide.
✅ Finally discover what your prospects actually do on your website; where they mouse over your page, how far they scroll down and which pages they spend the most amount of time checking out your health biz.
✅ Find out why almost every health business is set up to fail in Google and how you can leverage their regular updates (13 times per day on average!) to rank your website higher than your friendly competitors, and make 2026 your best client year yet...
✅ And lots more including how to make a lasting first impression online, the highest ranking sites to have your health business listed on for free, etc..,

We’re once again excited to level the playing field and empower your health business with these higher level tactics, website tools and actionable tips that anyone can use, whatever the current level of your tech skills.
Come along to our 16th Year birthday workshop and find out how to consistently boost your website traffic, engagement and client bookings over the coming weeks.

*Your workshop ticket gives you access to;
The latest website tactics, tools and tricks for Wellington health professionals
Comprehensive workshop booklet to customise the content for your own business
Morning tea and coffee
FREE parking
PLUS...
🎁 $500 of Celebratory Gifts with The Wellness Directory... just for attending!

*Limited seats are available and this event always fills fast.

Reserve your HALF-PRICE EARLYBIRD SEAT on this page while tickets are still available and avoid missing out later!





💬 What Other Kiwi Health Professionals Say About This Workshop


I wasn't sure whether to come to this event or not today however I'm very glad I did!
-Stephanie Hills Counselling

Great tricks for re-posting content with my own contact details on it and advice around creating lots of our own content. It's given me a kickstart into actually creating posts and putting myself out there on social media more. I would definitely recommend this to other health professionals.
Jonathan's expertise has helped me to understand what is likely to get me the best results now - together with some useful hints on how to up my hit rate on google searches and I've already noticed a lift in my hit rate!
-Deborah Williams (Tides of Change)

I’m glad the focus was not only on social media. I appreciated other ways to engage such as live chat and how to maximise my business on Google. Simple and cost effective tips for a small business owner.
Also appreciated knowing the top sites my business should be listed on and that my info must be consistent across listings. This was good value and time well spent. The material was relevant for my business and aligned with my needs.
-Lisa Bojarski (Four Leaves Nutritional Psychology)


**Our 10x Workshop Ticket Guarantee**
Having run over 30 marketing workshops for health businesses since 2009, we're highly confident that this event will transform the way you think about your current online presence and inspire you to attain far greater results heading into 2026.
If for any reason whatsoever, this experience isn't one of the most valuable and insightful marketing events you've attended in the past 10 years, we'll refund your ticket so that you can enjoy the material, refreshments and workshop booklet on us... no questions asked!

Thank you so much for the workshop. It's the best investment I've made in my business promotion in a long time!
Really appreciated your feedback on my current promo material - increased my confidence in what I am doing and also pointed me where to make a few small 'tweaks'. So helpful!!
The workshop was interesting, well paced and above all practical and usable. Thank you so much.
So glad I went and really look forward to using your help to maximise my web presence. I am busy recommending you and The Wellness Directory to all my colleagues!
-Jasmine Sampson (Business with Soul)

We had a presentation made to us by the business directory, Gopher, which was useful although I found your event to be much more helpful in terms of how to promote myself and health business info on the web.
-Nina Holman (Holistic Healing NZ)

Promoting myself and my business over the years has been more of a necessity rather than something I enjoyed doing.
The advice I received in the workshop has been extremely valuable. I feel more skilled in writing about my work and services in a way that appeals to potential clients.
-Ingrid Bryant (Supreme Health)

events.long_description:
Explore Healing For Self - Monthly Event
Tania loves creating & holding sacred space for people & in this monthly event she will be creating a space where you can focus on your own healing journey in a group environment. In each session you will be guided through clearing, releasing, healing & remembering processes to help & assist you. We will explore different tools, processes & modalities each time to experience the highest possible energetic shift that is possible at that time.

Each month will have a different focus & flavour with the intention of working on yourself in a safe held space.
Over the next 4 sessions we will explore:

The 12 Chakra system, tools to use to help clear & heal the chakras and then enjoy a beautiful energy healing with the Archangels that are connected to each of the chakras.

Angelic Reiki - Receive an Angelic Cleansing, releasing old karmic connections with Archangel Michael, followed by a group healing with the angels wanting to connect with you.

Full Sensory Perception tools through Pleiadian Lightwork - an explanation on how the tools may feel & work & being in those energies & frequencies to receive the clearing & healing that is possible.

Access Bars - How ‘running the bars’ can help, some key points to use for stress or healing, running clearing statements to release old beliefs & patterns. What else is possible & how does it get any better than this.

There is a lot to explore & embrace and there may be additional processes brought in as Tania is guided or as time allows.

First Tuesday of the month 10am-12pm $30


Tania is a gifted intuitive and holistic practitioner, known for her grounded presence and loving guidance. She is an Angelic Reiki Master Teacher, Pleiadian Lightwork Practitioner & Teacher, conscious channeler, and Access Bars Practitioner. With a rich background in intuitive and energy work, she brings a nurturing and empowering energy to both group workshops and one-on-one sessions.

Bookings are essential. Email Tania:

For more details Text/Phone Tania : 021 030 6507

events.id: Beehive to Business with Hon. Todd McClay-Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower, Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Beehive to Business with Hon. Todd McClay
events.venue: Wellington Chamber Of Commerce,NTT Tower, Level 13, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Todd McClay
Wellington Chamber of Commerce & Allen + Clarke present our Beehive to Business with Hon. Todd McClay

About this Event

Join us on Tuesday 2nd December for a very special, final Beehive to Business event of the year, with Hon Todd McClay, Minister of Agriculture, Forestry, Trade & Investment and Associate Minister of Foreign Affairs.

In a year full of global geopolitical shocks, tariffs and increasing complexity for exporters – there is no Minister better positioned to deliver the insights and direction your business needs to know than Minister McClay.

Minister McClay is at the forefront of some of the most pressing issues for New Zealand’s economic position, be it new trade deals, the pressure facing our exporters or increasing Foreign Direct Investment through new agency InvestNZ.

If your business is chasing exports, or new capital from overseas – this final Beehive to Business is not one to be missed.

This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.

Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes

Can't make it? to register for the free livestream. Sign up and watch at a time convenient to you.

It’s time for the Sustainable Business Network Wellington community to get together for our final coffee catch-up of 2025! 
This is an SBN investor-only event.
Join us to celebrate the start of summer, share your sustainability stories from 2025, and look ahead to 2026. 
You’ll have the chance to shout-out about what’s been happening in your organisation, we’ll provide an update on the latest at SBN. That will include reflections from the Next Fest and Sustainable Business Awards. 
As always, this will be a great opportunity to meet other organisations in the network and form new connections in a welcoming and informal setting.
Our December event will be hosted by RNZ.
Not a SBN Impact Investor (member) and want to know about joining the network? Please email us at investor@sustainable.org.nz.

events.id: Botanical Insights talk - Ancient plants-Treehouse Visitor Centre, 101 Glenmore St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Botanical Insights talk - Ancient plants
events.venue: Treehouse Visitor Centre, 101 Glenmore St, Wellington
events.long_description:
This talk, which partners a major pictorial display at the Tree House, starts with a look at landscapes preceding the rise of trees. It then focuses on the Silurian, Devonian and Carboniferous geological periods, characterised by the appearance of the likes of scale trees, seed ferns and calamites.….and the swamp forests that gave rise to the production of coal. Then it advances to the Permian period, including Gondwana prior to its eventual breakup, and the beautiful, strange, gymnosperm Glossopteris that was widespread in the ancient southern continents, embracing what is now New Zealand/Aotearoa. Finally, it progresses to the world of ‘living fossils’ such as ginkgo and the even more primitive horsetails. Attention will be drawn to some of the animals that populated this ancient world.

Located in the Treehouse Seminar Room, Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā.
Free of charge. You’re welcome to bring along your own ‘brown bag’ lunch to enjoy during the talk.

The speaker is Reg Harris, a volunteer guide [botany] at Wellington Botanic Garden.
Reg delivers botany lectures for diverse audiences, delving into plant interactions, adaptive radiation, tropisms, and more. As a dedicated volunteer guide at Wellington Botanic Garden (WBG), he pioneered collaborations between WBG and Victoria University, organising annual field labs for biology students.
events.description:
It then focuses on the Silurian, Devonian and Carboniferous geological periods, characterised by the appearance of the likes of scale trees, seed ferns and calamites.….and the swamp forests that gave rise to the production of coal.

The speaker is a familiar face, Brad Olsen, who is the Chief Executive and principal economist at Infometrics,  a nationally recognised economic intelligence and forecasting services.
We look forward to welcoming him back to Horowhenua for his latest economic update for the district and his insights into how the economy is doing as we head into 2026.

As an economist, Brad is passionate about using data and insights to drive solutions and outcomes that will benefit people, by understanding what is happening locally, and where there are emerging opportunities. He also brings this passion to his community, where creating meaningful change for people is the goal to strive towards. Brads particular skills lie in economics, community engagement, and governance, “the numbers, the people, and the boardroom. events.id: Fifty Years of New Zealand International Review-55 Lambton Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Fifty Years of New Zealand International Review
events.venue: 55 Lambton Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This event commemorates 50 years of publication of New Zealand International Review, the NZIIA flagship publication for fostering discussion and understanding of international affairs as they relate to New Zealand. It also acknowledges the immense contribution of Ian McGibbon, who steps down as the Editor of New Zealand International Review after 44 years.
Join us to hear reflections from Ian on his four-plus decades in the role, a presentation by previous editor and historian Malcolm McKinnon on the evolution of New Zealand’s relations with the outside world and other speakers to be confirmed.
The event is followed by a food and drink reception.
Entry is on a 'pay what you like' basis to help cover the costs of the reception.

The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: 5 Days Figure Sculpting Workshop With Model-Avalon Studios, 41 Percy Cameron Street, Avalon, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: 5 Days Figure Sculpting Workshop With Model
events.venue: Avalon Studios, 41 Percy Cameron Street, Avalon, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Working with a live model offers artists an invaluable opportunity to engage directly with the human form. The immediacy of the model’s presence encourages close observation and instinctive decision-making, leading to work that is expressive and real. This hands-on interaction brings a sense of movement and authenticity that’s hard to achieve otherwise.

The sculpting process typically starts by analyzing the model’s proportions and pose. A wire armature is built to support the structure, and clay is gradually applied to develop the form to a one-third life size, 750mm tall figure. From there, the artist refines the shapes focusing on anatomical accuracy and expressive detail that give the sculpture its final character.

Please visit the website to know more about the event.

With nearly 30 years of experience in traditional sculpture and the film industry, Javier is not just a sculptor — he’s a mentor. Trained in classical techniques, he studied fine arts and took anatomy courses at medical school, developing a rare combination of artistic and anatomical knowledge. He spent over five years at the world-renowned Weta Workshop, contributing to major films and exhibitions, and has worked across materials, scales, and digital technologies.

Material is included in the price.

Armature is supplied during the workshop.

You can buy our tools during the workshop if you like.

Tea, Coffee & snacks will be available.

We do share meals during the workshop.

Refunds are subjected to Terms & conditions

events.id: Amanda Bunting and Kris Zuelicke, Solos and Duets for Piano-St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Amanda Bunting and Kris Zuelicke, Solos and Duets for Piano
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.long_description:
Leo Smit - Divertimento

Ginastera - Danzas Argentinas, Op. 2 - Danza del viejo boyero and Danza de la moza donosa

Ravel - Sonatine, M. 40, Modéré and Mouvement de Menuet

Schubert - "Lebensstürme," Allegro in A minor, D 947

Amanda Bunting, piano

Amanda Bunting is a graduate of the New Zealand School of Music, completing her Bachelor of Music with Honours in 2019 in solo piano performance with Dr. Jian Liu; small group ensemble with members of the NZSQ, and performance and embodiment studies with Dr. Hamish Robb and Dr. Margaret Medlyn. Prior to that, she completed a Graduate Diploma in Music in performance piano, performance studies, and pedagogy.

After previously studying with Gillian Bibby at the Conservatorium of Music and graduating in 1996, Amanda chose to return to study, with the guidance of Rosemary Bromley, to further develop performance skills and to gain further knowledge that can inspire and be shared with her piano students. Amanda is an Associate of the Institute of Registered Music Teachers New Zealand and a member of the Wellington Branch. She has an established private piano teaching studio, teaches piano at St Mark’s Church School, and also works as a Human Resources Adviser at Victoria University of Wellington.


Kris Zuelicke, piano

Kris Zuelicke grew up in a theatrical and musical family and began performing from age 5. During school years, she accompanied and sang in choirs and performed in community and Miami University Theatre productions, including on piano, cello and harpsichord. After earning undergraduate degrees in music, linguistics and German in the United States from Miami University and a master's in music theory with a cognate in music education from Indiana University, she taught music along with other subjects at Montessori schools in Bloomington, Indiana and in Landau, Germany. While living in Germany, Kris also enjoyed teaching at the Karlsruhe Teachers College, including developing courses that utilised the arts to teach English.

In New Zealand, Kris obtained a doctorate in harpsichord from the New Zealand School of Music, studying with Douglas Mews and Erin Helyard, and won scholarships to study with Mark Kroll in Boston. She currently teaches in schools around Wellington, while maintaining a private studio for piano and cello lessons, along with accompanying university exams at the NZSM. Kris enjoys playing chamber music with friends, and has performed with the Renaissance Singers, Manawatu Sinfonia, the Queen’s Closet and Stroma, along with a fun stint as a harpsichordist extra in the recently released Time Bandits.

events.id: Site Visit - BRANZ Fire Lab Tour-1222 Moonshine Road, Judgeford 5381, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Site Visit - BRANZ Fire Lab Tour
events.venue: 1222 Moonshine Road, Judgeford 5381, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for an exclusive NAWIC members-only site visit to BRANZ’s brand-new, world-leading Fire Laboratory—Aotearoa’s only facility capable of testing multi-storey buildings in realistic fire scenarios.
You’ll learn about BRANZ - who they are and what they do - and explore parts of a purpose-built 2,300 m² laboratory - including the fire lab, structure lab, and the materials lab.
The lab was officially unveiled in June this year, and will be fully operational by the end of 2025. It places New Zealand at the forefront of fire safety science, enabling full-scale fire testing previously unavailable in Australasia.
This is a rare opportunity to see where cutting-edge fire testing meets practical building safety solutions. Ideal for engineers, architects, building professionals, policymakers, or anyone interested in the science behind fire resilience.
Huge thanks to BRANZ for offering us this opportunity!
Event Details
Date: Wednesday, 3 December 2025
Time: 1:30 PM – 3:30 PM
Location: BRANZ Fire Laboratory, 1222 Moonshine Road, RD1, Porirua (parking available on site)
Capacity and Cost: FREE, with a maximum of 20 attendees (NAWIC Members Only)
PPE Requirements: Hi-vis vest, closed-toe shoes, and safety glasses

Join us for an exclusive behind-the-scenes tour of BRANZ’s brand-new Fire Laboratory in Porirua. Explore cutting-edge fire testing facilities and see how world-class research is shaping safer buildings.
 Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

events.id: Randell Cottage writers-in-residence 2025 — Part of Randell Cottage writer-in-residence series-Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Facebook
events.name: Randell Cottage writers-in-residence 2025 — Part of Randell Cottage writer-in-residence series
events.venue: Cellar-Cafe, Molesworth St, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join author Saraid de Silva for an evening of conversation, readings, and video reflections from past Randell Cottage writers-in-residence, including Titaua Peu and Hinemoana Baker.
Join us at the Library or online. Register to receive a Zoom link: https://dia-nz.zoom.us/.../WN_p6_8lW8vSyOLAnFYTHhOgw...
A conversation with author Saraid de Silva
This year’s Randell Cottage writers-in-residence are Titaua Peu (French writer-in-resident) and Saraid de Silva (New Zealand writer-in-resident).
Join Saraid de Silva in conversation with Randell Cottage trustee Francis Cooke. Saraid will also read from her new novel, which promises to be very different from her first and acclaimed book Amma. But how different will it be from Amma’s stories that follow three generations of South Asian women? Saraid says her Untitled Second Novel is a revenge thriller about two best friends in a stolen car, crossing the country to crash a New Year’s Eve party.
Video reflections from former writers in residence
Following the conversation, French Cultural Counsellor, François Bockel, will present the latest in the series of short videos of writers-in-residence reflecting on their experience at Randell Cottage. Titaua Peu was the French writer-in-residence earlier this year, and New Zealander Hinemoana Baker was the 2024 New Zealand writer-in-residence.
The videos form part of Randell Cottage’s recorded oral history, designed to capture the essence of those writers and their interests while undertaking their fellowships.
RSVP to let us know you are coming
Light refreshments will be provided so RSVP before 1 December to info@randellcottage.co.nz.
Randell Cottage writer’s residency
Wellington’s historic Randell Cottage has been a writers’ residency for New Zealand and French writers since 2001. The Randell Cottage Writers Trust is supported by the New Zealand-France Friendship Fund/Arts Foundation of New Zealand, and the Wellington City Council. It works in close partnership with the Embassy of France.
About the speakers
Saraid de Silva is a Sri Lankan Pākehā writer and arts worker based in Tāmaki Makaurau. She was the co-creator and co-host of Radio New Zealand’s podcast and video series Conversations with My Immigrant Parents and has recently worked as a storyliner, script writer, and script editor on New Zealand television shows. Her first novel, Amma, was released in New Zealand and Australia by Hachette New Zealand in March 2024 and in the UK by Weatherglass Books in April 2024. It was long-listed for the Jann Medlicott Acorn Prize for Literature in the Ockham Awards and the UK Women’s Prize for Fiction.
Titaua Peu is a Tahitian novelist who stayed in Randell Cottage during the first half of 2025 as the French writer-in-residence. She is working on a new series of books that present a near future marked by a reverse migration, one in which inhabitants of Aotearoa have migrated north to the island of Mangareva in French Polynesia following a great war. The first laureate from French Polynesia, Titaua is considered one of the principal French-speaking voices in the literature of the Pacific, with her writings focusing on Polynesian society, the impact of colonialism and the place of women.
events.description:
Join author Saraid de Silva for an evening of conversation, readings, and video reflections from past Randell Cottage writers-in-residence, including Titaua Peu and Hinemoana Baker.
Register to receive a Zoom link: https://dia-nz.zoom.us/.../WN_p6_8lW8vSyOLAnFYTHhOgw... A conversation with author Saraid de Silva This year’s Randell Cottage writers-in-residence are Titaua Peu (French writer-in-resident) and Saraid de Silva (New Zealand writer-in-resident).
Saraid will also read from her new novel, which promises to be very different from her first and acclaimed book Amma.
Randell Cottage writer’s residency Wellington’s historic Randell Cottage has been a writers’ residency for New Zealand and French writers since 2001.
Her first novel, Amma, was released in New Zealand and Australia by Hachette New Zealand in March 2024 and in the UK by Weatherglass Books in April 2024.

events.id: Freedom and Responsibility in Science - WELLINGTON-11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Freedom and Responsibility in Science - WELLINGTON
events.venue: 11 Turnbull Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join the Royal Society Te Apārangi for a wide-ranging panel discussion about the many threats to the integrity of science around the world, how they can be addressed, and New Zealand’s place in the global context. The panel will feature expert guest speakers from the International Science Council’s (ISC) Committee for Freedom and Responsibility in Science.
Science today faces many challenges: Scientific and academic freedoms are declining worldwide as anti-science ideology becomes imbedded in many of the world’s governments; state obligations towards enabling science as a human right remain chronically ignored; irresponsible scientific conduct and governance of all kinds increasingly undermine science from within; and the tally of wars and crises which rob the world of the scientific talent held by entire nations is growing year by year.
At precisely the moment when scientific progress on some of the existential threats to humanity is most urgent, science itself is under more pressure than perhaps ever before. So, what can we do?
About the ISC Committee for Freedom and Responsibility in Science:
The Committee monitors trends related to scientific and academic freedom globally, advises the ISC on official statements and positions, and advocates for the Principles of Freedom and Responsibility in Science. The Committee also engages in major projects at the intersection of science, human rights, and philosophy, such as the ISC’s recent interpretation of The Right to Participate in and Benefit from Science.
Event details:
5:40pm - Doors open
6:00pm - Panel discussion
7:15pm - Networking with drinks and canapés till 8:15pm

events.id: Draw It Out - Fertility NZ national online workshop-Online - link provided on booking-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Fertility NZ national online workshop
events.venue: Online - link provided on booking
events.long_description:
A bespoke Draw It Out workshop for Fertility NZ, open to all genders.
Tickets: $34.50pp
Theme: Strengthen self-care for the holiday season
Strengthen your inner resources to care for yourself over the holiday season, and meet others going through similar experiences through this online national workshop, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.

FertilityNZ exists to support New Zealanders experiencing fertility problems, whether facing challenges becoming or staying pregnant. This bespoke workshop shares drawing for wellness, to tap into your inner guidance for support, within a safe space where others may be experiencing similar journeys.
Included in your workshop
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
What you will need
As this is an online workshop, you will need a computer in a comfortable, quiet setting. A hard surface to draw on (like a desk or a board), three to five pages of A3 paper (you can also tape two A4 printing papers together), and any colouring tools of your choice. Crayons are great as they are more child-like so you don't worry about how it looks. Coloured pastels or pencils are also good, or any coloured markers. The key is a range of colours.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.
Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.description:

Bruno Groening (1906-1959) brought a simple message: there is a higher power that is the basis of all living things and it can heal.
He showed how this energy can be absorbed freely into the body, and through his teaching many people were cured back then as today, even from diseases that are considered incurable.
These success reports have been proven and documented within the Medical Scientific Group – a world-wide forum of independent medical doctors, psychologists and health care professionals within the Bruno Groening Circle of Friends.
Our Information Lecture is open to all interested people.

events.id: 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model-41 Percy Cameron Street-All Events In
events.name: 5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
events.venue: 41 Percy Cameron Street
events.long_description:
5 days Figure Sculpting workshop with model
The immediacy of the model’s presence encourages close observation and instinctive decision-making leading to work that is expressive and real. This hands-on interaction brings a sense of movement and authenticity that’s hard to achieve otherwise.

The sculpting process typically starts by analyzing the model’s proportions and pose. A wire armature is built to support the structure and clay is gradually applied to develop the form to a one-third life size 750mm tall figure. From there the artist refines the shapes focusing on anatomical accuracy and expressive detail that give the sculpture its final character.

With nearly 30 years of experience in traditional sculpture and the film industry Javier is not just a sculptor — he’s a mentor. Trained in classical techniques he studied fine arts and took anatomy courses at medical school developing a rare combination of artistic and anatomical knowledge. He spent over five years at the world-renowned Weta Workshop contributing to major films and exhibitions and has worked across materials scales and digital technologies.

Material is included in the price.
Armature is supplied during the workshop.
You can buy our tools during the workshop if you like.
Tea

Also check out other Workshops in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt, Fine Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Come Together — Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together — Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For decades, New Zealand and Australia have sung along to each other’s songs. We’ve traded bands and tunes across the Tasman. The team of famous Kiwi musicians at Come Together are now putting it all to the test. Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025 packs the biggest hits from both sides of the ditch onto one stage. Some of New Zealand’s most iconic rock musicians will tear through these legendary antipodean tracks in an all-out rock fest. You can decide who truly owns rock. Is it the swagger of Aussie pub rock or the grit and heart of Kiwi anthems? Perhaps it’s both. 
Get ready to hear the biggest tunes from AC/DC, Split Enz, Cold Chisel, The Datsuns, INXS, DD Smash, Silverchair, Australian Crawl, and Hello Sailor. That’s just for starters, so the showdown is set to be epic. Here’s the kicker — you help shape the setlist, and when the amps power down, you vote for which nation takes home the crown. 
This is more than a concert — it’s a massive celebration of the music we grew up to, the songs that built us, and the riffs that still get us moving. Grab your mates, grab your tickets, and get ready to make some noise.

Open Mic night @ G16 Upper Hutt
📣 Come along to a brand new open mic night at Garage 16 media in Upper Hutt.

Bring your originals, covers, instruments, voice, even your poems!

This is an opportunity to try something new, collaborate or refine what you’re already working on.

Grand piano, drums, keyboard, guitars and microphones are available to use.

Doors open from 5pm and Open mics begins at 6pm.

Bring yourself, friends and family, it will be warm and cosy inside 🔥

ABOUT G16
G16 (Garage Media 16) is Upper Hutt’s newest performing arts centre for musicians, creatives and artists. Aaron (owner) has opened this space for current and emerging artists to come along, perform, jam and connect.

Performance slots are 15 minutes long.
To book your slot visit the booking page here: https://dth.kiwi/dthopenmic.html

*Open mic slots are an open, friendly and supportive space to practice, experiments and gain experience and feedback through a fun and low pressure environment. These nights are for musicians of any age and ability 🎶

events.id: Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions-Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions
events.venue: Westpac Building,Level 10, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions
Westpac Smarts: Local innovation to global ambitions with the Village Goldsmith

About this Event

Join Westpac and the Wellington Chamber of Commerce for the final Westpac Smarts session of the year, featuring a local innovation story that is reshaping a global industry and offering real-world insights for local businesses with global ambitions.

Christine Douglas and Chris Benham from The Village Goldsmith will share the journey behind Floeting®, a world-first diamond setting technology developed in Wellington that’s a step away from traditional claws and clasps, allowing the diamond to appear to float.

Hear how this bold idea evolved into an inspiring story of global innovation, forged a landmark partnership with Tiffany & Co., and scaled to more than 50 countries - all while keeping design and IP anchored in Wellington.

Floeting® has captured the attention of the world’s luxury sector, with the Financial Times calling it “gravity defying” and Vogue France saying the diamond appears “freed from all metal, shining as if suspended above the jewel.” Their achievements have been recognised nationally, with Chris Benham named the winner of the EY Entrepreneur Of The Year™ 2025 New Zealand Product Category, alongside The Village Goldsmith receiving top honours at the NZ Hi-Tech Awards.

This is a relaxed, inspiring session for business leaders to sit back, connect, and reflect on how bold ideas backed by smart strategy can transform established industries.

Event details:
12:00pm - Networking
12:15pm – Presentation
1:15pm – Wrap-up

Chamber members and Westpac customers: Free entry
Non-members: $5.00 donated to Life Flight Trust through the Westpac Chopper Appeal

events.id: A Place of Firsts-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: A Place of Firsts
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Globally, citizens assemblies are widely used as an effective way to involve local people in deciding how to address complex issues such as climate change. Despite the repeated failure of standard policy processes, citizens assemblies have only recently made it to New Zealand. Register for this event to find out more about the Porirua Assembly on Climate and its innovations. 
Porirua is known for community-led innovations in governance and delivery, and the Porirua Assembly on Climate continued this tradition by being:
the first climate assembly in New Zealand,  
the first assembly co-designed and organised by an iwi authority and a community group, 
the first assembly process designed to honour Te Tiriti o Waitangi by using a tricameral design,  
the first New Zealand assembly to include children and young people, and 
by creating a new local governance body - the Porirua Community Leaders Forum - that sponsored the Assembly, holds its recommendations and can instigate ongoing community dialogue on local issues. 
Panellists will share learning on the Porirua Assembly’s innovations, talk about why the standard citizens assembly model was modified, dig into what enabled so many firsts and how these worked out in practice. They will reflect on this legacy and possible future impacts. Might these democratic innovations strengthen local democracy elsewhere in Aotearoa New Zealand? 
About the Host and Speakers
Jodi Watene is a Systems Change Lead at Te Rūnanga o Toa Rangatira Incorporated, was the project manager for the Porirua Assembly and is helping to establish a New Zealand Community of Practice on Indigenous Citizens’ Assemblies.
Makerita Makapelu is a Team Leader for Wesley Community Action in Porirua with a background in performing arts and youth work. She specialises in community-led development and grassroots systems change, and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators.  
Cally O'Neill was a participatory designer of community spaces until 2019 when she shifted her focus towards advocating for Te Tiriti-based deliberative democracy to address the climate and other contemporary crises. She is a founding member of Te Reo O Ngā Tāngata/The People Speak and was one of the Porirua Assembly facilitators. 
Future Unity, a youth climate group formed during the Assembly process will be represented by Orini Rokx-Taratu and Santino Morehu, who were participants in the Assembly’s youth and community streams.  
Emily Beausoleil is an Associate Professor at Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington. Her research as a political theorist centres on the dynamics, conditions and challenges of democratic engagement in diverse societies. She is conducting an independent evaluation of the Porirua Assembly process.

They will reflect on this legacy and possible future impacts.

events.id: KinoFest goes Wellington - Cologne 75-Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: KinoFest goes Wellington - Cologne 75
events.venue: Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
KinoFest goes Wellington!
After a successful run in Auckland, the Goethe-Institut New Zealand is bringing KinoFest to Wellington with two special film screenings.

On 4 December 2025, we present Cologne '75 — the remarkable story of Vera Brandes, the 17-year-old concert promoter behind one of the most legendary jazz recordings of all time: Keith Jarrett’s Köln Concert. This captivating documentary dives into the chaos, charm, and cultural impact of a night that changed music history.

The screening begins at 6:45 PM, but we invite you to join us from 6:00 PM for snacks and drinks in the foyer.

Cologne 75: Family, 2025, 110 minutes
German with English subtitles
Age rating: Recommended for ages 16 and up

events.id: Terra Soma Yoga-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Terra Soma Yoga
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
You are welcomed to a gentle, invitational yoga experience.

Terra-soma yoga (translating to earth-body) weaves together hatha yoga, somatic inquiry, and nature connection, inviting you into awareness of your inner terrain. This approach encourages you to meet yourself as you are — to listen to the intelligence of your body's own rhythms and sense how they echo the wider rhythms of the earth. Through this listening, we enter a living, evolving conversation about well-being and what it can look like in today’s world.

How is your heart? We often hear “follow your heart” or “listen to your heart,” but what does that actually mean? In this class, you’ll be invited into heart somatic enquiry - locating this intelligent organ, listening into this space, and perhaps allowing it to lead, inform, or express through movement.

The structure of this hour-long class includes:

A gentle lead-in towards the heart

A mixture of supine, seated, and standing asana

Repeated sequences with encouragement to make them your own — add or subtract asana, move in your own time, with your own breath

Optional free movement explorations

This is an invitational practice — everything is a choice, not a must. Tailor the practice to suit yourself. Come as you are; everyone and all of you is welcome.

Your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, making this an evening of movement, heartful awareness, and wholesome connection.

Meet Abbie, your facilitator,
Abbie is a 200-hour certified yoga teacher who trained with Awakening Arts: School of Yoga and Eco Somatic. She deeply values the insight, liberation, inner and collective resources somatic movement practices can offer. Abbie has also completed a 50-hour training exploring how yoga can support trauma awareness, mental health, and body image. She thrives in and intends to create spaces where each person’s pace is honored and the body’s innate wisdom is encouraged to emerge and lead.
