events.id: The Power of Awareness: the Energies That Shape Us-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Power of Awareness: the Energies That Shape Us
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
You've probably noticed that there are particular patterns and energies that we meet over and over again in our life until we finally understand that we need to make some internal shifts in order to change our external reality.

We may continuously run into the same situations being frustrated with what happens to us - not noticing that we're actually meant to learn something and change our own doings.

In this seminar we will uncover some energetic principles that govern human beings and discuss psychological and energetic tools which we can practically apply in our lives - to change our internal and external reality to live a little happier and fulfilled lives.

Your ticket includes an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert too

Meet Gopi, your host

Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity and overcome challenges on their path through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

In this seminar we will uncover some energetic principles that govern human beings and discuss psychological and energetic tools which we can practically apply in our lives - to change our internal and external reality to live a little happier and fulfilled lives.
Your ticket includes an amazing plant-based dinner & dessert too Meet Gopi, your host Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity and overcome challenges on their path through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry.
During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology.

events.id: Conservation Kōrero: Under The Mistletoe-ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Conservation Kōrero: Under The Mistletoe
events.venue: ZEALANDIA Eco-Sanctuary, Waiapu Road, Karori, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join us this December for a kōrero exploring the complex lives of native mistletoes in Aotearoa.

Leading mistletoe expert and hands-on conservation practitioner, Trevor Thompson, will share insights into the ecology of these beautiful yet elusive plants, how he is propagating them, and the challenges they face across our landscapes.

From habitat loss to seed dispersal and browsing impacts, learn what is threatening the survival of these special plants and what’s being done to protect them. Come along to deepen your understanding, ask questions, and discover how we can help ensure these special species remain part of our ngahere for generations to come.

This event will be held in the Pāteke Room in the Visitor Centre with light refreshments provided. Doors open at 6.15pm, parking is available at both our Visitor Centre and overflow parking area on Birdwood Street.

events.id: Gordon H Brown Lecture: Dr Maia Nuku-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gordon H Brown Lecture: Dr Maia Nuku
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us to hear Dr Maia Nuku (Ngāi Tai) deliver the annual Gordon H Brown Lecture, hosted in collaboration with Victoria University and the Adam Art Gallery. Nuku is the Evelyn A. J. Hall and John A. Friede Curator for Oceanic Art at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York City.
What is the role and relevancy of museums in the 21st century? Are they living, expansive archives of Indigenous knowledge? Or outdated relics of colonial pasts.
The complete overhaul and construction of new galleries for the Arts of Oceania at The Metropolitan Museum in New York gave curator Maia Nuku a unique opportunity to reframe the galleries conceptually; to emphasize connectivity in the context of global and local histories; and elevate the equally critical arts of storytelling, oratory, and performance alongside Oceania’s dynamic visual arts. Curator Maia Nuku shares insights into the 10-year project that has culminated in a suite of galleries that offer international visitors perspectives on art that reach deep into Oceania’s past while also acknowledging ongoing manifestations of its agency in the present.
Born in London of English and Māori (Ngai Tai) descent, Dr. Maia Nuku is Curator for the Arts of Oceania at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. She completed two post-doctoral fellowships at the University of Cambridge (2008-2014) as part of an international research team exploring Oceanic art collections in European museums in France, Spain, the Netherlands and Russia. Researching the collections alongside Pacific artists and practitioners, the work was collaborative and sought to create access to these collections both in the physical and digital domains. During her time at the Met, Maia has evolved a curatorial approach that centers indigenous Pacific perspectives, grounding the presentation of visual arts in the unique conceptual and cosmological connections that make art from Oceania so compelling. In 2023, her exhibition The Shape of Time: Art and Ancestors of Oceania travelled to Museum of Art in Pudong, Shanghai (June 1 - Aug 20, 2023) and National Museum of Qatar (Oct 23, 2023 - Jan 15, 2024).  For the past eight years, Maia has overseen a major reinstallation of the Oceania galleries at the Metropolitan Museum which showcases the creativity of indigenous Pacific artists from the 18th century to the present through the compelling lenses of global history, indigenous storytelling, and Pacific oratory and performance.

events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This is one of THE best bands in Wellington.
Driving grooves, classy funk, outstanding musicians. That’s what you get from King Oyster.
The band is Oscar Laven on sax, Blain Fitzpatick on bass, Matthew Fitpatrick on guitar, and Jacob Randall on drums. One look at those names, and you know you are in for some remarkable playing.
A surrealist funk/fusion outfit blending shreddy guitar, sax, bass, and drums into a kaleidoscope of grooves. Their music spins between aggressive funk, jazz fusion, and playful originals, drawing influence from Jaco Pastorius, John Scofield, Primus, Billy Cobham, and George Benson.
This is the first time that King Oyster has played for Capital Blues so come and see why we were so keen to get them.

events.id: Jamie Pye Quintet-The Rogue & Vagabond-Rogue & Vagabond
events.name: Jamie Pye Quintet
events.venue: The Rogue & Vagabond
events.long_description:
Jamie Pye is a London-based jazz guitarist and composer with roots in both Australia and New Zealand. He performs in various line ups and contexts; from intimate duo residencies, to headline performances as a bandleader showcasing his original music. He is often part of house bands for jam sessions around town, or as a sideman on other projects.

In 2023, Jamie completed a 10-date national tour around Aotearoa, including appearances at the Creative Jazz Club in Auckland and Hanover Hall in Dunedin. In between shows, Jamie recorded his debut album ‘Monochrome’, released in November 2024 on Good Twin Records.

As a composer, Jamie draws influence from all music and art forms, paying particular attention to the work of composers and bandleaders Brian Blade, Kendrick Scott, Petros Klampanis and Aaron Parks. Jamie composes music with the intention of honest storytelling and narrative;
creating compositions that are as complex as they are harmonically-rich, while still remaining musically accessible to all ears.

“Guitarist Jamie Pye is establishing himself as a new and dynamic artist coming out of the New Zealand contemporary jazz scene. Displaying a strong compositional voice, he's delivered an exciting debut album and I'm looking forward to seeing his artistry progress into the future”.
-Myele Manzana, Artist, Drummer, Composer

For this Pōneke show, Jamie will be joined by Louisa WIlliamson (Tenor Saxophone), Ayrton Foote (Piano), Seth Boy (Bass) & Hikurangi Schaverien-Kaa (drums)

events.id: Come Together - End of Year Big Bash-The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Come Together - End of Year Big Bash
events.venue: The Opera House, 111 - 113 Manners Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
One stage. Two nations. One unforgettable night of rock.

This December, the Come Together Big Bash 2025 will ignite New Zealand stages with the ultimate Kiwi vs Oz rock showdown. For one massive night in each city, a supergroup of Aotearoa’s best rock musicians will unleash the biggest hits from both sides of the Tasman in an all-out end-of-year rock fest.

Expect wall-to-wall anthems from AC/DC, Split Enz, Cold Chisel, DD Smash, INXS, Silverchair, Hello Sailor and more – the songs that have defined generations, blasted stereos, and packed stadiums.
Joining forces for this epic battle are:

- Jennie Skulander (Devilskin)
- Milan Borich (PLUTO)
- EJ Barnes (Jimmy Barnes)
- Seamus Johnson (Seamouse)
…plus more to be announced.

They’ll be backed by the powerhouse Come Together Band: musical director Jol Mulholland, alongside Brett Adams, Matthias Jordan, Mike Hall, and Alistair Deverick.

For decades, Kiwis and Aussies have traded bands, stages, and stadium tours. Now, it’s time to settle the score the only way that matters — with a night of unrelenting, unapologetic rock.

And the audience isn’t just along for the ride — you’re part of the action. Fans can help shape the setlist by voting for the songs they want to hear in the Kiwi vs Oz showdown.

Head to www.libertystage.com/ct25poll to cast your vote before October 10th.

This is the ultimate end-of-year blowout — a chance to scream, sweat, and celebrate with some of New Zealand’s greatest musicians performing the biggest rock hits of all time.

So, who truly owns rock?

Is it the swagger of Aussie pub rock, or the grit and heart of Kiwi anthems? You decide.

The Come Together Big Bash 2025 caps off an epic year for the juggernaut series, which has already seen thousands of fans pack venues for Neil Young’s Live Rust, Pink Floyd’s Dark Side of the Moon and, next month, the hotly anticipated Led Zep II.

Born five years ago in the isolation of a world turned upside down, Come Together began as a bold celebration of legendary rock albums. It has since grown into one of New Zealand’s most electrifying live concert experiences. With a powerhouse collective of the country’s finest musicians, the series has drawn more than 50,000 fans nationwide and earned critical acclaim, cementing its place as a must-see on the music calendar.

events.id: Draw It Out - Parents of neurodivergent children block course-level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Draw It Out - Parents of neurodivergent children block course
events.venue: level 2/105 High Street, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A unique space to support those who are supporting others.

Theme: For parents of neurodivergent children
Care for yourself so you can care for others, by processing emotions using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
Parenting can often feel isolating yet many are going through similar journeys. This 4-session block course is a safe space for parents of neurodivergent children to draw out their feelings, draw out their inner guidance, and draw on each other.

Dates
This block course consists of 4 workshops:
6.30pm-8.00pm
Thursday 13 November – Re-finding yourself
Thursday 20 November – Caring for your needs
Thursday 27 November - Self-compassion
Thursday 4 December – Seeing potential

Cost
$184 total ($46 per session)

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

events.id: BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity-115 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,115 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, New Zealand 6011,115 Taranaki St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity
📅 DAY 1 — Friday, December 5 (Evening)

• Formal opening
• An evening on Palestinian resistance and solidarity, with Justice 4 Palestine, Falastin Tea Collective and many more, with speeches, poetry readings, kai, and music from Nam Chucks, Amira and Welmie

📅 DAY 2 — Saturday, December 6 (11am–12pm)

• Panel discussion: Solidarity with uprisings in the Global South, chaired by Richa Sharma and joined by 4 panellists
• Journaling workshop with Nadine Hura
• Collective bamboo wind chime making workshop with visual artist Jieying Cai, with support from Asian Arts Aotearoa
• Book Launch: "Our Climate Glossary" from Borneo to Aotearoa New Zealand
• An evening of poetry and other words, MCed by Nadia Solomon, featuring Khadro Mohamed, Cam McCausland-Taylor, Ahinata Kaitai-Mullane, Tarns Hood, Joshua Toumu’a and others

📅 DAY 3 — Sunday, December 7 (10am–5pm)

• Kai and Kupu from India, Nepal and Gaza — a screening of writers from Nepal, India and Gaza reading their work
• Children's reading event with Ar-Em Bañas
• Matike Mai — Constitutional transformation wānanga

💸 HOW BOOKS ARE PRICED

The bookstore will operate on a transparent ‘pay-what-you-can’ model to ensure accessibility as well as the sustainability of the project.

BOOK FESTIVAL: Songs of Solidarity 📅 DAY 1 — Friday, December 5 (Evening) • Formal opening • An evening on Palestinian resistance and solidarity, with Justice 4 Palestine, Falastin Tea Collective and many more, with speeches, poetry readings, kai, and music from Nam Chucks, Amira and Welmie 📅 DAY 2 — Saturday, December 6 (11am–12pm) • Panel discussion: Solidarity with uprisings in the Global South, chaired by Richa Sharma and joined by 4 panellists • Journaling workshop with Nadine Hura • Collective bamboo wind chime making workshop with visual artist Jieying Cai, with support from Asian Arts Aotearoa • Book Launch: "Our Climate Glossary" from Borneo to Aotearoa New Zealand • An evening of poetry and other words, MCed by Nadia Solomon, featuring Khadro Mohamed, Cam McCausland-Taylor, Ahinata Kaitai-Mullane, Tarns Hood, Joshua Toumu’a and others 📅 DAY 3 — Sunday, December 7 (10am–5pm) • Kai and Kupu from India, Nepal and Gaza — a screening of writers from Nepal, India and Gaza reading their work • Children's reading event with Ar-Em Bañas • Matike Mai — Constitutional transformation wānanga
The bookstore will operate on a transparent ‘pay-what-you-can’ model to ensure accessibility as well as the sustainability of the project.

events.id: 🎶 Concert, Wine & Food Pairing and Fundraiser @ Urlar 🎶-Urlar Vineyard East Taratahi,1497 Te Whiti Rd, Gladstone 5884, New Zealand, Gladstone-All Events In
events.name: 🎶 Concert, Wine & Food Pairing and Fundraiser @ Urlar 🎶
events.venue: Urlar Vineyard East Taratahi,1497 Te Whiti Rd, Gladstone 5884, New Zealand, Gladstone
events.long_description:
🎶 Concert, Wine & Food Pairing and Fundraiser @ Urlar 🎶
🎶 The Songbirds at Urlar Winery 🎶

Join us at Urlar Winery, Gladstone, for a fantastic evening of music, wine, and food in the majestic barrel room!

✨ Songs
Enjoy a mix of festive favourites, contemporary waiata, and popular choral arrangements performed by The Songbirds.

🍷 Evening Details
Please arrive at 6:00 p.m. to enjoy your first wine and food pairing before the concert begins at 6:30 p.m.
Parking is limited — please ride share if possible.

🎟️ Tickets
$55 per person
Available via or from any Songbirds member. Tickets are limited to 80pax. Price includes 4 sample wine and food pairings.
Last year’s concert sold out — book early to avoid missing out!

💖 Supporting a Great Cause
All proceeds will go to the Ruel Foundation NZ, which funds cleft palate operations for orphaned children in the Philippines — a cause close to our hearts.

🎁 Extras
Bring cash for the fundraising raffle! Urlar will also be offering special wine case deals.

⚠️ R18 event – due to liquor license rules.

Don’t miss this lovely evening of music, food, and wine at Urlar Winery! 🌟

Tickets are limited to 80pax.

events.id: Slinky Physics Workshop - Wellington-249 Taranaki Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Slinky Physics Workshop - Wellington
events.venue: 249 Taranaki Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
This one-day workshop experimentally investigates the physics of the slinky spring using past IYPT problems.
It is for both students and teachers, attending as a school group or individually.  
The workshop will reinforce the waves, mechanics and practical achievement standards of NCEA and their equivalent across other examinations. It will be especially useful for
Current year 12 students who plan to participate in the 2026 NZ Tournament or try for the NZ Representative team going to Zurich in July
Teachers new to the New Zealand Young Physicists' Tournament who want to support students through the Tournament in 2026
This is a full day workshop, between 9am and 4pm. We are providing lunch and refreshments in the breaks, plus a goodie bag for every student. We will also have workbooks for all participants including a teacher's version. 
You should bring a water bottle and your phone to film some of your experiments, sometimes in slow motion. A laptop may also be useful for sides to present your work, but it is not essential as whiteboards are available. All experimental equipment will be provided.
The cost is $135 for a school group of up to four people, or $40 for individual teachers and students. Both prices are inclusive of GST.

events.id: SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt-The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
events.venue: The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THE SECOND AND FINAL WELLINGTON REGION SHOW IN '25!

Tickets on sale NOW! Don't miss out...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.
events.description:
SOLD OUT SECOND SHOW!
Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.
Tickets on sale NOW!
Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry.
Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop.

events.id: Friday Laughs with Rhys Mathewson and Brendon Green-The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Friday Laughs with Rhys Mathewson and Brendon Green
events.venue: The Fringe Bar,30 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Friday Laughs with Rhys Mathewson and Brendon Green
Friday Laughs brings some of the best comedy talent NZ has to offer to the Fringe Bar

With Rhys Mathewson
Rhys Mathewson is a stand up comedian and reporter who has won pretty much every award New Zealand comedy has to offer. He currently serves as the roving reporter on Seven Sharp. Rhys has performed all over the world, including a packed out Spark Arena supporting Jack Whitehall.
Winner 2024 Directors Award at the NZ International Comedy Festavil
Winner 2016 Fred Dagg Award for best show at the NZ International Comedy Festival
Winner 2010 Billy T James Award
“One of New Zealand’s best comedians’” – stuff
“world class joke writing” – the speakeasy

And Brendon Green
Brendon Green brings a warm and friendly energy to every room he's in.

Combining hilarious jokes, world class storytelling, and an authentic emotional honesty, he is a treat for every kind of comedy fan. A great MC and a favourite feature act, he has honed his comedy skills on stages all over the world.

2023 Fred Award Nominee
2018 Best Storytelling Show Winner
2014 Billy T Award Nominee
Writer for 7 Days, Taskmaster NZ, Have You Been Paying Attention, Paddy Gower Has Issues, and many more.

"one of the strongest story-telling comics in New Zealand" - Ruminator
"He uses words and wordplay skilfully… and has a sweet wit about him" Stuff.co.nz

More acts to be announced!

Brought to you with support from Pub Charities Ltd

• Journaling workshop with Nadine Hura
• Collective bamboo wind chime making workshop with visual artist Jieying Cai, with support from Asian Arts Aotearoa
• Book Launch: "Our Climate Glossary" from Borneo to Aotearoa New Zealand
• An evening of poetry and other words, MCed by Nadia Solomon, featuring Khadro Mohamed, Cam McCausland-Taylor, Ahinata Kaitai-Mullane, Tarns Hood, Joshua Toumu’a and others
DAY 3 — Sunday, December 7 (10am–5pm)
• Kai and Kupu from India, Nepal and Gaza — a screening of writers from Nepal, India and Gaza reading their work
• Children's reading event with Ar-Em Bañas
• Matike Mai — Constitutional transformation wānanga
HOW BOOKS ARE PRICED
The bookstore will operate on a transparent ‘pay-what-you-can’ model to ensure accessibility as well as the sustainability of the project.

events.id: Clubhouse Sessions-93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Clubhouse Sessions
events.venue: 93 Mornington Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Get ready for an evening of groove and good times at the legendary Vogelmorn Bowling Clubhouse — a cosy community gem with vintage charm and a dance floor full of heart.
Join Marcos Alonso and Max Maxwell, two long-time collaborators known for their infectious energy and genre-blurring sets. Expect funky rhythms, cheeky basslines, and a joyful crowd ready to move.
Good people, great sound, and that unmistakable Vogelmorn vibe — this is your Friday night sorted.
Accessibility & Venue Info
Please note that Vogelmorn Upstairs is not wheelchair accessible, though there is an accessible bathroom available on site. The venue is all ages, but anyone under 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm.
The Vogelmorn Precinct is a cherished community space within a residential area — so please be kind, look out for others, and help us keep the good vibes going by leaving quietly after the show.
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked & Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm for pre-show drinks and kai. To book a table, email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com.
Follow Vogelmorn on Facebook: facebook.com/vogelmornnz￼

events.id: Chant du Saxophone-St Michael's Anglican Church, 81 Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Chant du Saxophone
events.venue: St Michael's Anglican Church, 81 Upland Rd, Kelburn, Wellington
events.long_description:
Enjoy the lush and mysterious sounds of French music performed by an exciting yet subtle chamber duo.
This concert explores a diverse range of repertoire from household names such as Claude Debussy to lesser known composers such as Paul Bonneau and Paule Maurice. Hear the many moods timbres of the saxophone, from delicately soaring melodies, to dark, enchanting arias and joyful, raucous moments.

Programme:
Francis Poulenc - Flute Sonata FP164
Eugene Bozza - Aria
Claude Debussy - Petite Suite (transcribed by Yukio Nakano)
Paul Bonneau - Caprice en Frome de Valse
Paule Maurice - Tableaux de Provence

About the performers:
Alex Trask is a saxophonist based in Pōneke. He has a keen interest in the classical saxophone and has studied with some of New Zealand's leading player such as Simon Brew and Reuben Chin. He is a member of the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and has performed with many other significant organizations such as Gallery Orchestra, Saxcess, Wellington Youth Orchestra, and Wellington City Symphonic Band.

Alex is also an accomplished jazz player, and has organized many events both in Wellington and nationally, performing in the Wellington Jazz Festival and the National Jazz Festival many times. Alex was the lead alto saxophone player in the Rodger Fox Big Band from 2024-2025 and has performed as a guest with that band since 2022. His debut album 'Pool of Tears’, which blends folk and classical melodies with jazz performance techniques, was released on Thelonious Records in 2023 and has been featured on RNZ Concert as well as other prominent radio stations.
-
David Codd is a New Zealand-born horn player and pianist. Originally from New Plymouth, New Zealand, David undertook a Bachelor of Music in Classical Performance—Collaborative Piano under Dr Jian Liu at Victoria University of Wellington, as well as secondary studies in French horn with Samuel Jacobs and Sebastian Dunn.

David maintains a busy schedule of performances as a horn player, pianist, and conductor. As well as being a member of the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band horn section, David performs with the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, Auckland Philharmonia, and the Dunedin Symphony Orchestra.

As a pianist, David has a particular passion for collaborative work, enjoying performing with artists from NZSO and Orchestra Wellington, as well as orchestral keyboard for NZSO and the NZSO National Youth Orchestra.

events.id: The Man Whose Mother Was A Pirate - The Musical-Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Man Whose Mother Was A Pirate - The Musical
events.venue: Hannah Playhouse, 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Man Whose Mother was a Pirate – The Musical is a brand-new musical theatre voyage, with songs and sea-shanties crafted by Te Whanganui-a-tara’s own Nino Raphael. Inspired by Margaret Mahy’s much-loved children’s tale and authorised by the author’s estate, this rollicking production breathes new wind and adventure into one of Aotearoa’s favourite stories.

“I would fight off crews of pirates to watch it again.” -Regional News

Landing at the Hannah Playhouse this December, the production marks the debut season of this high-spirited show right here in Wellington. Sure to have the young and young-at-heart singing along, The Man Whose Mother was a Pirate – The Musical promises swashbuckling fun wrapped up with a heartfelt message.

Tickets go on sale this September - don’t miss out on a seat upon the maiden voyage of this sure-fire hit!

“A perfect treat for kids who want an evening of joyous pirate-y entertainment.” -Wellyott

“Rambunctious chaos across the high seas” -Theatreview

events.id: Under the Full Moon: An Evening with Horses-299 Takarau Gorge Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Under the Full Moon: An Evening with Horses
events.venue: 299 Takarau Gorge Road, Ohariu, Wellington 6037, New Zealand
events.long_description:
A gentle gathering to reconnect with your breath, your body, and the quiet language of presence.
This is not a riding session.
It’s an opportunity to slow down, soften the edges of the day, and spend time with horses in an intentional, grounded way.
We’ll begin with warm cacao and a simple guided reflection to help you arrive in yourself. You’ll then be invited to step into the space with the horses; noticing your posture, your pace, your emotional landscape, and how the horses respond. They reflect us in subtle and honest ways, offering connection, feedback, and companionship without judgement or expectation.
No horse experience is needed.
Just a willingness to stay curious, breathe, and be present.
What to expect:
Cacao on arrival
A gentle guided settling practice
Time with the horses at liberty
Optional shared reflection
A quiet, unhurried closing
Duration: ~90 minutes
Location: Horse Space (Wellington region)
Group size: Max 6 to keep it intimate and personable
Suitable for: Anyone craving grounding, spaciousness, or connection
We usually make the cacao with coconut milk and honey so let us know if you have an allergy

events.id: Micetro - Classic improv-Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Micetro - Classic improv
events.venue: Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Let the holiday battles begin!

Beloved improv elimination comedy competition Micetro is back for another bite of the cheese. The magnificent Steven was once crowned the Greatest WIT in Wellington. But can he defend his title?

A crew of eager improvisers will again battle head to head using wit, spur-of-the-moment storytelling and risking everything for an the love of the audience. There’ll be songs! Drama! Pathos, bathos probably a bit of logos! A mix of seasoned improvisers and adorable newcomers and everyone in between will play their hearts out to decide who gets eliminated and who survives to be crowned ‘Micetro’.

The Wellington Improvisation Troupe, aka WIT, is a member-based community theatre group, teaching and performing in Wellington since 2003. Our theatre is made up on the spot, usually based on suggestions from the audience. WIT players share a love of storytelling and work together as a team to inspire the audience, we’re sometimes serious, often hilarious and always totally unpredictable.

Pay-what-you-can tickets from $5, and door sales. WIT is a registered charity.

events.name: Nirvana Tribute (UK) | You Pick the Setlist | Wellington, San Fran U18 W/ GUARDIAN
events.venue: San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Nirvana Tribute (UK) | You Pick the Setlist | Wellington, San Fran U18 W/ GUARDIAN
October Presents
😋 𝗡𝗜𝗥𝗩𝗔𝗡𝗔 𝗧𝗥𝗜𝗕𝗨𝗧𝗘 (𝗨𝗞) - ‘𝗬𝗢𝗨 𝗣𝗜𝗖𝗞 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗦𝗘𝗧𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗧’ 𝗧𝗢𝗨𝗥

𝗢𝗻 𝗦𝗮𝗹𝗲 𝗡𝗼𝘄
🗓️ Friday, December 5
📍 San Fran, Wellington (U18 ALLOWED WITH GUARDIAN)
🎫 bit.ly/nirvtrib25well

𝙎𝙞𝙜𝙣 𝙪𝙥 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙫𝙤𝙩𝙚 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙤𝙣𝙜𝙨 𝙔𝙊𝙐 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙝𝙚𝙖𝙧..𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙨𝙝𝙤𝙬 𝙞𝙨 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙨 🤲
🗳 www.octoberpresents.com/nirvanatribute2025

What if you could choose the songs at a Nirvana concert… and then watch them come to life on stage?

🎤 For the first time ever, Nirvana Tribute is putting the show in the hands of the fans. Audiences across Australia and New Zealand will vote on the songs they want to hear. From iconic anthems like Smells Like Teen Spirit, Come As You Are, and Heart-Shaped Box, to the deep cuts only true fans would dare request.

This isn’t just a tribute. It’s a show 𝗯𝘂𝗶𝗹𝘁 𝗯𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝗮𝗻𝘀, 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗳𝗮𝗻𝘀.

You may also like the following events from October Presents:
Next month, 12th September, 09:00 am, ILL NINO with special guests ADEMA | Liberty Hall, Sydney in Surry Hills
Next month, 13th September, 09:00 am, ILL NINO with special guests ADEMA | Max Watts, Melbourne in Melbourne
Next month, 14th September, 09:00 am, ILL NINO with special guests ADEMA | The Triffid, Brisbane in Newstead
Also check out other Concerts in Wellington, Music events in Wellington, Entertainment events in Wellington.

events.id: Somatic Dance Wellington ~ Hara Rising-11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Somatic Dance Wellington ~ Hara Rising
events.venue: 11 Hutchison Road, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
HARA RISING ~ FRIDAY EVENING SOMATIC DANCE
This month, we dance from the deep.
From the low-lit well within the pelvis, where instinct, intuition, and our inner fire reside.
Breath descends, awakening the Hara, our life force energy, clearing what no longer serves us.
Movement rises, carrying what wants to be felt, freed, and transformed, opening space for more joy and vitality.
We dance not to perform, but to reclaim our energy, our presence, our aliveness.
To sink into the molten center where your belonging, your power, and your knowing dwell.
Let your hips answer.
Let your breath carve.
Let the Hara lift you, guiding you toward the embodiment of your truest self and the year ahead.

~ Friday 5th December
~7pm -9 pm
~Te Whaea National Dance and Drama Centre, Newtown
~Limited Spaces Available
~No door sales 
✨ We are a passionate group of certified Somatic Dance facilitators, eager to get you grooving on a Friday evening and set the perfect mood for your weekend.
What to Expect:
Somatic Dance: A guided, free-form movement journey, delving deep into the layers of the body, supported by a carefully curated soundscape.
Non-Judgmental Space: Let it all go! All of you is welcome to explore your own unique expression.
No Dance Experience Necessary: There are no routines or steps to follow here, simply an invitation to discover how your body wishes to move.
Come and move to the rhythm of you, ready to deepen your connection with self and others.
This is a space free of booze, shoes and talking on the dance floor. Let the epic music and steady voice of your facilitator carry you out of mind and into body, slipping away to the transformative power of somatic dance. The music takes the form of a wave, beginning gently before building to a peak, then settling softly and slowly. You'll leave feeling refreshed and high-vibed for the days ahead. 
What to Bring:
Comfortable clothes for movement (layers are recommended)
A drink bottle
A drop or two of curiosity!
Please arrive 5-15 minutes early to settle into the space. We welcome you from 6:45 PM for a prompt 7PM start.
We can't wait to dance with you!
~Wellington Somatic Dance Collective x
events.description:
This month, we dance from the deep.
Let your breath carve.
Let the Hara lift you, guiding you toward the embodiment of your truest self and the year ahead.
Let the epic music and steady voice of your facilitator carry you out of mind and into body, slipping away to the transformative power of somatic dance.
We welcome you from 6:45 PM for a prompt 7PM start.

events.id: Yoga Nidra-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga Nidra
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
Yoga Nidra, often referred to as "yogic sleep," is a deeply restorative practice that promotes physical relaxation, mental clarity, and emotional balance.
It's the perfect way to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul: your hinengaro, tinana and wairua.
What to Expect: - A 90-minute guided Yoga Nidra Meditation led by one of our experienced instructors - A comfortable space to lie down (mats, blankets, bolsters & cushions provided) - A supportive community of fellow meditation enthusiasts - Complementary herbal tea before/after the session; - An opportunity to journal your experience, if desired - A chance to destress and cultivate inner calm Yoga Nidra is for everyone and no prior experience is required - everyone is welcome to experience the profound benefits of Yoga Nidra with us.
Wear comfortable clothes, and bring an open mind, a journal and eye mask if you have one (not required).
So, mark your calendar for the first Friday of each month and treat yourself to an evening of deep relaxation and mindfulness.

events.id: SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt-The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
events.venue: The Shed,46 Victoria St, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THE SECOND AND FINAL WELLINGTON REGION SHOW IN '25!

Tickets on sale NOW! Don't miss out...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.

You may also like the following events from Darren Watson:
This November, 9th November, 05:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Tauranga in Tauranga
This November, 15th November, 09:30 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Kumeū in Waitakere
This November, 21st November, 10:00 am, Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - New Plymouth in New Plymouth
Also check out other Music events in Lower Hutt, Entertainment events in Lower Hutt, Arts events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Levin-58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Levin
events.venue: 58 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.

events.id: Candlelit Concerts - it's a night out that feels good and does good!-87 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Candlelit Concerts - it's a night out that feels good and does good!
events.venue: 87 Oxford Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
🌙 Candlelit Concert Series — Summer Edition
Step into an evening of warmth, wonder, and world-class music. Once each season, our historic local church transforms into an intimate haven softly lit by 800 flickering candles. Pause, breathe, and connect in a truly magical atmosphere.
✨ What to Expect
Ease into the evening with local wines, dessert nibbles, and gentle background music by a talented youth musician. Then, as dusk settles, enjoy 75 minutes of exquisite acoustic music, curated to uplift and inspire.
🎶 Guest Artists: Saxcess
New Zealand’s premier saxophone quartet, Saxcess, delivers a rich kaleidoscope of sounds  swing, classical, tango, cutting-edge NZ contemporary, and much more. For decades, they’ve delighted audiences young and old across Aotearoa and beyond.
Saxcess members:
Debbie Rawson (soprano/alto)
Richard Marin (soprano/alto)
Franz Ombler (tenor)
Rachel Collingridge (baritone)
Let your ears travel the world, from the bold energy of Latin American saxophone pieces to the inventive sounds of New Zealand compositions.
Founded and led by Debbie Rawson, Saxcess is a project-based collective that has toured nationwide for nearly 30 years and have played all major Arts Festivals in Aotearoa, and performed original NZ compositions at Saxophone Congresses in Australia, Belgium, and the USA.
🎹 Pre-Concert Performance (8:15–8:30pm)
Be captivated by rising young pianist Kasra Mitchell-Kouttab, 15, whose talent and passion for classical music have already impressed audiences far beyond his years.
🕯️ Event Details
Doors: 8:00pm | Pre-show: 8:15pm | Main concert: 8:30–9:45pm
Venue: Historic local church, transformed by candlelight
Tickets: $35 | Limited to 100 guests — bookings essential
💛 Music That Feels Good and Does Good
Each concert supports local community programmes — so your night out helps make a difference.
Whether for the spellbinding music, magical setting, or sense of connection, this is an evening you’ll never forget — and one you’ll return to season after season.
✨ Book your tickets now!
(Adults only; please no children under 10.)

events.long_description:
Friday Laughs brings some of the best comedy talent NZ has to offer to the Fringe Bar

With Rhys Mathewson
Rhys Mathewson is a stand up comedian and reporter who has won pretty much every award New Zealand comedy has to offer. He currently serves as the roving reporter on Seven Sharp. Rhys has performed all over the world, including a packed out Spark Arena supporting Jack Whitehall.
Winner 2024 Directors Award at the NZ International Comedy Festavil
Winner 2016 Fred Dagg Award for best show at the NZ International Comedy Festival
Winner 2010 Billy T James Award
“One of New Zealand’s best comedians’” – stuff
“world class joke writing” – the speakeasy

And Brendon Green
Brendon Green brings a warm and friendly energy to every room he's in.

Combining hilarious jokes, world class storytelling, and an authentic emotional honesty, he is a treat for every kind of comedy fan. A great MC and a favourite feature act, he has honed his comedy skills on stages all over the world.

2023 Fred Award Nominee
2018 Best Storytelling Show Winner

Writer for 7 Days, Taskmaster NZ, Have You Been Paying Attention, Paddy Gower Has Issues, and many more.

"He uses words and wordplay skilfully… and has a sweet wit about him" Stuff.co.nz

More acts to be announced!

For our final free gig of the year, we're stoked to have Australian post-surf punk band Lazy Ghost joining us from across the ditch! This one is shaping up to be a live show you won't forget.

events.id: Heartland Flyer-Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Heartland Flyer
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand
events.long_description:
Heartland Flyer
Travel with Steam Incorporated north from Kapiti via the spectacular Manawatu Gorge to Woodville for an easy day out. Picking up along the way from Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, and Levin, our destination today is Woodville. To get there, we travel through the famous Manawatu Gorge. Now only accessible via rail, you get a unique perspective of the monumental slips which closed the Gorge to road traffic from 2017.

At Woodville, sample the delights of the restored 1960s era station whilst our train is prepared for the run back down the coast. Meridian’s Te Apiti wind farm can also be seen from the station, occupying 1,150ha of land, with enough sustainable renewable energy to power 45,000 kiwi homes.

Fares
Adult (12+yrs) - $139
Child (3-12yrs) - $89
Infant (0-2yrs) - Free

Tickets available at steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/heartland-flyer/

events.name: HARD OUT
events.venue: 26 Blair Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Hard Out — Jungle Juice is dropping their first-ever Hard Techno party, and it’s gonna go off.

We’re talking straight-up belters, raw sounds and heavy energy, just pure underground sound for the real techno whānau.

Pull up, bring your crew, and get ready for a full-on sesh — loud, sweaty, and proper hard out.

Heavy pulse of the underground. Jungle Juice has been shaping Wellington’s dance floors, and now they’re turning up the pressure — faster, harder, and unapologetically raw.

Lose yourself in the kick. Feel the weight of the bass. This one’s for the ones who live the night — Aotearoa’s true techno heads.
Line-up:
• DANI — 22:00–23:00
• MALWARE — 23:00–00:00
• DJ BY ACCIDENT— 00:00–01:00
• VNESS — 01:00–02:00
• GASPAR — 02:00–03:00

Venue: Red Square — 26 Blair St, Te Aro, Wellington

Get ready, Wellington — this is Hard Out. No compromises, just pure Hard Techno.
Important Information
This event is R18. Valid photo ID will be required for entry.
Respect each other and the venue.
We will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
Consent is key – always.
Lighting & Visual Effects: Please be aware that strobe lights, lasers and other flashing
visuals may be in use throughout the night. These effects may not be suitable for everyone.
Photos & Video: Our crew will be capturing the energy of the night through photos and videos. By being here, you’re part of that magic and may appear in content we share to celebrate and promote future events.
Have fun and please find the crew if you have any issues.

events.id: AUDITIONS - Girls Night The Reunion!-15 Hinemoa Street, New Zealand 5032,15 Hinemoa St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: AUDITIONS - Girls Night The Reunion!
events.venue: 15 Hinemoa Street, New Zealand 5032,15 Hinemoa St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
AUDITIONS - Girls Night The Reunion!
Coasters Musical Theatre is proud to present the New Zealand premiere of Girls Night The Reunion!
Our five 50-something friends are back together at their 40th school reunion. They’re facing new challenges like hot flushes, grown up children, failed marriages and everything that comes with middle age! Sharon has managed to hang onto her wings and the others are still navigating life together. They re-live the past and reveal a couple of surprising secrets! But as always, the warmth of their friendship carries them through. Girls Night – The Reunion tells us that life is messy, but it’s much easier to navigate with good friends.

We are lucky enough to have two of our original actors from Girls Night and Girls Night Too returning and are now looking for three more performers with strong singing voices to join them.

Email Jo at for more information and to book an audition time for SATURDAY 6 DECEMBER.

Show dates are 16 - 26 April 2026

Character descriptions:
Carol is 50-something, confident, well dressed and likes a drink – the perpetual party girl! She was Sharon’s best friend and has been married, divorced, married, divorced and married. Turns out she found the answer to marriage but didn’t realise it. Well, we all kiss a lot of frogs before we find a prince…Everyone knows and loves a Carol.

Anita is 50-something, naïve and uncensored and has had mental health issues all her life. The friends know about this but there’s never been any deep discussion between them as to why this is…such close friends but with hidden secrets. Her journey is like a rollercoaster. Will we find out at the reunion what Anita’s secret is?

Kate is late 40’s/early 50’s and is Carol’s little sister. She is quite prim and proper and a school teacher. Anita and Kate are quite close but despite issues with her sister Carol, the sisters are also close. Kate is quiet compared to the others but sticks with the friends. She is menopausal and with her hot flushes she’s relying heavily on her fans! She is very determined and is definitely the kind one.
events.description:
Our five 50-something friends are back together at their 40th school reunion.
Girls Night – The Reunion tells us that life is messy, but it’s much easier to navigate with good friends.
We are lucky enough to have two of our original actors from Girls Night and Girls Night Too returning and are now looking for three more performers with strong singing voices to join them.
Well, we all kiss a lot of frogs before we find a prince…Everyone knows and loves a Carol.
She is menopausal and with her hot flushes she’s relying heavily on her fans!

events.id: The Festive Flyer-Wellington Railway Station,Wellington Station, 2 Bunny St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: The Festive Flyer
events.venue: Wellington Railway Station,Wellington Station, 2 Bunny St, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Festive Flyer
Join us and celebrate Christmas with a delicious lunch and a day out on the train! Saturday 6th December 2025

Get into the festive spirit with Steam Incorporated—perfect for celebrating with colleagues, friends, and family!

Jump onboard our heritage train departing Wellington Station, and nestle down into your seats for a relaxing journey up the coast behind one of our heritage Da class locomotives.

After arriving at the private entry at Tatum, you'll take a short walk across the car park and follow the music into the Pavilion, where we settle in just in time for lunch!

Immerse yourself in a well-crafted meal, created by the talented chefs there. The menu is set to be a classic kiwi style Christmas buffet feast with all the trimmings!

There will be plenty to keep you entertained such as outdoor games, live music, and 2 dinner sittings, so there is plenty of time to tour Tatum, check out Tatum House, and relax in the gardens on the Tatum House Lawn with a drink. You will be advised of your sitting time prior to arrival.

Departing Tatum, climb on board, head to the Lounge Car, grab a drink from the bar and enjoy the journey home. This unforgettable ride hugs the dramatic coastline along the famed Kapiti escarpment, offering sweeping views of the Tasman Sea and rugged cliffs. It’s a rare chance to relive the golden age of rail in one of New Zealand’s most scenic rail corridors as the sun begins to set.

This excursion will be hauled by our 1955-built diesel electric locomotive, Da 1410, and consist of our steel carriages.

Fares (include your return train travel, meal and entertainment)
Adult 13+ yrs - $229
Child 2-12yrs - $189
Infant 0-2yrs - FREE

Thinking of a larger event, or your corporate Christmas Function?
We're pleased to be able to offer some fantastic packages for large groups, or corporate functions with our friends at Tatum. This all inclusive train ride and Christmas lunch combo is a great way to celebrate 2025 with your team! Please contact us via email or call us on 0800 783 264 for a personalized group package.

Please be at your boarding station minimum 10 minutes prior ready to roll, with your tickets, carriage letter and seating allocations at the ready.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Tatum does NOT have a platform. This means you must be able to board and disembark the train from ground level with little to no assistance.

Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

All tickets and seating allocations are sent via email, within 48 hours prior to the departure of this excursion.

Prior booking is essential, make sure you reserve your spot now to avoid missing out on this experience.

Open Air @ Carlucci Land
Open Air are excited to return to a day/night adventure at the weird and wonderful Carlucci Land in Happy Valley.

We are planning a fully immersive production again with an amazing range of artists.


Main stage:

3-430pm K-oTik
430-6pm NotMySister
6-730pm Everybody
730-9pm Donna-Marie
9-1030pm Greg Churchill
1030-12am Takas


2nd Stage to be announced soon!


Our friends from Cosa Nostra food truck will be back serving fresh pizzas and also have a range of soft drinks available.


Kids under 16yo are free as well as the mini golf for all attendees!


Please note no alcohol will be allowed, you are however welcome to bring your own food and beverage refreshments, NO glass is allowed please. There will also be multiple water stations free for use.


The #29 Metlink Bus route will be running on the hour with the last bus leaving Happy Valley around 10pm. We will also contact the taxi companies to get them to provision taxis for the event closure.


We will not be offering ticket refunds or swaps for this event, if you can no longer make the event, you can on-sell your own ticket - buyers please be sure about who you are buying from as there are lots of scammers around!


Consent is always required at any event to ensure that everyone is kept safe and boundaries are not crossed. Please ask before any hugging, touching of any sort, taking photos, etc. We operate a zero-tolerance policy to bad behaviour. If you see something that doesn’t seem right, you have a responsibility to do something. And remember, if it’s not an enthusiastic YES then it’s a NO.


Open Air reserve all rights and have a zero-tolerance approach.


Ngā mihi

Open Air

events.id: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December-28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December
events.venue: 28 Moana Road, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013,28 Moana Rd, Days Bay, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 6th of December
Join us for this special evening of harmonising pure sounds, inspiring music and relaxation in the beautiful Pause Yoga studio in Eastbourne.
Give yourself a peaceful moment and space of quiet awareness. Discover the power of your own voice, mantra and silence working to find inner peace and contentment. Bring an intention, get comfortable and let the sound waves take over. Invite the sound to take you into a journey within, into your heart, to rest, to release physical, mental and emotional tension.

Surrender to the sound of Gong, Tibetan and Crystal Bowls, Native American flutes, Harmonium, Sitar ,Esraj, Bells etc..Claudio brings high quality amplification so you can feel the sound in your body and take into a immersive experience.

Feel free to bring a pillow and blanket to assure comfort.


About Claudio: Claudio is a 3rd generation Multinstrumentalist Musician from Mexico City now based in Wellington. Claudio comes from a musicians family he started playing music since very early years. When he finished music school as a classical guitarist he moved to Montreal, Canada and explored new genres such a Jazz, World Music, and Spiritual Music. Traveling he discovered Indian Music and the Yoga Tradition and they became a very important influence on his career and lifestyle, and allowed him to study Music and Yoga with teachers in Europe and Asia. He learnt to play the Tibetan Singing Bowls in Kathmandu Nepal and Varanasi India.He explored many instruments and music styles such as Classical Guitar, Sitar, Esraj, Bansuri, Harmonium, Flutes, Gongs and Voice.Claudio is an active Sound Healing practitioner and performer. He has been playing the Tibetan bowls for more than 10 years now.

You may also like the following events from Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music:
Next month, 11th October, 07:00 am, Sound Healing Experience with Claudio at Pause Yoga 11th October in Lower Hutt
Also check out other Music events in Lower Hutt, Entertainment events in Lower Hutt, Health & Wellness events in Lower Hutt.

events.id: Heartland Flyer-Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: Heartland Flyer
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Travel with Steam Incorporated north from Kapiti via the spectacular Manawatu Gorge to Woodville for an easy day out. Picking up along the way from Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, and Levin, our destination today is Woodville. To get there, we travel through the famous Manawatu Gorge. Now only accessible via rail, you get a unique perspective of the monumental slips which closed the Gorge to road traffic from 2017.

At Woodville, sample the delights of the restored 1960s era station whilst our train is prepared for the run back down the coast. Meridian’s Te Apiti wind farm can also be seen from the station, occupying 1,150ha of land, with enough sustainable renewable energy to power 45,000 kiwi homes.

If you are wishing to take a ride from Palmerston North or Woodville, check out the Ashhurst Flyer running on the same day!
Group bookings of 10+ please contact us via email admin@steaminc.org.nz or call us on 0800 783 264 for a personalized package!

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

events.id: Kiwi Christmas in Kaitoke-Kaitoke Regional Park,Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Kiwi Christmas in Kaitoke
events.venue: Kaitoke Regional Park,Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kiwi Christmas in Kaitoke
Celebrate the season at Kaitoke Regional Park – Christmas carols and movie night in the park! 🎄🎅🎶

Gather the whānau and head to Kaitoke Regional Park for a magical evening of festive fun in nature.

Join us for Nick Tansley’s Pop Up Carols Caravan, bringing joyful live music to the park. Stay later for a screening of the movie Kiwi Christmas on the big screen—a funny, whānau-friendly movie about Santa tuning up for a summer holiday as far away from the North Pole as possible – Aotearoa!

Warm up with marshmallow toasting, pack a picnic or grab a bite from the from the local Scouts fundraising food stall (cash only), and if conditions allow, join a guided night time walk with the park ranger after the movie.

Carols: 5.30pm - 6.30pm

Movie: 6.30pm - 8pm

Why not make a weekend of it? Come camp at Kaitoke Regional Park and enjoy everything the park has to offer—from swimming holes and forest walks to peaceful picnic spots and native wildlife.

Get the whānau involved in Summer Events

Discover the magic of your regional parks. For 25 years, Greater Wellington has been hosting recreational events that help people connect with nature, get active outdoors, and enjoy time together.

Kaitoke Regional Park is more than just a beautiful place—it’s a hub for conservation. Greater Wellington’s work here protects freshwater, restores native bush, preserves historic sites, and helps build resilience to climate change. Our partners and volunteers play a vital role in keeping this park special.

events.id: Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag and Ozzy Memorial Show-Wildkiwi distillery,23 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt-All Events In
events.name: Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag and Ozzy Memorial Show
events.venue: Wildkiwi distillery,23 Blenheim St, Maidstone, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag and Ozzy Memorial Show
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends
Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Rockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.

Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.

This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.

The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:

•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera

•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne

•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More

•Demon Fetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth

(More bands to be announced!)

Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025

•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt

•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM

•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.

•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.

Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!

•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.

•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)

•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)

VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.

Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)

Perks:

•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.

•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.

•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.

•First dibs on the merch table.

•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).

Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30

•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!

This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.

LINK TO SIZING AND DESIGN HERE:

https://www.railrecords.net/utf2-tee

EVENT TNCS:

https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs

events.name: Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal Share
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Yana- An Inward Journey of Release and Renewal Share
https://events.humanitix.com/yana-release-and-renewal
Mystic Creative warmly invites you to join us for a very special evening to close out the last part of 2025. You'll experience the opportunity to restore, recalibrate and realign your soul to its highest timeline for 2026 and beyond. This intimate event will have very limited capacity, to ensure a deep inward experience for all.

We will share in a sacred water ceremony with coherent water that has been structured, charged and infused with frequency- ready to be programmed with your intentions to release and shift into the new.

Next, we will connect with a Triple Cone Orgonite meditation, further amplifying the Euphoria to all, energising your intentions and clearing the way for the shifts to come.

With awareness of breath and the rhythmic handpan drumming, you will gently be guided inward to begin your journey and actualize your intentions.

The heartbeat of the journey is a very special 30 year old handmade Buffalo drum from Utah, USA. Yana is the beat we move and breathe to, the guide and the gateway, the beat of Mother Earth. Allow her depth and resonance to take you to places you’ve forgotten and re-introduce to you the primal heartbeat of humanity, of your humanity.

An intentional weaving of a multitude of instruments, beats and frequencies that will take you to places deep within yourself: an opportunity to explore, feel and release what no longer serves you. As we move into higher frequencies of consciousness as a collective, we are being called to clear the old- expectations, stories, beliefs, programs, conditioning and paradigms. You bring the intention and Yana will guide you into surrender, allowing all that does not serve your highest timeline to fall away.

And as you gently re-emerge into the waking state, you'll experience the quiet and space to recalibrate and sink into the tenderness of renewal.

This journey is a sacred experience, designed to guide you through your own process. As such, this will mainly be a silent event (not social).
Contribution $55
Nameste

Namaste

events.long_description:
Matiu Te Huki concert Levin - Firebird Cafe
This sweet, intimate concert gathering will bring sweet souls
together to celebrate life with food, music, dance and good times.
Its time to gather and celebrate community (common unity)
Bring your good vibes and your dancing shoes

7:30pm the music kicks off

Matiu


As a musician, Matiu’s ability to powerfully connect with and lift a crowd with his powerful stage presence, while fronting great bands or with his solid solo looping show is mesmerising.


Looping live, Matiu's soulful roots music has a strong Maori flavor, using haka, chants and traditional Maori instruments, backed by grabbing grooves, deep, beautifully crafted bass lines, funky rhythms and magical melodies that stay with you well after the show ends, all held up by a pillar of Pacific passion and top class technical precision


As a composer, the soul stirring messages in Matiu's music are positive, inspiring and unifying.


Matiu intuitively nurtures a deep connection with his audience creating the energy that opens portals of paradise.


"I tell ya... Your medicine Is your music... Straight from the heart and the depths of your soul. You are a warrior of word n rhythm - inspiring peeps to look within n re switch the light inside their own souls. Thank u incredible you!”


Fan

The Pulse of Possibility - A Breathwork Immersion to Expand Beyond the Unknown
Breathe beyond what you know.....
Join us in the Yurt for The Pulse of Possibility - a transformative breathwork immersion to close the year with clarity, expansion, and embodied aliveness.

As the year draws to a close, we gather for one final breath -
a sacred space to release, recalibrate, and remember what’s possible.

✨ The Pulse of Possibility ✨
A Pulse Breathwork Immersion with Melisa Bassett

Join us in the Yurt for an evening of expansion, energy, and embodiment.
Through breath, sound, and rhythm, you’ll open to new creative frequencies and reconnect with the pulse of life itself.

This is not about forcing or striving - it’s about breathing beyond what you know and awakening the aliveness already within you.

🌕 What to Expect

A guided breathwork journey to clear the year’s residue

Somatic movement and sound to awaken energy flow

Gentle integration with grounding and reflection

Community connection in a sacred, candlelit space


💫 You’ll Leave Feeling

Expanded and grounded

Reconnected to your inner rhythm

Clear, light, and inspired for what’s next


📍 Event Details

Location: The R&R Yurt, Rapaura (Marlborough)
Date: Saturday 6th December 2025
Time: 7 – 9pm
Facilitator: Melisa Bassett – founder of Rhythm & Rise, Pulse Breathwork
Exchange: $55 (limited spots available)

🕯️ What to Bring

A yoga mat, blanket, and pillow for comfort

Journal and pen for reflections

Water bottle

An open heart and willingness to explore

💖 Reserve Your Space

Spaces are limited in the Yurt.
Click “Going” and secure your spot, invite your breathing buddies - your breath will thank you.

“You are the pulse, the rhythm, the creation.”

Douce Ambiance - Picton
The versatile and popular Douce Ambiance quartet comprising of Cathy Irons (violin), Dan Roberston (keyboard), Dougal Canard (guitar, double bass) and Doug Brush (drums) are all set to delight audiences again.

Well-known for the energy and creative musicianship they bring to the stage, this talented ensemble of top Christchurch musicians brings an exciting programme of rustic medieval dances, sublime classical music, light jazz, Irish, tango with a little Hendrix and a healthy splash of fiery Gypsy thrown in.

A breath-taking concert that captivates from start to finish.

“A brilliant gifted ensemble...truly inspiring!”

Tickets: $30 online

Door sales available (if not sold prior) $35
Limited seats

events.id: Aurora Distillery Gin Experience-Aurora Distillery, 76 Hikunui Road, Kahutara, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Aurora Distillery Gin Experience
events.venue: Aurora Distillery, 76 Hikunui Road, Kahutara, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.

events.id: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve-Taputeranga Marine Reserve, 61 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Community Snorkel: Taputeranga Marine Reserve
events.venue: Taputeranga Marine Reserve, 61 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington
events.long_description:
Dive into Taputeranga Marine Reserve and take part in a free snorkeling event this summer!

Beginners welcome! We provide all the necessary gear and experienced guides to ensure your safety and enjoyment in the water. Participants just need to be at least eight years old and confident swimmers. Those under sixteen must be accompanied by an adult.

Registrations open at 9.45am. Come down to book a snorkel time for the day, as spots may fill up quickly. Bring your togs, towel, refreshments and make a day of it exploring the activities and environment at Taputeranga Marine Reserve.

This free event is brought to you in partnership with Greater Wellington Regional Council.

Cancellations/Postponements:

Events are weather dependent. Stay updated by checking the Mountains to Sea Wellington Facebook event listings for any cancellations, postponements, or location changes.

To get to Taputeranga Marine Reserve:

We encourage attendees to leave cars at home and use alternative transport where possible. Locals- please come on foot or bring along your bikes/scooters! For those further afield, the number 1 bus drops you right to the event from the Wellington Train Station. Map your journey here

Accessibility:

Island Bay Beach is accessible by beach wheelchair. The nearest accessible toilets are in Shorland Park. There are two accessible parks in front of the Island Bay Surf Club, additional vehicles can be accommodated if required, near to our MTSW trailers. Please see a staff member on arrival if the Surf Club parks are full. We have a variety of options to enable a more comfortable experience in the water,including flotation aids and 1:1 support from our trained guides. Please get in touch with us at events@mtsw.org.nz in advance of the event to discuss your accessibility requirements, including to enquire about beach wheelchair assistance. We love helping people to experience our marine environment!

The snorkelling in this event is run under the Health and Safety of the Mountains to Sea Conservation Trust programme Experiencing Marine Reserves. Adventure Activity Certified - AA0534.

Photos: Kristine Zipfel

events.id: Kāpiti Food Fair 2025-15 Scaife Drive, Paraparaumu 5032, Kāpiti Coast-Humanitix
events.name: Kāpiti Food Fair 2025
events.venue: 15 Scaife Drive, Paraparaumu 5032, Kāpiti Coast
events.long_description:
All FOODIES and your tribe are invited to an exciting and indulgent day out that leaves a lasting impression on food lovers that will have you returning year after year. We take pride in our offering of GOOD food, GOOD music, and GREAT company for food enthusiasts – the ultimate Food Festival with something for everyone backed with a great vibe and professional entertainment to enjoy all day long!
On the menu for 2025 ……. up to 250 vendor sites including an off licence Liquor Zone, a licenced Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage, ANZ Kāpiti Kitchen Demo Stage, Kāpiti Ice Cream Dining Room, FREE Kid’s Zone, ZEAL Zone buskers, roving street performers and much more!
GETTING THERE: Walk | Bike | Drive | FREE bus from Paraparaumu Railway Station
ALL WELCOME + crowd friendly dogs on lead
LOOK out for the NEW shady picnic zone!
THAMES PACIFIC MAIN STAGE
9:45 AM – 9:50 AM | Official Mayoral Opening
10:00 AM – 10:30 AM | Devon Welch Music
10:45 AM – 11:15 AM | Intercite
11:45 AM – 12:45 PM | Jody & the Stowaways
1:15 PM – 2:15 PM | The Beat Girls
2:45 PM – 3:45 PM | The Relatives
4:15 PM – 5:15 PM | Love Shack
MERCHANDISE: $3 Bags, $5 T-towels, $10 Aprons (not sold online)
NOTE: Humanitix booking fees will be added to the cost of your ticket and paid at check-out.  Booking fees cover Humanitix costs, and everything else goes to their education projects that help to change lives.  Kāpiti Food Fair supports Manaiakalani Education Trust for Māori, Pasifika, and disadvantaged learners in Aotearoa to increase student outcomes and get equal access to digital education.
TOP TIPS for a FANTASTIC DAY at the Kāpiti Food Fair
Bring a gold coin for parking donations.
Pack a hat and sunscreen – complimentary SPF is available if you need it.
Bring a picnic blanket to relax, enjoy the ambiance, and savor your treats with plenty of seating and a NEW shaded picnic spot under the trees.
BYO your own chair if you wish and a chilly bin for purchases!
Plan your foodie route with the Site Map >>
Visit the Tuatara Bar & Thames Pacific Main Stage and relax over a craft brew, wine, local cocktails and delicious cider while enjoying the vibe of the 80's to 90's revival party all day long!  Children are welcome with their parent or guardian.  CHEERS to that!
MOST vendors accept EFTPOS or bank transfer.  BYO cash as there is no ATM available.
THANK YOU SPONSORS
Kāpiti Food Fair is a recipient of the Kāpiti Major Events Fund and is supported by numerous local businesses in-kind and reduced cost of services.  The Fair is a commercial event however we have a social agenda too.  We choose to support Kāpiti Community Patrol, Kāpiti Rotary Charitable Trust, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets, Paekākāriki Surf Lifesavers, Paraparaumu College, and Work Ready Kāpiti to help run key logistics on the day. 
Kāpiti Food Fair Ltd is privately owned and operated by Helene Judge and Jeanine van Kradenburg.  The Fair reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.
#KFF2025 #FoodFestival #KāpitiFoodFair #SomethingForEveryone #VisitKāpiti
Website >> | Facebook >> | Instagram >> | YouTube >> | TikTok >>
