We have dancers aged from 1 to adult performing many genres of dance. All Aboard incorporates all dancers at Elite Dance Company. There are a few short breaks to stretch your legs throughout the show and to purchase sustinence from the foyer.

events.id: DYING FETUS w/ 200 Stab Wounds-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: DYING FETUS w/ 200 Stab Wounds
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, DYING FETUS has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classical bums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.
After12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, DYING FETUS are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize. 
On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 200 Stab Wounds serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 200 Stab Wounds craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.

events.id: Wellington Theatre Awards 2025-12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Wellington Theatre Awards 2025
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Celebrate the theatrical wrap-up of the season, The Wellington Theatre Awards, Ngā Whakarākei O Whātaitai 2025, at the Hannah Playhouse.
From reimagined classical texts to politically charged reflections on Aotearoa, New Zealand, the Wellington Theatre Awards recognise the innovation, creativity and excellence of our live theatre sector and the hundreds of shows produced and performed in Te Whanganui a Tara over the last year. Indulge in art, connect, reminisce, and laugh the night away at this special evening honouring the writers, designers, actors, directors, technicians and audiences that make theatre in this city possible.
Without the support of our wonderful sponsors and funders the 2025 Ngā Whakarākei O Whātaitai - Wellington Theatre Awards wouldn’t be possible. Thank you Wellington City Council, Grouse Lighting, HardKase Audio, The Woodbury Family, Suzanne Snively & Ian Fraser, Adam Foundation and to our wonderful theatre cluster - Playmarket, Tākina, Taki Rua Productions, BATS Theatre, Circa Theatre, NZ Fringe, Barbarian Productions, Aotearoa NZ Festival, Te Auaha, Tahi Festival, PAYPA and Hannah Playhouse!

events.name: Thorndon Fair 2025
events.venue: Tinakori Rd and Hill Street, New Zealand 6011,241 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Thorndon Fair 2025
Wellington’s iconic street fair is back!

Since 1977, the Thorndon Fair has been a highlight of the capital’s summer calendar — and in 2025, we’re bringing the energy, creativity and community spirit back to the streets of Thorndon.

With over 250 stallholders from across Aotearoa, this is your chance to discover:
🖼️ Unique art and crafts
🍴 Delicious food and drink
👚 Fashion, accessories and lifestyle products
📚 Books, gifts, toys, and treats for pets
🌿 Outdoor and experience products
🎶 Live music and entertainment all day

Whether you're shopping, looking for a fun day out with the whānau, or just love a good local market — there’s something for everyone.

Around 40% of our stallholders travel 100km or more to be here, so many of the products you’ll find are unique to Wellington on the day.

🎈 Follow our page for sneak peeks, giveaways, and stallholder showcases as we count down to the big day.
📲 Click "Going" and invite your friends — let's make this our biggest fair yet!

Also check out other Music events in Wellington, Arts events in Wellington.

events.id: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking-Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly On Wheels - City to Island Bay: Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay. Build your confidence and skills to ride safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike), explore the latest cycleway improvements, and learn practical tips for night-time commuting.

The ride starts and finishes at Switched On Bikes HQ near Waitangi Park, heading to Shorland Park in Island Bay. You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park. Note: the event may be postponed in the case of adverse weather.

Duration: Please allow around 2 hours for the ride.
Arrival: Arrive 30 minutes early if you’re renting a bike.
Preparation: Bring clothing suitable for changing weather conditions.

These rides are ideal for people who:
- Can ride a bike but haven’t yet started biking regularly in the city.
- Already ride in the city but want to gain confidence.
- Want to learn how to use Wellington’s cycleway network safely and efficiently.

Who can join: Open to riders aged 18+, or 13+ if accompanied by an adult. Younger children are welcome on cargo bikes or bike seats provided by participants. If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.

Bikes and bookings:
An electric bike is strongly recommended. Thanks to Switched On Bikes and Wellington City Council, you can rent one for only $10 if you don’t have access to your own. Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels

After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic! You’re welcome to return the bike before 9am the next day at no extra cost or hold onto it for the following day at a discounted rate of $39.

If you’d like to learn to ride a bike away from traffic, check out the free Pedal Ready courses on their website.

For any pātai (questions) about the tours, please email info@pedalready.org.nz.

Privacy Statement:
Information collected for this ride is used for booking and safety purposes. Your name and emergency contact details will be deleted within 14 days after the tour. Other provided information may be stored anonymously to support project evaluation. Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

You have the right to request access to or correction of your information. To do so, please email tours@wcc.govt.nz.
events.description:
Join Wellington City Council, Pedal Ready, and Switched On Bikes for a guided bike tour along the cycle route from central Wellington to Island Bay.
You are welcome to finish the ride at Shorland Park or ride back to Waitangi Park.
If you’d like to borrow a bike seat, please contact Switched On Bikes directly.
Please book your e-bike separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels After the tour, you can either leave your bike with us and catch a bus back to the city or keep riding if you’re feeling energetic!
Your email address will be kept for up to 4 months so we can share follow-up information about biking in Pōneke and invite you to give feedback about your experience.

events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Tawa, Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.venue: San Fran,171 Cuba Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Throwing Muses - Wellington, New Zealand
Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed and beloved US indie bands - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.

The band's first NZ tour in 31 years features concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.

Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.

Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.

Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.

events.id: Hypnosis for a Manifestation Mastermind-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Hypnosis for a Manifestation Mastermind
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

This workshop invites you to explore the deeper roots of abundance, beyond effort, beyond control. Together, we’ll look at how inner clarity, energetic alignment, and conscious detachment open the flow of true prosperity.

Instead of chasing outcomes, you’ll learn to move with life, to act from purpose rather than pressure. We’ll reflect on how attention shapes reality, why stillness restores vitality, and how joy itself becomes a magnet for success.

This experience isn’t about manifesting more things, it’s about aligning with the movement of life, where fulfillment, freedom, and natural abundance unfold with ease.

Meet Gopi, your host

Gopi helps spiritually minded professionals achieve clarity and overcome challenges on their path through his unique integration of hypnotherapy and palmistry. During his former life as a monk, he delved into the timeless wisdom of astrology, palmistry, and the ancient knowledge of the mind and consciousness, gaining deep insights into human psychology. He combines these powerful teachings with modern, effective tools as a certified practitioner in applied hypnotherapy, along with the knowledge he gained through his diploma in psychology and counseling.

6.15pm Tuesday 9th December

End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

events.id: Men's Group Tuesday 9 Dec-Central City, Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Men's Group Tuesday 9 Dec
events.venue: Central City, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

events.id: Throwing Muses-San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Throwing Muses
events.venue: San Fran, 171 Cuba St, Wellington
events.long_description:
Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed US college bands of the 1990s - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.


The band has announced concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.
Throwing Muses' Aotearoa tour is part of New Zealand promoter Plus1 Touring's 25th anniversary celebrations.
These are Throwing Muses' first shows in New Zealand since 1994.
Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.
Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.
‘Moonlight Concessions’ goes back to basics, a return for Throwing Muses to their esoteric off-kilter best courtesy of Kristin’s pin-sharp sketches and their suitably abrasive musical arrangements. The album follows ‘Sun Racket’ from 2020, a heady set filled with tough and tender tales spiked with surreal imagery.
Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.

events.id: Christmas at Katherine Mansfield House & Garden-Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Christmas at Katherine Mansfield House & Garden
events.venue: Katherine Mansfield House & Garden, 25 Tinakori Rd, Thorndon, Wellington
events.long_description:
Get into the festive spirit with a guided tour of Katherine Mansfield House & Garden that highlights Victorian Christmas traditions and Katherine Mansfield’s own love of Christmas.

The tour will be followed by a performance of some Christmas favourites by members of the Wellington City Chorus while you enjoy a glass of Hunter’s Wines MiruMiru (or a non-alcoholic option) and nibbles. Our small but carefully curated gift shop might also provide some gift inspiration!

“I hope you have a happy Christmas and Joy in the New Year, real, real Joy.” – Katherine Mansfield in a letter to Dorothy Brett, 1919

Katherine Mansfield House & Garden is a Category I Historic Place that celebrates the life and work of internationally acclaimed writer Katherine Mansfield, born at the house in 1888. Please note that the guided tour will journey through the whole house, which includes stairs. For more information, please see the Accessibility page of our website.

events.id: WellyForge#6, 10th Dec 2025 (Christmas Edition)-118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: WellyForge#6, 10th Dec 2025 (Christmas Edition)
events.venue: 118 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us to help progress Wellington by bringing together science, tech & investors from across the city into an informal, fun and informative meet-up. The goal of the event is that you learn something new, meet someone new, have fun and we all start forging new paths ahead for Wellington.
Focus of the night is the KiwiNet award winners who are from Wellington. KiwiNet funds the commercialization of public research across 19 universities in NZ. So, your show will be:
1st Speaker: Dr Ben Mallett from the MacDiarmid and Robinson Research Institute (part of Victoria) who won the Breakthrough Innovator Award, and is a co-founder of JxB Space Systems.
Quickfire Speakers:
Maci Libby, Massey Design Graduate, founder of Wise Gear NZ, passionate about outdoor adventure
Suse Reynolds, KiwiNet Commercialization Icon Award Winner, and big start-up fan (investor & Director)
Lachlan Mead, Young Enterprise Scheme Award Winner, and founder of the Christmas Chaos card-game, yes, copies will be available!
2nd Speakers: Prof Rob Weinkove who leads the Malaghan Institute's CAR-T cell program which won the KiwiNet PwC Breakthrough Project Award, and John Robson CEO of BioOra, a spin-out from the Malaghan which recently raised $15m to accelerate roll-out of its cancer treatment.
The venue is bohemian bookstore, Undercurrent, a perfect venue for story telling but tickets are limited - so please reserve yours, but if you do end up not being able to come please return the ticket!
Join WellyForge

events.id: Young Photographer Award 2025-2 Queens Drive, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Young Photographer Award 2025
events.venue: 2 Queens Drive, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Join us for an evening of inspiration, creativity and photography
Join us for the inaugural Young Photographer Award, the first event of its kind in New Zealand celebrating young creative talent aged 7 to 18.
Over the past year we have run more than 80 workshops and inspired over 180 kids to try photography. Many arrived with no previous experience and discovered a new way to express themselves. Some even chose photography as their future career. Our workshops are fully inclusive and also support kids who may need extra learning help, giving them a space to slow down, focus and build confidence through creativity.
Held in Lower Hutt, Wellington, this evening is all about creativity, wonder and community. Students who took part in our photography workshops will have their work displayed at the event, and our nominated young photographers will receive special awards recognising their talent, effort and unique way of seeing the world.
A creative evening for everyone
The event will be inspiring not only for young photographers but also for adults, families and anyone who loves creativity and photography. It is a great chance to support young talent, enjoy beautiful images and be part of a welcoming creative community.
Bring your friends and whānau. The more support we show our young photographers, the more their creativity shines and inspires others.
Guest speakers
We are excited to welcome two inspiring speakers:
Tushar Sharma

Landscape and nature photographer, conservationist and founder of IMAGEn8, an Auckland-based charity offering photography workshops for kids. Tushar’s work focuses on connecting young people with the natural world through the lens.
Chris McKeown

Chris is a Wellington photographer whose images have been nominated for multiple awards and published widely. His work appears in calendars, fine art prints, canvases and magazines. His photos are also licensed for annual reports, websites, branding, headshots and large public-space murals. Chris photographs events, family gatherings, performances, sporting events and weddings, bringing a warm and thoughtful approach to every project.

events.id: Neural Calm Reset: Tapping for Your Nervous System-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Neural Calm Reset: Tapping for Your Nervous System
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
If moments of calm slip away as the day goes on, this workshop is designed to change that.

You’ll discover how to take control of your nervous system and cultivate a calm state that feels natural — all through a clear, 3-step framework.

This is not mindfulness. But a practice drawing on principles of memory biology and cognitive reconsolidation to help you interrupt stress signals at their source - the meaning level, where your nervous system responds to life’s challenges.

Calm becomes repeatable, a reliable part of everyday life.

You’ll walk away with a simple, 15-minute daily sequence built around three key steps:

* Tapping to deactivate the stress signal — a gentle, evidence-based technique to reset your nervous system.

* Bright-Side Rewrite Journal — shift your perspective and build empowering mental patterns.

* Inner Dialogue Reframe — transform the way you talk to yourself, supporting lasting calm and clarity.

Plus - your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert

Meet Krishnaloka, your host

Krishnaloka is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and psychology. As a mind technician trained in autaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

Calm becomes repeatable, a reliable part of everyday life.
You’ll walk away with a simple, 15-minute daily sequence built around three key steps: * Tapping to deactivate the stress signal — a gentle, evidence-based technique to reset your nervous system.

events.id: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yin Yoga & Sound Healing
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Take an evening to slow down and reconnect. This session weaves together the meditative stillness of yin yoga with the restorative vibrations of sound healing — an immersive experience that invites both body and mind to unwind.

Through long-held yin postures, you’ll be guided to soften rather than strive, creating gentle openings and space for deeper release. The live sound journey adds another layer — resonant frequencies that ripple through the body, calming the nervous system and encouraging inner stillness.

Emma offers a trauma-informed yin practice grounded in compassion and self-awareness, drawing on her own personal growth and understanding of what it means to truly rest. Paired with Alex’s soundscapes, the evening becomes a tender exploration of presence and renewal.

We’ll close with a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert — a simple way to share warmth, grounding, and connection after the practice.

All levels are welcome.

Meet Emma, your yoga teacher
Emma holds a 100-hour trauma-informed Yin Yoga teacher certification, blending her corporate experience with a deep understanding of self-care. Emma's classes are designed to help create a safe space where you can relax and connect with your body. Her approach to teaching yin is purposeful, driven by a strong desire to empower students through mindful and compassionate practices. Her journey is rooted in self-growth and connection, with a strong focus on nourishing the body as an essential part of this.

Meet Alex, your sound healer
Alex is a sound healing practitioner devoted to nurturing healing in both mind and body. She believes that sound vibration holds the power to expand consciousness and restore harmony and balance in our lives. Her journey into sound healing began with the realization of how deeply sound vibration was affecting her psyche—making her more mindful of the music she listens to and the intention it carries. Along the way, she has drawn inspiration from artists such as Deva Premal, The Flying Mystics, Stevin McNamara, and the Bhakti Lounge Kirtan. Their music has profoundly influenced her own sound healing practice, inspiring her to explore sound as a tool for transformation, connection, and inner peace.

events.id: Capital Blues Presents: Jamie and the Numbers-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: Jamie and the Numbers
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jamie and the Numbers are a Wellington soul‑funk outfit fronted by powerhouse vocalist Jamie Musuvā.
What began as a one‑off recording project quickly grew into a passion for Northern Soul, funk, and inventive covers, all delivered in their own unapologetically loud and soulful style. The band mixes original songs with cleverly re‑imagined classics, drawing praise for their debut album and earning airplay across New Zealand and even the BBC. With Jamie’s voice and a tight line‑up featuring Elliott Fuimaono and the Lerwill brothers, their live shows are renowned for energy, groove, and connection. Collaborations with producer Lee Prebble at The Surgery Studios and releases through Deltaphonic Records have cemented their reputation as one of Wellington’s most compelling soul‑funk acts.
It’s hard to describe how good this band is. You will just have to come and find out.

events.id: Diabetes NZ: Connect with Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth (Marlborough)-22 Queen Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Diabetes NZ: Connect with Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth (Marlborough)
events.venue: 22 Queen Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.long_description:
An evening for everyone in Marlborough living with type 1 diabetes: Let’s connect, share ideas, and build our community.
Join Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth for a relaxed and friendly evening, supported by the Diabetes Nursing Team, open to all people in Marlborough living with type 1 diabetes - children, teens, young adults, and adults.
Whether you or your child is newly diagnosed or you’ve been navigating type 1 diabetes for years, we’d love to meet you.
Parents, carers, spouses, and other support people are welcome to attend alongside those living with type 1 diabetes.
We’ll chat about what Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth offers including social events, peer connections, and support for the whole family. Meet together with others at the Health Hub, with our Diabetes NZ Nelson Youth & Type 1 Coordinator joining online via Teams.
This is a great opportunity to talk about the kinds of activities or support you’d like to see and how we can work together.
Have questions? Email amanda@diabetes.org.nz.

events.id: Nadia Reid tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Nadia Reid tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Presented by: Banished Music "[Nadia] embraces a full-bodied sound halfway between Haim’s sophisticated pop sparkle and Sharon Van Etten’s full-throated songcraft" — The Guardian This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.
“There’s a questing robustness to these songs, a sense of somebody finally having the perspective to seek out answers to long-hanging questions.” ★★★★ — MOJO Enter Now feels different.
It is an album, she says, of departure and questioning, that has reminded her how songwriting can be “the most useful thing to do with pain and joy and thoughts and feelings and anger.” That through music we can find great change.
“I’m so much better off now that it exists,” she says.
“Now feels like a new time.”

events.id: Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast-Sunday Cantina,1 Renown Rd, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast
events.venue: Sunday Cantina,1 Renown Rd, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Parent Support Group - Kapiti Coast
Grab a free coffee and chat with other parents and carers who know what it’s like to care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.


Parent to Parent hosts regular Parent Support Groups in Kapiti Coast to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.


So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want.


Contact Meredith Dyer for more information:
| 027 808 3947

events.name: A Very Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas
events.venue: Abandoned Petone,38 Fitzherbert St, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
A Very Wellington Sea Shanty Society Xmas
NAUTICAL GAMES /// BEST DRESSED PRIZES /// SINGALONG SHANTIES /// XMAS-TYPE STUFF

Your work Xmas-party is going to be lame or cancelled so put a 2-dollar shop Santa's hat on 2025 and have a sing with Aotearoa's Most Seaworthy Shanty crew.

Prepare to be hit by a wave of joy and merriment as the Full Wellington Sea Shanty Society Experience transform the Abandoned Taproom into a shanty wonderland.

We got shanty booklets for all ye faithful and merch for Xmas presents.

If there's one thing we can all agree on in this country, it's that Xmas needs more sea shanties!

Only Te Upoko o te Ika show for 2025. New EP out in March 2026.

🎅🎅🎅

WELLINGTON SEA SHANTY SOCIETY

Aotearoa New Zealand's Most 'Sea Worthy' Shanty Group™ have been belting out traditional and original sea songs from Aotearoa, France, Spain, the UK and more, since time immemorial (2012).

The W.S.S.S have toured Aotearoa and France multiple times and are known for their rowdy and participatory live shows. They've performed at Paimpol (one of the world's largest shanty festivals), Splore, Albany Folk Festival (Aus), Quebec Sea Shanty Festival (Canada) and a shipload of other festivals in NZ, France & Canada. Their new EP 'Sea Shanties of the 70s, 80s, & Today!' has just recently surfaced to complement their 'Now That's What I Call Sea Shanties' series. Another must-listen is 'Ahoy!' - a French/English album made with Nantes amis Croche Dedans.

Also check out other Festivals in Lower Hutt.

events.id: JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 2-Paraparaumu Memorial Hall-All Events In
events.name: JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 2
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 2
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details
Investment: $55

Sesssion - 7pm -8.30pm on Fridays
in 2025 - 28/11, 12/12,
in 2026 - 30/1, 13/2. 27/2, 14/3, 28/3

Bookings can be made by bank transfer
to account in name of Heartsong Healing (via Hnry), 12-3245-0322503-37. Reference YIN . MONTH . 25 and YOUR NAME

OR PAY FOR ONE OR MORE PLACE BY CARD HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/14k3g1fIa3cJboQdRI

OR BUY THREE TICKETS FOR $150 HERE -

https://buy.stripe.com/00gg2N8fI6oV3Wo9Bt

and please confirm your payment by email to . Thank you.

Policy:
depending on booking numbers, if you need to cancel your place you may be able to transfer ticket to the next month once. We reserve the right to refuse transfer or refund if cancelled within 48 hours

events.long_description:
Fruitcake: A Jolly Good Christmas Drag Show
What’s festive and fruity and sleighs the chimney down?!
Fruitcake: A Jolly Good Christmas Drag Show!

This December, come all ye faithful to The Fringe Bar, and get ready for a Drag Spectacular to wipe off that resting grinch face and jingle your bells!

A Mistle-toast brought to you by Willy SmacknTush and featuring a sleighful of naughty and nice performers from across the snowglobe, who are ready to shake it like a pole-ariod picture and make it rein!

Two shows over two nights! Double the presents!

So treat yo’elf this silly season, don thee now your gay apparel and grab your tickets on Eventfinda.
With tickets starting at just $20 or splash out on a Front Row or VIP ticket and get right in the action.

Presales essential or yule be sorry.

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($35.00 per ticket)
GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up.

Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

You can contact us at

events.id: The Kava Experience-20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Kava Experience
events.venue: 20 Parumoana Street, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Bula Vinaka and Welcome to Kava Culture, New Zealand’s newest destination for authentic Fijian Kava!
We are thrilled to invite you to another relaxing Kava Experience night. Whether you're a curious newcomer or a seasoned kava enthusiast, our dedicated team will warmly guide you through every step of this unique journey.
At Kava Culture, we offer a premium, traditionally brewed kava experience designed for wellness-focused individuals seeking natural relaxation. We pride ourselves on sourcing our kava directly from small Pacific Island farms, ensuring unparalleled quality and authenticity.
Immerse yourself in the rich traditions of the Pacific as you enjoy our exquisite kava in our calm, serene location at Kaitahi, beautifully illuminated by ambient lights. This is more than just a drink; it's an opportunity to connect with others, promote genuine stress relief, and celebrate ancient island culture with modern comfort.
Join us for a night filled with community, connection, and tranquility. Let Kava Culture transport you – no passport required!
Choose your journey:
* Mini Experience: $30 (1.5 hours)
* Full Experience: $50 (3 hours)
We can’t wait to welcome you!

Celebrate 50 years of Steven Spielberg’s iconic thriller JAWS (1975) at Regent 3 Cinemas, Masterton!

🎟️ Tickets: $15 (general admission)
⏱️ Running time: 124 minutes
Popcorn, ice creams, drinks, and themed treats will be available for purchase. Stay tuned for our JAWS Movie & Meal offer, coming soon!

#JAWS50 #DontGoInTheWater #Regent3Cinemas

events.id: The Napier Escape-Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: The Napier Escape
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station,Paekakariki, Paekakariki , New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Napier Escape
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in December 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.

Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.

Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.

The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.

Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.

- A Deco Deep Dive - a look into Napier's Art Deco history and culture and a tour of the city!

- Sip and Savour - Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.

- Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace.

Ticket pricing start at...

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $159
Child 2-12yrs - $139

Departing Palmerston North/Woodville
Adult 13+ yrs - $139
Child 2-12yrs - $119

More info and tickets available at www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

You may also like the following events from Steam Incorporated:
This Saturday, 13th September, 10:30 pm, Daffodil Express 2025 in Wellington
This December, 5th December, 09:05 pm, Heartland Flyer in Paekakariki
This December, 6th December, 12:10 am, The Festive Flyer in Wellington
Also check out other Arts events in Paekakariki , Food & Drink events in Paekakariki .

events.long_description:
What’s festive and fruity and sleighs the chimney down?!
Fruitcake: A Jolly Good Christmas Drag Show!

This December, come all ye faithful to The Fringe Bar, and get ready for a Drag Spectacular to wipe off that resting grinch face and jingle your bells!

A Mistle-toast brought to you by Willy SmacknTush and featuring a sleighful of naughty and nice performers from across the snowglobe, who are ready to shake it like a pole-ariod picture and make it rein!

Two shows over two nights! Double the presents!

Starring Selina Simone, Ginger Velour, Robin Yablind, Velma Cherry (Friday 12), Ms Weeds (Saturday 13) and hosted by Willy SmacknTush.

So treat yo’elf this silly season, don thee now your gay apparel and grab your tickets on Eventfinda.
With tickets starting at just $20 or splash out on a Front Row or VIP ticket and get right in the action.

Presales essential or yule be sorry.

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($35.00 per ticket)
GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up.

Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

You can contact us at willysmackntush@gmail.com

events.long_description:
VORTEK
The fusion of deep bass music, out of this world visuals, and intricate stage design, all connecting together to form the Vortex of all art in a unique audiovisual experience. As inspired by the ''Lemon Tek''; inside the Vortek all is one.

Enter your first psychedelic journey into Flotex, where you can heal yourself with the flowing energies of the tree of life. With the sounds of Dubstep, UKG, and Drum and Bass, immerse yourself into the heart of the forest where you’ll be welcomed by the spirit of bass music and dance the pain away.

Flowtek’s experience goes further than a bass party — it is the full psychedelic experience that will leave you breathless the moment you step inside.

Lineup:
9pm - SPAM B2B TOY PURPLE |OPENING DUBSTEP
10pm - AMIRA |DUBSTEP
11pm - SKULLI |DUBSTEP
12am - SQUEAKZ. |DUBSTEP- DNB- UKG
1am - BEN-JAMMIN B2B CROOKED MIND |UKG-DNB
2am - DJ BY ACCIDENT |DNB-JUNGLE
VJ: SPAM

Location: Garden Hotel, 63 Courtenay Pl
Time: 9pm - 3am
IMPORTANT INFORMATION
This event is R18. Valid photo ID will be required for entry.
Respect each other and the venue.
We will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
Consent is key – always.
Lighting & Visual Effects: Please be aware that strobe lights, lasers and other flashing
visuals may be in use throughout the night. These effects may not be suitable for everyone.
Photos & Video: Our crew will be capturing the energy of the night through photos and videos. By being here, you’re part of that magic and may appear in content we share to celebrate and promote future events.
Have fun and please find the crew if you have any issues.

events.name: Reiki Level One - Wellington, New Zealand. Dec 13th & 14th, 2025..
events.venue: Capricorn Spirit,103 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Reiki Level One - Wellington, New Zealand. Dec 13th & 14th, 2025..
Discover the Gift of Reiki with Usui Reiki Level One

Usui Reiki is a gentle yet powerful method of natural healing, rediscovered by Mikau Usui over 100 years ago. It uses the flow of Universal Life Force energy to heal and rebalance the mind, body, and spirit. The beauty of Reiki lies in its simplicity and accessibility—everyone has the ability to connect with these healing frequencies. Reiki is a lifelong tool, ready to support you whenever you need it most.

In this Reiki Level One course, you will:
🌟 Learn how to perform a self-Reiki session and offer one-on-one Reiki to family and friends.
🌟 Receive the sacred Usui Reiki Level One attunement in person.
🌟 Begin a 21-day spiritual cleanse to integrate the energy shifts.
🌟 Study the history of Reiki, basic anatomy, chakra systems, and the frequencies of language and emotional states.
🌟 Gain practical tools to incorporate Reiki into your daily life.

This comprehensive course exceeds all standards set by Reiki NZ Inc. The training includes 12 hours of tuition spread over two days (both dates must be attended), with a 21-day integration period supported by ongoing guidance and a private Facebook group.

Includes:
✨ 12+ hours of expert tuition over 2 days
✨ Comprehensive manual and certificate
✨Cacao Ceremony to expand our hearts in preparation for our attunement
✨ Light healthy afternoon tea and herbal teas each day
✨ Access to a private Facebook group for support
Payment options, including plans, are available—please email me for details at .

Class size is kept small to ensure an intimate and personalized learning experience. A commitment to home study and self-Reiki practice is required for 21 days following the course.

🌟 When & Where:
📍 Capricorn Spirit, Willis St, Wellington
📅 Two days attendance required - 10.45am to 4.45pm, Saturday, December 13th and Sunday, December 14th.

🌟 About Your Teacher
Gina Noetica is one of New Zealand’s most experienced and dedicated Reiki Master/Teachers. Teaching all levels since 2008 and working as a professional Energy Healer (Quantum Energy Alchemy) since 2001, Gina brings a wealth of knowledge and a deeply intuitive approach to her courses. Her grounded, heartfelt teaching style empowers students to embark on their own journeys of healing and self-discovery.

I would be honoured to share this sacred practice with you.

Namaste,

Gina Noetica
Founder of the Centre for Expanding Consciousness
Professional Quantum Energy Alchemist & Reiki Master/Teacher, Consciousness Coach, Cacao Ceremonialist, CE5 Ambassador, Breathwork Facilitator.
📧
📞 022 413 6752

events.long_description:
Christmas in the Quarters – Santa’s arrival and Carols at Waitangi Park
We are celebrating Christmas with four free whānau-friendly events, in four different parts of the city this year!

🎅 Santa is coming to Waitangi Park, and he’s bringing festive cheer! Santa will arrive in his special sleigh on 13 December and do a walk-around Waitangi Park between 11am and 11.30am to greet the crowd. Meet Santa in his grotto between 11.30am and 5 pm, take a photo, and a selfie on his sleigh!

There will also be a range of Christmas activities between 11am - 5pm, including ice skating, the snowball globe, a foam pit, live music and entertainment, face painting, and caricatures. Plus a variety of food trucks will also be on site.

To wrap up Christmas in the Quarters be sure to stick around for Christmas carols with Nick Tansley & Friends at 5-7pm for a night of sing-alongs📍


Join us for four weekends of Christmas magic all around Pōneke!
🎄 Crafts at Midland Park on Saturday 22 November.
🎄 Music at Glover Park on Saturday 29 November.
🎄 Circus on Queens Wharf on Saturday 6 December.
🎄 Santa's arrival at Waitangi Park and Carols in the park on Saturday 13 December.

Join in on the festivities 👉 https://wellington.govt.nz/news-and-events/events-and-festivals/christmas-in-the-quarters

Tākina Christmas Market
🎄✨ The Tākina Christmas Market 2025 ✨🎄

The magic of Christmas is back in Wellington! 💫

Join us for two unforgettable days as the Tākina Convention and Exhibition Centre transforms into a sparkling Christmas wonderland filled with festive joy, twinkling lights, and holiday cheer.

This not to be missed event is your perfect festive outing, whether you’re shopping for special gifts or simply soaking up the Christmas spirit with friends and whānau. ❤️

🤶 Sunday, 14 December | 10am – 4pm

📍 Location:
Tākina Convention and Exhibition Centre, 50 Cable Street, Wellington (opp Te Papa)

💫 Entry: $2 per person (Kids under 12 free!)

Come and experience the magic! Let’s bring Christmas back to Wellington! 🌟

events.id: Messiah-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Messiah
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
It’s one of the great Christmas traditions — listening to a performance of Handel’s Messiah. Orpheus Choir Wellington, Orchestra Wellington, and four soloists join forces to bring this timeless masterpiece to life. A beacon of holiday joy for centuries, Messiah blends grandeur, beauty, and drama in equal measure. 
Under the direction of Brent Stewart, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work. From the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound to the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is an uplifting musical journey. Soloists include Emma Pearson, Maaike Christie-Beekman, Lila LJ Crichton, and Joel Amosa. 
Considered one of the greatest musical works of the 18th century, Messiah continues to endure over 280 years since it first premiered. Head to the Michael Fowler Centre to see why it continues to deliver.

events.id: The Napier Escape-Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki-Event Finder
events.name: The Napier Escape
events.venue: Paekakariki Railway Station, Tilley Road, Paekākāriki
events.long_description:
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in December 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.

Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.

Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.

The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.

Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:

- A Deep Deco Dive: includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
- Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views: Travel by coach from Hastings to Crab Farm Winery near Bay View for a curated wine tasting and late lunch.
- Napier at your Leisure: Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace.

Limited Mobility Disclaimer
Due to the age, design and nature of our heritage carriages, these are not suitable for passengers with limited mobility. If you have any concerns, please contact us on 0800 783 264 to discuss options with our bookings team!

events.id: WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL-End of Bay Drive, Titahi Bay beach,Titahi Bay Boat Sheds, Bay Dr, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
events.venue: End of Bay Drive, Titahi Bay beach,Titahi Bay Boat Sheds, Bay Dr, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
Hi everyone - welcome to the WSKN Christmas SKISL / Paddle to Mana!

On Saturday 13th December we will have a Christmas event on Mana Island, departing Titahi Bay at 10am (so arriving at 9:30) getting to Mana around 10:40, keen ones can do stuff prior to lunch around 12:00, then there might be groups that head back at different time slots, but we can work that out on the day. Return could therefore either be 1:30 or 2:30 with the latest return to Titahi Bay being 3pm.

We've made this event later than the normal SKISL so that it's easier for folks to drive down from Palmerston North, and also because it is a lunch event.

The lawn on Mana is really nice, sheltered and pleasant and there are also good walks. Mana is of course a sanctuary so you must check your boats for any wildlife especially ants that may have gotten in past the hatches. Also we cannot have any fires

Plan B: If weather nukes Mana, we'll try for Green Point or Onehunga Bay in Whitireia Park by driving there.

Plan C: We will postpone to 21 December

Also check out other Workshops in Porirua.

events.id: 🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄-Petone Salvation Army,MTR Service NZ, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt-All Events In
events.name: 🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄
events.venue: Petone Salvation Army,MTR Service NZ, Petone, Lower Hutt 5012, New Zealand, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
🎄💃🕺 Xmas Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺🎄
"May I have this Christmas dance?" 🎄😊💃🕺 It's that time of year already! Come spread the Christmas cheer on the dance floor with us!

Come dance the night away with your like-minded friends, and loads of classic Salsa songs from years ago, as well as a “dash” of Bachata and a “sprinkling” of Kizomba…..

• One fantastic wooden dance floor with a mix of Salsa, Bachata, and Kizomba music

• Easy to find venue off a main street in Petone (72 Cuba St)

• Plenty of parking in surrounding streets

• On main bus routes (#83 from Wellington, or #110 from Upper Hutt), or short 8min walk from Ava Train Station

• Water station provided however bringing your own water drink bottle is recommended. Also, BYO soft drinks, fruit juices, non-alcohol drinks, etc. (NB/ No alcohol allowed on premises!)

• Please wear high heel/stiletto caps to prevent damage to the venue’s wooden floor – For example, from https://www.beclickless.com/pages/faqs

• Only goes until 10:30pm so get there early to have a decent "fix" of dancing and socialising 😊

• Only $10.00 at the door (cash), or bank transfer (preferably at least 24 hours in advance):

Account: 06-0507-0092784-05
Account Name: Kasia L Wypych
Particulars/Code/Reference: “Your 1st and last name” - Salsa Hutt – “date of Salsa Hutt party”
******* (If you have prepaid on the night, please take a screenshot and show proof of payment at the door).

• Invite your friends to this event…and see you there! 😊

💃🕺 From 7:30pm to 10:30pm

💃🕺 Petone Salvation Army
Corner of Cuba and High Sts, Petone, Lower Hutt (Entrance from High St)

Email Kasia on or ring/text on 021 141 8116 for more details.

events.id: Christmas on the Coast-Mazengarb Reserve, Mazengarb Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Christmas on the Coast
events.venue: Mazengarb Reserve, Mazengarb Rd, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Get ready to sparkle, Christmas on the Coast is back! Register now to be a float or stall for the 2025 Christmas Parade - www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/do-it-online/forms/register-your-float-or-stall-for-the-2025-christmas-parade

Join us on Saturday, 13 December, from 11am–3pm at Mazengarb Reserve for a festive family day filled with cheer.

At 11 am, catch the colourful Christmas float parade as it travels from Paraparaumu College along Mazengarb Road to the reserve, then stay on for an afternoon of festival fun.

At the festival, enjoy free activities like games, face-painting, live entertainment, a bounce zone, and visits to Santa’s grotto. Bring a picnic or grab a bite from one of our food trucks, and don’t forget to bring a can for the Kāpiti Foodbank collection.

For more info, visit www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/Christmas

events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Denise Walker Dance Academy is proud to present 'Encore' 2025 - A Dance Spectacular!

Get ready to be swept off your feet! Take a journey with us full of tutus and tiaras as our amazing junior dancers take the stage at Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Coastlands Theatre. 'Encore' is a high-energy, feel good celebration of our favourites, bringing together the beauty of ballet, energy of jazz and the emotion of lyrical dance. events.id: Sapphic Somatics: A Queer Embodiment Workshop-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sapphic Somatics: A Queer Embodiment Workshop
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.long_description:
Somatic: Of or relating to the body, particularly the perception of physical sensations and internal experiences

What does it feel like to exist in a queer body? This workshop aims to help sapphic women and gender minorities find joy, freedom, and connection through somatic exercises that help you embody and embrace your queerness. You will leave feeling confident in your ability to take up space, tapped into your self-expression, and connected to the experiences of your sapphic community.

Here’s a rundown of what to expect:
- Opening Exercise: Guided somatic movements to loosen up your body
- Community Connection: Rotating conversations with other participants about queer embodiment
- Yoga Flow: Creative 30 minute class to explore presence and connect to your self-expression
- Guided Meditation: A relaxing combination of breathwork and visualisation to cultivate safety in your body
- Closing Connection: Gentle and grounding partner stretches (optional) and group reflections

No prior experience with yoga or somatic exercises necessary! All you need to attend is an open attitude, a desire to connect with your body, and a willingness to share your experience with other sapphics. Yoga mats and all other props will be provided. While this workshop dives into your embodied expression of sapphic identity/sexuality, none of the content is sexual in nature and the small amount of physical touch with other participants is completely optional.

The workshop is facilitated by Megan Edwards, creator of Golden Hour Gigs and a 500CYT trauma-informed yoga teacher. This event is intended specifically for queer women and gender minorities. No TERFS no SWERFS.

Content consideration: Because this workshop focuses on finding joy/pleasure/freedom in your body, it might not be suited for anyone experiencing intense dysphoria. With that said, you are welcome to explore discomfort and work on integrating challenging feelings. Megan is trained in movement techniques to lead you away from anything too activating and help you find safety in your body.

Accessibility: Awhi Yoga Studios has an elevator and is wheelchair accessible. There are plenty of gender neutral bathrooms and cosy spaces to rest if you need a break from the workshop at any time. If you want to attend but are concerned about the level of movement required, please email the organiser with any mobility questions at goldenhourgigz@gmail.com

events.id: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26-Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary Open Day 25/26
events.venue: Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Black Sheep Animal Sanctuary, Ōtaki
events.long_description:
Join us for a Tour of the Sanctuary

Open days include a tour of the sanctuary to meet the animals, learn about them, their stories and how we look after them, followed by a vegan afternoon tea. Money raised from ticket sales help us with the ongoing care of our animals. We will also happily accept donations of fruit, veggies, or hay for the animals.

Please note open days are weather dependent and in the event of rain we will normally rearrange to the following saturday.

Please arrive between 12:30 and 1pm- bring strong closed-toe footwear, sunblock, and clothing for all weather. No animal food products are allowed on the sanctuary grounds as we are a human vegan space. Sadly, dogs are not welcome as we have a lot of vulnerable animals on site. Depending on the weather, your clothing and footwear might get muddy, so please wear clothing that isn’t too precious.

If you have questions about accessibility please these questions email us before you arrive. Unfortunately, the sanctuary is not wheelchair accessible.

Make a day of it!- we are 5 mins away from some lovely river spots on the Ōtaki river and 20 mins from Ōtaki town and beach.

events.id: Foraged Basketry - December-65 Wallace Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Foraged Basketry - December
events.venue: 65 Wallace Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Our ancestors, no matter where in the world they came from, knew how to weave baskets, nets and vessels from what they found around them. Join artist Hannah Schickedanz to rediscover the art of twined and woven basket-making, using grasses, Montbretia, Convolvulus and other foraged flora. You'll take home at least one small basket and a useful skill, enabling you to create baskets from any number of fibres found in nature.
Coeliac friendly afternoon tea will be provided, please let me know if you have any other dietary requirements.

events.long_description:
Celebrate the season with Greytown’s annual Santa Parade - an afternoon of festive fun, community spirit, and creative flair. The parade begins at 2pm on Saturday, 13 December 2025, bringing music, colour, and holiday cheer to the streets of Greytown. This free event is proudly presented by South Wairarapa Rotary.

Local businesses, schools, clubs, and community groups are invited to take part by entering a float. There’s no cost to register, and all entries are welcome. Prizes will be awarded across several categories, including Mayor’s Choice, Best Tractor or Farm Vehicle, Most Creative Concept, Best Business Representation, Best Youth Entry, and Best Overall Floats (1st, 2nd, and 3rd place).

To register your float, scan the QR code on the event poster or contact the organisers directly.

events.id: KinoFest goes Wellington - Greetings from Mars-Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: KinoFest goes Wellington - Greetings from Mars
events.venue: Massey University Theatrette, Block 10 (Old Museum Building), Buckle Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
KinoFest goes Wellington!
After a successful run in Auckland, the Goethe-Institut New Zealand is bringing KinoFest to Wellington with two special screenings.

On 13 December 2025, we present Greetings from Mars — a heartwarming and imaginative coming-of-age story.
Ten-year-old Tom is different: he hates change, loud noises, and anything red. When he’s sent to spend six weeks with his siblings at their grandparents’ house, he transforms the experience into a full-blown Mars mission. Along the way, Tom discovers unexpected courage, connection, and new sides of himself.

A tender and humorous film about family, neurodiversity, and the power of imagination — perfect for audiences of all ages.

The screening starts at 4:00 PM, but feel free to join us from 3:30 PM for snacks and drinks in the foyer.

Greetings from Mars: Family, 2024, 82 minutes
German with English subtitles
Suitable from 6 years of age.

events.id: Handel's Messiah-Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Handel's Messiah
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, 111 Wakefield Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
Celebrate the festive season with a magnificent performance of Handel’s Messiah on Saturday, 13 December, at 7:30 pm in the Michael Fowler Centre. Presented by Orpheus Choir Wellington in collaboration with Orchestra Wellington, this timeless masterpiece has been a beacon of holiday joy for centuries, blending grandeur, beauty, and drama in equal measure.

Under the direction of Brent Stewart, Music Director of Orpheus Choir Wellington and one of New Zealand’s leading conductors, this performance promises to capture the full brilliance of Handel’s most beloved work. From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.

Joining Brent is a stellar lineup of soloists. Emma Pearson, recognised for her captivating performances on international stages, brings brilliance and artistry. Mezzo-soprano Maaike Christie-Beekman adds depth and warmth with her rich, expressive voice. Rising tenor Lila LJ Crichton contributes freshness and flair, while Lexus Song Quest winner Joel Amosa grounds the quartet with his commanding bass.

The Michael Fowler Centre, renowned for its superb acoustics and stunning architecture, provides the perfect setting for this extraordinary concert. With its sweeping choruses, unforgettable arias, and sheer emotional power, Messiah is the ultimate way to mark the festive season.

Come and join us for an evening of musical brilliance that will have you saying, Hallelujah!

From the exuberance of Worthy is the Lamb to the powerful The Trumpet Shall Sound and the transcendent Hallelujah Chorus, Messiah is a musical journey that inspires and uplifts like no other.

Save the Date: Saturday, December 13!

The rumours are true… after much soul-searching (and to give our neighbours a breather!) The Closet is taking a year off from Kiwiburn. BUT ~ don’t worry the closet doors aren’t closing just yet… we're throwing an end of year party for you all to keep the fruity vibes alive!
We're bringing the pre-burn heat early this year with an epic night at our fabulous friends Champagnaria bar Otto, and we want your beautifully creative minds to help create the party…
Theme TBD >>>>
We want YOU to dream up the wildest, weirdest, most wonderful party themes you can think of. Send us your ideas & the top picks will go to a public vote.
Winner scores two FREE tickets + a bottle of bubbles to pop at the party!
The Lineup so far is already looking epic:
• Seraph – delivering her signature melodic uplifting magic
• Tori – back with the booty-shaking, baddy bass we all crave
• More DJs to be announced soon!
While we won’t be fundraising for the Burn this time, we are raising funds to secure long-term storage for our fabulous clothes & infrastructure… So The Closet can return next year bigger, better, and even more fabulous.
Stay tuned. Start dreaming. Get ready to party like its the end of 2025!

BUT ~ don’t worry the closet doors aren’t closing just yet… we're throwing an end of year party for you all to keep the fruity vibes alive!
Send us your ideas & the top picks will go to a public vote.

events.id: Girls Rock The Boys - Wellington-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Girls Rock The Boys - Wellington
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POWERHOUSE WOMEN SINGERS: CLASSIC ROCK FROM THE BANDS OF MEN: A KICKASS LIVE BAND
Girls Rock the boys is back—bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage.
This time, it’s Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, with a stellar band behind them: Andrew Richardson (drums), Matt Fitzpatrick (bass), Aslan Rowlands (guitar), and Duncan Haynes (keys).
We’re diving deep into the golden era of rock—Journey, Whitesnake, Boston, Foreigner, Rainbow, and Deep Purple, all delivered with the energy of a rugby pitch and the comfort of your favourite dressing gown.
Whether you’re waving your phone torch to Foreigner, headbanging to Rainbow, or playing air guitar to Deep Purple, you’ll find something to do with yourself in every “mini EP” set.
The band are amazing - the singers nail it, and we've added new songs!
Need a breather? The wonders at Underworld will sort you a drink and a plate.
Feedback from our last gig: “Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking—check them out!”
Come and see us - we love it when you do!
🎟️ Early bird tickets just $20. Door sales $30.
💔 A special shout-out to our inaugural bass player, Callum Black, who’s heading overseas. You’ve been an inspiration, Callum. We’ll work to do you proud.

events.id: Stigmata: The Resurrection-Ivy Bar and Cabaret, 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Stigmata: The Resurrection
events.venue: Ivy Bar and Cabaret, 63 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Tired of your usual Christmas themed drag shows and craving something a little more twisted? Back from the dead, Ness Quick brings you Stigmata, the Resurrection. Reject holiday cheer and join us in a celebration of all things sinful, join us as we delve deep into the twisted minds of our artists. From the Devil himself, to his sexy seven sins, all are welcome at Stigmata. So leave the rosary beads and home, and make sure to book a confession with priest beforehand, and come down to Ivy Bar for an evening so ungodly, Saint Nicholas will be leaving coal in your stocking for the rest of your life.

Hosted by Ness Quick,
Featuring;
Cailiah
Faux Femme
Veronica Heart
Miss Gendered
Maxxine Goth
Rocky Rhodes

We strive to provide a safe space for all queer people from all backgrounds. If concerned about the venue, access or any other queeries regarding the show, please send an email to croi.osullivan@gmail.com. You are also welcome to reach out via my Instagram, @theonly_nessquick
Doors open at 9:30 for a 10pm start. No Stag Dos

Ngaio Village Christmas Market
Foxtail Events are bringing the Christmas spirit to Ngaio on Sunday, 14 December 2025 from 10am - 3pm at the Ngaio Town Hall!

events.name: ☕🚨Coffee & Cars 🚨🚘
events.venue: 250 Otaihanga Road, New Zealand 5036,250 Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu 5036, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
☕🚨Coffee & Cars 🚨🚘
🚗☕ FREE EVENT - Coffee & Cars is back for Season 8! 🚗☕

We’re rolling into our eighth season of Coffee & Cars at Southward Car Museum!

Bring your pride and joy, check out an incredible mix of classics, customs, hot rods, and modern favourites - or just come along to enjoy the atmosphere.

📅 Upcoming Dates (weather dependent):

- Sunday 16 November 2025
- Sunday 14 December 2025
- Sunday 11 January 2026
- Sunday 8 February 2026
- Sunday 8 March 2026

🍔 Food & Drinks:
The Southward Coffee Stop is open for drinks & snacks (check out the new Milkshakes & Icies!)
We’ll also have the Coffee Cruisers + Food Trucks on-site plus the ever-popular BBQ Fundraiser - each month run by a different local sports club or organisation, so bring some change to support them.

💙 Look out for our Gulf GT40-inspired donation box near the museum entry!
Coffee & Cars is a FREE event and we love keeping it that way so everyone can come along and enjoy it. But, as you can imagine, it does cost a lot to run each season. If you’d like to help us keep the wheels turning, we’d be so grateful for any contribution - big or small. Every bit of support helps us keep Coffee & Cars running strong for the whole community. Thank you for helping us make this event possible 🙌

🚙 All Cars Welcome – classics, performance, JDM, vintage, muscle, daily drivers… if you love it, bring it.
🚗 Spectator Parking is also available on-site.

⚠️ Please note: There will be no October event this year as the last few October events have been rained off, so we’re looking forward to a dry & sunny start in November!

events.name: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032,91 Ruapehu St, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
Come and be held in a ceremony of sound. Sunday 14th, from 2:22 PM to 4:04 PM at Lotus Yoga, Papamaru, an immersive Sound Journey awaits you.

This is a time and space to breathe, release, and be nurtured by the deep vibrations of medicinal instruments including Didgeridoo, HandPan, Jaw Harps, Shamanic Drone Flute, Shamanic Drum, Mongolian Throat Singing (Sygyt and Khoomei), and more — all amplified and layered through a loop station.

Comfortably lying down, you’ll be guided on a relaxing, clearing, and rejuvenating inner journey. This transformative experience supports your nervous system, helping to release tension and restore calm and presence.

Benefits of Sound Healing
-Mental clarity and emotional balance
-Deep relaxation and revitalization
-Enhanced focus and memoryBetter sleep quality
-Strengthened immune response
-Boosted creativity
-Heightened self-awareness and environmental sensitivity

What to Bring
- Comfortable clothing
- A mattress, pillow, blanket, eye mask — anything to support your full comfort
- Water bottle
- An open heart

Event GuidelinesTo create a held and focused space:
- Please silence your phone before entering
- Arrive on time — we recommend 2:12 for a smooth, grounded start. Doors close at 2:22 PM sharp.

Please book your ticket, place limited !


This offering is part of the Kohael Project, where I (Justin) and fellow co-creators offer well-being practices in exchange for koha or donation — supporting personal transformation and collective healing.
More info : https://kohael.com/Live music and more : https://www.youtube.com/@kohaelproject/playlists https://www.instagram.com/kohaelproject/
Support the project and the Kohael Truck : https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/kohaelprojectonwheels

Thank you for reading, and see you soon

.With gratitude and love,
Justin

events.id: bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON-Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON
events.venue: Meow,17 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON
SATURDAY 13 DECEMBER - HOLLYWOOD AVONDALE, AUCKLAND
SUNDAY 14 DECEMBER - MEOW, WELLINGTON
with support from Ngahere Wafer

“...grungy, gritty, and a bit sexy” - Stereogum
“...swaggering and devastatingly cool” - NME

Hot on the heels of announcing their highly anticipated new album Some Like It Hot, the eternally enigmatic UK post-punk darlings bar italia have also unveiled two huge New Zealand shows for this December, brought to you by Strange News Touring and Banished Music. Saturday 13th of December, the band will take the stage at Auckland’s glorious Hollywood Avondale for an all-ages show, playing Meow in Wellington on Sunday 14th December.

After bursting onto the scene with two incredible albums in a single year - the brilliant Tracey Denim and the noisy niceness of The Twits - bar italia spent the next while earning a reputation as one of the best live bands in the game, including a sold out and sweaty show at Auckland’s Neck of the Woods. Since then, the band have been plotting their next move in world domination, dropping fan favourite single Cowbella in June, and this week lifting the lid on Some Like It Hot with accompanying tune Fundraiser - with a video featuring Matt “Super Hans” King.

The London based band, built around the core of Nina Cristante, Jezmi Tarik Fehmi and Sam Fenton, may have looked to be hiding out this year while cooking up this new batch of tunes, but in reality they’ve been anything but dormant. Cristante teamed up with Yves Tumor for a dangerously good duet on We Don’t Count, while Jezmi and Sam dropped another full-length album under their Double Virgo moniker just last month.

With the album dropping on Matador this October, local fans will have a couple of short months to learn the words and get ready to scream and swoon along when bar italia hit our shores this December. Shit yeah!
events.description:
bar italia 'Some Like It Hot' Tour | WELLINGTON
Saturday 13th of December, the band will take the stage at Auckland’s glorious Hollywood Avondale for an all-ages show, playing Meow in Wellington on Sunday 14th December.

The London based band, built around the core of Nina Cristante, Jezmi Tarik Fehmi and Sam Fenton, may have looked to be hiding out this year while cooking up this new batch of tunes, but in reality they’ve been anything but dormant.
Cristante teamed up with Yves Tumor for a dangerously good duet on We Don’t Count, while Jezmi and Sam dropped another full-length album under their Double Virgo moniker just last month.

events.name: Artisan Craft Market
events.venue: Te Wharewaka o Poneke, Taranaki St Wharf, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Come support local at our monthly market in Wellington City on the Waterfront at Wharewaka O Poneke venue.
