events.id: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Kohael Sound Journey Paraparaumu
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and be held in a ceremony of sound.
Sunday 14th, from 2:22 PM to 4:04 PM at Lotus Yoga, Papamaru, an immersive Sound Journey awaits you.
This is a time and space to breathe, release, and be nurtured by the deep vibrations of medicinal instruments including Didgeridoo, HandPan, Jaw Harps, Shamanic Drone Flute, Shamanic Drum, Mongolian Throat Singing (Sygyt and Khoomei), and more — all amplified and layered through a loop station.
Comfortably lying down, you’ll be guided on a relaxing, clearing, and rejuvenating inner journey. This transformative experience supports your nervous system, helping to release tension and restore calm and presence.
Benefits of Sound Healing
Mental clarity and emotional balance
Deep relaxation and revitalization
Enhanced focus and memory
Better sleep quality
Strengthened immune response
Boosted creativity
Heightened self-awareness and environmental sensitivity
What to Bring
Comfortable clothing
A mattress, pillow, blanket, eye mask — anything to support your full comfort
Water bottle
An open heart
Event Guidelines
To create a held and focused space:
Please silence your phone before entering
Arrive on time — we recommend 2:12 for a smooth, grounded start. Doors close at 2:22 PM sharp.
This offering is part of the Kohael Project, where I (Justin) and fellow co-creators offer well-being practices in exchange for koha or donation — supporting personal transformation and collective healing.
More info : https://kohael.com/
Live music and more : https://www.youtube.com/@kohaelproject/playlists
https://www.instagram.com/kohaelproject/
Support the project and the Kohael Truck : https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/kohaelprojectonwheels
Thank you for reading, and see you soon.
With gratitude and love,
Justin

events.id: Still Not Dead - Rachel McAlpine & The Andrew London Duo-Kapiti Playhouse, 7 Ruahine St, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Still Not Dead - Rachel McAlpine & The Andrew London Duo
events.venue: Kapiti Playhouse, 7 Ruahine St, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
After recovering from a shocking epiphany (OMG I'm getting old!), popular poet Rachel McAlpine started unpicking the mysteries of old age. Results: a best-seller book of poems, How To Be Old. A sell-out play, The Secret Lives of Extremely Old People. A podcast, Learning How To Be Old. And it seems at 85 she's still not done and still not dead. She reads selections.

On the cusp of receiving the mythical Gold Card, satirical songwriter/guitarist Andrew London and partner Kirsten assemble a selection of age-related songs from both original and borrowed repertoires, to compliment Ms McAlpine's meanderings. 'When I'm 64' is almost too obvious to include but...

Could ace harmonica virtuoso Coral Trimmer make a surprise appearance? We think so. You can expect more afternoon events from these people from now on. The bar will be open.

events.id: Bar Italia (UK) 'Some Like It Hot' NZ Tour-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bar Italia (UK) 'Some Like It Hot' NZ Tour
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
SATURDAY 13 DECEMBER - HOLLYWOOD AVONDALE, AUCKLAND
SUNDAY 14 DECEMBER - MEOW, WELLINGTON

“...grungy, gritty, and a bit sexy” - Stereogum
“...swaggering and devastatingly cool” - NME

Hot on the heels of announcing their highly anticipated new album Some Like It Hot, the eternally enigmatic UK post-punk darlings bar italia have also unveiled two huge New Zealand shows for this December, brought to you by Strange News Touring and Banished Music. Saturday 13th of December, the band will take the stage at Auckland’s glorious Hollywood Avondale for an all-ages show, playing Meow in Wellington on Sunday 14th December.

After bursting onto the scene with two incredible albums in a single year - the brilliant Tracey Denim and the noisy niceness of The Twits - bar italia spent the next while earning a reputation as one of the best live bands in the game, including a sold out and sweaty show at Auckland’s Neck of the Woods. Since then, the band have been plotting their next move in world domination, dropping fan favourite single Cowbella in June, and this week lifting the lid on Some Like It Hot with accompanying tune Fundraiser - with a video featuring Matt “Super Hans” King.

The London based band, built around the core of Nina Cristante, Jezmi Tarik Fehmi and Sam Fenton, may have looked to be hiding out this year while cooking up this new batch of tunes, but in reality they’ve been anything but dormant. Cristante teamed up with Yves Tumor for a dangerously good duet on We Don’t Count, while Jezmi and Sam dropped another full-length album under their Double Virgo moniker just last month.

With the album dropping on Matador this October, local fans will have a couple of short months to learn the words and get ready to scream and swoon along when bar italia hit our shores this December. Shit yeah!
Tickets on sale now at Banished Music

events.id: Cryptopsy-Valhalla, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Cryptopsy
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.description:
Valhalla Touring are proud to announce direct from Canada, one of the worlds most brutal Death Metal bands, the mighty CRYPTOPSY, headlining 2 shows to close out the year of 2025, on their ALL SO VILE tour!!!
More than 30 years into their storied career, Montreal Death Metal innovators Cryptopsy return with their ninth studio album, An Insatiable Violence, set for release on June 20, 2025 on Season of Mist.
Revered in extreme Metal circles for such groundbreaking classics as 1994’s Blasphemy Made Flesh and the 1996 magnum opus None So Vile, Cryptopsy find yet another gear on An Insatiable Violence, which further solidifies the band’s place in the upper echelon of Death Metal.
Coming out of the pandemic, the band dedicated themselves to staying on top of their game more than ever before, with the intention of consistently putting out a new record every two years.
That started with 2023’s acclaimed As Gomorrah Burns, which WON them a CANADIAN GRAMMY, and continues 21 months later with An Insatiable Violence.

Āhuru Mōwai Trust Sensory Session - Rebound
Āhuru Mōwai Trust Sensory Sessions are held weekly at Rebound, Playland and Trampoline Park, in Paraparaumu.

When: Mondays (Yes, even in the school holidays!)
Time: 5:30pm-7:30pm
Cost: $10 per family (immediate, not extended)
Who: School aged children with extra and special needs and their parents, guardians, family members, carers, siblings.
Upon entry you will be required to register your attendance.

If you are looking to have a birthday celebration at one of these sessions please txt Paul on 0272787087, or message us in advance. We would also encourage you to make use of a party room to host additional guests (an extra charge would apply to guests)

Come along in any dynamic that suits the family, to these relaxed and open sessions for families and kids living with special needs of all kinds.

Although we cannot cater to everyone's needs, we will do our best to support families to overcome obstacles to attend the sensory sessions.

Please speak with trustees regarding concerns.
(I.D or needs verification may be required at Trustee discretion).
Disclaimer: WE WILL GENTLY AND KINDLY TURN AWAY ANYONE WE FEEL SHOULD NOT BE THERE, AND WE RESERVE THE RIGHT TO DO SO

events.id: Jazz and Beyond Workshops 2025-91 Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Jazz and Beyond Workshops 2025
events.venue: 91 Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Jazz and Beyond for students 19 and under
December 15–18, 2025
Coordinated by Chris Beernink, Dave Wilson, Daniel Hayles, and Lance Philip. Proudly supported by the Tauranga Jazz Society.
Take your playing to the next level at the Jazz and Beyond Workshops! Young musicians from across Aotearoa come together to dive into jazz and connected styles, working closely with some of the country’s leading performers and educators. In a friendly, inclusive environment, you’ll grow your skills, make new musical connections, and learn alongside other students your age from all around the motu.
Here’s what’s in store:
small group ensembles led by professional musicians
developing improvisation skills in supportive settings
an introduction to music production
listening sessions that expand your skills
inclusive jam sessions where all are welcome
ensemble performances at the end of week concert
And more!
If you're 19 or under with at least a year of experience on your instrument or in vocal training, you’re welcome to join. Choose from trumpet, trombone, saxophone, clarinet, flute, bass, piano, guitar, drums, vibraphone, or voice.
The workshops are held at the New Zealand School of Music—Te Kōkī at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. Follow the Jazz and Beyond Workshops on Instagram or Facebook for the latest updates. Email jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com with any questions.
Schedule
The workshops run 9:00am–4:30pm Monday through Thursday, with evening activities including concerts and our inclusive jam sessions Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Students perform in a closing concert on Thursday afternoon.
Accommodation
Students arrange their own accommodation. Often students from outside Wellington stay together in groups with a parent chaperone. Options for housing near Victoria University of Wellington include backpacker hostels and hotels. If you have a group of 15 or more, University Student Housing can been booked at Cumberland House. Contact info for this option is via email at Cumberland-House@vuw.ac.nz or by phone at +64 4 463 4770.
Meals
Lunch for the four days is available for purchase at many convenient locations on campus, or students may bring their own lunch.
Equipment
Provided equipment includes drum kits, guitar and bass amps, pianos/keyboards, microphones and PAs for vocalists.
All brass and wind players should bring their own instruments.
Drummers: you are required to bring your own cymbals, sticks, and hi-hat clutch.
Guitarists and bass players: you are required to bring your own instruments as well as cables (leads).
Preparation
All students with one year of experience on an instrument or in vocal training have the skills required to participate, so no musical preparation is required. On the first day, students will play a very short audition to be placed in an appropriate ensemble. Guidelines for this short audition will be sent to all registered participants in advance of the workshops.
Cost
Early bird price: $325 - register by 19th October
Standard price $350 - after 19th October
Registration is open to all until all spots are filled.
We are dedicated to ensuring all students can participate in the workshops without financial constraints. If the cost poses a barrier, please email us at jazzandbeyondworkshops@gmail.com and we will find a solution to facilitate your participation!

events.id: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - A Starry Christmas-The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - A Starry Christmas
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar, 166 Willis St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

events.id: Teulo Talks: Studio – Where Fashion Meets Technology with Anouk Wipprecht-Level 3/78 Victoria Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Teulo Talks: Studio – Where Fashion Meets Technology with Anouk Wipprecht
events.venue: Level 3/78 Victoria Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Step inside the studio for an exclusive live recording of Teulo Talks: Studio with internationally acclaimed FashionTech designer Anouk Wipprecht.
This intimate session will be filmed in front of a small audience in Wellington, capturing the conversation as part of a special online release coming in January 2026.

By attending, you agree to be part of the live studio audience and may appear on camera.
In this session, Anouk explores the intersection of fashion, technology, and human interaction—sharing how sensors, robotics, and 3D printing are reshaping design.

Limited to 15 guests, this is a rare opportunity to witness a world leader at work and experience how innovation comes to life on the cutting edge of wearable technology.
CPD points will be allocated for the online recording once released.

events.id: Cooking Classes-Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cooking Classes
events.venue: Sheila's Indian Kitchen, Ashton Fitchett Dr, Wellington
events.long_description:
Authentic Indian cooking classes in Wellington with panaromic views over Wellington Harbour.

In each class, you will learn 4-5 recipes like: potato stuff roti, roasted eggplant curry, wholemeal, roti, naan; shahi paneer; dhal, samosa; palak paneer; gourmet chickpeas; vegetable korma; gulab jamun; kheer; mango lassi; masala chai, and many more...

The classes start at 6 pm or 10:30 am on weekends and weekdays with a 2-hour session followed by a dinner or lunch afterwards. The ingredients, copies of recipes, organic karma drink will be provided with a full course meal in a banquet setting. Custom made classes available for gluten free, dairy free and any other food intolerance and dietary requirements.The ingredients, recipes, complimentary organic karma drinks will be provided with a full course meal.

There are 2 to 8 people in each class in purpose built cooking studio. Also a private cooking classes available.

The menu for the class can be:

1) Spicy potato stuffed paratha and roti, rajasthani tomato relish, aalu matter or spicy peas- potato curry, roasted cumin yogurt raita and fresh mint- coriander chutney.

2) Shahi Paneer (cottage cheese cubes with spices and rich tomato-cashew gravy), garlic coriander naan, cumin jeera basmati rice and sweet fragrant rice pudding with cardamom. Also I will teach how to make fresh paneer.

3) Roasted eggplant curry, plain whole wheat chapatti or roti, jeera aaloo or potato curry, Tuar dahl (split yellow lentil) and Basmati rice with homemade pickle.

4) Palak paneer (creamy spinach curry with cubes of paneer), jeera rice (basmati rice with fragrant spices, panjabi chhole or spicy chickpeas curry and mango lassi. Also fresh paneer making.

5) Khadi (chickpeas fritters in yogurt and chickpeas flour soupy gravy), Aloo-Gobhi (cauliflower and potato curry),  savoury wraps with herbs and spices, fresh pickle and basmati rice.

The total cost is $130 per person, this includes ingredient cost. (As an alternative we also sell cooking class gift vouchers.The food options are unlimited and the class provides fresh and best ingredients)
For booking a class please contact indiancooking@xtra.co.nz

Just bring your taste buds! and Enjoy!!

events.id: Last one for 2025 - 16 Dec-Central City, Wellington, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Last one for 2025 - 16 Dec
events.venue: Central City, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

Join the event waitlist if meetings are full - a space often comes up!

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

events.id: Welly On Wheels Kilbirnie - Confidence & Skills for Biking-Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Welly On Wheels Kilbirnie - Confidence & Skills for Biking
events.venue: Switched on Bikes, Wellington Waterfront 15/22 Herd Street, Te Aro, Wellington, Wellington
events.long_description:
Wellington City Council and Pedal Ready are teaming up to run social bike tours of the cycle routes in Kilbirnie and the surrounding area. Build confidence and skills to travel safely and efficiently by paihikara (bike) while getting to know the cycle routes in Kilbirnie!

Rides start and finish at Switched On HQ on the waterfront. A great way to exercise your newfound cycling skills and confidence on a fun social ride!

Please allow 2 hours for the ride. Arrive 30 minutes early if you are renting a bike.

These rides are suitable for people who:
- Know how to ride a bike but aren't yet travelling by bike in the city; or
- Those travelling by bike in the city but would like to gain confidence; or
- Those who want to learn how to use new infrastructure.

Open to riders aged 18+ (or 13+ if accompanied by an adult). Families are also welcome to bring younger children on cargo bikes or bike seats provided themselves. Please enquire directly with Switched on Bikes if you'd like to borrow a bike seat for the tour.

An electric bike is strongly recommended to participate in this ride. Thanks to Switched on Bikes and Wellington City Council, you can rent an electric bike for just $10 if you don't have access to one. Please book that separately here: https://switchedonbikes.rezdy.com/642002/electric-bike-hire-welly-on-wheels

You can either leave the bike with us after the tour and make your own way home (there are regular buses that depart regularly to the city from the Kilbirnie bus depot) or come back with us to Switched On HQ. If you're feeling extra enthusiastic and want to extend your ride overnight, you're welcome to hold onto the bike for free and return it before 9am to Switched on Bikes. You can also hold onto the bike and return it at the end of Thursday at a discounted cost of $...! You can decide what you'd like to do as late as the end of the guided ride on Wednesday.

If you would like to learn to ride a bike away from the road, check out the free Pedal Ready courses on their website. Any pātai (questions) about these tours please get in contact: tours@wcc.govt.nz.

PRIVACY STATEMENT: The information you shared in signing up for this ride is used for booking and safety purposes. Within 14 days after the tour, your name and emergency contact details will be deleted. Other information provided may be stored anonymously to support our project evaluation. Your email address will be stored for up to 4 months following the tour. Within that time, we may contact you with follow-up information about biking in Pōneke, as well as feedback opportunities about the ride and the impact it has had on your travel around Pōneke. You have the right to ask for a copy of any personal information we hold about you and to ask for it to be corrected if you believe it is incorrect. If you would like to ask for a copy of your information or to have it corrected, please contact us at tours@wcc.govt.nz.

events.id: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.long_description:
Fun, family .... and fantasies of fratricide!

The famous first musical written by Andrew LLoyd Weber and Tim Rice as teenagers, still performed around the world today.

Joseph is his father's favourite child. After dad Jacob gives Joseph an amazing coloured coat, his jealous brothers plot to get rid of him - but things don't quite work out as planned and Joseph goes on a big journey which ends in fame, fortune and - in the end, forgiveness.

The original story dates from many hundreds of years ago, Lloyd Webber and Rice created the piece in 1968 and today 1st Gear Productions is bringing a quirky new look to this musical classic.

With an onstage cast of just eight and a live band of five, set in the intimate space of the Gryphon Theatre, it's a fast and funny take on a classic aimed at people of all ages and offering pure fun for the festive season.

events.long_description:
Ryanosaurus New Zealand only tour!
NEWTOWN MOON WELLINTON THURSDAY 18th DECEMBER 2025
TUBS AUDIO SOUND SYSTEM
THIS IS NOT ONE TO BE MISSED! LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE
The Ryanosaurus sound is a monstrous mix of bigbasslines, glitchy soundscapes and emotive melody with a sly playfulness.
The project blurs the line between many genres, but has its soul planted in psytrance. The project begun as a place to release the solo trancework of Ryan Whare from Australia.
With a drive for interesting but crisp and powerful production, the psychedelic trance genre was an instant attraction. Afteryears of cutting his teeth on the Australian circuit and writing with Mr Bill for his duo project Electrocado, Ryan begun releasing Ryanosaurus, and quickly built up a following for his unique style.
He has now had releases on labels around the globe such as; Zenon, Iboga, Kinematic,Merkaba, Hommega, Gravitas and many more. His touring record is extensive across mainstages at many of the nicest festivals around the world and he tours regularly through Australia, Europe and America. Somestand outs being; Boom (Portugal), Ozora (Hungary), LostTheory (Croatia), Universo Parallelo (Brazil), Ozora(Hungary) Freqs Of Nature (Germany), Ozora Brazil, SoulVision (Brazil), Origin (South Africa), Klika Of Happiness(Israel), Park.Art Progressive (Brazil), Adana (Brazil), EarthFrequency (Aus), Psyfari (Aus), Lucid Labrythnth (Aus),Yemaya (Aus), Fractangular (Aus), Earthcore (Aus)

events.id: Capital Blues Presents: BB and the Bullets-13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Capital Blues Presents: BB and the Bullets
events.venue: 13 Pirie Street, Mount Victoria, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
“An authentic, powerful and generous album, which will undoubtedly place BB & The Bullets among the blues rock revelations of the year.” – Zicazic Magazine, France
It’s been a great couple of weeks for dynamic Whanganui blues band BB & THE BULLETS! 
Currently playing their North Island tour, celebrating the international release of their debut album HIGH TIDE from September, the album has achieved impressive traction across Aotearoa’s music soundscape by entering the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Albums at #12 and #5 on the Independent Music NZ Charts!
Landing on both the IMNZ Charts and the Official Aotearoa Music Charts is a cracking result, not just as independent artists, but also for a blues-rock outfit, demonstrating that it’s a genre that can successfully cross both indie and conventional charts, appealing to both grassroots and mainstream audiences – an outcome that the band is thrilled about.
“It’s a great result! We are so proud to be #5 on the IMNZ Chart. Independent artists are the grassroots and lifeblood of Kiwi music. And there’s only been a few local indie blues-rock albums on the Official Aotearoa Music Charts over the last decade – our mate Grant Haua in 2022, and Troy Kingi in 2016, so we’re stoked to be here and rep the Blues in 2025!”
The tight, three piece blues rock outfit of band members Brad McMillan (drums), Stu Duncan (bass), and Brian Baker (guitar / vocals)  have garnered a reputation for their powerful and moving live performances, drawing comparisons to Stevie Ray Vaughan, Johnny Winter, Peter Green and Jeff Beck, while firmly putting their own stamp on the timeless medium that is the blues.
BB & The Bullets have released three well received singles to date off the album: debut single ‘Something In The Water’; album title track ‘High Tide’; and their blues-soaked rendition of the Beatles classic ‘I Want You (She’s So Heavy)’ which is a huge fan favourite at their live shows. To date, all three singles have enjoyed some excellent blues radio attention, including airplay on Radio New Zealand and around the country, as well as in Germany, USA, and Canada, with ‘High Tide’ charting at #4 on Roots Music Charts in Australia, achieving #1 on the Roots Music Report Blues Album Chart, #1 on the Blues Rock Album Chart and three songs on the Blues Singles chart.
Home country of their label Dixiefrog Records has plenty of great things to say about BB & The Bullets, with Paris Move Magazine giving the album a very favourable review, ranking it as a ‘red heart’ favourite, as has French outlet Zicazic Magazine, and the title track single ‘High Tide’ has made the weekly playlist of Rolling Stone Magazine, France.
“This album proves to be a declaration of love to the roots of the blues, driven by striking live energy and unabashed virtuosity.” – Zicazic Magazine, France
With a well-deserved reputation for their compelling live shows, BB & The Bullets audiences are always wowed by the power and intensity of their performances.
With this chart action, it is evident that the blues scene is alive and vibrant on Antipodean shores, grab your mates and don’t miss your chance to check out a blues-rock experience like no other with BB & The Bullets!

events.id: Sexy Ghost of Xmas Boy-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Sexy Ghost of Xmas Boy
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.long_description:
The silly season spin-off of the legendary Sexy Ghost Trilogy, creator George Fenn presents an unmissable Christmas performance to warm the hearts of Wellington's worn wretches to remind them of the true meaning of Christmas: Dystopic Consumerism.

This interactive experience combines elements of clown and burlesque to make an unmissable wordless comedy.

Tickets $30 waged / $20 unwaged.

“The Sexy Ghost of Xmas Boy has been unlike anything I have ever experienced and it has been so much fun! My stomach hurts from laughing non-stop for an hour along with every other person in the audience. Fenn has given us sexy, unhinged chaos and camaraderie, and has definitely warmed our cold winter hearts!” - Ayla Chamberlain, Theatreview

“A theatrical alchemist, Fenn has the rare talent to create something utterly ridiculous yet very clever.” - Rosheen FitzGerald, Theatreview

This event is strictly R18, it contains sexual themes and nudity down to underwear.

Professional Bull Riders presents PBR NZ . . . the toughest sport on dirt!

Making it's New Zealand debut this December at Manfeild Stadium in Feilding.

PBR NZ will feature bull riders competing to win the Tasman Cup. The PBR Tasman Cup is a high-stakes international bull riding showdown between Team Australia and Team New Zealand. This electrifying event showcases fierce competition, national pride, and elite athleticism as both teams go head-to-head in a battle for glory. Every ride counts in this winner-takes-all contest.

events.id: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 26- 44 by Cheeky Events Australia-The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Speed Dating for ages 26- 44 by Cheeky Events Australia
events.venue: The Arborist Rooftop Bar,166 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Speed Dating for ages 26- 44 by Cheeky Events Australia
Get ready for a night of fun and connection at Wellington's hottest speed dating event!

About this Event

Let’s ditch the apps together and embrace real connections. Say goodbye to the dating apps and hello to your very own Cheeky Love Story! 💖
🍸 What’s included: Your first drink is on us—let’s toast to great company!
👇How It Works:
Before the event:Make sure to download the Cheeky Events App (free on Google Play & the App Store) to set up your profile and upload a photo.
P.S. Don’t worry—it’s not a dating app! We’ve skipped the chat feature because we’re all about real, in-person connections.
During the event:
Check in to grab your name tag and free drink token. 🍻
Arrive on time to enjoy 15 minutes of casual pre-mingling.
Ladies stay seated while men rotate every 5 minutes—don’t forget to rate your matches in the app! 👍👎
Take a quick 15-minute break before the next round.
After the rotations, feel free to stick around for some extra socializing!
After the event: Stay for extra mingling and check the app for your cheeky matches 12 hours later! 📱💖
For more details, check out our blog: What to expect
Who knows? You might just find your next spark! ✨ Our IRL singles events (single mixers and speed dating events) are happening across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! 🌏

About Cheeky Events
We host fun, inclusive singles events across Australia, New Zealand, London, and NYC! Whether you’re in your 20s, over 40, looking for love, or just looking to meet new people, our events are designed to bring people together. Whether you’re seeking romance, new friendships, or even networking, we’ve got something for everyone!
👉 Follow us on Instagram:@cheekyeventsaustralia @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekyeventsnewzealand @cheekyeventsukandireland @cheekeventsus
Visit our website: www.cheekyevents.net or download the Cheeky Events app to get started.
We can’t wait to see you at one of our events soon! 🕺💃
#speeddating

Kai Tahi Kiwiana Christmas Market
🎄 Kai Tahi Kiwiana Christmas Market 🎄
Saturday, 20 December 2025 | 10am - 3pm

Get into the festive spirit with a day of Christmas shopping, local art & craft stalls, delicious kai, and family fun! 🎁✨

* Browse unique gifts at our artisan market
* Treat yourself to tasty food & drinks from Kai Tahi vendors
* Grab a cold one from Get Fixed Bicycle Cafe or Abandoned Brewery 🍻

North Pole Express Kapiti 2025
The North Pole Express is back in 2025!

SUBSCRIBER PRE-SALE 25 JUNE 2025
PUBLIC TICKET SALE FROM 1 SEPTEMBER 2025
Get your tickets or sign up for the “Nice List” at: ontrackevents.co.nz

Families love the magical train ride in one of the beautifully decorated carriages, you’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.

Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express and delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a two hour long round-trip journey to see Santa!

COCOA CLASS – General Admission – $79 per passenger
CANDY CLASS – $91 per passenger

**Children under 2 and travelling on the knee of an adult are Free - please select "Under 2 years" at time of ticketing.

The Two Hour Round Trip includes: Entertainers, Carolling, Iced Cocoa & Cookies, Souvenir Mug, Santa Visit, Special Gift and Extra surprises on the way.

Also check out other Workshops in Paraparaumu.

events.name: VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN
Come and join Bryony from Heartsong Healing for a powerful Vision Board and Voice Empowerment experience as we move through the energy of the Celtic festival of the Summer Solstice!

This is a Women's Day Retreat.

This workshop includes powerfully transformative Voice and Energy practices which support manifestation of your dreams and visions.

New dreams, new possibilities and celebrations, all seen within the light and power of this powerful portal. Invoke the Source of healing, growth and positive change and new beginnings.

#vsionboard #creativity #healing #specialtimes #transformation

JOIN US FOR A DAY OF DEEP CREATIVE DIVING INTO OUR VISIONS - with specially chosen and composed healing songs, chants, conscious sound practices.

These are enjoyed alongside intuitive drawing, collage and fully guided vision board creation. All of this will be held within a sacred space of Spiritual connection, ritual and energy work.

We will make this sacred space in our lives to explore, clarify and strengthen our visions for our lives, for our selves, for our fullest and highest embodiment on this beautiful and precious Earth.

Saturday 20th December 2025 10am-4.30pm

This special day retreat will draw on the strong astrological energies available at this time, connect with our Spirit teams and Angelic forces and channel in the creative and opening force of Blessing, Balance and Alignment.

Through valuing what we are harvesting in our lives we make space for the next step, the new direction, the new possibility.

Supported by meditation and a guided practice we will each create a new image or personal vision board to focus us and assist us in drawing new energies into our lives as we move further into the new year. We will then use wonderful voice and extremely powerful energy practices, and healing songs, to strengthen and empower them and bring them closer to manifestation.

The day includes a powerful group Reiki healing session, Specialized Voice exercises, supporting materials and follow up resources and support. You will be nourished with a delicious, healthy, fully organic lunch and refreshments

Full day experience investment - $233 (limited number of concessionary places available).

BOOK HERE -
https://buy.stripe.com/eVa03P53w3cJboQ7tH

Contact Bryony at or call or text 02041010684 with any questions and for a no-obligation conversation

events.id: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day-Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Rewa Rewa Station Craft Day
events.venue: Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton
events.description:
Our on farm Craft Open Days are aimed primarily at knitters, spinners, crocheters and other fibre crafters.
Romney, Corriedale cross Romney, Polwarth & Gotland sheep provide the fleeces to create fibre products for crafters which are sold via the Rewa Rewa Station website, and at Fibre Markets.
Our Craft Days give you an opportunity to work on your own project, seek advice, learn a new fibre skill or maybe just spend time with fellow fibre crafters while potentially ticking off a project or two in the process.
Please bring your knitting, crocheting, spinning , hand sewing, or any project you are working on and enjoy a drive in the country!
Everyone is welcome the more the merrier!

events.id: Taste Kāpiti-Otaihanga Road, 5036, NZ,115 Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu 5036, New Zealand, Paraparaumu-All Events In
events.name: Taste Kāpiti
events.venue: Otaihanga Road, 5036, NZ,115 Otaihanga Rd, Otaihanga, Paraparaumu 5036, New Zealand, Paraparaumu
events.long_description:
Taste Kāpiti
Celebrate your year with Taste!
A boutique beverage mini fest created to celebrate the unique flavours and producers of Aotearoa’s regions.

With successful events in Whanganui, Kāpiti, and now Tauranga, each Taste Festival is thoughtfully curated to bring together local producers, food trucks and live music in a beautiful outdoor setting.
Founded and run by event professionals with a passion for local culture and connection, Taste K`apiti is a high-quality food and drink experience in a vibrant and relaxed setting that doubles as a perfect end-of-year celebration for friends & families, teams & businesses.
Want to elevate your Taste experience? Check out our VIP/Corporate tickets/tables.
Includes:
A festive lunch, two signature cocktails, and access to our exclusive VIP area – complete with premium seating, shade, and great vibes.
Join us on the beautiful waterfront to eat well, drink local, and celebrate the best of the season!

You may also like the following events from Taste Whanganui:

events.description:

A boutique beverage mini fest created to celebrate the unique flavours and producers of Aotearoa’s regions.
With successful events in Whanganui, Kāpiti, and now Tauranga, each Taste Festival is thoughtfully curated to bring together local producers, food trucks and live music in a beautiful outdoor setting.
Check out our VIP/Corporate tickets/tables.
Join us on the beautiful waterfront to eat well, drink local, and celebrate the best of the season!

events.id: North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025-Paraparaumu Train Station,Amohia St, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025
events.venue: Paraparaumu Train Station,Amohia St, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Saturday, 20 December 2025
Be whisked away on the North Pole Express to meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.

About this Event


Public sales commence 1 September 2025.
Nice List presale: 12pm, 25 June 2025 - 5pm, 1 July 2025. Password required.
No tickets will be held during presale, any remaining tickets will be offered to the public from 12pm on 1 September 2025. To join the 'Nice List' visit the .
If you would like to purchase a private carriage for your group on this service, please email prior to 15 June 2025.



Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Your tickets include:
Entertainers
Carolling
Iced cocoa
Cookies
Souvenir Mug
A special souvenir from Santa
Santa
Extra surprises along the way
Our Candy Class and Claus Class Guests travel in comfort and receive extra treats along the way.


Prepare to be surrounded by the magic and wonder of the Christmas season!
Families will love the magical train ride in one of our specially decorated carriages. You’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.
Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express. Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
From the distance the North Pole Express arrives then the train Conductors invite you and the other passengers to climb aboard shouting “All aboard!”.


All Aboard
During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
You’ll meet the conductor, and join in the fun singing and dancing with your hosts and a few other characters who will appear in your carriage on the journey.
At the 'North Pole' Cocoa Class passengers enjoy their iced chocolate from their souvenir mug, and a delicious cookie served by our North Pole Express hosts. Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
Along the journey Santa appears in your carriage to present each passenger with their very own Christmas ornament. During the trip, characters in each carriage lead passengers in carolling and entertainment as the train makes its way back home.
Children UNDER 2 years (0-23 months) and travelling on the lap of an Adult are FREE. All Passengers 2 years old and over must hold a purchased ticket.

Please note: Seating in our Candy and Claus Classes is strictly limited. Candy and Claus Class Guests receive some extra surprises and treats along the way.
Seating in all carriages is arranged in a configuration of 4 seats as per normal train travel. NPE always endeavour to ensure those who book more than 4 seats are seated in close proximity to each other to ensure they can enjoy the experience together. Children under the age of 2 and travelling on the lap of an adult travel for free.
Wheelchair access: Due to the age and design of the carriages it is not possible to board whist seated in a wheelchair as the entrance is stairs and the doorways are very narrow. However we will be pleased to convey passengers of limited mobility whenever possible provided they can step onto the train from the platform, climbing a step and move to their reserved seats with the help of an able bodied carer. Our crew would assist guiding the passenger up the step onto the train and arrange for the storage of the wheelchair in the guards van. The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train. Please let us know when booking if you need wheelchair assistance.

Photo credit: John Bovis
events.description:
Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
All Aboard During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train.

events.id: Artisan Craft Market-Christmas on the Lawn-Riddiford Gardens, Laings Road, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Artisan Craft Market-Christmas on the Lawn
events.venue: Riddiford Gardens, Laings Road, Lower Hutt, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Artisan Craft Market has been asked to work together to supply craft stalls for the POP UP CAROLS event that is to be run in conjunction with Nick Tansleys pop up carols caravan, some food trucks and hutt city council.
A lovely grass space near the lower hutt library- anzac gardens in the lower grassed area to fill with amazing local creators. Come enjoy Woderful Christmas carols, and celebrate a festive atmosphere in Hutt City.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

Potters House Porirua Presents: The Merry Christmas Concert 2025

Free Entry | Live Music | Major Prize Draw | Family-Friendly Event

Potters House Porirua invites you to a powerful and uplifting Christmas Concert on Saturday, 20 December at 6:00 PM.
This is a community night filled with music, hope, and the true meaning of Christmas — open to all ages and completely free.

What to Expect
• Live Christmas music and carols
• Real stories of hope and personal transformation
• Family-friendly atmosphere
• Christmas photo booth
• Free entry for everyone

Major Door Prize

Every attendee receives an entry into the draw to win a brand-new Breville Duo-Temp Pro Coffee Machine (Valued at $599).
Additional spot prizes will also be given out throughout the night.

Event Details

Date: Saturday, 20 December
Time: 6:00 PM
Venue: Potters House Porirua
Address: 28 Warspite Avenue, Cannons Creek, Porirua

Why Attend?

This concert brings together live music, heartfelt stories, and a strong sense of community. It is an opportunity to celebrate the season, enjoy a memorable evening, and hear a message of hope and purpose.

More Information

Visit: poriruachurch.nz

events.id: Banks Arcade | NU Zealand Tour 2025-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Banks Arcade | NU Zealand Tour 2025
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
After a massive few years that have seen them support global heavyweights like Highly Suspect, Northlane, and The Plot in you as well as selling out headline shows across Australia and New Zealand, Banks Arcade are coming home this December for two unmissable nights.
 On December 19 and December 20, the genre-bending powerhouse will return to New Zealand stages, bringing their explosive live energy and fierce catalogue of anthems back to where it all began.
 Joining them are their good friends in Ocean Grove, known for their wild, genre-defying live shows, and rising heavy hitters No Life, setting the tone for a night of chaos. 
 Don't miss this chance to see one of the fastest-rising forces in NZ heavy music up close and personal.
 🎟 Tickets are on sale now — get in quick, these will move fast.


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: White Christmas - a Cocktail Soirée-Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: White Christmas - a Cocktail Soirée
events.venue: Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Welcome to White Christmas. A festive night out - minus the clichés.
All the sparkle, candlelight, and Christmas magic - just better dressed.
We’re turning Whisky & Wood into a modern Christmas soirée dressed in white, cream, and crimson (with a touch of gold). Think curated cocktails, sharp fits, and that “last big night before the holidays” kind of energy.
Expect a room full of style, a soundtrack that starts perfect for catching up and ends on the dancefloor, and cocktails that taste as good as they look.
Whether you’re still in Welly or sneaking back for one more night out, this is your reason to celebrate the year - properly.
What to Expect
✨ DJs and live music - smooth early, party late
🍸 Curated festive cocktails & premium bites
📸 Photo moments (because you’ll look too good not to)
🎁 Tiered tickets for those who want more than the standard night out
Tickets
🎟 General Admission - $59 Early Bird / $69 Final
Entry, light festive bites, a welcome glass of bubbly, and entertainment all night.
💎 Premium Experience - $95 Early Bird / $109 Final
Everything in GA plus a 2-hour open bar (7:30-9:30PM; select RTDs, beers, wines + 2 festive cocktails), a reserved leaner or table, and a small take-home gift.
✨ A reserved leaner or table awaits - just tell us who you’re celebrating with when you book.
Dress Code
White and cream with hints of red or gold - refined, stylish, and photo-ready. A little sparkle never hurts.
Music
Early evening DJ set, live music 8:30-9:30PM, then the DJs take it up a notch.
⚠️ Responsible service applies - one drink per person at a time.
⚠️ Strictly an 18+ event.

events.id: Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party-Abandoned Taproom Petone,38 Fitzherbert Street, Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party
events.venue: Abandoned Taproom Petone,38 Fitzherbert Street, Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party
Come enjoy the release of Halcyon Drift's new album Fading Light!!

About this Event

Steve, Matt, Matthew, and Gregor from Halcyon Drift are thrilled to partner with The Abandoned Taproom in Petone to share our life's work with you, through our newly released album, Fading Light!!
Produced by our great friend and collaborator Craig Sengelow, the album features 12 of our favourite tracks, capturing the essence of everything we've poured into this journey.
We'll be performing the album in full, track by track, followed by a set of our best-loved songs from the rest. This is going to ROCK.
We're also excited to be joined by Jed Symonds our support act. A talented singer-guitarist who's been performing for six years, Jed’s music draws from his roots in country and expands into the gritty energy of 90s alternative and rock. He’s currently carving his path through live performances, and we’re stoked to have him open the night.
Let’s give Jed a warm welcome and show him your full support!
Note, there is an option to purchase on a vinyl copy of Fading Light when you purchase your ticket to the event.

events.long_description:
For the first time in 10 years, father and son reunite on stage. PapaSon brings together Matiu and his talented, well-known musician son Nikau from Casual Healing, weaving generations of sound into one unforgettable night.
Expect deep grooves, soulful harmonies, and rhythms that move body and spirit. A celebration of aroha, whānau, and music that heals, this is a rare chance to witness their beats, voices, and wairua blend live under one roof.
📍 Paekākāriki Hall
🎶 Beats, grooves, harmonies & love for all present.
One night only – come be part of the story.

events.id: The Wellington Comedy Club with Ben Hurley and Friends-The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Wellington Comedy Club with Ben Hurley and Friends
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.long_description:
The Wellington Comedy Club Christmas Special heads to the Fringe Bar, with guest MC Ben Hurley

Ben Hurley - As seen on The Project, Seven Sharp, and more
With a massive but hugely likeable stage presence, Hurley can win over even the toughest room. A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.

Featuring:

Cori Gonzalez-Macuer
7 Days regular and star of What We Do In The Shadows, Cori Gonzalez-Macuer has been performing his unique brand of self-deprecating observational and deadpan comedy since 2003.

Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee
Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian. She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest. She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.

Kipling DC - 2026 Billy T Award nominee
Kipling is the self proclaimed ‘Big Dog’ of Wellington comedy. This jack russell with a microphone uses his quick wit and killer crowdwork to leave his audiences in stitches and constantly guessing about what’s coming next.

Mo Munn is a multi-award-winning stand-up comedian, improviser and writer based in Wellington, New Zealand.
A regular on the professional stand-up circuit in Pōneke, Mo has taken shows to the NZ International Comedy Festival, NZ Fringe Festival, NZ Improv Festival and Chicago iO Festival.

This event made possible with support from Pub Charities Ltd, and Wellington City Council

Helping raise funds for the 2026 Wellington Comedy season, including the Wellington Comedy Club Rainbow showcase, and the 2026 Wellington Raw Comedy Quest

A sharp improvisational mind and well honed original material make Hurley a popular act with audiences and critics alike.
Lesa Macleod-Whiting - 2025 Billy T Award nominee Lesa is a Wellington-based writer, improviser and comedian.
She has been a regular on the Wellington improv scene since 2016 and began doing stand-up in July 2020, going on to nab the Runner Up spot at the Wellington Raw Comedy Quest.
She has a penchant for characters, accents and fast-paced silliness.

events.id: Martinborough Lavender Sky Experience - Exclusive-Ranui Essentials, 284c Dry River Road, Martinborough-Event Finder
events.name: Martinborough Lavender Sky Experience - Exclusive
events.venue: Ranui Essentials, 284c Dry River Road, Martinborough
events.long_description:
Exclusive evening - Discover the Magic of Martinborough Nights!

Join us for an extraordinary evening of lavender picking and stargazing. Immerse yourself in the breathtaking night sky.
Our expert Astronomy Guides from 'Under the Stars' will lead you through the constellations, making the night sky come alive.

Watch the sun set over the lavender fields, pick your own bunch of lavender, and explore our charming lavender shop.
Indulge in delightful lavender treats that will tantalize your taste buds.

Limited tickets available – only 20 per night!

Entry: $80 per Adult and $50 Children under 18 years (includes stargazing, lavender flowers and treats)

Please note: No pets and no smoking allowed.

In case of unfavorable stargazing conditions, we will contact you on the day to offer a refund or reschedule.

events.id: Aerial Arts Silks Practical, IN PERSON, Wellington, NZ-SWPT,10 Lydney Pl S, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Aerial Arts Silks Practical, IN PERSON, Wellington, NZ
events.venue: SWPT,10 Lydney Pl S, Porirua City Centre, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Aerial Arts Silks Practical, IN PERSON, Wellington, NZ
Aerial Arts starts at the very beginning, teaching instructors everything they need to know about correct placement and technique so their students will have the building blocks to progress safely from one level to the next.

Aerial Arts Teacher Training and Certification courses provide extensive training in spotting and progression so the teachers feel confident, knowledgeable and inspired to teach Aerial Arts.

This course is offered in person and delivers the hands-on spotting and instruction of the syllabus from Primary to Level 6. For this course, you will be required to attend in person. Demonstrators will be provided by the host studio: you are welcome to bring a student of your own.

During the course you will:

-Learn to spot and teach the 7 levels of Aerial Arts syllabus; Primary - Level 6 including Strength, Technique, Balance, Drops / Slides, and Climbing

-Understand the teaching and spotting requirements of each level

-Learn how to safely teach and spot each skill in the syllabus

-Review anatomy and stability exercises to assist in the training of Aerial Arts

-Review safety and rigging tips for Aerial Arts

-Review how to maintain your apparatus

-Learn how to implement Aerial Arts lesson plans

Pre-requisites:

Teachers must have successfully completed Aerial Arts Silks Theory prior to attending this course.

Teachers must be a minimum of 16 years old to attend the course. Full certification will not be granted until the teacher turns 18.

Assuming successful completion of the exams, the teacher will be granted ‘Assistant Teacher’ status from age 16-17 and can teach classes with a certified teacher in the same room. Upon turning 18, full certification will automatically be granted.

Info + registration: https://www.acrobaticarts.com/training-courses/silks-practical-in-person/1801

During the course you will: -Learn to spot and teach the 7 levels of Aerial Arts syllabus; Primary - Level 6 including Strength, Technique, Balance, Drops / Slides, and Climbing -Understand the teaching and spotting requirements of each level -Learn how to safely teach and spot each skill in the syllabus -Review anatomy and stability exercises to assist in the training of Aerial Arts -Review safety and rigging tips for Aerial Arts -Review how to maintain your apparatus -Learn how to implement Aerial Arts lesson plans Pre-requisites: Teachers must have successfully completed Aerial Arts Silks Theory prior to attending this course.
Full certification will not be granted until the teacher turns 18.

events.id: Christmas Market at The Pines!-The Pines,50 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Christmas Market at The Pines!
events.venue: The Pines,50 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Christmas Market at The Pines!
🎄✨ It’s Beginning to Look a Lot Like Christmas… at The Pines Market! ✨🎄

Foxtail Events is thrilled to bring the magic back with the Christmas Market at The Pines — and this year, it's going to be more festive, more sparkly, and more joyful than ever!

Step into a holiday wonderland filled with twinkling lights, merry music, and the scent of cinnamon, pine, and freshly baked goodies wafting through the air. This is your chance to soak up all the Christmas cheer while checking off your gift list in the most magical way possible.

What’s waiting for you:

✨ Handcrafted gifts, festive homewares & stocking stuffers
🎄 Beautiful Christmas decorations & ornaments
🕯️ Locally made candles, art, and seasonal scents
🍬 Sweet treats, baked goods & edible delights
🧤 Cosy crafts, knitwear & holiday treasures
🍹 Festive cocktails and delicious bites from the bar
🎅 Plus, surprise appearances from some jolly holiday characters!

Support incredible local artisans and creators while you sip, shop, and soak in the warm, welcoming vibes of this magical market. Whether you’re searching for that perfect handmade gift, a little Christmas sparkle for your home, or just want a jolly good time with your friends and whānau — this is the event of the season!

📅 Sunday, 21 December 2025
🕐 1PM – 6PM
📍 The Pines, Houghton Bay, Wellington

So dig out your Christmas jumpers, grab your crew, and join us for a day of festive fun, unique finds, and holiday cheer.

🎄✨ The Pines Christmas Market — it’s the most wonderful time of the year, wrapped into one magical afternoon. ✨🎄

#ThePinesChristmasMarket #FoxtailEvents #ChristmasInWellington #SupportLocalNZ #FestiveVibesOnly #MerryAndBright

events.id: Titahi Bay Christmas Fair-Kura Street Park . Titahi Bay, New Zealand 5022,6 Kura St, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: Titahi Bay Christmas Fair
events.venue: Kura Street Park . Titahi Bay, New Zealand 5022,6 Kura St, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
Titahi Bay Christmas Fair
Welcome to the annual Titahi Bay Christmas Fair, join us on the 21st December at Kura Park, Titahi Bay from 10am to 3pm for a fun family day out just on Christmas.

Our gold coin gate fundraiser this year is Wellington Free Ambulance, look out for the buckets at the gates, please dig a little deep every dollar helps.

We have a great selection of children's entertainment rides and over 160 stallholders showcasing their quality artisan crafted goods.

Fair day is a good time top stock up on those sauces and condiments, crackers from our local artisan food stalls for the BBQ season or as gifts this Christmas.

Join us for brunch/lunch with over 30 foodies covering every corner of the globe to tempt those taste buds.

Friendly reminder to bring some cash as some stalls and foodies do not have eftpos and we are some distance to the nearest atm .

See you on the 21st December






Also check out other Nonprofit events in Porirua.

events.id: A Spell Before Christmas-Little Theatre, 2 Queens Dr, Lower Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: A Spell Before Christmas
events.venue: Little Theatre, 2 Queens Dr, Lower Hutt
events.long_description:
Everything is running smoothly in Santa’s workshop this year — the toys are built, the reindeer are ready, the cookies are baked, and even the elves are behaving (for once!). But trouble is never far away…
Curious Buddy, the elf on a shelf, discovers a dusty old bottle marked “DO NOT OPEN.” Of course, he opens it and out bursts a magical spell that shatters into tiny sparkles, floating through the workshop and before long Freezle and Elfis are back to their naughty ways!
Can Santa, the Christmas Fairy, and the rest of the gang catch the spell before it causes too much chaos? Or will Christmas unravel quicker than Buddy can eat a gingerbread man?
Packed with laughter, songs, and festive magic, A Spell Before Christmas is a hilarious pantomime treat for the whole family and grab a photo with Santa and the elves after the show!

events.id: Christmas Carols 2025 - Back At Brewtown!-Brewtown, 27 Blenheim St, Upper Hutt-Event Finder
events.name: Christmas Carols 2025 - Back At Brewtown!
events.venue: Brewtown, 27 Blenheim St, Upper Hutt
events.long_description:
Due to massive demand we're excited to announce that Christmas Carols are BACK AT BREWTOWN!

We missed you all so much last year that we couldn't go another without bringing you the best Christmas Carols experience in Upper Hutt!

So get ready to rock out with Nick Tansley and his Christmas Caravan…and there may even be a visit from the big guy in the red suit himself.

We've teamed up with the excellent folk at Alliance Fire & Security and Empire Roofing Ltd & Construction to be able to make this FREE to attend! How is awesome is that!

Gather the crew, the Carols are fun for the whole Whanau - gates open at 1pm, show kicks off at 2pm.

Deck chairs are all good.
No picnic blankets please (to make sure there is plenty of space for everyone!)
No outside food and drinks (except water bottles) we'll have plenty of local foodies for you to enjoy and the Brewtown Bar pouring a refreshing range of beverages.

Check out the work of our partners

Roofing Company Upper Hutt, Wellington - Empire Roofing - https://empireroofing.nz/

Alliance – Fire and Security - https://www.alliancefs.co.nz/

events.id: North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Sunday, 21 December 2025-Paraparaumu Train Station,Amohia St, Paraparaumu, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Sunday, 21 December 2025
events.venue: Paraparaumu Train Station,Amohia St, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
North Pole Express Kapiti: 1pm - Sunday, 21 December 2025
Be whisked away on the North Pole Express to meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.

About this Event


Public sales commence 1 September 2025.
Nice List presale: 12pm, 25 June 2025 - 5pm, 1 July 2025. Password required.
No tickets will be held during presale, any remaining tickets will be offered to the public from 12pm on 1 September 2025. To join the 'Nice List' visit the .
If you would like to purchase a private carriage for your group on this service, please email prior to 15 June 2025.



Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Your tickets include:
Entertainers
Carolling
Iced cocoa
Cookies
Souvenir Mug
A special souvenir from Santa
Santa
Extra surprises along the way
Our Candy Class and Claus Class Guests travel in comfort and receive extra treats along the way.


Prepare to be surrounded by the magic and wonder of the Christmas season!
Families will love the magical train ride in one of our specially decorated carriages. You’ll meet Santa, sing, and celebrate this special time of year.
Set to the sounds of carols passengers are invited to join us to be whisked away on the North Pole Express. Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
From the distance the North Pole Express arrives then the train Conductors invite you and the other passengers to climb aboard shouting “All aboard!”.


All Aboard
During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
You’ll meet the conductor, and join in the fun singing and dancing with your hosts and a few other characters who will appear in your carriage on the journey.
At the 'North Pole' Cocoa Class passengers enjoy their iced chocolate from their souvenir mug, and a delicious cookie served by our North Pole Express hosts. Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
Along the journey Santa appears in your carriage to present each passenger with their very own Christmas ornament. During the trip, characters in each carriage lead passengers in carolling and entertainment as the train makes its way back home.
Children UNDER 2 years (0-23 months) and travelling on the lap of an Adult are FREE. All Passengers 2 years old and over must hold a purchased ticket.

Please note: Seating in our Candy and Claus Classes is strictly limited. Candy and Claus Class Guests receive some extra surprises and treats along the way.
Seating in all carriages is arranged in a configuration of 4 seats as per normal train travel. NPE always endeavour to ensure those who book more than 4 seats are seated in close proximity to each other to ensure they can enjoy the experience together. Children under the age of 2 and travelling on the lap of an adult travel for free.
Wheelchair access: Due to the age and design of the carriages it is not possible to board whist seated in a wheelchair as the entrance is stairs and the doorways are very narrow. However we will be pleased to convey passengers of limited mobility whenever possible provided they can step onto the train from the platform, climbing a step and move to their reserved seats with the help of an able bodied carer. Our crew would assist guiding the passenger up the step onto the train and arrange for the storage of the wheelchair in the guards van. The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train. Please let us know when booking if you need wheelchair assistance.

Photo credit: John Bovis
events.description:
Join The Magical Journey to meet Santa!
Delight in the magic of Christmas as the train departs for a journey to collect Santa who has been magically transported to an undisclosed location along the tracks.
All Aboard During the first leg of the journey wide-eyed children of all ages are invited to engage with characters who are eager to hear what makes the Christmas season special to them.
Candy and Claus Class passengers will be served aboard the train on the way to the North Pole.
The wheelchair must be able to be folded up and cannot be used on the train.

events.id: Michelangelo — A Different View-Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre-Wellington NZ
events.name: Michelangelo — A Different View
events.venue: Tākina Wellington Convention and Exhibition Centre
events.long_description:
There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.

events.long_description:
Christmas Buffet at Oak & Vine Wellington
Christmas plans? We’ve got you covered. Join us for a festive buffet on Christmas Eve or Christmas Day at Oak & Vine Wellington.

About this Event


🎄 Christmas Eve Lunch & Christmas Day Dinner at Oak & Vine Wellington
Oysters, sizzling grills, glazed ham and festive desserts. Christmas tastes better when someone else does the cooking.
Join us for a relaxed celebration at Oak & Vine Wellington with a generous buffet and a two-hour drinks package including house wines, beer and soft drinks. Start with a glass of bubbly and a freshly shucked oyster, then explore live grill stations, a curated charcuterie spread, seasonal salads and indulgent mains. Save room for dessert — we’re serving pavlovas, chocolate fondue and Christmas pudding with brandy sauce.
Whether you're joining us for lunch on Christmas Eve or dinner on Christmas Day, expect good food, good company and zero washing up.
Event Details
📅 Christmas Eve Lunch: Wednesday 24 December 2025
🕒 12:30PM to 3PM
📅 Christmas Day Dinner: Thursday 25 December 2025
🕒 6PM to 8:30PM
💰 $169 per adult | $59 per child (ages 5–12)
Location
Oak & Vine Wellington, Oaks Wellington Hotel
89 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington, 6011
Questions?
Email our events team at





CHRISTMAS BUFFET MENU
Includes house wines, beer & soft drinks
Glass of bubbly with freshly shucked oyster with mignonette dressing & lemon on arrival

APPETIZERS
Cream of Mushroom Soup
Earthy and rich, made with sautéed mushrooms and finished with cream, garlic croutons.
Cheese & Charcuterie Station
A curated selection of aged cheeses, cured meats, olives, nuts, and dried fruits, served with artisan breads, crackers, chutneys, and honeycomb.

SALADS
Build-Your-Own Salad Station
Salad bar featuring two types of lettuce, assorted nuts, corn, chickpeas, cranberries, capsicums, cherry tomatoes, pickles, and a variety of dressings.
Apple, Walnut & Celery
Crunchy and refreshing, tossed in a light yogurt dressing with crisp apples, celery, and toasted walnuts.
Roasted Beet & Feta
Sweet roasted beets paired with arugula, walnuts, and creamy feta, finished with a balsamic glaze.
Pear & Blue Cheese
Juicy pears, candied pecans, and creamy blue cheese served over mixed greens for a festive flavour balance.
Kale & Pomegranate
Massaged kale leaves tossed with pomegranate seeds, pumpkin seeds, and a creamy tahini dressing.

MAINS
Live Grill Station
Free Range Chicken Breast, Prawns, Grass Fed Beef, Market Fish
Accompaniments: Red Wine Jus, Mushroom & green peppercorn sauce, Chimichurri
Carving Station
Glazed Ham
Slow-roasted ham glazed with cloves and brown sugar for a sweet and savory finish.
Butternut Squash Risotto
Creamy Arborio rice cooked with roasted butternut squash, parmesan, and a hint of nutmeg.
Sweet Potato & Lentil Bake
Layers of spiced lentils and mashed sweet potato, baked with a crunchy topping.
Sautéed Seasonal Asparagus with Balsamic
Tender asparagus spears lightly sautéed and drizzled with aged balsamic glaze.
Garlic & Herb Tossed Jersey Benne Potato
Baby Jersey Benne potatoes roasted and tossed with garlic, herbs, and olive oil.

Live Pasta Station (Kid friendly)
Freshly cooked pastas: Gnocchi, Penne, Spaghetti
Sauces: A classic Marinara, Alfredo, Herb Pesto
Condiments: Cherry tomatoes, capsicum, mushroom, sun dried tomatoes, capers

DESSERT
Christmas Pudding with Brandy Sauce
Traditional steamed pudding made with dried fruits and spices, served warm with rich brandy sauce.
Fruit Pavlovas
Individual meringue nests topped with whipped cream and a medley of fresh seasonal fruits.
Fruit Mince Pies
Buttery pastry filled with spiced dried fruits and citrus peel, baked until golden.
Hummingbird & White Chocolate Mousse
Silky smooth chocolate mousse served.
Seasonal Fresh Strawberries with Whipped Cream
Juicy strawberries served with lightly sweetened whipped cream.
Chocolate Fondue with Condiments
Warm melted chocolate served with marshmallows, seasonal fruits, and lady fingers for dipping.

Please inform our staff of any dietary requirements. Kindly note that the menu is subject to change based on market availability.

events.id: Matiu-Somes Island Trip-Matiu / Somes Island,Lower Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Matiu-Somes Island Trip
events.venue: Matiu / Somes Island,Lower Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Matiu-Somes Island Trip
Join our club trip across to Matiu-Somes Island. Enjoy a pot luck lunch with time to explore the island before conducting an underwater clean up dive by the wharf (conditions permitting).

After a BBQ dinner it is time for a walk before dessert to observe the Little Blue Penguins returning to their nests at sunset and to hunt for Giant Weta and Tuatara.

Sunday morning is a great time to relax, continue exploring the island before the boats arrive and to conduct a beach clean up before catching a ferry home.

This is a great experience for the whole family.

$100pp + Ferry

events.long_description:
New Year Camp at Paraparaumu Beach
Join us for a relaxed New Years camp at Paraparaumu Beach Sea Scouts site. Its just a short walk to the beach, estuary and local shops, and beside a large park and sports area.
The site is suitable for tents and camping vehicles. The scout hall has toilets, a shower and a basic kitchen.

There is limited space on the site, so if you are planning to camp with us, please RSVP in advance using the button below.

$5 per adult per night for members. $8 for non-members. Children free and discounted rate of $4 per night for members who bring children with them.

More details & RSVP at https://www.allpointscampingnz.org/event-details/new-year-camp-at-paraparaumu-beach

You may also like the following events from All Points Camping NZ Camping Club:
