events.long_description:
WELLINGTON NEW YEAR’S EVE 2026 BAR CRAWL | Wellington NYE 2026 Event
Don't Miss Wellington's Biggest Club Crawl of The Year, New Year's Eve 2026 on Wednesday, December 31st @ 4 Premium Clubs

About this Event


🎉✨ WELLINGTON NEW YEAR'S EVE 2026 CLUB CRAWL ✨🎉
Ring in the New Year at Wellington’s Biggest and Hottest NYE Club Crawl! Celebrate New Year’s Eve 2026 with exclusive access to 4 top venues on Wednesday, December 31st, 2025!
This upscale, high-energy club crawl takes you through Wellington’s premier nightlife destinations — all just steps apart. Experience the city’s vibrant party scene, hop between top venues, and celebrate the countdown in style at the final stop as you welcome 2026 in unforgettable fashion!
🎶 Enjoy Top-40, Hip-Hop, R&B, and Live Music
📍 Crawl Stops: TBA — Full lineup of venues to be announced soon!
🕙 Doors Open at 7:00 PM at the first check-in location (TBA)
🎟 Tickets start at $30 Early Bird – grab yours now before early bird prices are gone!





What’s Included in Your Ticket:
🎊 Join Hundreds of NYE Revelers
🚫 No Cover for All Participating Clubs
🎆 Exclusive NYE 2026 Wristband for Club Crawl Access
📱 NYE Crawl Map for Easy Navigation 🗺️
🎵 Live DJs Spinning Wellington’s Hottest Tracks
🥂 Celebration and Countdown to 2026 at the Final Venue


🚨 Get Tickets NOW Before Prices Increase! 🚨
⭐ Voted Wellington’s #1 New Year’s Eve Club Crawl 3 Years Running! This isn’t just a night out — it’s the ultimate NYE experience where you and your crew kick off 2026 with unforgettable memories.
Meet new people, party across Wellington’s hottest clubs, and feel the electric energy that only a true downtown countdown can deliver.
🔥 Nonstop music, packed dance floors, and champagne at midnight — this is how Wellington celebrates! Don’t miss the city’s most anticipated NYE event. Grab your tickets, dress to impress, and let the countdown to 2026 begin!

🚫🍸🔑 Celebrate Responsibly!
We DO NOT condone drinking and driving. Use Uber, Lyft, get a Taxi, or a designated driver to ensure a safe ride home. Celebrate responsibly and make it a New Year to remember!
🎉 Let the WELLINGTON NYE 2026 CLUB CRAWL begin!


100% CANCELLATION REFUND GUARANTEE
👌 If the event is canceled for any reason, all tickets will be refunded in full! No vouchers, no credits, just your money back in your bank! Guaranteed!


WRISTBAND PICKUP INSTRUCTIONS & POLICY
Where and When to Pick Up Wristbands
📍 Check-In Venue: TBA
🕒 7:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: Please arrive at our first stop to scan your ticket and collect your wristband. You have from 7:00 PM to 10:00 PM to check in and pick up your wristband for the night. You can stay at this venue until 10:00 PM or explore other participating stops once announced.
OPTIONAL STOPS:
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
📍 TBA
🕒 8:00 PM – 10:00 PM
Details: These are optional stops — you can visit any of them at your leisure between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM once they’re announced.
FINAL VENUES:
📍 TBA
🕒 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Details: This is the final stop! Everyone should meet here by 10:00 PM and stay for the massive NYE countdown party featuring live DJs, dancing, and a midnight champagne toast.
Please note: A Taxi/Uber/Lyft may be required for some stops. The crawl does not provide transportation or shuttle services between venues.
Wristband Policy
This is an open-format crawl. You must start at the first venue to collect your wristband. Once you have your wristband, you can visit any participating venues labeled as “Optional Venue” at your convenience between 8:00 PM and 10:00 PM or stay at the wristband venue. After 10:00 PM, all participants will meet at the final venue to celebrate and ring in the New Year together (marked as ‘The Final Stop’ below).
Please remember that you need to collect your wristband at the first stop, as it is required for entry into all venues except the first one. Also, wristbands are no longer available after 10:00pm at the first venue.


2025 CRAWL MAP AVAILABLE NOW:
TBA





TIPS FOR OUR CRAWL
Pick Up Wristbands On Time: Collect your wristband(s) during the designated time at the scheduled venues before 10:00PM. Latecomers won’t be accommodated – no wristband, no entry.
Assign a Proxy if Needed: Can't make the check-in? Have a friend pick up your wristband to ensure you don’t miss out.
Note Club Schedule: Each venues’s scheduled times are listed in the "DIGITAL BAR LIST." Wristbands (for entry) and any applicable drink specials apply only during these times.
Day-Of Check: Review the "DIGITAL CRAWL MAP" on the event morning for any last-minute details or venue changes.
_______________________________________


IMPORTANT DISCLAIMERS
Age Requirement: You must be 18 years or older with a valid government-issued ID to participate in this event. No exceptions.
Wristbands: Your wristband is your key to entry. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive your wristband. Wristbands must be worn at all times to access participating bars and venues. No wristband, no entry.
Ticket Policy: All sales are final—no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. In case of event cancellation without a rescheduled date, a refund (excluding fees) will be automatically issued. Event lineup, venues, and specials are subject to change without notice.
Responsible Drinking: Please drink responsibly. We promote a safe, fun environment, but remember, no one should drink and drive. Use designated drivers or rideshare services. Participating venues reserve the right to refuse service or entry to any attendee based on intoxication or inappropriate behaviour. No refunds will be given if you are denied entry for any of these reasons.
Capacity and Late Entry: Some venues may hit capacity during the event. If a venue reaches capacity or you arrive late, you may have to wait in line to gain entry. There is no guarantee of immediate access or entry to any specific venue once capacity is reached, and no refunds will be provided due to waiting times or access issues.
Respect & Conduct: Treat others and the event venues with respect. Disorderly conduct, inappropriate behaviour, or damage to the venues will result in removal from the event without a refund. The participating bars reserve the right to refuse entry or remove attendees for inappropriate behaviour at any time.
Liability Waiver: By purchasing a ticket and participating in the crawl, you acknowledge that you are attending at your own risk. Events Per Se, its affiliates, venues, staff, and organizers are not liable for any injuries, accidents, death, loss, or damage that may occur during the event.
Event Changes: Bars and venues may change, but the event will continue rain or shine. Be sure to check your email for any last-minute updates.
*By purchasing a ticket, you agree to these terms and conditions and accept the inherent risks involved in attending.

events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Tragedies Tour (Jan 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Come and hear stories of those who met sad, shocking and untimely ends. This tour traverses some of the older parts of the story where historic headstones mark the stories of lives lost too soon: accidents, murder, misadventure and those who fell by their own hand.
This tour contains a number of adult themes and some graphic descriptions so is not suitable for everyone.
Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Please note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day 1 hour before the tour starts by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
This tour is approximately 2 hours long.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
If you have purchased tickets for other people can you please pass our tour information on to them as well.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: Maoli — Island Vibe Tour-Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Maoli — Island Vibe Tour
events.venue: Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Music with Hawaiian roots will ring out across Waitangi Park in early January. Maoli is heralded as one of Hawaii and Polynesia’s number one commercial recording artists. Led by singer-songwriter Glenn Awong, the group is known for crafting unforgettable music that transcends borders. As one of Hawaii’s most beloved bands, Maoli blends island reggae, country, soul, and contemporary rhythms. The resulting soundscape is sure to transform Wellington’s waterfront park into a summer party zone. 
Formed in 2007, Maoli has since risen to fame with heartfelt songs that connect deeply with listeners. Their journey from small Hawaiian venues to international stages highlights the group’s dedication to music and culture. Maoli’s new album, ‘Last Sip of Summer’, was released in 2025. Expect to hear Glenn’s smooth vocals applied to new songs as well as gems from the back catalogue.
Tickets available to the general public on Thursday, 6 November at 7pm.

events.id: UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion-Upper Hutt College,Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion
events.venue: Upper Hutt College,Moonshine Road, Trentham, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
UHC class of 2000 - 25 year reunion
Luke Vilain here - I’m putting together a school reunion for our year. Key details:

Where - UHC fields (probably somewhere behind the astroturf, maybe near the pine trees if shade is needed) - Mrs Van Maren (who is now the deputy principal) has said we can use them 😊
When - Saturday, January 10th, from midday until the food
Food - please BYO picnic and drinks. I'll be organising some toilets and some spare water, as the school won't be open at that stage, therefore no staff to open up the facilities
Activity - it’ll be a relaxed day - with some “back to school” races (egg & spoon, sack race, that sort of thing)
Families / dogs / hangers on - if you’ve got kids, it would be great if you could bring them along – the more chaos, the better 😄

Please forward this event to people that you know that went to UHC! They don't need to strictly have been in the 2000 year, or even have stayed in school until 2000 - the point is to have people come together who haven't seen each other in a long time, but have a shared connection in our teenage years

I'll likely be reaching out to people asking for contact details (like your name, facebook profile, cell phone, vague location), so those that are happy to share with others can do so - I've had a couple people already mention that they'd like to follow up with people and reconnect after all this time. This will obviously be optional (the privacy act and all that 😄)

Really looking forward to seeing you all! Any questions please shout and I'll update the event 😊

events.id: A Century Celebration!-18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua-All Events In
events.name: A Century Celebration!
events.venue: 18 Main Road, Titahi Bay, Titahi Bay,18 Main Rd, Titahi Bay, Porirua 5022, New Zealand, Porirua
events.long_description:
A Century Celebration!
In 1926, at a meeting at the Accounts Chambers in Johnston Street, Wellington, Mrs JW Bell (and her husband) offered to lease three sections of her land for the purposes of establishing a tennis and bowling club in Titahi Bay.

Well Mrs Bell, thanks to your kind offer, we are still here 100 years later and don’t we have some stories and memories to share of those years gone by!

Over the course of Wellington Anniversary weekend (16-18 January 2026), we invite current and former members of the Titahi Bay Tennis Club to come and join us in celebrating this incredible milestone!

In coming months, we will update this post with more information about events planned for the weekend. In the meantime, please put this in your diary, share with friends, family, or perhaps use it as an opportunity to reach out to a former interclub team mate you haven’t seen or heard from in a while and tell them you’ll see them there!

We hope you can join us for what should be a great occasion!



(article : https://paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/newspapers/EP19270114.2.141)

Also check out other Sports events in Porirua, Workshops in Porirua, Meetups in Porirua.

events.id: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute-11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Tony As Robbie Williams Tribute
events.venue: 11 Logan Street, Ebdentown, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
events.long_description:
For over two decades, Tony Lewis has been turning heads and wowing audiences worldwide with his incredible portrayal of Britain’s greatest entertainer — Robbie Williams. Since debuting in Legends in 2002, Tony has performed across the globe, leaving crowds asking, “Is that really…?”
Based in Manchester, England, Tony first met Robbie in 2005, earning his idol’s approval when Robbie said, “I think it’s great, I’m really flattered! It’s bloody hard work being me!”
Three years later, Tony reached the finals of BBC One’s The One and Only, performing to over 7 million viewers each week. His uncanny resemblance and spot-on performance have led to countless TV appearances, promotional campaigns, and even official work for Robbie’s album Rudebox.
Tony has also appeared alongside stars like Simon Cowell, Olly Murs, Stephen Fry, and Ant & Dec — even helping prank Robbie himself on Saturday Night Takeaway!
His show captures all the greatest hits, from the early classics and swing favourites to modern anthems and a touch of Take That. With the looks, the moves, the voice, and the attitude — Tony Lewis truly is Robbie Williams!

events.id: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt-Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
events.venue: Brewtown Upper Hutt,25 Blenheim Street, Upper Hutt, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Ready to Roll: Th' Dudes, Mockers & Stellar* | Brewtown, Upper Hutt
This summer, three of Aotearoa’s most beloved bands hit the road for Ready To Roll, a brand-new touring show celebrating New Zealand music and sun-soaked good times. Featuring the legendary Th’ Dudes, iconic Mockers, and multi-platinum favourites Stellar*, the tour will bring timeless hits and unforgettable live energy to some of the country’s most picturesque summer locations.

Ready To Roll pays homage to the iconic TV music chart show that ran from the 1970s through to the 1990s. As New Zealand’s homegrown version of the Top 40 countdown, Ready To Roll became appointment viewing for generations of music fans, a showcase for both international chart-toppers and breakthrough Kiwi acts. It helped launch and cement countless careers while becoming a cultural touchstone in Aotearoa. Reviving the name for this tour nods to its legacy of celebrating great music and good times, a perfect fit for a summer series featuring three of the country’s most enduring and much-loved groups.

events.id: Summer Singing Retreat-2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Summer Singing Retreat
events.venue: 2 Rhine Street, Island Bay, Wellington 6023, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Start the new year with intention in a fun and inclusive environment. The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for renewal and hope. Sing for harmony, joy, and inspiration. Sing for healing. Sing to regain your strength and empower others.
Spend the 2 days encircled by a community of like-minded people and focusing on your well-being through singing. Rest, connect, and restore. The weekend is carefully planned so there is plenty of time to sing and to rest in between.
We will breathe together, listen, create beautiful sounds, let go of our worries, and lift each other to a sense of fulfillment and joy. And to make the event even more special, Lala will be cooking an authentic Malagasy dinner on Saturday night (an experience not to be missed).
Jonathan Berkahn and Lala Simpson have been working together, leading workshops and performing for many years. They are both highly skilled song leaders who lead from the heart and joyfully share their gifts. You will be in safe hands. ALL SINGERS OF ALL LEVELS OF ABILITY ARE WELCOME!!!
Jonathan will teach a mix of pop, folk and original songs, and Lala will teach a mix of songs from South Africa, Georgia, Madagascar and community songs.
If you are coming from out of town, the Home of Compassion offers some accommodation with reasonable rates which includes breakfast. Please contact them directly to enquire islandbay@compassion.org.nz
SCHEDULE
Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church. We will spend the day singing in the beautiful auditorium and share a Malagasy meal cooked by Lala at the end of the day. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and dinner provided. Please BYO lunch.
Sunday 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay. We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel. Morning tea, afternoon tea, and lunch provided.
The Iskand Bay Presbyterian Church and the Home of Compassion are within walking distance of each other.
Bring a water bottle, swimming togs if you want to swim in Island Bay during lunch time, and a picnic mat for eating outside.
events.description:
The beginning of the year is a perfect time to get together and feel the power of community and connection through singing.
Sing for healing.
Saturday, 17th of January: This first part of the retreat will be at the Island Bay Presbyterian Church.
Sunday 18th of January: We will be singing in the Lyon Room at the Home of Compassion in Island Bay.
We will finish the day singing the songs we learn through the weekend at a FREE community concert in the Chapel.

events.id: Marlin’s Dreaming - Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Marlin’s Dreaming - Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
A year and some change since touring HIRL, Marlin’s Dreaming will again bless Aotearoa’s main city centres for a short summer stint this January 2026.
Marlin’s Dreaming has long been associated with New Zealand’s balmier months, but this marks the band’s first summer tour since 2020, and a chance to play through the back catalogue of hits. 
Drawing songs from 2024’s sweet, nostalgia inflected album HIRL, the starry debut Lizard Tears, and the scores of sublime tracks between, it’s a chance for fans to get the complete Marlin’s Dreaming summer experience.
Renowned for their tightly choreographed live shows, the summer tour will add the talents of Tiare Kelly (Benee) on the keys & vocals.  
“We’re joining to play a couple of great festivals in Slackbarn and Festival of Lights so wanted to take a moment to get out to Christchurch, Auckland, and Wellington. As well as playing through our back catalogue, we also have new music to tease, that I’m really excited to try out live,” said Semisi Ma’ia’i frontman of Marlin’s Dreaming.
“It wasn’t until after booking these shows that I realised we hadn’t played a summer tour since 2020, which history has shown was one of the most significant things to happen that year.”
As well as its headline shows, Marlin’s Dreaming performs in the Hawke’s Bay at Slackbarn on January 10, and Festival of Lights in New Plymouth on January 11.



San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest-19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: LONG LUNCH in the Waitarere Beach Forest
events.venue: 19 Hydrabad Drive, Waitārere Beach 5510, New Zealand
events.long_description:
HELLO BEACH LOVERS
The Waitārere Forest Long Lunch
- Sunday 18 January 2026
- book your tickets online
Get ready for one of the highlights of our Waitārere summer calendar - the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch is returning on Sunday, 18 January 2026, and it’s looking to be our biggest and best yet!
 Held beneath the towering pines of the Waitārere Forest, this annual event is all about community,   connection, and celebration. The Long Lunch has become a much-loved tradition for residents and visitors alike - a day to relax, share good food, and enjoy the easy-going Waitārere lifestyle that makes our beach so special.
We’re proud to announce that "Gareth Heard and the team from Unique Realty" are now our major sponsors for Long Lunch. Their generous support is helping us make this year’s event extra special, including an exciting $500 cash giveaway to one lucky ticket holder! You must be present on the day to claim the prize, so make sure you don’t miss out on what promises to be an unforgettable afternoon.
Early Bird Tickets: $15* per person (01 Dec - 11 Jan)
Standard Tickets: $20* per person (12 Jan - 17 Jan)
Gate Sales Tickets: $25* per person (18 Jan)
*Fee (per Ticket/Order) 3% + 30c
All tables and chairs are provided - bring your own plates, cutlery, glasses, drinks, and a plate of food to share. From homemade favourites to gourmet treats, the shared tables are always overflowing with creativity, flavour, and generosity.
And don’t forget - the Long Lunch is also a major fundraiser for our community. There will be raffles, auctions, and prizes throughout the day, so bring plenty of cash and help us raise funds for local projects that make Waitārere Beach an even better place to live.
This year’s fundraising focus:
The Upgrade of the Community House Preschoolers' playground on Rua Ave.
It’s more than just a meal - it’s a celebration of our people and our place. Whether you’re a full-time local or here on holiday, you’ll be part of something special: great food, great company, and great memories under the forest canopy.
So gather your friends, pack your picnic gear, and join us for the Waitārere Forest Long Lunch. Let’s make this a summer to remember - full of laughter, flavour, and community spirit.
See you under the pines
on Sunday, 18 January 2026!

events.id: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
He’s had an incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. Stewart Copeland is one of the great rock drummers. He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM). Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show. 
Stewart’s remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world fame between 1977 and 1986, and then again in 2007 and 2008 when the band was reunited. He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts. This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.

events.description:
Presented by: Frontier Touring & MG Live by arrangement with One Fiinix Live Frontier Touring and MG Live are thrilled to announce the hotly anticipated return of global superstar Ed Sheeran, who is heading back to New Zealand next January with his all-new Loop Tour.
Having already sold over 2.5 million tickets across Australia and New Zealand to date, Ed Sheeran’s Loop Tour sees the beloved singer returning to our shores with a brand-new live show that’ll follow the release of his new album, Play – out Friday 12 September.
Performing at Sky Stadium in Wellington Ed’s new live show promises to be filled with surprises, new music, as well as his biggest hits.
With a brand-new album, a renewed creative spirit and a catalogue of global hits, Ed Sheeran’s 2026 stadium tour is set to be one of the most anticipated live events of the year.
Don’t miss the return of one of the world’s most loved live performers!

Ed's forthcoming eighth studio album ‘Play’ is set to be released on 12 September.
The album marks the beginning of a fresh new chapter of music for the artist.
Described as an “explorative, technicolour pop album”, ‘Play’ will be full of fun, chaos and heart — and the show is set to match in both energy and production.
With plenty of other hits and crowd favourites from his back catalogue, the brand-new live show is set to be an epic event for every kind of Ed Sheeran fan.

events.id: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Beoga New Zealand 2026 | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed Irish band Beoga will make their long-awaited return to New Zealand in January 2026, performing two intimate headline shows in Auckland and Wellington.
Known for their adventurous spirit and willingness to chart new musical territory, Beoga have redefined the possibilities of Irish traditional music. Their global reach was cemented through collaborations with Ed Sheeran on the record-breaking ÷ (Divide) album, including the smash hits “Galway Girl” and “Nancy Mulligan.” The former has now surpassed 1.4 billion streams on Spotify alone.
After a four-year hiatus from touring and releasing music, Beoga made a powerful comeback earlier this year with their new album Phases, released in June. The band went on to perform at Glastonbury and Coachella, where they shared the stage with Shaboozey, Alex Warren, and Ed Sheeran at his now-famous Old Phone Pub pop-up experience.
With a GRAMMY nomination, international tours, and collaborations with some of the biggest names in music, Beoga have established themselves as one of Ireland’s most exciting and genre-blurring acts. Their sound fuses accordion, fiddle, keyboards, guitars, and vocals into a vibrant, modern take on Irish roots music that feels both timeless and new.

San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.name: Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
events.venue: Lotus Yoga Centre,91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Silent Retreat - A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection
🌸 Silent Retreat – A Day of Calm, Creativity & Inner Connection

Hosted by Lisa Conroy from Living the Sweet Life & Tracey Crandall from CharlieRae/TraceyLidene Art

📍 Lotus Yoga & Retreat Centre, 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu (a short stroll from the train station)
🗓️ Saturday, 24th January 2026
🕐10.00am - 3.00pm
💰 $125 — all materials provided
🥗 Light refreshments available throughout the day (BYO lunch)
✨ Event Link: https://facebook.com/events/s/silent-retreat-a-day-of-calm-c/1831388837742351/?

Shhh… can you hear it? That gentle whisper calling you back to yourself? 💫
Join us for a day designed to quiet the noise and awaken your inner calm through creativity, meditation, and mindful stillness.

You’ll be gently guided through soulful experiences — from sound bowls and meditation to creative journaling, intuitive art, and sacred self-care. This retreat is your space to exhale, reflect, and simply be. Surrounded by nature, a pond and birdsong.

✨ What’s Included:
🌿 Begin your day with a guided meditation and soothing sound healing
🌿 Infuse your crystal of intention — your quiet companion for the day (and it goes home with you)
🌿 Wander between creative stations at your own pace:

* Write a letter to yourself 💌
* Connect with nature through leaf rubbings & botanical sketches 🌸
* Create an intention or dream page from magazines 🌈
* Try teabag art, intuitive breath drawings, and mandala inserts 🎨
* Pull a symbol stone and reflect on what it means to you 🪶

Your beautiful journal (included) will grow with colour, words, and meaning as the day unfolds.

🌸 Pampering & Peace
Because we all need a little nurturing...
🩷 Foot soak stations (ahh, yes please!)
🩷 Self-pampering including warm stones to hold and melt away tension

Prompts to guide your day:
💫 Inspirational gentle prompts
💫 A space to leave little love notes of encouragement to be shared at the end

A gentle, soul-soothing day to rest, create, and reconnect — surrounded by stillness, soft energy, and kind hearts.
✨ Spaces are limited for this intimate experience.

Contact for further information or to book your place.

🪷Tracey Crandall -
🌸Lisa Conroy -


With Creativity, Sparkle & Soul,
Tracey & Lisa
CharlieRae & Living the Sweet Life

👯‍♀️ Meet your co-creators:
Tracey Crandall and Lisa Conroy are two creative souls who live for colour, connection, and sparking joy. Together, they blend art, play, and nurturing rituals into experiences that lift you up, light you up, and leave you glowing inside and out.

events.venue: Waitangi Park, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
New Zealand’s most celebrated boutique gin festival. Waitangi Park hosts Gindulgence in January. A group of 18 distillers will showcase a fabulous selection of more than 90 gins and other spirits from New Zealand and around the world. The ticket price includes samples from distillers, so you’ll be able to explore an exceptional range. Delight the senses with botanical flavour combinations. 
This year, it’s not just gin that features in the outdoor fair. You’ll find rum, whisky, vodka, liqueurs and other specialist spirits. Shop for a summer tipple or listen to presentations from some passionate distillers. Alternatively, just sit back on the grass and soak up the atmosphere, accompanied by live acoustic music and great local food.

events.id: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip-Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington-All Events In
events.name: Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip
events.venue: Marlborough Sounds,15 Waterloo Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand, Wellington
events.long_description:
Inner Marlborough Sounds Kayak Trip


Hi this is a trip through the Inner Marlborough Sounds, suitable for beginners who have gone to at least one SKISL and be OK with rescues. The focus is on camping, coffee, and having a fun time with relatively short kayaking times on the water.

The schedule for Wellingtonians is: on the Thursday 29th Ferry over to Picton, in at 12:30, launch from Picton beach head over to Kumoto, tents up, Friday - paddle around the Bay of Many Coves, stop for coffee / lunch / chips / shower at Punga Cove, stay at Camp Bay. Maybe a quick trip over to Bumine Island with empty boats. Saturday night at Ratimira for camping / snoozing. Sunday - up early, on water at 8am, paddle back to Picton in by 12, lunch, on 1pm sailing. So 4 days with Blumine as an optional paddle, mostly shortish trips. We might shift the plan around depending on the weather, but that sets out the general plan.

For the ferry you need to book your own tickets and I would urge you to get your ferry tickets now as they go fast. If you are concerned about the weather get the fully refundable tickets. When you buy your ticket select the "kayak" option. Any questions ask them in the comments below.

Also check out other Trips & Adventurous Activities in Wellington.

events.name: JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 3
events.venue: Paraparaumu Memorial Hall
events.long_description:
JOURNEY TO SERENITY Yin Yoga and Sound Healing Special Series # 3
Welcome to the Journey to Serenity Yin Yoga and Sound Healing twice monthly session!!!

These beautiful, nourishing Yin and Sound Sessions are on the second and Fourth Friday of each month (between November 28th and March 28th 2026) and are held in the Meeting / Supper Room of the Paraparaumu Memorial Hall on Tutanekai Street.

It would be lovely to share this healing, nourishing restorative practice in the special energy and support you to give your life a boost of wellbeing and good feeling!!

INTRODUCING - SPECIAL WELCOME OFFER - TWO PEOPLE FOR $90 (You don't have to be a couple) - Book through bank transfer or message me directly

Unique Yin Yoga, Sound Healing, breathwork and meditation come together to create this specially guided, deeply relaxing and healing experience, held within a unique holistic framework that encourages reflection and self-care.

Take the time and space that this session offers, for yourself, and give yourself a gift of true nourishment.

Bryony Shanti from Heartsong Healing will use a wide range of special healing sound instruments along with her voice to guide you into peace, relaxation and stillness. The healing vibration of the specially chosen sounds will wash over you bringing deep clearing, balance and alignment. There is a experience of gratitude and blessing.

Bryony's sound works to strengthen and deepen the powerful work of Yin yoga teacher Bianca who will guide you through 90-minutes of restorative and uplifting poses that are intended for you relax, heal and to open more to receive the healing vibration of sound.

Bianca's Yin Yoga focuses on easily accessible and effective poses
which work into the deeper connective tissues of the body. These poses are held for anywhere between 90 seconds to 5 minutes to allow for an opening in the body, the perfect way to receive the sound vibrations.

Yin yoga invites us into stillness and gives space for both the mind and body to relax and release tension and stress.

OPEN TO ALL: Whether you have experience in either Yin Yoga and Sound Healing or are looking to try something completely new, you are very welcome to join in the journey into a sense of serenity. Beginners and experienced practitioners alike will find something nourishing for themselves in this session.

Booking Details

Sesssion - 7pm -8.30pm on Fridays
in 2025 - 28/11, 12/12,
in 2026 - 30/1, 13/2, 27/2, 14/3, 28/3

to account in name of Heartsong Healing (via Hnry), 12-3245-0322503-37. Reference 'YIN . MONTH' and 'YOUR NAME'

OR PAY FOR ONE OR MORE PLACE BY CARD HERE - https://buy.stripe.com/14k3g1fIa3cJboQdRI

OR BUY THREE TICKETS FOR $150 HERE -

https://buy.stripe.com/00gg2N8fI6oV3Wo9Bt

and please confirm your payment by email to . Thank you.

events.long_description:
Gallop Into the New Year: Lunar Celebrations in the Hutt
📍 Dowse Square & Lower Hutt Town Hall
📅 Saturday, 31 January 2026
🕚 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Join us for a colourful, family-friendly Lunar New Year Festival in the heart of Lower Hutt!

Hosted by Viet Hub NZ, this outdoor cultural festival celebrates not only Vietnamese Tết but also embraces the wider Lunar New Year traditions of diverse communities across Aotearoa.

Come and experience a day full of music, culture, food, and community connection as we gallop into the Year of the Horse!

⸻

🎭 What to Expect:
• Outdoor Cultural Market: Delicious food stalls, handmade crafts, community booths, and more
• Live Performances: Lion dance, drumming, cultural music and dance throughout the day on the Town Hall stage
• Cultural Games & Activities: Try your hand at Vietnamese folk games, calligraphy, lantern making, and storytelling
• Exhibition Space: Discover real stories of migration and belonging through our Immigrant Storytelling installation
• Traditional Costume Photography: Indoor photo area with Vietnamese and Lunar New Year-inspired costumes
• Children’s Zone: Face painting, interactive games, and family workshops
• Lucky Draw & Spot Prizes!

⸻

🎟️ Tickets:
• Free General Admission – Registration encouraged for updates & giveaways
• Optional Donation – Support our community initiatives and annual cultural programmes

Every ticket holder goes into the draw for a lucky Lunar prize!

⸻

💛 Why Attend?

This is Lower Hutt’s largest and most inclusive Lunar New Year celebration – welcoming all ages, all cultures, and all walks of life. Whether you’re reconnecting with your roots or exploring new traditions, there’s something here for everyone.

⸻

📢 Stay Connected:

Follow us on Facebook￼ or visit www.viethubnz.org￼
📧 Contact us:

⸻

This event is proudly supported by local businesses, volunteers, and the wider Hutt community. Proceeds support Viet Hub NZ’s year-round cultural, educational, and community programmes.

events.id: SUMAC | WELLINGTON-Valhalla, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: SUMAC | WELLINGTON
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.long_description:
Acclaimed experimental metal trio finally make their New Zealand debut in January 2026, with dates booked for Auckland & Wellington
Banished Music, Whammy Bar, and Valhalla are proud to present the long-awaited New Zealand debut of experimental post-metal trio SUMAC.
Formed in 2014, the powerhouse trio comprised of Aaron Turner (guitar, vocals; Isis, Old Man Gloom), Brian Cook (bass; Russian Circles, Botch), and Nick Yacyshyn (drums; Baptists) are renowned for merging crushing heaviness with improvisational freedom, exploring the boundaries between structure and chaos. 

SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band. Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation. In 2024, the band released their critically acclaimed album The Healer, a sweeping, transformative work spanning four monumental tracks. The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.

The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career. It’s dense and invigorating, highlighting the band’s dexterity, creativity, and clarity of purpose. - Pitchfork

Soon after the release SUMAC teamed up with poet and sound artist Moor Mother to release The Film, a boundary-pushing collaborative album. Released via Thrill Jockey in April 2025, the record unfolds as a cinematic journey across eight “scenes,” merging SUMAC’s heavy, jazz-inflected textures with Moor Mother’s incisive spoken-word commentary. 

SUMAC’s work has always been about transition between different states of being. Our sense of normal, and indeed our sense of life, is now being shaken. We don’t know what is coming next. We are looking for pointers towards the future, as well as things to hold onto in the moment. 
New Zealanders, don’t miss this rare and powerful journey into uncharted sonic terrain.

SUMAC have built a reputation as a fearsome live band.
Visceral and cathartic shows where crushing riffs & sprawling drones collide with extended bursts of wild improvisation.
The record dives deep into themes of regeneration, suffering, and spiritual reconstruction — a testament to the band’s ability to meld raw power with emotional depth.
The experimental metal trio’s four-song, 76-minute album is the peak of their career.

events.id: Ludovico Einaudi-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Ludovico Einaudi
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
His music has been performed live on an Arctic ice-floe and as soundtracks for Oscar and Golden Globe-winning films. Italian pianist and composer Ludovico Einaudi is returning to Wellington with a new album to explore with audiences. The Michael Fowler Centre will be filled with Ludovico’s special mix of neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock, and experimental styles. His modern soundscapes are renowned for being able to cross artistic and generational boundaries. Because of this, he has become one of the world’s most-streamed classical music artists. 
Ludovico began composing in the 1980s for theatre and ballet. He has since gone on to write for film and television and produce multi-million-selling albums. His most recent is ‘The Summer Portraits’. Written in 2025, it is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer, and family holidays. Here, he returns to the lush full-band textures of earlier works. You’ll get to hear this first-hand, so don’t miss your chance.

events.id: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026-Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) Conference 2026
events.venue: Kelburn Parade, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Kia ora!
Electricity and electrification are seen as the significant enablers for decarbonisation of our nation. The Future Architecture of the Network (FAN) | Te Whatunga Hiko programme aspires to meet the challenges the electrical power system will face as we journey towards sustainable decarbonisation.
Our vision is to provide an infrastructure paradigm through a hybrid AC/DC transmission and distribution system that meets the needs of tomorrow’s efficient, low-carbon, reliable and resilient electrical power system.
Funded as part of the New Zealand Government’s Strategic Science Investment Fund (SSIF) on Advanced Energy Technology Platform (AETP), the research team is investigating what the future electrical power system might look like.
Hear about the team’s latest achievements as we approach the final phase of the programme.
Attendance is in person at Victoria University Wellington.
Ngā mihi nui,
Prof. Neville Watson,
Science Leader
The detailed programme will be circulated closer to the event.
 More information on the research can be found at https://www.fan.ac.nz/
If you have any questions, please contact futurearchitecturenetwork@canterbury.ac.nz

events.name: Malcolm Todd tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Presented by: Handsome Tours & Laneway
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

events.long_description:
Host Responsibility Training for all staff
Regular staff training is an important part of maintaining and renewing your premises' Alcohol Licence. We are bringing regular, in-person Host Responsibility training to you and your staff. We all know Hospitality venues can be fun and dynamic places to work, but serving alcohol carries a lot of responsibility.
Minimising harm and providing safer environments for the sale and supply of alcohol is a priority whether working in a restaurant, bar, hotel, club, or off-licence.
This Host Responsibility course is essential training that provides the following:
Knowledge of the law
The principles of responsible service
Practical tools for all staff working in licensed premises.
Book your team for this in-person training, which your regional manager will present.
If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.

If any of your team members can no longer attend after booking, please cancel the booking, as space is limited.

events.id: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.

events.id: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox-34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032-All Events In
events.name: Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
events.venue: 34 Poplar Ave, Raumati South, Paraparaumu 5032
events.long_description:
Paraparaumu, New Zealand-Raumati Social Club with Celia Farran and Melissa Cox
Join the Mystic Muses, award-winning singer/songwriters Melissa Cox (NZ/USA) and Celia Farran (USA) for an unforgettable show featuring Celtic music of the past, present, and future - Enya, Sinead O'Connor, The Cranberries, Loreena McKennitt, traditional tunes, lore & legends, sea shanties, and haunting original songs by Melissa and Celia.

-- Meet the Muses --

MELISSA COX: Multi-instrumentalist and award-winning songwriter Melissa Cox conjures a one-woman storm of Celtic tradition, tribal beats, and celestial synths to create an ethereal, danceable Elvish EDM dream. Using her looping pedal, she layers tin whistle, electric mandolin, piano, synths, drum beats, and her haunting voice to create performances reminiscent of Enigma, Enya, and Loreena McKennitt. A seasoned touring artist and classically trained vocalist, she pushes Celtic and World music into the 21st century with raw energy and fearless, honest lyrics. http://www.melcoxmusic.com

CELIA FARRAN: “A cross between an Earthy Enya, Joan Baez, and Tina Fey.” She dishes up the most delicious concoction of the silly and sacred, delighting audiences across the globe. With rusty red locks and twinkling eyes, she casts a spell of enchantment upon her listeners, bringing deep and resonating experiences to audiences across the globe. With powerful, heart-felt vocals and wacky comedic improvisations, the audience never knows what will happen with Celia on stage. http://www.celiafarran.com

events.id: The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026-Shorland Park,17 Reef St, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
events.venue: Shorland Park,17 Reef St, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
The Italians of Island Bay Second Edition 2026
Details to follow closer to time, but already got a few new ideas for the 2026 edition.

***

Description from Inaugural 2025 Edition FYI:

I would like to acknowledge the support of The Island Bay Festival, which will be celebrating its 40th year of bringing the community together this year, and thank them for giving me a space in The Park this Sunday at The Day in The Bay to showcase and celebrate The Italians of Island Bay, their history and their contributiion to the community, business and culture.

#supportlocal
#celebratelocal
#celebratecommunity
#islandbayfestival

The majority of Island Bay Italians are Neapolitan from the hill top town of Massa Lubrense and surrounds on the Sorrentine Peninsula, followed by Sicilians from the small volcanic island of Stromboli in the Aeolean sea.

When you think of The Italians of Island Bay you might think of their involvement and contribution to the Fishing and Food (and related) Industries, but it goes much wider than that..

In alphabetic order as to not to offend. NB: list a work in progress.

- academics
- accountants
- artists
- authors
- builders
- cinema
- electricians
- exporters
- film makers
- financial advisors
- fishermen
- footballers
- hairdressers
- hoteliers
- importers
- journalists
- lawyers
- lecturers
- lawn bowlers
- management consultants
- martial arts instructors
- mozzarella makers
- musicians
- olympic medalist
- opera singers
- photographers
- plumbers
- poets
- property developers
- public servants
- publishers
- quantity surveyors
- realaters
- restauranteurs
- scholars
- seamstresses
- secretaries
- retailers
- tailors
- teachers
- tomatoe growers
- volunteers
- wine makers
- wholesalers

Books that will on display:

- Alle Fine del Mondo by Paul Elenio
- Le Famiglie Strombolani by
- Food & Family by
- Family Business by Vincent Moleta
- Angelina by Gerard Hindmarsh
- Unsheltered by Clare Moleta
- Umberto Saba : poetry & prose selected & translated, with notes by Vincent Moleta

Just a few days to go till the big Day in the Bay on Sunday. I'm unexpectedly in Perth for family reasons, so have had to piece this together organically long distance, with the help and contribution of my mum's childhood girlfriends from The Bay, for which I'm extremely greatfull.

My Back-Story:

On my mother's side I'm double 4th generation Strombolana-Kiwi and 2nd generation Dutch-Kiwi on my father's side (RIP).. thus my long and unusual name..

Rosina Maria Giuseppina van der Aa.

All 4 of my biz-nonni (great grandparents) bravely sailed to the ends of the earth (alle fine del mondo) in search of a better future.

My maternal great grandfather (Bartolo Barnao) and his elder brother(Giuseppe) initially fished and slept under their fishing boat in Makara, before returning with their Strombolane wives who were also siblings (Giuseppina and Maria Concetta Pirera) to set up shop literally (a fish shop) in Palmerston North before then moving to No 64 The Parade Island Bay when my Nonna Rosina was 17 circa 1934.

My paternal great grandparents (Angelina Criscillo and Vincenzo Moleta) along with Vincenzo's brother (Antonino) and Angelina's cousin (Rosa) settled and tamed D'urville. My Nonno (Leslie George Moleta) spotted my Nonna (Rosina Elvira Barnao) at the Zino-Toscano wedding where she was a bridesmaid. They had two children, both named after their grandparents as was the tradition. My uncle Vincent Bartolo and my mother Maria Josephine The rest as they say is Family Business..

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery: SS Penguin Tour (Feb 2026)-76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery: SS Penguin Tour (Feb 2026)
events.venue: 76 Old Karori Road, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.long_description:
On the 12 February 1909, the SS Penguin sank in Cook Strait in a raging southerly storm with the loss of 72 lives, one of the worst maritime disasters in NZ history.  Many of those who died were woman and children, as their lifeboats capsized in the wild sea. 
Although the Captain was heavily criticised, it is still not clear what the ship hit nor where, as the wreck of the Penguin has never been located. 
The tragedy stunned Wellington and a day of mourning was called for 16 February.  The city came to a standstill as many of those who died were brought up to Karori Cemetery for burial in a long procession of cabs and lorries.
To commemorate this tragedy the Friends will be undertaking a guided tour of most of the Penguin graves on Sunday 8th February. 
The tour duration is approximately 2 hours long.
This tour is suitable for people with moderate fitness. The route mostly follows paved surfaces but there are some areas of unevenness. Surefootedness is required.

Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee). Children under 12 are free.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you one hour before the tour start time by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
There is only one toilet which is located by the cemetery office at the main entrance.
Please meet us at the shelter (shown as the Historic Chapel on the map at the main entrance)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

events.id: The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Best of Bill Bryson — Live on Stage
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
With 21 published nonfiction books, you’ll likely have come across Bill Bryson’s work. One of his most famous books, ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything’, has been given a major rewrite. He takes to the stage at The Opera House to talk about his new findings. 
In ‘A Short History of Nearly Everything 2.0’, Bill updates the book with the latest scientific research on the Earth and the universe. In the live show, you’ll hear about planetology, astronomy, particle physics, the Big Bang, quantum mechanics, and evolution. Throughout his career, the journalist and author has covered a wide range of subjects, including travel, the English language, and the human body. This rare chance to see him live promises forays into many of these areas. All conducted with his usual theatrical flair. 
Bill Bryson has a quest to understand everything that has happened from the Big Bang to the rise of civilisation and what humans are today. Join him as he shares the latest major advances in science.

events.id: Gregory Alan Isakov-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Gregory Alan Isakov
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
American indie-folk artist Gregory Alan Isakov is a Grammy-nominated singer and songwriter. He’s bringing his intimate and lyric-driven show to Wellington in February. Audiences will be given a special opportunity to experience stripped-down acoustic arrangements. He’ll delve into favourites from six of his full-length studio albums, including his most recent ‘Appaloosa Bones’. 
This 2023 album was praised with an Associated Press reviewer saying, “His new songs are relentlessly majestic, a kind of musical morphine”. Gregory has amassed a devoted community of fans who have helped him garner over 1 billion streams on listening platforms to date.

events.id: Wellington Gypsy Fair-Frank Kitts Park,68 Jervois Quay, Wellington, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Wellington Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Frank Kitts Park,68 Jervois Quay, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Wellington Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

events.id: The Very Best of Deacon Blue-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Very Best of Deacon Blue
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Scottish pop-rock icons Deacon Blue are heading to The Opera House in 2026. The visit coincides with the band’s 40 anniversary and the release of its eleventh studio album, ‘The Great Western Road’. New Zealand fans can expect a curated setlist blending arena-sized classic anthems and intimate surprises.
Deacon Blue is known for emotionally-charged performances and enduring hits like Dignity, Real Gone Kid, I’ll Never Fall In Love Again, and Fergus Sings the Blues. Audiences are sure to have a dynamic live experience in a concert spanning the band’s full career. Songs will range from the soulful grit of acclaimed debut album ‘Raintown’ to newer releases. ‘The Great Western Road’ reflects the band’s journey across four decades of music making with honesty, warmth, and a renewed sense of adventure.
With a reputation for crafting unforgettable live moments,
Deacon Blue’s 2026 tour will be 40 years strong, and more poignant and potent than ever.

A vibrant local market showcasing fresh, seasonal produce, handmade goods, and artisan treats from Otaki and Te horo. Brings together the community to support small businesses, enjoy live music, and discover unique, locally made products.

events.id: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand-48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CBT skills for physical health practitioners in Aotearoa New Zealand
events.venue: 48 Mein Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) is a psychological intervention initially developed for emotional disorders. It is now widely used in supporting people to deal with the challenges of physical ill-health. Professionals from various backgrounds can learn to use a simplified CBT skills set, and use of these skills enables them to be more effective in managing aspects of their patients’ distress.
The training is a mix of theory, skills demonstration and skills practice, giving participants a better understanding of the applicability of the skill set in their area of practice and providing some skills to take away. Training sessions are spaced to allow participants to use their new skills in their clinical practice. Each participant reflects on their learning and their work with a specific patient, and the whole group reflects on lessons learned. In this way, learning remains rooted in participants’ clinical practice. These CBT courses are consistently evaluated highly by participants.
The Course
Teaching will be commenced with 2 days of in person sessions. 19th and 20th Feb 2026 at Mary Potter Hospice, Wellington and subsequently 2 sessions on-line via Zoom. These will be either 18th or 19th March an 22nd or 23rd April 2026.
Attendance at all sessions is mandatory to complete the course.
The courses cost is $850 per person (incl GST).
The Trainers
Kathy Burn was a Clinical Nurse Specialist in Palliative Care who went on to train in CBT and to develop the CBT service at St Christopher’s Hospice, London. She now works in CBT in chronic pain, and she teaches and supervises CBT trainees at the institute of Psychiatry, London.
Kathryn Mannix was a Palliative Medicine Consultant and CBT therapist. She developed ‘CBT First Aid’ to enable palliative care clinicians to adapt skills from CBT into their clinical practice. She is an author. There are insights into her use of CBT in her books With the End in Mind and Listen.
Terms and Conditions
Attendance: In order to create a learning community for each course, it is important that each person on a course attends every session and is able to join in the discussions by keeping up with the course. By accepting a place on a particular course, you agree to attend all the sessions, to arrive on time, and to work alongside your group members during the session to support each other's learning. Each session builds on the last, and you'll be asked to put your new learning into practice in- between sessions. Building learning groups in this way means we can't add new trainees after a course has begun.
We are not able to run catch-up sessions for sessions missed. If you miss sessions, you may be asked to withdraw from the course and no refunds will be given.
Refunds/Canellations: Once you sign up and pay, we won't be able to refund your payment unless we can reallocate your place to another person before the course begins. The deadline for cancelling your place is 28 days before the day and time of the first session. If you cancel and we can fill your place with another person, we'll offer you the choice of a refund or a place on a future course, if places are available. We will do our best to fill your place, but we can't promise this. Refunds will incur an administration fee.
Dates and Times of Sessions: all dates and times are given in NZ time, and this varies over the year. It is up to you to check the correct time in your time zone: you may find this website useful to check your own time zone with Auckland NZ time on each specific date: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/
Trainers: we have a team of trainers, all of whom are experienced CBT therapists and trainers, and all are familiar with applying CBT in physical health settings. Different sessions may be taught by different trainers, or by 'guest appearances' by some of our team. The team of trainers will ensure there is continuity of content and of learning as the course progresses.
Special circumstances: Sometimes, life events appear unexpectedly. If something unexpected prevents you from attending, please let us know as early as you can, and we will give consideration to how we might be able to support you to continue your training if that is what you wish to do.
events.description:
Training sessions are spaced to allow participants to use their new skills in their clinical practice.
She developed ‘CBT First Aid’ to enable palliative care clinicians to adapt skills from CBT into their clinical practice.
Terms and Conditions Attendance: In order to create a learning community for each course, it is important that each person on a course attends every session and is able to join in the discussions by keeping up with the course.
If you cancel and we can fill your place with another person, we'll offer you the choice of a refund or a place on a future course, if places are available.

events.id: Wankernomics — Just Touching Base-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Wankernomics — Just Touching Base
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email? Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post? You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk. Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution. ‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.   
The shows are hilarious and include many ‘oh-my-god-that’s-exactly-what-happens-at-my-workplace’ moments. You’ll get a demonstration of the buzzwords, bureaucracy, banality, and baloney of modern working life. You’ll get tips on how to speak at work, how to look like a genius in meetings, and how to get promoted by simply dropping the phrase ‘360 degree all-hands ideation session’ into an email to your boss. 
So, pop some time in the diary for an outcomes-focused, value-added, best-practice, deep-dive into the realities of the working world.
events.description:

events.long_description:
Upper Hutt Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

events.id: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026-Blenheim, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026
events.venue: Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Climate Action Week 2026 - Agenda
Dates: February 2026 - 23rd - 27th February
Theme: Leading by Doing: Local Businesses, Local Solutions, Collective Action
Each day features:
Morning: Local Business Story Sessions (Curated stories for our business community to get inspired with raw, honest and authentic stories)
Midday: Action Design Workshops (Crafting Plans & Solutions)
Afternoon: Immersion Experiences and Hands-On Field Visits (Applied Learning & Practical Support)
Day 1 - Water, Risk and Resilience 
Morning: Marlborough businesses facing water risks (horticulture, viticulture, manufacturing, nature, tourism) share adaptation stories: irrigation shifts, stormwater projects, water reuse innovations.
Midday: Business-specific water risks and trials of resilience-building solutions.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to diverse water initiatives across the region
Day 2 - Circular economy & waste
Morning: Circular leaders (including wine, food and beverages, building, construction, fisheries, nature) show how they have reduced waste, repurposed byproducts, or created new revenue streams from "waste."
Midday: Waste Challenge Mapping: Identify business-specific waste streams + select 1 trial action for next 6 months.
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to waste initiatives and innovative approaches across the region
Day 3 - Nature and Biodiversity 
Morning: Farmers, viticulturists & landscapers share regenerative planting, biodiversity corridors, and ecosystem services initiatives.
Midday: Biodiversity on Your Site Toolkit Workshop — Co-design biodiversity plans for business properties (guided by local ecologists & farming leaders)
Afternoon: Immersion experiences to nature, land and biodiversity initiatives across the region.
Day 4 - Energy & Carbon
Morning: Businesses share their real decarbonisation journeys: EV transitions, renewable installations, process efficiencies — including the unexpected savings, costs and impacts.
Midday: Carbon Reduction Sprints — Design quick-win carbon actions + long-term projects with support from energy consultants and local peers.
Afternoon: Site visits to Carbon and Energy initiatives across the region
Day 5 - Taking the courage to act
Morning: Businesses share how they initiated climate actions, including failures, lessons, and unexpected wins.
Midday: Climate Action Map Workshop — Business leaders build their tailored action roadmaps (guided by peers + facilitators).
Afternoon: Immersion to unique businesses focussed on climate resilience
Immersion Experience Hosts Confirmed
Yealands Estate Winery
Carbonscape
Wineworks
Climate Action Marlborough has had the support of Yealands Estate Wines from its inception and we are super grateful to have their support for Climate Action Week Marlborough 2026. They are committed to influencing the Marlborough business community, driving collaboration that impacts climate resilience, education, health and wellbeing of a thriving region and growing our regions expertise.

events.id: Amble | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Amble | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Amble, the critically acclaimed three-piece folk group hailing from Ireland, today announce their return to Australia and New Zealand in February 2026, in support of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie.
Irish trio Amble harness a rare magic threaded into the fabric of their novelistic folk.
Originally hailing from the West Region of Ireland, the group—Robbie Cunningham (lead vocals/guitar), Ross McNerney (mandolin/bouzouki), and Oisin McCaffrey (vocals/guitar)—have unassumingly gone from quitting their day jobs in rural Ireland to the doorstep of an international breakthrough, buoyed by over 100 million streams and sold-out shows around the world.
Amble’s debut album, Reverie, set for release on Friday, 23 May this year, showcases Amble's signature sound: relatability, intimate storytelling, and authenticity seamlessly blended with no-frills acoustic instrumentation, serene soundscapes, and heavenly natural harmonies.
The album, recorded live in various studios between Ireland and Los Angeles, captures the spirit of the band's early days.

events.id: The Music of Greece-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: The Music of Greece
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Marking its Aotearoa debut, the Hellenic Music Ensemble brings the unforgettable soundscape of Greece to life in a landmark global tour. The group will be under the direction of acclaimed composer and conductor Panos Liaropoulos. This 21-piece orchestra honours the genius of Greece’s most iconic composers: Mikis Theodorakis (BAFTA-winning ‘Zorba's Dance’) and Manos Hadjidakis (‘Never on a Sunday’). 
The orchestra will be joined by legendary voices Manolis Mitsias, Giannis Haroulis, and Natassa Bofiliou. Together, they’ll bring the quintessential melodies of Greece to the Michael Fowler Centre. This one-night-only show is part of the Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. Soar through a century of song — celebrating the soul, poetry, and passion of Greece.

When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.

events.id: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course-24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course
events.venue: 24 Hawkestone Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.long_description:
POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

events.id: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington-200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Interpretation 101 - INNZ Workshop Wellington
events.venue: 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Are you looking to enhance your story-sharing skills and visitor engagement?

This workshop is a foundational step towards mastering interpretation and transforming visits into unforgettable experiences. Perfect for those working in museums, galleries, parks, zoos, heritage sites and tourist attractions.
Designed and presented by Lynda Burns this workshop offers a full day of immersive learning. With decades of experience as a practitioner, trainer, and mentor across Aotearoa and abroad, Lynda brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise and is a leader in the field of interpretation.
Throughout the day, you will: 
Experiment with new ideas and skills.
Share your existing knowledge with like-minded professionals. 
Explore the role of place interpretation in visitor experience. 
Learn how to reach the hearts and minds of visitors through meaningful story-sharing. 
Take a closer look at visitor demographics and behaviours. 
Discover the steps to start your interpretation projects, including research, goal setting, media choices, budgeting, and collection analysis. 
Gain basic project management tips to get things done efficiently. 
Explore how to work alongside iwi, stakeholders and managers. 
Please bring actual project ideas or content research to trial what you have learned throughout the day. This hands-on approach ensures that you get to test your new skills and leave with actionable insights. 
"Lynda recently facilitated a workshop on guiding for our team at Cornwall Park. Her amazing, tailored response to our programme has vastly improved the visitor experience and how we interpret this place. Our guides love the new skills they have learnt and are enjoying updating the entire programme of park-led walks.”
- Charlotte Taylor Visitor Experience 2IC Cornwall Park
Join us for this incredible opportunity to enhance your professional skills and elevate your visitor experience. 
Friday 27 February
9.30am-5pm
Wellington Zoo, 200 Daniell Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021
Tickets:
Non member $250
INNZ Member $215
Student/unwaged $190

Morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea will be provided, and all dietary requirements will be accommodated. Please let us know if you have any accessibility requirements.

Discover highlights from our Auckland Interpretation 101 workshop

events.id: Blenheim Gypsy Fair-Pollard Park,Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, Blenheim, New Zealand-All Events In
events.name: Blenheim Gypsy Fair
events.venue: Pollard Park,Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, Blenheim, New Zealand
events.long_description:
Blenheim Gypsy Fair
The Gypsy Fair is a nationwide travelling event, bringing family fun, live music and an unbeatable vibe to each town we visit.🌞💜

Having been on the road for over 45 years, it’s safe to say our roots run deep. Our people are incredible, and house trucks/buses are pretty cool too! So don’t forget to check out our unique way of living while you’re here 🫶🌿🌻💜

Whether you’re just having a browse, letting the kids loose on our rides, parking up with some food or coffee, or checking out some funky handmade crafts, we would love to see you! Come and hang out for the day, we’re sure to bring smiles to your faces, and create lifelong memories💜

🌞Free entry for everyone🌞 We pride ourselves on being an affordable event for every family. With free entertainment all day, plenty of chill out zones, and loads of life size games laying around, we truely love to see the community getting amongst it all! Can’t wait to see you there🌞👣🐝🌿🌊

Follow us on Facebook – ‘Gypsy Fair’ for updates on our travels and creations! We’re always open to anyone who wants to come and live the dream, so please email us if this sounds like a bit of you. –

You may also like the following events from The GypsyFair:
Next Friday, 26th September, 11:00 pm, Papamoa Gypsy Fair in Tauranga
Next month, 3rd October, 11:00 pm, Gisborne Gypsy Fair in Gisborne
Next month, 10th October, 11:00 pm, Havelock North Gypsy Fair in Havelock North
Also check out other Music events in Blenheim, Entertainment events in Blenheim.
